Job_Description: About Solium  Solium is fulfilling a vision of becoming the global leader in equity-based (stock) incentive and share purchase savings plan management. We specialize in the delivery of complete web-based services for the full lifecycle of equity-based incentive and savings plans. Through our technically advanced Solium Shareworks™ platform, Solium is setting the industry’s service standard for the administration and execution of all types of equity-based incentives and savings plans.  Why work at Solium  Solium is a fast growing company where every member of our team is important to our success. If you have an unfailing commitment to excellence, alignment to customer interests, and strong problem-solving skills, Solium would welcome your contribution to our enthusiastic team. We reward our people with a competitive compensation and benefits package. We currently have a full-time, permanent opportunity for:  Software Development Manager  Solium is looking for a helms-person to help pilot their financial services Death Star through more than $10,000,000,000 of transactions per year.  If you:  Are a leader who believes in leader-leader self-organizing teams and is willing to work on that evolution Are a coach who supports broad growth because you know that developers have careers and not just jobs Are a pragmatic problem solver who can identify process inefficiencies and find creative ways to eliminate them Are excited by the challenge of helping us evolve from a midsize SaaS application to a global enterprise platform Then we are looking for you!  We are big fans of Turn the Ship Around! by L. David Marquet, and are working to build and reinforce a culture of action and ownership. You will help foster leadership through all levels of the organization. You are not a master developer, but have a strong technical background and familiarity with patterns and practices. You know that agile is a description, not a dogma, and that continuous improvement is achievable.  Requirements:  Foster a team culture that encourages ownership, continual learning, and customer delight Provide hands-on coaching and mentoring to Software Developers for technical and soft skill growth Work with product owners and clients to contribute to strategic growth of the platform Remove barriers to keep product teams close to the client and product to find value in what we build Champion product ownership and spread leadership throughout the team Ruthlessly identify process weakness and build and use metrics to drive improvement Take a lead role in recruiting and hiring Software Developers Familiarity with the enterprise Java technology stack. While we are not dogmatic about what technologies we use, this is the one we are using right now. Help lead the team to balance commercial viability, scalability, security, and technical innovation to evolve the Shareworks platform Qualifications:  Bachelors of Science in Computer Science, or Equivalent experience Familiarity with development and deployment of enterprise applications Working knowledge of management techniques and strategies 8+ years’ experience as a developer or engineer 5+ years’ experience as a development or engineering team lead (or other technical management) If you've read this far and you're thinking "I want to be a part of this", we agree! Apply now!
Title: Software Development Manager

Job_Description: About Solium  Solium aims to solve the problem of equity management and financial record keeping with our platform: Shareworks. Shareworks provides the ability for public and private companies to manage stock option plans, employee share purchase programs, and perform complex financial reporting. Shareworks also empowers employees of companies using the platform to access their equity through the transaction of their shares and holding. We actively trade on exchanges around the world including the NYSE, NSADAQ, LSE, and ASX.  Our Culture  Solium takes cultural characteristics from the industries we draw upon. We develop and maintain a sophisticated set of enterprise software products, so we embody the casual style but relentless focus that is often associated with the tech industry. But we are also a client service organization, offering support to both corporate clients and their employees. We also employ a wealth of “numbers” people, those with backgrounds in math, finance and economics. And because we are a global organization, you’ll routinely hear Spanish and French spoken in our offices. Solium offices are all about diversity. What unites us is a commitment to quality. We are all passionate people who bring our best in support of a singular focus, to be the global leader in our industry.  We think in terms of what-ifs. And we answer with:  Innovation: We create solutions and services that make the complex manageableFlexibility: We offer the choices that provide compliance and convenienceService: We demonstrate problem-solving, reliability and accuracy in everything we do for our customers We reward our people with a competitive compensation and benefits package and a fun, flexible working environment.  Recent Awards:  Deloitte’s Technology Fast 50™ - 2006 to 2010, 2012, 2014 Canada's 10 Most Admired Corporate Cultures - 2012 Branham’s Top 5 Canadian Software-as-a-Service Companies Top 20 Movers & Shakers – 2011 Top 25 Canadian Software Companies - 2011 We currently have several permanent full-time opportunities for a Web Operations Analysts  Highlights:  When a bystander walks past your computer do they ask you if you're looking at the Matrix? Have you ever made a Developer or QA team member cry tears of happiness and gratitude? Do people throughout the organization come to you because you get the job done? Have you ever tamed a wild RDBMS? Are you a high functioning individual in stressful situations? Are you obsessed with keeping the data on time and system up and running?  If you've answered yes to any of these questions, we want to talk to you!  Overall Responsibility:  Solium’s production application support team is responsible for supporting our internal and customer-facing web application in order to fulfill our required service standards. The team interacts with multiple business teams within Solium including software developers, customer support, operations, and quality assurance and provides hands-on technical assistance as needed. The team is dedicated to ensuring a quick response to urgent customer needs and special requests as they arise.  At this time the Production Application Support Team (aka the LIVE team) is undergoing a transformation into a service driven arm of the organization with the following aims:  Keeping the data on time: SQL and Scripting are our main tools to make sure the data is correct and the equity is managed the way our customers need. We use Oracle and in addition to SQL skills the ability to administer Oracle is preferred.  Keeping the system and all its components operational: Shareworks makes Equity Management easy for our clients. That means it's on us to keep it running and bring the creations of our developers to life. It's a complex system and working on it is both interesting and exciting. Software systems knowledge combined with strong debugging skills are required.  Monitoring and measurement: Knowing how the system is doing over time and how things are trending. We simply have to know what is going on in the system. We use a series of metrics to drive a dedicated process of ongoing improvement. We are not complacent and are always looking for ways to make our system better. Step one is measuring everything. Step two is understanding the story our data is telling us.  Automation and Tooling: We're not keen on repetitive tasks and seek to apply automation where it makes sense.  Skills that we require:  Linux Administration (ubuntu, centos and RHEL) Programming Skills: Java, JSP, Ruby, SQL Scripting (bash, perl, ruby)· Experience with composed systems (many individual systems combined to provide the end service to the user) Technical Debugging capability Soft Skills:  Communication: you'll be working with every arm of the business you must be fluent in technical and business and be able to switch between the two Discipline: you follow a prudent course of action regardless of the situation (during an outage or just writing a script) Trustworthiness: each member of the team is responsible for how they execute their work and how they work with others Commitment to Excellence: we all aim to achieve excellence in our skills and knowledge and actively combat complacency through the pursuit of continuous improvement Teamwork: the team is above any individual, we all rely on each other and our ability to solve problems  Qualifications:  BS degree preferred in Computer Science, Engineering or related fields (or the equivalent tenacity and wherewithal to have obtained a degree or technical diploma) Ability to interface with diverse technical and non-technical groups spanning the all organizations levels Experience running/maintaining large scale complex technology stacks Solid experience with time series data collection and analysis Outstanding verbal and written communication skills Understanding of WebOps principles and familiarity with WebOps tools
Title: Web Operations Analyst

Job_Description: Charger Industries is an ISO 9001 certified custom battery pack manufacturing company, specializing in high reliability battery packs for a wide variety of applications and industries. Job_Description: Interested in being a part of a team that is leading the evolution of retail in Canada?  Embracing and driving change is critical to our success. The complexity and rate at which the retail industry is transforming has increased exponentially in recent years and we are committed to being a leader in the industry. As such we are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join the Canadian Tire Family of Companies.  Our Technology team plays a critical role in our evolution, specifically as we transition to an omni-retailer where digital complements the physical. Our commitment to being a world-class digital organization is evident in how we are using cutting-edge technologies to bring our digital strategy to life in-store, online and on your mobile devices, ultimately improving customer experiences, driving traffic, and boosting loyalty.  The Enterprise Data team is responsible to serve Canadian Tire’s data management and analytics services to meet business service levels. We work in a fast paced Agile environment, that provides opportunities to learn every day. This includes:  Day to day identification and triaging of issues that are identified from customers, enterprise support desk or business partners  24/7 support for the reporting environment  Monitoring of the applications and their infrastructure  Updating and implementation of tools and techniques to improve monitoring and system health  Develop, document and update procedures to improve support processes  Work with IT and Business Partners to ensure the reporting systems are performing as optimally as possible  What you’ll do: As a member of the Enterprise Data team the DevOps Support Analyst plays a BI DevOps role that provides production support, enhancements and maintenance of CTC reporting and analytical applications.  As the DevOps Support Analyst, you will be responsible for the following:  Initial triage and documentation of production issues as they are identified  Creating and managing tickets for each issue to resolution  Working with developers and other IT partners to find root cause of issues  Communicating with team management regarding issue status and progress  Documenting issue resolutions and ensure relevant teams are informed  Suggesting and documenting improvements to support processes and procedures  Working with development teams focus on the best practices and scalability  Who you are: We are looking for high performing individuals who are: Agile and innovative individuals, who are able to manage in an environment of change and ambiguity to help us take bold and strategic moves in this rapidly evolving retail environment  Creative thinkers who take initiative and are capable of building, launching and managing projects/programs that drive results for our customers  Problem solvers with the ability to analyze and prioritize to meet business objectives  Collaborative team players with superior influencing skills, who build relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward  If you’re curious, ready to take on new challenges and open to doing things differently to help us evolve rapidly, then Canadian Tire is definitely the place to be.  What you’ve done: Post-secondary education in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related discipline (or equivalent experience)  Experience with BI tools like MicroStrategy, Cognos and Crystal Reports etc  Knowledge on Hadoop and related programs and it's key architecture technologies: Nifi, Kafka, Hive, Sqoop, Pig, Flume, MapReduce and NoSQL  Expert knowledge and experience with Data Warehousing, ETL or Hadoop  Provide application support for Production systems  SQL programing skills (Intermediate or higher)  Data Analysis and Modeling  Excellent verbal and communication skills  Proficiency in written English and good documentation skills  Willingness to provide off-hours support on a rotation basis  Why us: Canadian Tire is one of Canada’s most iconic and diversified companies. Our culture and values uphold our pledge to sustainable practices, and commitment to our local communities through Jumpstart cannot be beat.  To learn more about this team and the Canadian Tire Family of Companies follow us on LinkedIn.  AODA/D&I; statement  Canadian Tire is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees -- their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.  FGL Corporate  Alberta-Calgary  Permanent  Full-time  Job Posting  :  May 17, 2018, 10:41:43 AM

Finally, they will support the QA leaders in reporting the status of testing across all stakeholders within the CTC, FGL & Marks organizations. activities for data integrations in alignment with the testing strategy and expectations for the quality of the project  Create liaisons between different teams and contribute to the smooth communication between teams  Design, implement and execute tests for ETL and Data Integration scenarios  Perform Functional, Integration, Regression and End to End testing on all Data Technology knowledge of integration testing methodologies and practices  Experience testing in a Unix/Linux environment  Experience working with integration tools like Tibco, Data stage, MQ, Change  Experience working on Agile based team collaborative tools like JIRA, Bitbucket and Jenkins  Experience developing tests in functional programming languages such as Python  Experience testing of ETL and message queue workflows and workloads, including such tools as Apache Kafka, Nifi  Experience testing distributed systems, including testing on the Hadoop platform and user-level Hadoop configuration and Experience working with XML, jSON and EDI data formats  Experience working with databases, including SQL Server, Oracle, Netezza and MariaDB  Experience in planning, developing and executing Test Plans and Test Procedures and coordinating the collection of test results  Detailed oriented personality complimented with strong analytical and problem solving skills  Ability to communicate clearly in written and verbal communications  Ability to work independently and as part of a team  Excellent organizational and planning skills  Ability to work well under pressure in a fast-paced team environment,working on multiple deliverables at the same time  Knowledge of Retail, POS, Warehousing/Inventory, Supply Chain, or Finance industries an asset  About You  Builds Trust and Credibility by consistently adhering to the organization’s business principles and values. Considers the wider team, function, banner or the organization and takes action or makes decisions which support the success of those groups  Recovers quickly after change, disruptions, or mistakes and can remain productive and focused. Title: QA Analyst

Job_Description: About usClinicSense is a small, profitable company that is growing quickly, and we’re looking to add another developer to our team. Officially, we’re based in Toronto, but each of us work remotely.Our clinic management software helps reduce paperwork for small wellness clinics. This includes online scheduling, treatment notes, intake forms, invoicing, and integrated marketing tools. We are known for taking an approach to clinic management that includes a high degree of automation (which ultimately saves our customers plenty of time from administrative tasks so they have more time to spend with their clients).About the positionThis is a full-time position as a Full Stack Developer. You will work remotely from anywhere you like. Requirements:Eligible to work in Canada1+ years of React/Redux experience2+ years of CSS experience3+ years of Python/Django experienceDay-to-dayAs a small team, we each play a role in the creative process and decision making. You will typically kick off a project with a product designer who will guide you through the design and ask for your feedback. You will also have the opportunity to bring new ideas to the table (whether that’s new features or ideas on internal processes). One of the benefits of our small team is you get to work on a variety of tasks - building new features, improving existing features, working on mobile, 3rd party integrations, etc.Our philosophy on work & productivityOur goal for ourselves and for you is to not be over-worked or stressed. We find that a flexible schedule and ample vacation/holiday time allows us and maintain a positive work-life balance and take care of personal tasks without feeling pressure to be on the clock.We evaluate our performance based on output, not input - meaning that we care more about quality work and being productive (rather than how many hours we worked this week). Ultimately, this gives us the freedom to choose the hours we work and work when we feel the most productive (on average our work weeks are 35-40 hours) . We schedule some overlap hours and use JIRA and Slack to stay connected.CompensationSalary: $60,000 - $70,000Vacation: Stat Holidays + 4 weeks vacationApplyingPlease include a cover letter. We'd like to hear specifically about past projects you've worked on using Python/Django and React. If you are working on any personal projects or are making contributions to open source, we'd love to hear about that too. Thanks!Job Type: Full-timeSalary: $60,000.00 to $70,000.00 /year
Title: Full Stack Developer (Remote)

Job_Description: Agile DeveloperAbout SymendOur mission is to reduce the incidence of debt delinquency while creating a positive experience for everyone involved in the debt collections process."SYM" refers to the symmetrical, fair, and transparent approach we take to bridging the gap between creditors and debtors. "MEND" is the result of repairing and restoring the relationship while mending outstanding delinquent debt.Symend is lead by a passionate FinTech Team and built on the values of respect, knowledge, fairness, and innovation. We believe we can make a profound positive impact on the delinquent debt industry by changing the tools, technology, and tactics used to promote and incentivize debtors to repay outstanding debts.The Role: Are you up for the challenge?At Symend, we’re expanding and looking for a Agile Developer to join our talented and results oriented team. What do we mean by results oriented? You'll work closely with clients to understand not only what they want but what they need and help them solve some big and interesting problems.Who you areYou are someone who likes solving interesting problems with a team. You love to get at the root of a problem and work with others to create great outcomes and have a strong desire to learn. In fact, you’re the first to rattle off which Rails video or Blog would help your co-worker.You can speak to language best practices, understand that starting is as important as finishing, know the difference between simple and easy, have a strong understanding of classes and mix-ins, and know the advantages and trade-offs between closure/blocks and delegates. You’re also diligent about meeting allocated budgets and can work within time constraints, but you will never sacrifice quality.On top of this, you are comfortable working in cross-functional teams and can share insights and expectations with stakeholders, clients, team members and various levels of management.Key Responsibilities- Design, program and test software- Maintain relevant documentation for developers, clients and users- Develop and refine prototypes to confirm requirements- Program according to project plans (versions, sprints)- Release activities, such as support, versioning and maintenance- Collaborate with our designers to create interfaces- Peer review other team members’ code, and learn and adapt from peer review of your own codeBasic Qualifications- 3+ of delivering software with preference given to those who have a degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent- Working knowledge with C#, .NET, Azure, SQLServer- Working knowledge with NoSQL and serverless architectures a plus- Experience with DevOps would be an asset- Experience breaking down user problems into stories and solutioning- Experience working on iterative projects with continuous delivery pipelines- Experience with test driven developmentPreferred Qualifications- Ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical audiences- Exceptional interpersonal and relationship management skills- Demonstrated effectiveness working across multiple business units to achieve results- Hands on development experience or full understanding of mobile and service development pipeline and process- Track record for being detail-oriented with a demonstrated ability to self-motivate and follow-through on projects- Strong problem-solving skills; the ability to analyze problems and develop actionable and appropriate tactical plans quickly- Ability to succeed in a fast-paced, innovative, and rapidly evolving industry and business organizationTo apply for this position, please e-mail your resume and cover letter to: with the Subject Line: “Agile Developer”. Apply early as position may be filled prior to deadline.No phone calls please, only those candidates selected to move forward will be contacted.Job Type: Full-time
Title: Agile Developer

Job_Description: Your Opportunity We're active members of the communities we serve. That's why at Stantec, we always design with community in mind.  The Stantec community unites approximately 22,000 employees working in over 400 locations across six continents. Our work—engineering, architecture, interior design, landscape architecture, surveying, environmental sciences, project management, and project economics, from initial project concept and planning through design, construction, and commissioning—begins at the intersection of community, creativity, and client relationships. With a long-term commitment to the people and places we serve, Stantec has the unique ability to connect to projects on a personal level and advance the quality of life in communities across the globe. Stantec trades on the TSX and the NYSE under the symbol STN. Visit us at stantec.com or find us on social media.  We have an exciting opportunity for a contract Software Developer in our Calgary, AB office.  We are looking for an individual that is motivated, talented, and committed to enhancing individual, team, and company performance.  This role is an eight (8) month contract with the possibility for extension or conversion to permanent employment.  Your Duties Your primary responsibilities as a Software Developer will include:  Documenting the types and structure of the data as well as mapping and tracing data from system to system to solve a given business or system problem Manage data integration from different sources into the database and apply QC/QA processes Develop flowcharts, layouts, and documentation to identify requirements and solutions Write well-designed, testable code Produce specifications and determine operational feasibility Integrate software components into a fully functional software system Develop software verification plans and quality assurance procedures Document and maintain software functionality Troubleshoot, debug and upgrade existing systems Your Capabilities and Credentials Minimum of a Bachelor’s or Associate’s Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or GIS related field Familiarity with Agile development methodologies Experience with software design and development in a test-driven environment Minimum of 5 years’ experience in database development and/or software development Minimum of 5 years of experience with tools and technologies: C# program on desktop WinForm, WPF, UWP, and ASP.Net / ASP.Net Core, Webform, MVC, JavaScript/JQuery Minimum of 5 years’ experience with SQL Server, T-SQL, and Microsoft Business Intelligence Tools Ability to work independently and multi-task effectively Demonstrated understanding of projects from the perspective of both client and business Good communication skills (both oral and written) Experience with Microsoft Azure is an asset Experience of FME desktop and Server an asset Experience of Tensorflow as an asset
Title: Software Developer

Job_Description: Job Description  The Software Development Intern will work with the Project Development Manager (PDM) to define requirements in sufficient detail for successful development of assigned software features. The Software Developer will also design, develop and implement high quality software that fulfills the defined requirements, and assist the Quality Assurance team with testing tools. Qualifications  Job Responsibilities: Setup of a fully automated software testing framework. Maintain the current software version. Deliver software design and code on schedule. Report progress on a frequent basis to the project manager. Maintain code with the approved source control system and update the source control problem tracking system. Stay up to date with the latest technologies. Job Requirements: Must be enrolled in an accredited North American university with a focus on geophysics, physics, mathematics, computer science, engineering or related science degrees. Enrollment in advanced degrees is desirable. Past experience on software development projects beyond school work is preferred. Good written and verbal communication skills - essential for interacting with users and colleagues. Must be able to clearly present design ideas and programming results to colleagues. The ability to function in a team environment or an individual setting Analytical and creative problem solving skills. Strong ability to recognize errors, troubleshoot and identify solutions independently. Good practical knowledge of the programming languages and software development tools necessary for creating the target software applications. Fluent in C++ is a must. Job_Description: Devon Canada Corporation is the Canadian operating division of Oklahoma-based Devon Energy Corporation, a leading independent energy company. Devon’s Canadian head office is located in Calgary, Alberta with approximately 1,500 employees who support the development and operations of world-class heavy oil properties in northeastern Alberta. Our strong entrepreneurial spirit, together with a culture of empowerment, integrity and innovation create opportunities to grow and succeed and have put us on Fortune 100 Best Places to Work list for seven straight years. Information Technology Co-op Student Calgary Office Devon Canada Corporation is an experienced player in heavy oil, with more than 20 years of cold flow heavy oil production in Lloydminster and Bonnyville, Alberta, and steam assisted gravity drainage (SAGD) heavy oil operations in the Athabasca region of northeastern Alberta. Exponential growth in our Jackfish 1, 2 and 3 operations has led to in excess of 100,000 BOED of best-in-class production. Devon Canada knows heavy oil – and it’s what we do best. We pioneered using saline water in the SAGD process, completely eliminating the use of fresh water in our operations and we have the most vigorous wildlife monitoring program in the industry. We are committed to maximizing our assets and finding solutions to help us work faster, safer and better. We’ve made the list of Fortune 100’s Best Companies to Work For for seven straight years. Just watch where we go from here. www.devonenergy.com This 8-month co-op student position will provide a well-rounded IT experience with opportunities to learn about multiple roles. The position will commence on September 4, 2018 and is based in Calgary, Alberta. Duties & Responsibilities Analyst Participate in requirement gathering sessions with stakeholders Become familiar with Devon’s SDLC (System Development Lifecycle) through the documentation of Opportunity Evaluations, Business Cases, Business Requirements, Process Flows and Diagrams. Facilitate the training, documentation and support of technology users as required Participate in testing and quality assurance procedures Query generation, maintenance, and design of reports and analyses using business intelligence technologies and platforms like Spotfire and Power BI Work with stakeholders to identify opportunities for enhancements, and facilitate the creation of changes to existing or new workflows and establish related best practices Developer Provide applications development and enhancement functions in the support of the Devon systems environment. Includes analysis, design, coding, testing, and deployments of web, SharePoint and Windows applications Work with business analysts and technical architects to formalize specifications for custom development Attend Knowledge Transfer sessions for all custom work developed prior to release of their duties from the projects Develop and enhance custom solutions using approved technologies and platforms Document and perform unit, string, integration, and regression testing in support of new implementations and releases Qualifications Currently enrolled in an Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Software Engineering, or Computer Engineering program returning to school in 2018 Personal commitment to safety Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills Ability to present thoughts and ideas clearly and effectively Strong analytical skills Oil & Gas industry experience is beneficial but not required Enjoys working in a team environment Be a self-starter and recognize when issues need to be raised Time management and task prioritization skills. Willingness to travel to field site locations. Why work for Devon? Devon Energy’s core values emphasize openness, teamwork and results. Students who work at Devon Energy experience: work-life balance, a fun working environment, consideration for long-term employment, an “open-door” office environment, the opportunity to learn and enhance skills, and working for a successful company that maintains a “small company” work environment. For more information on Devon Energy visit devonenergy.com. Application Process: Individuals interested in pursuing this opportunity are encouraged to submit their resume, cover letter and transcripts at devonenergy.com. Applicants must be legally eligible to work in Canada. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for interviews will be contacted.

You will be responsible for working with a team of developers to bring our software to life, as well as be a liaison between our development department, call center and customers. We are unique in the industry because we view our customers as business partners, technology innovators, and friends. Discover the face behind the name and the culture that defines us as an organization.  What we do;  PBS Software is a true windows based platform boasting ease of use and training while fully featured to support our customer experience. Our software can run all aspects of an automotive dealership with sales, service, inventory management and accounting modules to keep things moving at a steady pace.  We can provide the opportunity for you to utilize your skills and abilities. Take a chance and apply to our Team today!

General Dynamics Missions Systems-Canada is working in partnership with General Dynamics Mission Systems - United Kingdom to design, develop, and deliver an exceptional Command, Control, Communications, Computing and Intelligence (C4I) system based on open architecture and industry standard principles. The software product team will consist of several software development teams, each focusing on a specific set of software components and services in the areas of communication, device integration, and common services for multiple third-party software applications. Software development teams will follow the Scrum framework for software development. The Scrum teams operate within a larger Scaled Agile Framework organization. The successful candidate will be a Product Owner for one of the Scrum teams. Responsibilities Typical Duties: The Product Owner is a content management leader who prioritizes and grooms the backlog and ensures that the team understands what they are working on. The Product Owner’s responsibilities include: Working with the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) product manager and other stakeholders to understand their needs Provides vision and roadmap for what the Product Owner wishes to be built Clearly communicates this vision in understandable product backlog items Ordering and prioritizing the items in the product backlog to best achieve goals and missions Optimizing the value of the work the development team performs Ensuring that the product backlog is visible, transparent, clear to all, and shows what the Scrum team will work on next Ensuring the development team understands items in the product backlog to the level needed The Product Owner is the sole person responsible for managing the product backlog Qualifications Required Skills & Experience: Minimum of four years experience in software engineering Disciplined approach to software engineering with knowledge of agile development methods Strong attention to detail Strong communication skills, both written and verbal Strong problem solving and analysis skills Skills & Experience – Nice to have: Previous experience as a Product Owner or Scrum Master on an Agile team Professional Scrum Product Owner (PSPO) or Professional Scrum Master (PSM) certification Previous experience leading teams in an agile environment Previous experience, certification, or knowledge of the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe 4.0) Education: Bachelor’s degree in Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, System Engineering or equivalent discipline is required  Other:  Minimum 10 year consecutive residence in Canada – for Canadian Secret Security Clearance Applicants will be required to obtain/hold a valid and current Canadian security clearance to gain access to the classified spaces, information and equipment in order to perform the work associated with this position. We specialize in the delivery of complete web-based services for the full lifecycle of equity-based incentive and savings plans. Through our technically advanced Solium Shareworks™ platform, Solium is setting the industry’s service standard for the administration and execution of all types of equity-based incentives and savings plans.  Why work at Solium  Solium is a fast growing company where every member of our team is important to our success. If you have an unfailing commitment to excellence, alignment to customer interests, and strong problem-solving skills, Solium would welcome your contribution to our enthusiastic team. We reward our people with a competitive compensation and benefits package. We currently have a full-time, permanent opportunity for:  Software Development Manager  Solium is looking for a helms-person to help pilot their financial services Death Star through more than $10,000,000,000 of transactions per year.  If you:  Are a leader who believes in leader-leader self-organizing teams and is willing to work on that evolution Are a coach who supports broad growth because you know that developers have careers and not just jobs Are a pragmatic problem solver who can identify process inefficiencies and find creative ways to eliminate them Are excited by the challenge of helping us evolve from a midsize SaaS application to a global enterprise platform Then we are looking for you!  We are big fans of Turn the Ship Around! by L. David Marquet, and are working to build and reinforce a culture of action and ownership. You will help foster leadership through all levels of the organization. You are not a master developer, but have a strong technical background and familiarity with patterns and practices. You know that agile is a description, not a dogma, and that continuous improvement is achievable.  Requirements:  Foster a team culture that encourages ownership, continual learning, and customer delight Provide hands-on coaching and mentoring to Software Developers for technical and soft skill growth Work with product owners and clients to contribute to strategic growth of the platform Remove barriers to keep product teams close to the client and product to find value in what we build Champion product ownership and spread leadership throughout the team Ruthlessly identify process weakness and build and use metrics to drive improvement Take a lead role in recruiting and hiring Software Developers Familiarity with the enterprise Java technology stack. While we are not dogmatic about what technologies we use, this is the one we are using right now. Help lead the team to balance commercial viability, scalability, security, and technical innovation to evolve the Shareworks platform Qualifications:  Bachelors of Science in Computer Science, or Equivalent experience Familiarity with development and deployment of enterprise applications Working knowledge of management techniques and strategies 8+ years’ experience as a developer or engineer 5+ years’ experience as a development or engineering team lead (or other technical management) If you've read this far and you're thinking "I want to be a part of this", we agree! Apply now!
Title: Software Development Manager

Job_Description: Company Overview At General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada, Canada’s premiere defence company, innovation happens on a daily basis. We develop and deliver highly-complex leading edge technology, products and systems that make important contributions to our customer’s success in land, airborne, maritime and public safety applications. The challenges and opportunities are endless.The results – incredible.  Our employees are exceptional. We are proud to employ more than 1,100 talented individuals across Canada. Working in a collaborative environment, our employees are encouraged daily to contribute their technical knowledge and expertise. Our employees are passionate, dedicated, and conscientious about the work they do which results in our ability to deliver the highest value, customized solutions in order to meet the most demanding requirements. Project/Program Overview General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada currently has an exciting contract opportunity for a Product Owner in Calgary. As part of our team, you will play a key role in delivering a world class secure next generation communications system for the Ministry of Defense in the United Kingdom. General Dynamics Missions Systems-Canada is working in partnership with General Dynamics Mission Systems - United Kingdom to design, develop, and deliver an exceptional Command, Control, Communications, Computing and Intelligence (C4I) system based on open architecture and industry standard principles. The software product team will consist of several software development teams, each focusing on a specific set of software components and services in the areas of communication, device integration, and common services for multiple third-party software applications. Software development teams will follow the Scrum framework for software development. The Scrum teams operate within a larger Scaled Agile Framework organization. The successful candidate will be a Product Owner for one of the Scrum teams. Responsibilities Typical Duties: The Product Owner is a content management leader who prioritizes and grooms the backlog and ensures that the team understands what they are working on. The Product Owner’s responsibilities include: Working with the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) product manager and other stakeholders to understand their needs Provides vision and roadmap for what the Product Owner wishes to be built Clearly communicates this vision in understandable product backlog items Ordering and prioritizing the items in the product backlog to best achieve goals and missions Optimizing the value of the work the development team performs Ensuring that the product backlog is visible, transparent, clear to all, and shows what the Scrum team will work on next Ensuring the development team understands items in the product backlog to the level needed The Product Owner is the sole person responsible for managing the product backlog Qualifications Required Skills & Experience: Minimum of four years experience in software engineering Disciplined approach to software engineering with knowledge of agile development methods Strong attention to detail Strong communication skills, both written and verbal Strong problem solving and analysis skills Skills & Experience – Nice to have: Previous experience as a Product Owner or Scrum Master on an Agile team Professional Scrum Product Owner (PSPO) or Professional Scrum Master (PSM) certification Previous experience leading teams in an agile environment Previous experience, certification, or knowledge of the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe 4.0) Education: Bachelor’s degree in Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, System Engineering or equivalent discipline is required  Other:  Minimum 10 year consecutive residence in Canada – for Canadian Secret Security Clearance Applicants will be required to obtain/hold a valid and current Canadian security clearance to gain access to the classified spaces, information and equipment in order to perform the work associated with this position.  General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace.Workplace accommodations are available.

It’s the same drive that’s helped us become Canada’s fastest growing national firm. We foster collaboration, value your ideas, promote based on talent, live balanced lifestyles and make time for FUN. infrastructure teams to develop solutions that drive business value Design, architect and build new APIs based on technical specifications Build prototypes and proofs-of-concept that validate design approaches to improve work processes Design databases for both new and existing projects Credentials Completion of relevant post-secondary education Minimum two (2) years of professional experience in software development Understanding of current web services technologies such as Web APIs, REST, JSON and SOAP Knowledge of ASP.NET, C#, VB.Net and associated frameworks Experience with HTML, CSS, JavaScript, JQuery and other related web technologies Prior experience working with large, complex databases and queries Experience on enterprise software development and integration projects is beneficial Understanding of Agile development methodologies, including Scrum is preferred Core Competencies and Personal Characteristics Integrity – professional whose honesty, integrity, confidentiality and high ethical standards contributes to effective leadership and optimal business relationships Energy – displays enthusiasm, optimism, drive and passion while maintaining a high level of productivity and a balanced lifestyle Diversity – understands the importance of different backgrounds, perspectives and experiences and is respectful of individual differences Communication – being courteous, responding to client requests in a timely manner and monitoring satisfaction Teamwork & Relationship Development – works collaboratively with team members in order to achieve a common goal and develops, maintains and strengthens relationships with others, both inside and outside the Firm Accountability – takes responsibility for one’s own performance by setting clear goals and tracking progress against those goals; is highly organized and uses personal judgement and decision making Flexibility – effectively manages multiple assignments, adapts to changing priorities and is Job_Description: Are you passionate about coding? Does it “hurt” when you see an application with bad UI? Does finding an elegant solution to a hard problem make your day? SMART Technologies is looking for enthusiastic developers like you who want to make a difference in the lives of teachers and students through our world-class software.  Our products are in use in millions of classrooms around the world and we are continuously striving to improve the learning experience. You will have the opportunity to work directly with customers to ensure that you are building products that will help them in their day to day lives.  At SMART, we are always trying to learn and improve. We encourage innovation and creative problem solving. You will be working with the latest web technologies deployed at scale, such as Ember, Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud, Firebase and others.  What would you be doing?  Designing and building next generation web products for use in classrooms around the world. Implementing new functionality in our web products. Working closely with the User Experience team to design the User Interface. Working with other developers to architect and design the technical structure of our products. Evaluating and choosing new technologies and libraries to incorporate into our products. Working with customers and product management to understand how educators use technology in the classroom. Writing and maintaining unit and integration tests to ensure our products meet our quality standards. Working closely with our test team to ensure automated testing has appropriate coverage. Core Skills Building interactive HTML interfaces using Javascript frameworks like Ember or Vue.js. Understanding test-driven development practices including writing and maintaining unit tests. Experience with developing software using Agile software development. Building and deploying applications to Google AppEngine or Amazon Web Services. Experience releasing software using a continuous deployment pipeline. Education and work experience Degree or Diploma in Computer Science or a related field Junior, intermediate or senior level experience with: Javascript (required) HTML5 CSS (required) JavaScript frameworks like Ember, Angular or Vue.js Experience with iOS and Android development is an asset. Experience with web-based Java development is an asset. Looking for you to have a strong understanding of core computer science concepts, this will enable you to grow into a strong contributor for the web teams.  For more information on who we are check us out at smarttech or view our youtube channel… or just apply!
Title: Web Application Developer

Job_Description: Showpass is a ticketing and event management software company. We empower venue and event organizers to create a rich, connected experience for their customers through next-generation technology. We combine cutting-edge software and hardware for seamless on- and offline sales, while delivering event management tools on the same integrated platform.  But what makes us different?  Showpass offers a unique platform for collaboration between the key groups that power events. From venues, to organizers, to street teams, to event attendees, we are focused on bringing people together through the magic of live events. We also happen to be powered by a very talented team fostering innovation, creativity and disruption. These pillars support the Showpass culture which is built on a love for events, and all things food. That’s what makes us the fastest growing Canadian ticketing company. and improve strategic design and user experience for new and existing features Work closely with clients to create and improve client websites through integrating the Showpass SDK and Wordpress plugin technologies would be an asset: Python, Django, Swift or similar (Flask, Rails, Node.js, Go) Experience creating prototypes, storyboards, user flows, etc. Strong problem solving, testing and debugging skills Analytical thinker with the ability to problem solve in a fast-paced work environment Must have a clear understanding of the importance of user-centered design Be passionate about all things Job_Description: About Solium  Solium aims to solve the problem of equity management and financial record keeping with our platform: Shareworks. Shareworks provides the ability for public and private companies to manage stock option plans, employee share purchase programs, and perform complex financial reporting. Shareworks also empowers employees of companies using the platform to access their equity through the transaction of their shares and holding. We actively trade on exchanges around the world including the NYSE, NSADAQ, LSE, and ASX.  Our Culture  Solium takes cultural characteristics from the industries we draw upon. We develop and maintain a sophisticated set of enterprise software products, so we embody the casual style but relentless focus that is often associated with the tech industry. But we are also a client service organization, offering support to both corporate clients and their employees. We also employ a wealth of “numbers” people, those with backgrounds in math, finance and economics. And because we are a global organization, you’ll routinely hear Spanish and French spoken in our offices. Solium offices are all about diversity. What unites us is a commitment to quality. We are all passionate people who bring our best in support of a singular focus, to be the global leader in our industry.  We think in terms of what-ifs. And we answer with:  Innovation: We create solutions and services that make the complex manageableFlexibility: We offer the choices that provide compliance and convenienceService: We demonstrate problem-solving, reliability and accuracy in everything we do for our customers We reward our people with a competitive compensation and benefits package and a fun, flexible working environment.  Recent Awards:  Deloitte’s Technology Fast 50™ - 2006 to 2010, 2012, 2014 Canada's 10 Most Admired Corporate Cultures - 2012 Branham’s Top 5 Canadian Software-as-a-Service Companies Top 20 Movers & Shakers – 2011 Top 25 Canadian Software Companies - 2011 We currently have several permanent full-time opportunities for a Web Operations Analysts  Highlights:  When a bystander walks past your computer do they ask you if you're looking at the Matrix? Have you ever made a Developer or QA team member cry tears of happiness and gratitude? Do people throughout the organization come to you because you get the job done? Have you ever tamed a wild RDBMS? Are you a high functioning individual in stressful situations? Are you obsessed with keeping the data on time and system up and running?  If you've answered yes to any of these questions, we want to talk to you!  Overall Responsibility:  Solium’s production application support team is responsible for supporting our internal and customer-facing web application in order to fulfill our required service standards. The team interacts with multiple business teams within Solium including software developers, customer support, operations, and quality assurance and provides hands-on technical assistance as needed. The team is dedicated to ensuring a quick response to urgent customer needs and special requests as they arise.  At this time the Production Application Support Team (aka the LIVE team) is undergoing a transformation into a service driven arm of the organization with the following aims:  Keeping the data on time: SQL and Scripting are our main tools to make sure the data is correct and the equity is managed the way our customers need. We use Oracle and in addition to SQL skills the ability to administer Oracle is preferred.  Keeping the system and all its components operational: Shareworks makes Equity Management easy for our clients. That means it's on us to keep it running and bring the creations of our developers to life. It's a complex system and working on it is both interesting and exciting. Software systems knowledge combined with strong debugging skills are required.  Monitoring and measurement: Knowing how the system is doing over time and how things are trending. We simply have to know what is going on in the system. We use a series of metrics to drive a dedicated process of ongoing improvement. We are not complacent and are always looking for ways to make our system better. Step one is measuring everything. Step two is understanding the story our data is telling us.  Automation and Tooling: We're not keen on repetitive tasks and seek to apply automation where it makes sense.  Skills that we require:  Linux Administration (ubuntu, centos and RHEL) Programming Skills: Java, JSP, Ruby, SQL Scripting (bash, perl, ruby)· Experience with composed systems (many individual systems combined to provide the end service to the user) Technical Debugging capability Soft Skills:  Communication: you'll be working with every arm of the business you must be fluent in technical and business and be able to switch between the two Discipline: you follow a prudent course of action regardless of the situation (during an outage or just writing a script) Trustworthiness: each member of the team is responsible for how they execute their work and how they work with others Commitment to Excellence: we all aim to achieve excellence in our skills and knowledge and actively combat complacency through the pursuit of continuous improvement Teamwork: the team is above any individual, we all rely on each other and our ability to solve problems  Qualifications:  BS degree preferred in Computer Science, Engineering or related fields (or the equivalent tenacity and wherewithal to have obtained a degree or technical diploma) Ability to interface with diverse technical and non-technical groups spanning the all organizations levels Experience running/maintaining large scale complex technology stacks Solid experience with time series data collection and analysis Outstanding verbal and written communication skills Understanding of WebOps principles and familiarity with WebOps tools
Title: Web Operations Analyst

Job_Description: About Solium  Solium is fulfilling a vision of becoming the global leader in equity-based (stock) incentive and share purchase savings plan management. We specialize in the delivery of complete web-based services for the full lifecycle of equity-based incentive and savings plans. Through our technically advanced Solium Shareworks™ platform, Solium is setting the industry’s service standard for the administration and execution of all types of equity-based incentives and savings plans.  Why work at Solium  Solium is a fast growing company where every member of our team is important to our success. If you have an unfailing commitment to excellence, alignment to customer interests, and strong problem-solving skills, Solium would welcome your contribution to our enthusiastic team. We reward our people with a competitive compensation and benefits package. We currently have a full-time, permanent opportunity for:  Software Development Manager  Solium is looking for a helms-person to help pilot their financial services Death Star through more than $10,000,000,000 of transactions per year.  If you:  Are a leader who believes in leader-leader self-organizing teams and is willing to work on that evolution Are a coach who supports broad growth because you know that developers have careers and not just jobs Are a pragmatic problem solver who can identify process inefficiencies and find creative ways to eliminate them Are excited by the challenge of helping us evolve from a midsize SaaS application to a global enterprise platform Then we are looking for you!  We are big fans of Turn the Ship Around! by L. David Marquet, and are working to build and reinforce a culture of action and ownership. You will help foster leadership through all levels of the organization. You are not a master developer, but have a strong technical background and familiarity with patterns and practices. You know that agile is a description, not a dogma, and that continuous improvement is achievable.  Requirements:  Foster a team culture that encourages ownership, continual learning, and customer delight Provide hands-on coaching and mentoring to Software Developers for technical and soft skill growth Work with product owners and clients to contribute to strategic growth of the platform Remove barriers to keep product teams close to the client and product to find value in what we build Champion product ownership and spread leadership throughout the team Ruthlessly identify process weakness and build and use metrics to drive improvement Take a lead role in recruiting and hiring Software Developers Familiarity with the enterprise Java technology stack. While we are not dogmatic about what technologies we use, this is the one we are using right now. Help lead the team to balance commercial viability, scalability, security, and technical innovation to evolve the Shareworks platform Qualifications:  Bachelors of Science in Computer Science, or Equivalent experience Familiarity with development and deployment of enterprise applications Working knowledge of management techniques and strategies 8+ years’ experience as a developer or engineer 5+ years’ experience as a development or engineering team lead (or other technical management) If you've read this far and you're thinking "I want to be a part of this", we agree! Apply now!

Job_Description: Position Overview   Cognera is looking for a self-starting individual who enjoys a fast-paced environment. When people think about Cognera, they think teamwork, client focus and fun. As a web developer, you will be responsible for designing, coding and modifying web applications, from layout to function and according to a client's specifications. You will be working in a full-stack JavaScript development web environment with some legacy support for older web applications. You should be keen on striving to create visually appealing apps that feature user-friendly design and clear navigation. Primary Functions Work on an agile team developing and supporting web applications. Responsible for feature additions, debugging, deployment, customer support, and design. Code reading and code writing as required. Ability to problem-solve and troubleshoot customer issues. Skilled in all areas of communication, verbal and written. Prepare and maintain well-organized documentation. Qualifications Experience in application development using modern JavaScript libraries Oracle JET, node.js, jQuery, Knockout, Require.js are just some examples of the technology you will be using Working knowledge of relational databases and experience with Oracle is desirable A driven self-starter able to work in a team or individually Strong verbal and written communication skills Strong understanding of security principles and their implementation Understanding of Object-Oriented Design principles Understanding of Web Services (REST/SOAP) Ability to create clear and concise API designs Understand Agile development methodologies Understand foundations of good UI/UX design Company Overview Cognera (www.cognera.com), a division of Harris Computer Systems, provides next generation billing solutions and online services to help our clients improve their customer relationships. Our deep-rooted experience in the energy and utilities industries, in both regulated and deregulated environments, makes us a natural choice when upgrading systems to meet evolving business, regulatory and technology requirements.  Harris Computer Systems has been providing complete Customer Information System (CIS) and Financial Management solutions exclusively to public and municipal utilities for over 30 years. Our track record speaks for itself. We are an experienced, solid company with proven solutions that are presently in use by over 6000 customers across North America. We are the number one provider of powerful Financial and CIS solutions because of our specialized understanding of the electric, water and gas utility industry and our commitment to customer relationships.  Harris Computer Systems is a member of the Constellation Software Inc. group of companies.  Harris is an EEO/AA/Disability/ Veteran employer.

Job_Description: Microhard has a position open for an Embedded Network Linux Developer to join our R&D team. The successful candidate will be responsible for the design, verification, and release of firmware, for embedded radio modem projects. The candidate must possess strong communications skills with attention to detail and a team-oriented attitude. Duties: Develop Embedded Networking Linux Applications Embedded Firewall and VPN design, support, maintenance Develop, test and support 802.11 a/b/g/n wireless protocols Develop, test and support Ethernet protocols Create well-documented, reusable and tested modules Properly document work Establish version control for new projects Plan, design, develop, debug and commission software modules Qualifications: Minimum of 5+ years of experience Must have more than experience on Networking or Network administration Solid understanding of VPN and other Network Tunneling protocols CISCO Certification Understanding of Ethernet devices, routers, and networking background is essential Please email your resume to the attention of Human Resources with “ELD0218” in the subject line:  resumes@microhardcorp.com  Hardware/FPGA Developer  Develop and support Board and/or FPGA/CPLD designs through all phases of design and system integration for high-reliability embedded radio applications. Perform activities such as requirements generation, Board and VHDL design, RTL-synthesis, test bench development and design simulation, static timing and power analysis, and requirements based design verification. Other activities include prototype evaluation, design-to-cost tradeoffs, design reviews, qualification test support, system integration support, production. Maintain the desire to stay current in the continuously developing field and to expand knowledge base and skills in FPGA design and digital hardware engineering. Duties & Required Skills: 5+ years circuit design experience, with the demonstrated ability to design VHDL-based FPGAs and CPLDs Comprehensive knowledge of digital electronic devices and circuit design principles Design experience with Microprocessor/Microcontroller interfaces such as I2C, SPI, CAN, memory interfaces such as SDRAM controllers, Flash, SRAM; serial interfaces (MIL-STD-1553, ARINC-429, RS422, RS485, etc) and FPGA design using Microsemi, Xilinx, Lattice, Altera, etc Experience with design tools such as Synplify and ModelSim Experience with high-speed Digital circuit card design, including part placement and routing, constraint generation, and signal integrity analysis Experience with Model-Based FPGA Development with Matlab, conversion between floating -point/fixed point domains Expereince with application design Hands-on hardware build, test, and integration experience Excellent problem solving skills, judgment, and analytical capability, along with follow-up and monitoring skills Familiarity with FPGA integration into digital circuit card designs to ensure electrical integrity of FPGA design in embedded applications Experience using design/analysis tools, such as Timing Designer and Hyperlynx Education: Minimum Training/Education: BSEE Please email your resume to the attention of Human Resources with “FPGA0218” in the subject line:  resumes@microhardcorp.com

Job_Description: What You'll Do This is an opportunity to work within a group of exceptional software engineers on one of the fastest growing products. The AMP (Advanced Malware Protection) team has shipped endpoint software for a number of platforms including Windows, Mac, Linux, and Android. The endpoint clients communicate with a Linux backend running Mongo, ElasticSearch, MySQL, Hive, RabbitMQ, Ruby, and custom C code, all managed by Chef. We're deployed across a cloud infrastructure including Amazon's EC2 and our own hardware running Joyent's SDC, and have condensed these services down into a single instance deployable on VMWare.  We know how to ship software, and shipping software feels good.  Who You'll Work With  We have a dynamic environment that inspires employees to create, honing their talents and skills every day. Employees are self-motivated, results driven and engaged. We recognize and reward quality results and commitment to our company's purposes and principles. We are looking for an experienced windows software developer to join us. We are willing to train those excited to learn. Who You Are  Required Skills: 6-10 years of relevant professional experience Strong debugging skills 3 + years of C/C++ development under Windows Experience with writing test tools/frameworks Strong understanding of secure computing practices Nice to have: Kernel driver/embedded development experience Security experience Why Cisco  We connect everything: people, processes, data, and things. We innovate everywhere, taking bold risks to shape the technologies that give us smart cities, connected cars, and handheld hospitals. And we do it in style with unique personalities who aren't afraid to change the way the world works, lives, plays and learns.  We are thought leaders, tech geeks, pop culture aficionados, and we even have a few purple haired rock stars. We celebrate the creativity and diversity that fuels our innovation. We are dreamers and we are doers.  We Are Cisco.

Title: Software Developer Intern

Job_Description: Company Overview At General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada, Canada’s premiere defence company, innovation happens on a daily basis. We develop and deliver highly-complex leading edge technology, products and systems that make important contributions to our customer’s success in land, airborne, maritime and public safety applications. The challenges and opportunities are endless.The results – incredible.  Our employees are exceptional. We are proud to employ more than 1,100 talented individuals across Canada. Working in a collaborative environment, our employees are encouraged daily to contribute their technical knowledge and expertise. Our employees are passionate, dedicated, and conscientious about the work they do which results in our ability to deliver the highest value, customized solutions in order to meet the most demanding requirements. Project/Program Overview General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada currently has an exciting opportunity for a Development Services Software Developer in Calgary. As part of our team, you will play a key role in delivering a world class secure next generation communications system for the Ministry of Defense in the United Kingdom. General Dynamics Canada is working in partnership with General Dynamics Mission Systems - United Kingdom to design, develop, and deliver an exceptional Command, Control, Communications, Computing and Intelligence (C4I) system based on open architecture and industry standard principles.  Our Calgary team is developing a key software product as part of this offering that provides the operating system and middleware to enable tactical voice and data communications, sensor and device integration, and common application services.  The Development Services System Team, working in a scaled agile framework, is responsible for developing and implementing the strategy for a continuous integration and delivery pipeline. The environment is using industry standard best practices to allow the software being developed to be tested, integrated, packaged, and deployed using automated tools and virtualized environments. Responsibilities  Typical Duties:  As a member of the Development Services System Team, the successful candidate will: Create and maintain infrastructure, including continuous integration, automated builds, and automated build verification testing Create platforms and environments for solution demos, development, quality assurance, user acceptance testing and staging Create products, utilities, and scripts to automate deployment Coordinate with other Agile Teams in order to efficiently share responsibilities, therefore increasing overall performance Qualifications Required Skills & Experience: Interest and/or experience in continuous integration, continuous deployment, release management, and automation Strong scripting abilities Strong knowledge of Linux and the Microsoft Windows OS family Some familiarity with the following tools: Nexus OSS, Jenkins, Docker, Parasoft Development Test Plaftorm and GitLab Knowledge of agile development methods Strong problem solving and analysis skills Strong attention to detail Strong communication skills, both written and verbal Strong interpersonal skills Previous experience, certification, or knowledge of Scrum or the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe 4.0) Education: Bachelor’s degree in Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, System Engineering or equivalent discipline is required.  Minimum 10 year consecutive residence in Canada – for Canadian Secret Security Clearance Applicants will be required to obtain/hold a valid and current Canadian security clearance to gain access to the classified spaces, information and equipment in order to perform the work associated with this position.  General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace.Workplace accommodations are available.

Job_Description: Showpass is a ticketing and event management software company. We empower venue and event organizers to create a rich, connected experience for their customers through next-generation technology. We combine cutting-edge software and hardware for seamless on- and offline sales, while delivering event management tools on the same integrated platform.  But what makes us different?  Showpass offers a unique platform for collaboration between the key groups that power events. From venues, to organizers, to street teams, to event attendees, we are focused on bringing people together through the magic of live events. We also happen to be powered by a very talented team fostering innovation, creativity and disruption. These pillars support the Showpass culture which is built on a love for events, and all things food. That’s what makes us the fastest growing Canadian ticketing company.  THE ROLE: Full Stack Developer (full-time permanent role)  T HE LOCATION: Calgary, Alberta  THE PERKS: A unique and fun place to work – flexible hours and vacation policy, in-house chef, fully stocked snack and fresh pressed juice bar, gym membership, dog-friendly office and parking  Competitive compensation and benefits package  THE RESPONSIBILITIES: Work with developers and designers to make exciting new features and elegant pages  Learn new technologies, frameworks and concepts in a short period of time  Assist production deployment and provide post-production support and troubleshooting  Participate in routine standups, code reviews and testing parties  Write clean code in a testable, reliable and sustainable way  THE QUALIFICATIONS: Post secondary education in engineering or computer science would be an asset  Minimum 1 year experience working in a technology or software company  Must have experience working with the following technologies: Python, Django or similar (Flask, Rails, Node.js, Go), Git, Amazon Web Services (AWS), Docker, Kubernetes, Fabric, Chef or other infrastructure automation tools, AngularJS or similar frontend frameworks (Backbone, Ember, Polymer)  Strong testing and debugging skills  Must work great in a team and also as an individual contributor  Ability to champion new ideas and develop creative approaches  Analytical thinker with the ability to problem solve in a fast-paced work environment  Must have the hustle and drive to take initiative and make things happen!  NOTE: We will only contact qualified candidates of interest.
