Job_Description: Company Overview At General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada, Canada’s premiere defence company, innovation happens on a daily basis. We develop and deliver highly-complex leading edge technology, products and systems that make important contributions to our customer’s success in land, airborne, maritime and public safety applications. The challenges and opportunities are endless.The results – incredible.  Our employees are exceptional. We are proud to employ more than 1,100 talented individuals across Canada. Working in a collaborative environment, our employees are encouraged daily to contribute their technical knowledge and expertise. Our employees are passionate, dedicated, and conscientious about the work they do which results in our ability to deliver the highest value, customized solutions in order to meet the most demanding requirements. Project/Program Overview General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada currently has an exciting contract opportunity for a Product Owner in Calgary. As part of our team, you will play a key role in delivering a world class secure next generation communications system for the Ministry of Defense in the United Kingdom. General Dynamics Missions Systems-Canada is working in partnership with General Dynamics Mission Systems - United Kingdom to design, develop, and deliver an exceptional Command, Control, Communications, Computing and Intelligence (C4I) system based on open architecture and industry standard principles. The software product team will consist of several software development teams, each focusing on a specific set of software components and services in the areas of communication, device integration, and common services for multiple third-party software applications. Software development teams will follow the Scrum framework for software development. The Scrum teams operate within a larger Scaled Agile Framework organization. The successful candidate will be a Product Owner for one of the Scrum teams. Responsibilities Typical Duties: The Product Owner is a content management leader who prioritizes and grooms the backlog and ensures that the team understands what they are working on. The Product Owner’s responsibilities include: Working with the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) product manager and other stakeholders to understand their needs Provides vision and roadmap for what the Product Owner wishes to be built Clearly communicates this vision in understandable product backlog items Ordering and prioritizing the items in the product backlog to best achieve goals and missions Optimizing the value of the work the development team performs Ensuring that the product backlog is visible, transparent, clear to all, and shows what the Scrum team will work on next Ensuring the development team understands items in the product backlog to the level needed The Product Owner is the sole person responsible for managing the product backlog Qualifications Required Skills & Experience: Minimum of four years experience in software engineering Disciplined approach to software engineering with knowledge of agile development methods Strong attention to detail Strong communication skills, both written and verbal Strong problem solving and analysis skills Skills & Experience – Nice to have: Previous experience as a Product Owner or Scrum Master on an Agile team Professional Scrum Product Owner (PSPO) or Professional Scrum Master (PSM) certification Previous experience leading teams in an agile environment Previous experience, certification, or knowledge of the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe 4.0) Education: Bachelor’s degree in Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, System Engineering or equivalent discipline is required  Other:  Minimum 10 year consecutive residence in Canada – for Canadian Secret Security Clearance Applicants will be required to obtain/hold a valid and current Canadian security clearance to gain access to the classified spaces, information and equipment in order to perform the work associated with this position.  General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace.Workplace accommodations are available.
Title: Software Developer (Product Owner)

Job_Description: About Solium  Solium is fulfilling a vision of becoming the global leader in equity-based (stock) incentive and share purchase savings plan management. We specialize in the delivery of complete web-based services for the full lifecycle of equity-based incentive and savings plans. Through our technically advanced Solium Shareworks™ platform, Solium is setting the industry’s service standard for the administration and execution of all types of equity-based incentives and savings plans.  Why work at Solium  Solium is a fast growing company where every member of our team is important to our success. If you have an unfailing commitment to excellence, alignment to customer interests, and strong problem-solving skills, Solium would welcome your contribution to our enthusiastic team. We reward our people with a competitive compensation and benefits package. We currently have a full-time, permanent opportunity for:  Software Development Manager  Solium is looking for a helms-person to help pilot their financial services Death Star through more than $10,000,000,000 of transactions per year.  If you:  Are a leader who believes in leader-leader self-organizing teams and is willing to work on that evolution Are a coach who supports broad growth because you know that developers have careers and not just jobs Are a pragmatic problem solver who can identify process inefficiencies and find creative ways to eliminate them Are excited by the challenge of helping us evolve from a midsize SaaS application to a global enterprise platform Then we are looking for you!  We are big fans of Turn the Ship Around! by L. David Marquet, and are working to build and reinforce a culture of action and ownership. You will help foster leadership through all levels of the organization. You are not a master developer, but have a strong technical background and familiarity with patterns and practices. You know that agile is a description, not a dogma, and that continuous improvement is achievable.  Requirements:  Foster a team culture that encourages ownership, continual learning, and customer delight Provide hands-on coaching and mentoring to Software Developers for technical and soft skill growth Work with product owners and clients to contribute to strategic growth of the platform Remove barriers to keep product teams close to the client and product to find value in what we build Champion product ownership and spread leadership throughout the team Ruthlessly identify process weakness and build and use metrics to drive improvement Take a lead role in recruiting and hiring Software Developers Familiarity with the enterprise Java technology stack. While we are not dogmatic about what technologies we use, this is the one we are using right now. Help lead the team to balance commercial viability, scalability, security, and technical innovation to evolve the Shareworks platform Qualifications:  Bachelors of Science in Computer Science, or Equivalent experience Familiarity with development and deployment of enterprise applications Working knowledge of management techniques and strategies 8+ years’ experience as a developer or engineer 5+ years’ experience as a development or engineering team lead (or other technical management) If you've read this far and you're thinking "I want to be a part of this", we agree! Apply now!
Title: Software Development Manager

Job_Description: About Solium  Solium aims to solve the problem of equity management and financial record keeping with our platform: Shareworks. Shareworks provides the ability for public and private companies to manage stock option plans, employee share purchase programs, and perform complex financial reporting. Shareworks also empowers employees of companies using the platform to access their equity through the transaction of their shares and holding. We actively trade on exchanges around the world including the NYSE, NSADAQ, LSE, and ASX.  Our Culture  Solium takes cultural characteristics from the industries we draw upon. We develop and maintain a sophisticated set of enterprise software products, so we embody the casual style but relentless focus that is often associated with the tech industry. But we are also a client service organization, offering support to both corporate clients and their employees. We also employ a wealth of “numbers” people, those with backgrounds in math, finance and economics. And because we are a global organization, you’ll routinely hear Spanish and French spoken in our offices. Solium offices are all about diversity. What unites us is a commitment to quality. We are all passionate people who bring our best in support of a singular focus, to be the global leader in our industry.  We think in terms of what-ifs. And we answer with:  Innovation: We create solutions and services that make the complex manageableFlexibility: We offer the choices that provide compliance and convenienceService: We demonstrate problem-solving, reliability and accuracy in everything we do for our customers We reward our people with a competitive compensation and benefits package and a fun, flexible working environment.  Recent Awards:  Deloitte’s Technology Fast 50™ - 2006 to 2010, 2012, 2014 Canada's 10 Most Admired Corporate Cultures - 2012 Branham’s Top 5 Canadian Software-as-a-Service Companies Top 20 Movers & Shakers – 2011 Top 25 Canadian Software Companies - 2011 We currently have several permanent full-time opportunities for a Web Operations Analysts  Highlights:  When a bystander walks past your computer do they ask you if you're looking at the Matrix? Have you ever made a Developer or QA team member cry tears of happiness and gratitude? Do people throughout the organization come to you because you get the job done? Have you ever tamed a wild RDBMS? Are you a high functioning individual in stressful situations? Are you obsessed with keeping the data on time and system up and running?  If you've answered yes to any of these questions, we want to talk to you!  Overall Responsibility:  Solium’s production application support team is responsible for supporting our internal and customer-facing web application in order to fulfill our required service standards. The team interacts with multiple business teams within Solium including software developers, customer support, operations, and quality assurance and provides hands-on technical assistance as needed. The team is dedicated to ensuring a quick response to urgent customer needs and special requests as they arise.  At this time the Production Application Support Team (aka the LIVE team) is undergoing a transformation into a service driven arm of the organization with the following aims:  Keeping the data on time: SQL and Scripting are our main tools to make sure the data is correct and the equity is managed the way our customers need. We use Oracle and in addition to SQL skills the ability to administer Oracle is preferred.  Keeping the system and all its components operational: Shareworks makes Equity Management easy for our clients. That means it's on us to keep it running and bring the creations of our developers to life. It's a complex system and working on it is both interesting and exciting. Software systems knowledge combined with strong debugging skills are required.  Monitoring and measurement: Knowing how the system is doing over time and how things are trending. We simply have to know what is going on in the system. We use a series of metrics to drive a dedicated process of ongoing improvement. We are not complacent and are always looking for ways to make our system better. Step one is measuring everything. Step two is understanding the story our data is telling us.  Automation and Tooling: We're not keen on repetitive tasks and seek to apply automation where it makes sense.  Skills that we require:  Linux Administration (ubuntu, centos and RHEL) Programming Skills: Java, JSP, Ruby, SQL Scripting (bash, perl, ruby)· Experience with composed systems (many individual systems combined to provide the end service to the user) Technical Debugging capability Soft Skills:  Communication: you'll be working with every arm of the business you must be fluent in technical and business and be able to switch between the two Discipline: you follow a prudent course of action regardless of the situation (during an outage or just writing a script) Trustworthiness: each member of the team is responsible for how they execute their work and how they work with others Commitment to Excellence: we all aim to achieve excellence in our skills and knowledge and actively combat complacency through the pursuit of continuous improvement Teamwork: the team is above any individual, we all rely on each other and our ability to solve problems  Qualifications:  BS degree preferred in Computer Science, Engineering or related fields (or the equivalent tenacity and wherewithal to have obtained a degree or technical diploma) Ability to interface with diverse technical and non-technical groups spanning the all organizations levels Experience running/maintaining large scale complex technology stacks Solid experience with time series data collection and analysis Outstanding verbal and written communication skills Understanding of WebOps principles and familiarity with WebOps tools
Title: Web Operations Analyst

Job_Description: Our client is a leader in business intelligence and analytics. Their software provides one integrated process for analyzing data from every source and gaining the predictive power to drive change at every level. This is your chance to join this great organization which has been included on Fortune's list of the "100 Best Companies to Work For" for seven straight years. They have engaged ROSS (www.getROSS.com) to search for a Senior BI Technical Consultant. ROSS is an innovative leader in Recruitment Process Outsourcing (RPO) and Recruitment Augmentation. Our unique model truly creates strategic alignment between the goals of hiring managers, HR professionals, recruiters and career/contract seekers..  As a Senior BI Technical Consultant  You Will…  Be responsible to architect and implement Business Intelligence tools and technologies to meet the needs of our client’s customers. You must have a strong understanding of how various software, hardware and BI tools integrate together for optimal business BI solutions.  Your responsibilities will include:  Take direction from Senior technical staff on work products that need to be created Understand company tools and technologies well and demonstrate effective use of them in a customer setting Provides solutions to problems assigned by the technical lead on the project Works well with the team in the project to meet the project objectives Makes effective use of the time to deliver a quality work product as agreed with the technical lead on the project. Performs good quality testing of the work product developed Escalates technical issues with the team leader for solution Provides status on tasks assigned in the project to the tech lead and the project manager Ensure up-to-date knowledge in company and competitive solutions, through self-motivated approach to continuous learning. Actively participates in knowledge-sharing activities. Documents programs and program flows. Ensures that programming complies with available standards Undertakes design of applications as assigned by the technical lead. In smaller projects, acts as a technical lead Coordinates development-level, system testing and acceptance testing of applications and proposes design changes when applicable. Designs and authors help screens, menus, indices to ensure ease-of-use and consistency. Leads the technical design, programming and code documentation for entire applications. Prepares Data Models as required for the application. Prepares specification documents for other developers as required. Documents requirements and other technical documents according to a methodology. Mentors other consultants as required. May provide presentations on project under development or projects completed Focuses on the development and enforcement of design standards for Consulting services applications. Performs other duties as assigned. You Have:  At least 5-10 years of work experience with BI tools and technologies including one or more of Cognos, informatica, Hyperion, SAS, Business Objects, Information Builders (IBI), Generation5, Angoss, Peregrine, g5, spss, Teradata, MicroStrategy) Ability to assess client requirements in a sales setting and suggest technical alternatives. Ability to understand and customize multiple software solutions to fit together. Working knowledge of common hardware environments and operating systems such as Windows and UNIX environments Basic understanding of connectivity issues and connectivity protocols, ability to use and configure software on multiple operating systems. Excellent written, verbal and interpersonal communication skills  Nice to Have:   Bachelor’s degree in Engineering or Computer Science or Masters in Statistics (preferred)  Experience using relational database technology such as DB2 or Oracle.  Experience with software design methodologies.  Working knowledge of GUI technologies  Experience with testing and validation techniques in software engineering.  Travel and Location:  Ability to travel approximately 50% of the time as this is mainly an external client-facing role. Other work can be done from your home or our client’s office in Calgary. Although ideally located in Calgary, our client is open to individuals who reside anywhere in BC, AB, SK, MB with close access to an airport. Our client will consider relocating you to Calgary if you wish.  If you're not interested, but know someone who is; please help a current or former colleague in their career development by referring them. In addition, we're happy to give you a $750 referral fee. Click http://www.getROSS.com/referral_fee.php for more details.
Title: Senior BI/ DW Technical Consultant for Top Company

Job_Description: Eagle is currently seeking an AWS Architect . This is a three (3) month, contract position scheduled to start in May.  Key Responsibilities  The successful candidate will be responsible for: Providing recommendations to clients with respect to cloud migrations and preparing technical implementation roadmaps for AWS adoption;  Creating functional design specifications, reference architectures, and assisting with other project deliverables as needed;  Designing state-of-the-art technical solutions on AWS that address customer’s requirements for scalability, reliability, security, and performance;  Collaborating with other project teams on technical solutions and help improve service IP; and,  Staying up-to-date on all technical developments related to AWS.  Skills and Qualifications  The qualified candidate must have: Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, other technical field;  Knowledge of building product-quality software on AWS including experience in designing for high availability, building multi-zone and multi-region architectures, and designing across appropriate SQL and NoSQL data layer technologies;  Familiarity with various application stacks such as Java, C#, .Net, etc.;  Configuration and deployment experience in two or more of the following:  AWS apps technologies such as RDS, ElasticBeanstalk, DynamoDB, RedShift;  AWS IaaS Technologies such as EC2, S3, EBS, ELB, VPC, Route 53;  Deployed applications with Web UI frontends;  Deployed application with RESTful/SOAP services interfaces;  Experience building private AMI’s on VPC’s;  Firm grasp on cloud security, leveraging Linux and Windows operating systems, using the AWS console and CLI (command line interface);  Experience as a hands-on technical practitioner/specialist in client facing roles in large enterprises and demonstrated client facing consulting skills, including building strong client relationships;  Excellent verbal, presentation and written communications skills;  Strong team skills including the ability to lead and be a team player; and,  AWS certification in any of the following - Solutions Architect, Developer or Systems Ops (an asset).  Don’t miss out on this opportunity, apply online today!  Eagle is an equal opportunity employer and will provide accommodations during the recruitment process upon request. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please note that your application does not signify the beginning of employment with Eagle and that employment with Eagle will only commence when placed on an assignment as a temporary employee of Eagle.
Title: AWS Architect

Job_Description: Calgary, AB  Job Summary  Reporting directly to the Integration Practice Lead, the Integration Architect will lead and work cooperatively with internal and 3rd party Integration developers to design, development, and support high quality integration solutions following industry and company standards that meet the objectives of the projects and our company. The successful candidate will be responsible and accountable for delivering high quality Integration solutions utilizing a number of tools and technologies and will exercise leadership through superior technical and domain knowledge along with consensus forming amongst the diverse Integration team.  Responsibilities   Gain a detailed understanding of two disparate and merging systems and interactions from a standpoint of architecture, design, technology, processes, and constraints Understand business problems in order to develop creative, innovative and practical solutions that deliver high quality services to business Design, develop, implement, document, and maintain high quality EAI solutions using appropriate Integration architectures and tools (ESB, Web Services, Message Brokers, Queues, Schedulers, ETL tools, PL/SQL, Stored Procedures, etc.). Collaborate with a team of architects, developers, analysts, and infrastructure and security engineers on defining overall EAI solutions and integration approaches Act as Integration team lead on various projects defining and overseeing Integration solutions while managing small teams successfully through the project lifecycle. Support the estimating/scoping of customer requirements and planning of deliverables for Integration work within multiple projects Manage the ‘day to day’ of the technical team throughout the lifecycle of a project. Report issues, risks and statuses effectively to supervisor(s) both written and verbally Be an integral part of and contribute regularly to the Integration Center of Excellence: Help establish and refine Integration standards and best practices. Provide input into EAI technology and architecture topology and roadmaps for continual evaluation of current state and plan future evolution and improvements Mentor and train Integration team members on integration technologies and designs patterns and conducting regular ongoing code and design reviews with the team Have a clear understanding of Company policy and standards, become an advocate of such standards and evolve in the spirit of continual improvement  Required Skills and Experience  Minimum of 10 years’ overall IT or software engineering experience preferably with the last 5 of those immersed in integration specific technology development  Experience leading implementation teams through full project lifecycle, architecture, design, development, delivery, etc.  Proven experience and success in major system integration projects using messaging middleware and database technologies  Strong general EAI knowledge, process design, and implementation concepts including both industry and technology trends  Modeling (Visio/Provision) and Documentation knowledge and experience   Able to work in a fast-paced dynamic team-oriented environment with minimal supervision Great communication (both written and verbal), organizational, and trouble-shooting skills  Desired Technical Skills:  Database: SQL, PL/SQL, Oracle and SQL server, JDBC General programming skills: XML and XSD, java, JMS, WSDL/SOAP, Web services, SOA Experience in TIBCO suite of middleware products such as TIBCO Business Works, TIBCO Integration Manager, TIBCO adapters, TIBCO HAWK, etc. an asset  ·   EXPERIENCE WITH DATASTAGE is an asset  Desired behaviors   Builds Trust and Credibility by consistently adhering to the organization’s business principles and values. Is seen as direct, truthful, and trustworthy by co-workers, vendors, and customers. Committed to results by taking personal responsibility for achieving mutually agreed upon individual/team objectives wearing multiple hats as required. Demonstrates a desire to help and serve internal/external customers to meet their needs. Is proactive, responsive, and focused on discovering, anticipating, and exceeding the customer’s needs. Works collaboratively and cooperatively with others to achieve shared goals and objectives. Considers the wider team, function, banner or the organization and takes action or makes decisions which support the success of those groups. Recovers quickly after change, disruptions, or mistakes and can remain productive and focused. Is adaptable and can apply lessons learned in one situation to another situation. Retail experience/knowledge would be an asset  Academic / Educational requirements  Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or related area of expertise  Hiring contact: smears@tundratechnical.ca  Tundra Technical Solutions would like to thank you for the interest you have demonstrated in this opportunity. However, only candidates with the required skills will be contacted.  Tundra Technical Solutions is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in our workplace .  Not interested in this position, but know somebody who might be? Check out our Referral Reward Program, referrals are a big secret behind our success. As always, we’re on the lookout for great people. And we know that you know great people. Simply click on ‘Tell a Friend’ option to refer a friend.  Tundra Technical Solutions is among North America’s leading providers of Information Technology and Engineering staffing and consulting services. Our success and our clients’ success are built on a foundation of service excellence. Rather than continually trying to sell to new clients and companies and simply filling databases with candidates, we focus on developing stronger relationships and deeper knowledge of our existing clients’ challenges and opportunities.  Open ears. Open minds. Open futures  The Tundra team has over 600 years of experience, from a wide variety of disciplines – recruiting executives, business owners and technical consultants. Our combined experience ensures that your needs are covered from every possible direction.

Job_Description: About Aimsio: Founded in 2013, Aimsio is a fast growing software company that helps businesses with field operations create a paperless workflow. The Aimsio cloud-based solution allows companies to communicate with field employees and track business assets in real-time. The software provides access from anywhere using mobile, iPad, laptop and desktop computer devices.Aimsio's offices are located in the hearts of downtown Calgary and Vancouver. Whether a business is looking to simply digitize field paperwork or requires an all-in-one platform to run its field operations, Aimsio can help!THE ROLE: Are you up for the challenge?We are searching for a talented iOS developer to help build our iOS team in downtown Calgary, including defining and executing the direction of our iPad product and working to create a great team culture. We are looking for someone who will be a strong partner for our existing team--someone who is energized by the long-term challenges of building a team, but who can also respond quickly to short-term challenges like supporting new customers.Aimsio’s iOS product consists of a comprehensive iPad app that our customers pay a yearly subscription fee to use. As an iOS Developer with Aimsio, you will work on a large existing codebase written in Swift and Objective-C. You will use the iOS SDK and many other third party frameworks. For example, you will utilize the AFNetworking framework to make REST calls and consume data from a Java back-end.RESPONSIBILITIES:  How you will make a contribution to our teamAdd new functionalities while maintaining and improving existing ones.Contribute to building the iOS vision and goals for the company.Collaborate on cross-functional teams to define, design, plan, and implement new features and performance improvements.Learn and use the technologies chosen by the team.Test the software to assure quality and usability through automated and manual system testsQUALIFICATIONS:  Do you have what it takes?BSc or MSc in Computer Science or related fieldProven iOS development experience, 3+ years strong background in Objective-C and SwiftSolid understanding of software development practices and design patternsExperience with Xcode and GitProficiency in database designPassionate about user interface design and user experienceAny working knowledge of Java, JavaScript, RESTful APIs and/or Web services is a plusExperience with Agile/Scrum and SaaS is a plusCompensation: Competitive salaryFull benefitsRRSP matching programHealth spending accountAre you intrigued yet? Here are a few more reasons to make Aimsio your daytime home: Work with the brightest, most innovative people you’ve ever met. Plus, we’re pretty funny. And there are snacks in the kitchen, too.Play a role in building a technology company that can’t stop and won’t stop growing. We’re Rick-Rolling over here and we’re never gonna give you up.Make an impact by leading projects and driving the direction of the company.Solve complex problems. Develop initiatives and solutions that drive your career and boost the company’s growth.Attend and speak at regular Aimsio Academy meetings. Inspired by Talks @ Google, Aimsio Academy meetings are meant to inspire employees by sharing nuggets of wisdom. And chicken nuggets. Just kidding. But maybe we should start doing that.Have fun! Not only are we smart, we’re also an absolute hoot. Xbox tournaments, poker nights, foosball games, team events, even a hammock in case you find yourself a lil’ sleepy. Seriously, everybody’s working for the weekDAY over here. (That’s another ‘80s music joke. Maybe we should just stop.)Enjoy the little things – all you can drink coffee, tea, and a fully stocked kitchen. Snacks on snacks on snacks.Work hard, play hard. It’s a fast-paced, fun environment. If you don’t believe us, give us a creep. We’re on Instagram (aimsio_inc), Facebook (@aimsio) and Twitter (@aimsioinc).Does this sound like you? Please apply asap as we are interviewing immediately for this permanent, full time position.Job Type: Full-timeExperience:iOS development: 1 yearObjective-C & Swift: 3 yearsXcode & Git: 1 yearEducation:Bachelor'sLocation:Calgary, ABLanguage:English
Title: iOS developer

Job_Description: FLYHT provides an opportunity to deliver cutting-edge products for the global aviation industry, a unique opportunity in Alberta. FLYHT leads the industry with our patented black box streaming technology and focuses on customer satisfaction and profitability as keys to success.FLYHT’s mission is to improve aviation safety, efficiency and profitability (located in Calgary, Canada; publicly traded as: FLY: TSX.V; FLYLF: OTCQX). Airlines, leasing companies, fractional owners and original equipment manufacturers have installed the Automated Flight Information Reporting System (AFIRSTM) on their aircraft to capture, process and stream aircraft data with real-time alerts. AFIRS sends this information through satellite networks to the UpTimeTM cloud-based data center, which provides aircraft operators with direct insight into the operational status and health of their aircraft and enables them to take corrective action to maintain the highest standard of operational control.The Company fosters a community-driven work environment with the opportunity to contribute directly to the success and achievement of the Company’s goals and objectives. FLYHT offers comprehensive benefits and a 9/80 work week which provides flexibility with every other Friday off.Position Summary: FLYHT is looking for a high performing technical resource within our Customer Engineering team; a team of software developers who configure and support FLYHT’s real time aircraft data monitoring and Satcom products. The products extract and process information from aircraft data buses in real time. This information is used to construct and deliver reports to customers via satellite and ground-based systems to dramatically improve their situational awareness on the ground.This position is ideal for someone who has experience in software configuration and development in a support, product development and service environment. The successful candidate will need to quickly learn software configuration, testing and development practices while becoming an effective team leader. He/she is a high performing technical resource who is a result driven individual and works exceptionally well with all stakeholders.Responsibilities: Work closely with the Manager Customer Support to plan, coordinate and execute delivery of product and services in the most efficient mannerExecute software configuration and software development tasks as an effective team member 24/7 technical support of FLYHT’s products and services to ensure timely response to customer and internal infrastructure issuesEscalate voice of the customer and product deficiencies to Product Management and Product EngineeringProvide mentorship and support to the customer engineering team while maintaining an enjoyable work environmentEmbrace a culture of continuous improvementReport on data metrics and challenge the team to continuously improve results with the objective of increasing customer satisfactionDocument and maintain process, procedures and work instructionsMaintain compliance with AS9100 certification requirementsAfter hours on-call support as requiredTechnical Proficiencies: Experience with C, Java, SQL, DB2, C++, C#, Bash scriptingEmbedded software development experienceFamiliar with serial protocols and data transfer conceptsAbility to define and validate data processing algorithmsQualificationsProven ability to learn quicklyProven analytical and problem-solving capabilityExcellent skills in customer and interpersonal communicationExcellent organizational, prioritization and time management skillsQualities of a leaderAssetsKnowledge of avionic software development guidelines (DO-178, DO-278)Understanding of Flight Manuals, and other aircraft related publications (AFM, AMM, FCOM, QRH, AOM, FPCCM, CAFM, CIFP, SCAPs, EFBs, MMEL, DDG, etc)Technical writing skillsGeneral understanding of aircraft systems and maintenanceAircraft data busses- ARINC 717, 429, ASCB, MIL-STD-1553, etc.Bachelor’s degree or higher in aerospace engineering or computer science with aminimum of 3 years of aerospace and/or airline industry experienceFLYHT is guided by our core values. We are a tight-knit team who like to have fun, promote teamwork and support each other while valuing and empowering each employee. We challenge our employees to develop creative and innovative solutions. We embrace change, manage risk and continuously improve. Job_Description: Eagle is currently seeking an Intermediate Business Systems Analyst for a six (6) month contract opportunity, scheduled to begin in June.  Key Responsibilities  The successful candidate will be responsible for: Documenting and analyzing business system requirements in such a way that the business team members understand and approve them and other project team members can successfully use them to develop the solution;  Ensuring the solution meets the business requirements;  Developing detailed functional, system, and program specifications;  Conducting analysis to help the business system function more effectively through analytics, developing and writing business systems specifications or can plan and analyze business systems practices providing expertise to senior management;  Being involved in matters that could have strategic importance;  Supporting facilitation of user requirements/user story/backlog development sessions;  Documenting assumptions and constraints;  Producing and maintaining business process models and system data flow maps;  Collaborating and defining requirements with project teams and business users, translating business needs into documented requirements and use cases that can be used by developers to create software, by application specialists to configure software, or by infrastructure specialists to develop technical solutions;  Reviewing and validating requirements with project teams and business users, translating business needs into documented requirements and use cases to create and configure software by application specialist, or by infrastructure specialists to develop technical solutions;  Facilitating and assisting the business in prioritizing and re-prioritizing requirements;  Building and maintaining relationships with the project business stakeholders and team members;  Tracking requirements and deliverables to ensure that business requirements are being met; and,  Identifying business requirements that may change due to development or technical decisions or as a result of scope changes or technical changes from vendor.  Skills and Qualifications  The qualified candidate must have: A minimum of five (5) years’ demonstrable experience as a Business Analyst/Quality Analyst on large technology projects;  Experience with Agile development projects;  Experience with facilitation, requirements gathering, and story writing;  Experience working with remote teams;  Experience with tools for backlog-management, testing and iteration planning: Microsoft Team Foundation Server (TFS), Visual Studio, SharePoint, Excel, Kanban Boards, SQL Server;  The ability to understand and describe business problems, business processes, constraints, and advantages and disadvantages of solution options;  Experience with defining the QM Standards and Test Process standards;  Experience developing and executing User Acceptance test cases with the QA team;  Experience establishing test repository for test plans, test cases and test results;  Experience performing defect tracking and analysis;  Experience generates test status reports for the Project Manager;  Experience develops test cases for Functional, Integration, System testing and any other test types;  Experience working with the business client to identify test data to support the different test cycles;  Experience executing System/Integration test cases; performs Ad Hoc testing;  The ability to function effectively in an environment where change occurs continuously;  The ability to build effective relationships with team members, business partners, external vendors, and key stakeholders;  The ability to effectively communicate to all levels of personnel from field/operations through to Corporate management;  Excellent verbal and written communication skills;  The ability to ramp quickly, gaining an understanding of the business problems/opportunities, project objectives, and high level design completed to date; and,  Strong understanding of business processes, analyzes complex business problems to be solved with IT technologies.  Don’t miss out on this opportunity, apply online today!  We would like to thank all applicants for their interest; however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please note that your application does not signify the beginning of employment with Eagle and that employment with Eagle will only commence when placed on an assignment as a temporary employee of Eagle.
Title: Intermediate Business System Analyst

Job_Description: Brookfield Properties is a leading owner, operator and developer of office and multifamily assets. Our signature office properties define the skyline of dynamic cities around the world, including gateway cities such as New York, London, Berlin, Toronto, and Sydney. Our multifamily business owns, develops, renovates and manages approximately 40,000 high quality rental apartment buildings in supply constrained markets of major cities such as New York and London, as well as high growth markets in the suburban U.S. Reporting to the Manager, Operations, your primary responsibilities will be supervision of the building’s daily operations and maintenance. You will be required to ensure that day-to-day HVAC and preventative maintenance of mechanical and electrical equipment is operating at optimum levels. You will also be responsible for supervising all operations and maintenance staff ensuring a high level of communication and teamwork within the team, as well as with other departments. Responsibilities: Inspecting, supervising and coordinating the repair and maintenance of any building mechanical, electrical, life safety and envelope systems. Liaising with tenants regarding any requests for services or information, ensuring issues and concerns are resolved to the tenant’s satisfaction. Organizing and overseeing mechanical and electrical contractors performing base building and tenant improvement work. Ensuring all systems are operating in an efficient safe manner and that related safety guidelines set out in provincial Environmental Health and Safety legislation, and company policies/procedures are being met. Providing guidance, coaching and direction to 13 operations and maintenance staff on a day to day basis, giving regular feedback. Preparing and presenting Operations and Maintenance staff performance reviews at the review board and meet with individual staff. Completing checks of and making any required corrections to Tenant Billing System for each version and submitting to Shared Services by the 15th of each month. Working within Budget constraints. Other duties and projects as assigned. Qualifications: This individual requires superior customer service skills, strong interpersonal skills, and the ability to deal with difficult situations diplomatically. This successful candidate must have a thorough understanding of operational and technical issues in an effort to provide direction and leadership to the Operations and Maintenance departments and efficiently interact with Construction, Security, Tenant Services, and Building Services. The position demands flexibility (able to work on call and over time as required) and a high degree of organizational and administrative skills to manage a variety of priorities and changing deadlines. Experience: A minimum of five (5) years’ experience working in a large commercial multi-tenant building. Supervisory experience in a similar capacity leading large teams. Project management experience. Proven customer service skills Education/Designations/Licenses: Fourth Class Power Engineering Certification Trade certificate would be an asset Completion of leadership/supervisory/management training Technical Skills: Intermediate computer skills (MS Office 2010) Experience with Samsung phone Ability to learn new software and technology Thorough knowledge of building components, including air handling systems, mechanical & electrical systems, water treatment, environmental issues and building automation systems. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those selected for pre-screening will be contacted. Brookfield is committed to accommodating the individual needs of all applicants with disabilities during the recruitment and selection process as an organizational best practice and as required under the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act.
Title: Supervisor, Operations

Job_Description: Calgary Sales Manager Huntwood Industries … Headquartered in the Pacific Northwest, Huntwood Industries (www.huntwood.com) is the premier West Coast leader of a wide range of custom and semi-custom interior wood finishings including: cabinetry; architectural doors/millwork and commercial caseworks. As an entrepreneurial spirited 30 year-old family-owned business we employ over 500 workers (US and Canada), and we are – stronger than ever, growing, and always looking for top-tier prospects to join our team of creative-seasoned professionals. Meantime, as one of our core strategic growth initiatives we are pleased to announce an exceptional career opportunity for the right cabinetry design/sales professional currently doing business in the Calgary, Alberta Market As of the date of this job posting, we are commencing a search for a highly driven, energetic and focused individual to lead, manage and build a significant cabinetry sales portfolio in the Calgary, Alberta Market. The client-prospect focus of sales & service is targeted at residential home builders (single & multi-family), remodelers, construction companies and developers. Those individuals with existing business relationships in these targeted markets – is a significant plus. Responsibilities: Collaboratively work with Regional Sales Manager to achieve sales production goals. Organizing, planning, controlling, directing and staffing – Calgary Office. Business development: Targeting, selling, leading, motivating and monitoring branch sales production efforts, performance and bottom-line results. Company Ambassador: Senior Huntwood boots-on-the-ground liaison between Company-Clients and Prospects. Create a professional and engaging first impression with our prospects and customers. Thoroughly qualify all inbound and outbound opportunities and collaborate with account executives for a positive customer experience. Generate new business through outbound prospecting. Prioritize leads, research prospects – to match our core product offerings/capabilities. Negotiate successful sales contracts.  Requirements: Living and working within the Greater Calgary area 5+ years of successful cabinetry sales and design experience. 3+ years of C-level builder selling experience. Strong working knowledge of CAD or 2020 software. Proficient computer skills to include Microsoft Office Suite. Self-motivated, driven and committed to developing new business. Strong communication skills (verbal and written). Solid organizational and leadership skills. Extensive experience in negotiating and preparing contracts to secure new business. Trade show/convention industry experience - a plus. Experience developing targeted solicitation to secure key accounts. Creates and conducts Huntwood capabilities presentations. Demonstrated proficiency in developing short-term and long term vision and strategy to achieve targeted sales objectives in a fast-paced environment.  Compensation - Working Experience – Opportunities : Competitive base pay plus sales production incentives. Ancillary employee benefit package. Creative, innovative and entrepreneurial “can-do” working climate. Unlimited occupational and professional growth opportunities for our employees.

Job_Description: About Scalar Decisions: Scalar is Canada’s leading IT solutions provider, focused on security, infrastructure, cloud, and digital transformation. Founded in 2004, Scalar is headquartered in Toronto, with offices in Montreal, Ottawa, London, Winnipeg, Calgary, Edmonton, Vancouver, and Victoria. Scalar was recently named one of Canada's Best Managed Companies, named to CRN’s 2017 Solution Provider 500 List, and listed on the PROFIT 500 for the seventh year running. In addition, Scalar was deemed a major player in the IDC MarketScape for Canadian managed security service providers and ranked the #1 ICT security company on the 2014 -2017 editions of the Branham 300. We focus on recruiting top talent, and we work hard to keep them. To learn more about Scalar, go to www.scalar.ca .  Job Summary: Are you an experienced ServiceNow Systems Administrator? Are you driven to deliver excellent customer service? Do you like leading a team and like working in a fun, fast-paced and rapidly growing work environment?  Scalar Decisions is looking for a versatile and experienced ServiceNow Systems Lead with strong hands on experience to join its Managed Services team. Your role will lead a small team on Level 2 System Administrators as well as managing Scalar’s ServiceNow implementation. You will also be responsible for creating detailed online reports.  Scalar is a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment so to be successful you’ll need to be a pro-active individual, take direction well, communicate succinctly and collaborate effectively.  Core Responsibilities: Analyze, define and document requirements for data, workflow, logical processes, hardware and operating system environment, interface with other systems, internal and external checks, controls, and outputs  Configuration of ServiceNow system including creating workflows, UI design, ACL and business rules  Load, manipulate and maintain data between ServiceNow and other systems  Create and maintain integrations with other internal and external systems and solutions  Implement and maintain automated workflows using ServiceNow Orchestration  Provide time estimates for assigned work packages to support sprint and project plans  Performs general support, daily administration and maintenance of ServiceNow platform and associated applications  Facilitate and support the rollout of new application and enhancements in ServiceNow  Lead a team of L2 System administrators that are responsible for onsite deskside support, backup management and VDI support.  To collaborate with other team members to enable best-in-class service  Act as a primary liaison between infrastructure support teams  Must have strong creative, analytical and problem-solving skills.  Excellent oral and written communicate with customers, teammates, and management  Provisioning: Follow ITIL practices regarding incident, problem and change management Deploy new services and environments for customers and internal systems  Create, update and maintain customer build documents and runbooks  Help research, develop and implement new services, tools and software Document and update technical procedures, administrative processes, configuration management database  Work within revision control for tool or script development  Contribute towards the development of automation  Qualifications and Experience Level: University or College Degree in Computer Science or a related field  In-depth technical understanding in a variety of hardware and software platforms  Experience on applications with multiple functions  Strong knowledge of ITSM processes  5+ years of experience in ServiceNow as ServiceNow Developer and Administrator with hands on Experience on Service Portal, CMDB, Discovery, Orchestration and Service mapping.  Worked on different modules of ServiceNow such as Change, Incident, Service Catalog, CMDB and Asset, knowledge, different integrations, Change, Release with basic knowledge of CMS, Discovery with good knowledge of ITIL process.  Experienced in Application Development and Integrations between ServiceNow and external systems.  Working experience in creating workflows for Service Catalog items in ServiceNow  We thank all candidates for their interest, however, only those selected for interviews will be contacted.
Title: ServiceNow System Lead, MS

Job_Description: SUBNET Solutions Inc. is a global software solutions provider for electrical utilities. SUBNET focuses on Making Power Grids More Intelligent®. Founded in 1992, SUBNET is an industry leader providing intelligent solutions that securely connect real time electrical utility field information with utility business systems to enable Smart Grid solutions. Over 200 utilities worldwide rely on SUBNET software to safely manage and monitor thousands of substations. SUBNET is a Microsoft Gold Certified Partner and a Cisco Developer Network Connected Energy Partner. SUBNET has offices located in Calgary, Edmonton, and throughout the United States, South Africa and Australia. Are you looking for a challenging and rewarding career with a dynamic company? SUBNET is growing and is looking for a career driven Account Manager. Job Summary: The SUBNET Account Manager is a strategic member of the sales team who manages the relationships with our key customers and develope new business. This management includes creating the plans necessary to increase SUBNET product adoption with those customers and new businesses as well as ensuring that customer satisfaction is high. The SUBNET Account Manager keeps current with a customer by scheduling regular customer calls, attending the same events that customers are attending, and scheduling periodic visits on-site. Also, they continuously keep current with the industry leads and increase the customer base in their assigned regions. The SUBNET Account Manager coordinates customer activities and information with both the SUBNET services and SUBNET software departments to ensure the communication between SUBNET and the customer is consistent, clear, and in alignment with sales goals. It is expected that a SUBNET Account Manager has a technical understanding of the products SUBNET develops and the solutions they are intended to provide. Much of the customer touch-points are with engineers, and a technical understanding of the product is necessary for effective communication. SUBNET takes a pro-active approach to customer relationship management. We want to make an impact with our customers, not just be visible. Accountabilities & Responsibilities: This position is accountable for: Building and executing a SUBNET account plan that is approved and incorporated into SUBNET’s larger business sales objectives. Understanding technical problems addressed by the products including key regulations, business drivers, evolving business needs, etc. Techncial leadership has been provided for business development including product demonstrations, RFI responses, and sales support for RFP/RFQ responses Translating business and user requirements into accurate system requirements/specification documents, through systems and data analysis, while managing traceability of satisfaction criteria throughout the project delivery. Achieving the goals set forth within the SUBNET account strategy. Own all primary Customer communication and resolve account related escalations regarding SUBNET products. Owernership of aspects of project plans including the creation, performance and customer acceptance Delivering of engineering implementation, installation, commissioning and instruction services This position is responsible for: Use existing sales templates to design Account PPT and Create quotes for products, CCE Program, services, training, ASE Test Sets per the SUBNET standard quote process Managing maintenance of customer data in SUBNET tracking system (CRM) and ensuring that each qualified Opportunity notes are tracked within CRM using established CRM Templates. Assist Account Managers in activities to help execute key customer strategies. Provide internal sales support to the Director of Sales with regard to customer and operational requests. Set up part numbers for re-occurring orders (customer standardization). Coordination and promotion of Training Tours, as well as helping to maintain the Trainers schedule Follow-up on customer product trials and training attendance. Prepare various reports for sales including sales forecasts, CCE License Lists, and other miscellaneous reports as required and attending internal SUBNET Training Cold Calling/lead generation as well as gathering customer needs and conducting lead qualification. Managing the Request for Proposal and/or Request for Information process for assigned accounts Liaise with Customer Services to resolve customer issues Maintaining a high level of expertise in utility communication systems and SUBNET products and solutions Responsible for Overall Sales Performance of accounts in your territory Liaise with other Account Managers to generate new opportunities for SUBNET products and services Participate in the creation of presentations or case studies for presentations at conferences and tradeshows Ownership of aspects of project test plans including the creation, performance and customer acceptance Develop, support and provide effective demonstrations/presentations of SUBNET Products which address clients’ needs and competitive situations. Jointly develop project plans with our customers and SUBNET in order to successfully manage the solutions that exceed our customer’s expectations Contribute to product specifications with emphasis on customer requirements Obtain customer technical information including existing technical architecture, technical requirements, future needs, and existing pain points and creating work back plans for the delivery of product or solution. Work with customers to identify and define project requirements and opportunities. Facilitate case studies and success stories with customers SKILLS AND KNOWLEDGE  Experience with SCADA communications, automation, and system integration. Experience with Microsoft desktop, embedded, and network environments. Excellent organization, time management, and interpersonal skills. Understanding of business environments and terminologies. Ability to adapt in a dynamic work environment and make independent decisions. Detail-oriented with a strong customer service focus. Advanced problem solving skills and the ability to work with innovative solutions. Excellent written and oral communication skills. Excellent presentation skills.  QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE: High school diploma required. Technical competence is an asset (understand software, hardware, networks, etc..). BCOM or related business diploma or degree preferred (or appropriate related experience). Minimum 5 years of strategic sales experience in a business-to business sales environment. Experience doing business in the T&D utilities space an asset. Proven sales track record for exceeding sales targets and quotas. Minimum 3 years’ experience with strategic account planning. The following is considered as asset: Ability to verbally communicate in more than one language Compensation & Benefits: Compensation: Negotiable, Full-time Salaried Benefits: Full benefits including disability, life insurance, medical, dental and vision for employees and their families. Flex days in addition to vacation. Education reimbursement program. Employee Personal Spending Account. Employee/Employer Matching GRSP/401K Program How to Apply: By email: jobs@SUBNET.com
Title: Account Manager

Founded in 1992, SUBNET is an industry leader providing intelligent solutions that securely connect real time electrical utility field information with utility business systems to enable Smart Grid solutions. Over 200 utilities worldwide rely on SUBNET software to safely manage and monitor thousands of substations. SUBNET is a Microsoft Gold Certified Partner and a Cisco Developer Network Connected Energy Partner. SUBNET has offices located in Calgary, Edmonton, and throughout the United States, South Africa and Australia. Are you looking for a challenging and rewarding career with a dynamic company? SUBNET is growing and is looking for a very driven and result-oriented Director of Marketing. Job Summary: The Director of Marketing is accountable for the coordination, organization, and maintaining of all SUBNET marketing activities, events, communications, materials, budgets, and marketing databases to leverage SUBNET in the market place according to the companies strategic plan and goals. This position is responsible for leading and mentoring SUBNET employees and contractors in event planning and other marketing initiatives. This position will work closely with the SUBNET executive team to define marketing strategies and tactics.  Accountabilities & Responsibilities: This position is accountable for the following outcomes/results: Developing, Overseeing and Delivering on SUBNET’s Marketing strategy. This position is responsible for the following: 1) Marketing Plan Develop and execute a marketing strategy that contains a clear action plan, timeline and milestone(s). Create written communication plans to disseminate marketing objectives and strategies to key stakeholders. 2) Marketing Collateral Establish and administer complete online web seminar marketing initiatives. Oversee the setup and administer mass-email applications and servers. Oversee the writing and editing of case studies, press releases, brochures and web copy. Oversee the design graphics for web and print. Design, develop, and maintain the company website and online store. 3) Marketing Analysis Interpret and integrate consumer insights and industry issues into tactics that support the company’s long term and short term objectives. Identify and describe potential markets. Conduct market research, compile existing data and analyze trends. 4) Corporate Branding Establish corporate branding policies and documentation including writing style guides. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Strong decision making, proficiency in developing and evaluating options, and alternative course of actions, making informed decisions. Making recommendations that are justified and align to goals and objectives. Leadership skills – communicates goals and objectives of others. Capable of working collaboratively and engaging resources as required across the organization. Accepts personal responsibility for one’s own performance. Integrity – acts in accordance with ethical principles and SUBNET’s values, raises and addresses ethical concerns or issues when appropriate, follows-through on commitments and implied agreements, takes ownership. Goal oriented - sets, pursues, and follows-through with achieving goals, persists despite obstacles, engages in problem-solving activities regularly, is dissatisfied with average performance. Results oriented - ability to learn new skills and assume new responsibilities, demonstrates adaptability and flexibility in overcoming challenging situations, shows resolve in searching for alternative solutions to problems. Detail oriented - must be very detail-oriented and analytical in their thinking in order to successfully plan and execute marketing events, goals and projects. Strong project management skills Outstanding organizational skills. QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE: Business/Marketing degree/diploma or minimum seven years of relevant experience. Technical skills as it relates to marketing, Customer Relationship Management software and Microsoft SharePoint. 7+ years of Marketing and Communication experience. Must have experience in Media relations and Digital Marketing. The following is considered as asset: Ability to verbally communicate in more than one language REQUIRED SUPERVISION Must be able to work under minimal supervision TRAVEL Perform site visits where necessary Attend events when necessary.
