Job_Description: Our Calgary location is currently looking for a <strong><u>full-time Software Developer</u></strong> to be part of a team that is responsible for delivering timely, high quality releases that delight our customers in the upstream oil & gas sector. You’d be designing, coding and testing enhancements to our Harmony desktop application in C++ and/or C#. <br/><br/> <strong>About You:</strong> <ul> <li><strong>You’re highly collaborative</strong> - you have an affinity for solving complex problems through dialogue with team members</li><li><strong>You’re a problem solver</strong> – you enjoy solving complex problems, and are comfortable exploring them even if the problem and solution are not yet well-defined</li><li><strong>You’re practical</strong> – you assess the circumstances and make the best decision based on the facts</li><li><strong>You’re always improving something</strong> – whether it’s learning a new programming language, or finding better ways to do things with your team, continuous improvement is important to you</li> </ul> <strong>Some of the things you’d be doing as a developer on our team:</strong> <ul> <li>Be an active and collaborative team member as part of an agile development team of 5-9 people</li><li>Design, code and test enhancements for a Windows-based desktop application written in C++ and/or C#, with SQL Server as its backend database</li><li>Work with customer stakeholders to ensure we’re adding value for our users</li><li>Work closely with other developers, for example by pair programming and participating in code reviews</li><li>Troubleshoot and fix bugs</li><li>Contribute to testing of user stories, features and releases</li><li>Assist our customer facing support team in solving client issues, when necessary</li><li>Contribute insights and suggestions as part of our continuous improvement</li><li>Generally pitch in wherever needed to help get a high quality release out on time</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications that would make you a good fit for this role:</strong> <ul> <li>Minimum B.Sc. in software engineering, computer engineering, computer science, or equivalent experience.</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Experience writing code in C++ and/or C#</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Experience with SQL Server databases</li><li>Familiarity with object oriented software design</li><li>Experience with unit testing</li><li>Familiarity with, or interest in, agile principles and values</li> </ul> <strong>About Us</strong> <br/><br/> We are IHS Markit. We harness deep sources of information, analytics and expertise to forge solutions for the industries and markets that drive global economies. Our company partners with clients in business, finance and government to provide the unrivaled insights and perspectives that lead to well-informed, confident decisions. We call this The New Intelligence. IHS Markit serves more than 50,000 key customers in more than 140 countries, including 80 percent of the Fortune Global 500. We help decision makers apply higher-level thinking to daily tasks and strategic issues across a host of industries and disciplines including energy, finance, automotive, engineering, technology, maritime and trade, aerospace and defense, chemical, and economics and country risk. <br/><br/> Headquartered in London, IHS Markit (Nasdaq: INFO) is committed to sustainable, profitable growth. <br/><br/> It is the policy of IHS Markit to provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, IHS Markit will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. We maintain a drug-free workplace. For candidates in the US, we are a participant in E-Verify (see link below). <br/><br/> EEO is the Law <br/> EEO is the Law Supplement <br/> Right to Work <br/> Pay Transparency Policy <br/> E-Verify<br/><br/>Current ColleaguesIf you are currently a colleague with IHS Markit please apply internally via Workday.
Title: Sr. Software Developer

Job_Description: Interested in being a part of a team that is leading the digital evolution of retail in Canada? <br/><br/> Embracing and driving change is critical to our success. The complexity and rate at which the retail industry is transforming has increased exponentially in recent years and we are committed to being a leader in the industry. <br/><br/> As such we are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join the Canadian Tire Family of Companies as a Senior Software Developer at Canada’s premier sporting goods retailer, FGL. FGL owns the most recognizable sporting goods brands in the country including Sport Chek, Sports Experts, National Sports, Pro Hockey Life and Atmosphere. <br/><br/> <strong>What you’ll do</strong> <br/><br/> In this role, you will be expected to: <br/><br/> Collaborate actively with the business analyst (BA) in the design of: <ul> <li>Fully integrated systems, which may include applications, databases, and related systems</li><li>Alternative solutions to existing applications</li><li>Effective and efficient interfaces to systems, applications, and databases</li><li>Conduct feasibility studies, proof-of-concept prototypes</li><li>Provide high-level development during the initial stages of a project</li><li>Provide & meet estimated time of accomplishment for assigned tasks</li><li>Evaluate and enhance the efficiency of existing programs, anticipating future user needs</li><li>Ensure system integrity, efficiency, and security</li><li>Provide and supervise unit, integrated, and volume testing</li><li>Maintain and support assigned systems to ensure minimal downtime and loss of productivity, service</li><li>Maintain and support associated databases, models, and technical documentation</li><li>Lead a small team of developers to achieve the above goals</li> </ul> <strong>Who you are</strong> <br/><br/> We are looking for a high performing individual who: <ul> <li>Possesses an entrepreneurial spirit, a bias for action, and a desire to work with key stakeholders to drive innovation in the retail environment and in-store e-commerce;</li><li>Is direct and truthful, and builds trust and credibility with co-workers, vendors, and customers by consistently adhering to the organization’s business principles and values</li><li>Demonstrates a desire to help and is proactive, responsive, and focused on discovering, anticipating, and exceeding the customer’s needs</li><li>Is committed to results by taking personal responsibility for achieving mutually agreed upon individual/team objectives, and working collaboratively and cooperatively with others to achieve shared goals and objective</li><li>Considers the wider team, function, banner or the organization and takes action or makes decisions which support the success of those groups</li><li>Recovers quickly after change, disruptions, or mistakes and can remain productive and focused</li><li>Is adaptable and can apply lessons learned in one situation to another situation</li><li>If you’re curious, ready to take on new challenges and open to doing things differently to help us evolve rapidly, then FGL Sports is definitely the place to be</li> </ul> <strong>What you’ve done</strong> <ul> <li>Minimum 10 years of experience as a developer</li><li>5 years working experience designing and building applications using Java</li><li>Fundamental understanding of Java design concepts and design patterns</li><li>Strong understanding of the J2EE ecosystem including proven experience with Application Servers (Apache Tomcat) and standard Java technologies such as JNDI, JMS, JMX, and the Spring Framework</li><li>Experience with the MEAN stack (MongoDB/MariaDB, Express, Angular, Node.js)</li><li>Experience building and debugging client/server Internet systems and architecture</li><li>Strong understanding of Git</li>  <ul> <li>Solid knowledge of at least one SQL programming environment</li><li>SQL Server 2005-2012</li><li>Oracle 9i-12c</li><li>MariaDB or MySQL 10</li> </ul>  <li>Experience in native Android application development</li>  <ul> <li>Android Studio, Gradle, Maven</li><li>User Interfaces Layouts</li><li>SQLite</li> </ul>  <li>Local Services, External Services, Content Providers, Account Manager Integration Spring Mobile, Corodva (nice to have)</li><li>Proficient understanding of Linux operating systems (RHEL 6.x, 7.x) and development environments</li><li>Understanding of security, encryption, and compression best practice</li><li>Experience developing and deploying to at least one cloud platform</li>  <ul> <li>AWS</li><li>Azure</li><li>Google Cloud</li><li>Kubernetes/Docker</li> </ul>  <li>Experience with DevOps environments</li><li>Bamboo, Jenkins, Ansible</li>  </ul> <strong>Why us</strong> <br/><br/> Canadian Tire is one of Canada’s most iconic and diversified companies. Our culture and values uphold our pledge to sustainable practices, and the commitment to our local communities through Jumpstart cannot be beat. <br/><br/> To learn more about this team and the Canadian Tire Family of Companies follow us on LinkedIn. <br/><br/> FGL Sports is an equal opportunity employer. Job_Description: <strong><u>Job Summary:</u> <br/>  <br/> </strong> <br/> Intermediate Software Developer <br/>  <br/> <strong><u>Job Description:</u> <br/><br/> </strong> <br/> For field service companies who need web based fleet management tools, AssetWorks Field Service Solutions (FSS) improves operator safety, streamlines operations, & reduces fleet related operating costs. Unlike other fleet management tools which are often AVL only focused and fairly one dimensional, FSS has the ability to address the nuances of a wide variety of field service industries with features such as custom map data layers, incident reporting, lone worker monitoring, customized work flows, satellite communication backup, private roads etc, while addressing common transportation issues like Hours of Service and driver behaviour. This provides AssetWorks a competitive edge in this market. <br/> There are ongoing requirements to expand the FSS product to support new industry requirements, adapt to new web and mobile technologies and maintain a system that clients depend on 24x7 for their operations. We are seeking qualified individuals to join our software development team in the Calgary, AB office. <br/><br/> <strong>Primary Responsibilities:</strong> <br/><br/> The successful applicant will work a team of experienced developers and will be involved in all stages of the development process from research, specification development and review, implementation and testing to pilot and support. There will be involvement on all aspects of the solution from the web client through to the mobile devices. <br/><br/> <strong><u>Requirements</u>:</strong>  <ul> <li>BSc in computer science or computer/software engineering;</li><li>Strong C# / Microsoft .NET programming experience;</li><li>MS SQL DBMS experience</li><li>Practical experience with unit testing and overall testing strategies;</li><li>Ability to work collaboratively within a team;</li><li>Strong diagnostic and troubleshooting skills;</li><li>Capable of clear and concise written and oral communications.</li> </ul>  <strong><u>Assets</u>:</strong>  <ul> <li>Experience in WPF and web development;</li><li>Experience with mobile application programming</li><li>Experience with Oracle DBMS</li><li>Experience using source control (i.e. TFS);</li> </ul>  We are seeking candidates with at least 2 years of relevant experience. <br/><br/> <strong><u>Worker Type:</u> <br/>  <br/> </strong> <br/> Regular <br/>  <br/> <strong><u>Number of Openings Available:</u> <br/>  <br/> </strong> <br/> <strong>1</strong>
Title: Software Developer - AssetWorks Field Service Solutions (FSS)

Job_Description: At General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada, Canada’s premiere defence company, innovation happens on a daily basis. We develop and deliver highly-complex leading edge technology, products and systems that make important contributions to our customer’s success in land, airborne, maritime and public safety applications. The challenges and opportunities are endless.The results – incredible. <br/><br/> Our employees are exceptional. We are proud to employ more than 1,100 talented individuals across Canada. Working in a collaborative environment, our employees are encouraged daily to contribute their technical knowledge and expertise. Our employees are passionate, dedicated, and conscientious about the work they do which results in our ability to deliver the highest value, customized solutions in order to meet the most demanding requirements. <br/><br/> General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada currently has an exciting contract opportunity for a Product Owner in Calgary. As part of our team, you will play a key role in delivering a world class secure next generation communications system for the Ministry of Defense in the United Kingdom. General Dynamics Missions Systems-Canada is working in partnership with General Dynamics Mission Systems - United Kingdom to design, develop, and deliver an exceptional Command, Control, Communications, Computing and Intelligence (C4I) system based on open architecture and industry standard principles. <br/><br/> The software product team will consist of several software development teams, each focusing on a specific set of software components and services in the areas of communication, device integration, and common services for multiple third-party software applications. Software development teams will follow the Scrum framework for software development. The Scrum teams operate within a larger Scaled Agile Framework organization. The successful candidate will be a Product Owner for one of the Scrum teams. <br/><br/> Typical Duties: <ul> <li>The Product Owner is a content management leader who prioritizes and grooms the backlog and ensures that the team understands what they are working on. The Product Owner’s responsibilities include:</li><li>Working with the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) product manager and other stakeholders to understand their needs</li><li>Provides vision and roadmap for what the Product Owner wishes to be built</li><li>Clearly communicates this vision in understandable product backlog items</li><li>Ordering and prioritizing the items in the product backlog to best achieve goals and missions</li><li>Optimizing the value of the work the development team performs</li><li>Ensuring that the product backlog is visible, transparent, clear to all, and shows what the Scrum team will work on next</li><li>Ensuring the development team understands items in the product backlog to the level needed</li><li>The Product Owner is the sole person responsible for managing the product backlog</li> </ul> Required Skills & Experience: <ul> <li>Minimum of four years experience in software engineering</li><li>Disciplined approach to software engineering with knowledge of agile development methods</li> <li>Strong attention to detail</li><li>Strong communication skills, both written and verbal</li><li>Strong problem solving and analysis skills</li> </ul> Skills & Experience – Nice to have: <ul> <li>Previous experience as a Product Owner or Scrum Master on an Agile team</li><li>Professional Scrum Product Owner (PSPO) or Professional Scrum Master (PSM) certification</li><li>Previous experience leading teams in an agile environment</li><li>Previous experience, certification, or knowledge of the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe 4.0)</li> </ul> Education: <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree in Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, System Engineering or equivalent discipline is required</li> </ul> Other: <br/><br/> <strong>Minimum 10 year consecutive residence in Canada – for Canadian Secret Security Clearance</strong> <br/> Applicants will be required to obtain/hold a valid and current Canadian security clearance to gain access to the classified spaces, information and equipment in order to perform the work associated with this position. <br/><br/> General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace.Workplace accommodations are available.

Title: Principal/Associate Director Software Developer

Job_Description: <strong>Who You Are:</strong> <br/><br/> You love developing elegant solutions to complex problems. You are a developer who enjoys coding and find yourself exploring the latest code development practices, platforms and design patterns because it's fun. You regularly read code blogs to stay in touch with the development community and are passionate about finding ways to improve quality, performance and delivery times. You are well established as an excellent individual contributor, but do your best work as a member of an effective team. You have a great mix of technical and soft skills which allows you to excel in a highly collaborative, agile work environment. Software craftsmanship means something to you. <br/><br/> <strong>Your Next Challenge:</strong> <br/><br/> Be a part of development and maintenance of project code including: <ul> <li>Take an active role in all aspects of the development life cycle</li><li>Utilize TDD and BDD</li><li>Work within a continuous integration release cycle</li><li>Create and maintain project documentation, in accordance with established standards</li> </ul> Participate in implementation of a high volume, high traffic web based application including: <ul> <li>Develop proprietary and open-sourced technologies</li><li>Have impact on the direction of projects and features</li><li>Work in an agile environment utilizing the LEAN/KANBAN process</li><li>Work on a development team that is within a larger technology organization</li>  </ul> <strong>What Youll Need:</strong> <ul> <li>Strong understanding of object oriented programming (OO) with real world enterprise web development experience</li><li>Ruby with RoR experience is a must</li><li>Must have experience with Javascript, jQuery, AJAX and ideally Angular.js</li> <li>Must have experience with HTML5, CSS3 and other front end tools (Sass, Less, etc)</li><li>Experience using Git or a similar version control system</li><li>Strong creative problem-solving ability</li><li>Ability to contribute to cross functional team discussions</li><li>BSc. in Computer Science or equivalent education/experience</li><li>Excellent communication, organizational, and interpersonal skills</li><li>Experience with C#, Visual Studio, PHP or Java is a definite asset</li> </ul> <strong>Who We Are:</strong> <br/><br/> Getty Images is the most trusted and esteemed source of visual content in the world, with over 200 million assets available through its industry-leading sites www.gettyimages.com and www.istock.com. The Getty Images website serves creative, business and media customers in almost 200 countries and is the first place people turn to discover, purchase and share powerful content from the world's best photographers and videographers. Getty Images works with over 200,000 contributors and hundreds of image partners to provide comprehensive coverage of more than 130,000 news, sport and entertainment events, impactful creative imagery to communicate any commercial concept and the world's deepest digital archive of historic photography. <br/><br/> Visit Getty Images at www.gettyimages.com to learn more about how the company is advancing the unique role of still and moving imagery in communication and business, and enabling creative ideas to come to life. For company news and announcements, visit our Press Room, and for the stories and inspiration behind our content, visit Stories & Trends. Find Getty Images on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, LinkedIn, Pinterest and Tumblr, or download the Getty Images app where you can explore, save and share the world's best imagery. <br/><br/> Getty Images is an equal opportunity employer and strongly supports diversity in the workplace.
Title: Software Engineer

Job_Description: <ul>  <li>Design, Document, Implement, and maintain software used in Human Machine Interface’s (HMI’s).</li> <li>Responsible for creating mockup’s of the required screens and working closely with senior developers and/or product managers to ensure all user requirements are being met.</li> <li>Responsible for documenting the design, creating code and following the software development process which includes but is not limited to: Code Reviews, pair programming, creating unit tests, doing design reviews, etc.</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements</strong> <ul> <li>3yrs of experience in writing HMI software.</li></ul>  <ul>  <li>Experience in Beijer IX or XTERM HMI’s would be an asset.</li> <li>Must have knowledge of programming languages like C/C++, C# (.net), VB, Java, LabView and others.</li> <li>Excellent communication (written and verbal), analytical and interpersonal skills</li> <li>Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint</li> <li>Ability to handle multiple tasks under tight deadlines</li> <li>Applicable knowledge and understanding of schematics, P&IDs, process flow diagrams Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills and the experience to handle the pressure of resolving issues under high pressure.</li> <li>Effective time management skills and ability to handle a fast-paced environment.</li> <li>Ability and willingness to travel up 4 weeks per year.</li> <li>Must be willing to travel to Frac’ing job site or manufacturing yards.</li>  <li> Professional Engineer or Professional Technologist or have accredited certification in some programming language desired.</li> <li>Bachelor of Science or related degree or certificate from an accredited university or technical school or the equivalent combination of education and experience.</li>  </ul> <strong>Benefits</strong> <br/><br/> Comprehensive benefits including paid vacations and holidays, supplemental healthcare including paramedical and health savings account, dental; vision, prescriptions, Registered Retirement Savings Plan (RRSP) with generous company match, long and short term disability and life insurances, etc.,
Title: Software Developer/Engineer

Job_Description: At General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada, Canada’s premiere defence company, innovation happens on a daily basis. We develop and deliver highly-complex leading edge technology, products and systems that make important contributions to our customer’s success in land, airborne, maritime and public safety applications. The challenges and opportunities are endless.The results – incredible. <br/><br/> Our employees are exceptional. We are proud to employ more than 1,100 talented individuals across Canada. Working in a collaborative environment, our employees are encouraged daily to contribute their technical knowledge and expertise. Our employees are passionate, dedicated, and conscientious about the work they do which results in our ability to deliver the highest value, customized solutions in order to meet the most demanding requirements. <br/><br/> General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada currently has an exciting opportunity for a Development Services Software Developer in Calgary. As part of our team, you will play a key role in delivering a world class secure next generation communications system for the Ministry of Defense in the United Kingdom. General Dynamics Canada is working in partnership with General Dynamics Mission Systems - United Kingdom to design, develop, and deliver an exceptional Command, Control, Communications, Computing and Intelligence (C4I) system based on open architecture and industry standard principles. <br/><br/> Our Calgary team is developing a key software product as part of this offering that provides the operating system and middleware to enable tactical voice and data communications, sensor and device integration, and common application services. <br/><br/> The Development Services System Team, working in a scaled agile framework, is responsible for developing and implementing the strategy for a continuous integration and delivery pipeline. The environment is using industry standard best practices to allow the software being developed to be tested, integrated, packaged, and deployed using automated tools and virtualized environments. <br/><br/> Typical Duties: <br/><br/> As a member of the Development Services System Team, the successful candidate will: <ul> <li>Create and maintain infrastructure, including continuous integration, automated builds, and automated build verification testing</li><li>Create platforms and environments for solution demos, development, quality assurance, user acceptance testing and staging</li><li>Create products, utilities, and scripts to automate deployment</li><li>Coordinate with other Agile Teams in order to efficiently share responsibilities, therefore increasing overall performance</li> </ul> Required Skills & Experience: <ul> <li>Interest and/or experience in continuous integration, continuous deployment, release management, and automation</li><li>Strong scripting abilities</li><li>Strong knowledge of Linux and the Microsoft Windows OS family</li><li>Some familiarity with the following tools: Nexus OSS, Jenkins, Docker, Parasoft Development Test Plaftorm and GitLab</li><li>Knowledge of agile development methods</li><li>Strong problem solving and analysis skills</li><li>Strong attention to detail</li><li>Strong communication skills, both written and verbal</li><li>Strong interpersonal skills</li><li>Previous experience, certification, or knowledge of Scrum or the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe 4.0)</li> </ul> Education: <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree in Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, System Engineering or equivalent discipline is required.</li> </ul> <strong>Minimum 10 year consecutive residence in Canada – for Canadian Secret Security Clearance</strong> <br/> Applicants will be required to obtain/hold a valid and current Canadian security clearance to gain access to the classified spaces, information and equipment in order to perform the work associated with this position. <br/><br/> General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace.Workplace accommodations are available.
Title: Software Engineer, Development Services , Intermediate

Job_Description: Imagine yourself as part <br/> of one of the most dynamic companies in the healthcare technology industry <br/> today! QHR Technologies is a division of Shoppers Drug Mart, a Loblaw Company. <br/> QHR is leading the way in Canadian healthcare technology, by providing solutions <br/> to assist healthcare professionals enrich their practices and improve the <br/> quality of care delivered to all Canadians across the country. We are looking <br/> for talented, inspired, and motivated people to join our incredible team and <br/> experience a workplace culture that stands above the rest! Competitive salaries <br/> and generous perks are just a few of the reasons that QHR has been voted one of <br/> BC's Top Employers and Canada’s Top Small & Medium Employers for 2017. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Summary:</strong> <br/><br/> We deliver a <br/> comprehensive suite of technologies to enable secure medical record management <br/> and office automation for clinical environments. Our Electronic <br/> Medical Record (EMR) software Accuro®EMR has the largest adoption in Canada and <br/> serves thousands of practitioners and millions of patients. Our patient platform Medeo leverages that market <br/> penetration and connects patients to their healthcare providers.  <br/> As we continue to expand our integrations into patient and pharmacy workflows, <br/> we are looking for strong Angular or full-stack developers to be part of our <br/> team and to help shape our next generation of products and services. <br/><br/> <strong>About You:</strong>  <ul>   <li>You are enthusiastic about making a significant difference in the <br/>  lives of your customers through your work.</li> <li>You are passionate about software development and take security <br/>  seriously.</li> <li>You love building beautiful applications that are easy to <br/>  understand and use.</li> <li>You care deeply about your code and couldn’t imagine writing <br/>  software without TDD and Continuous Integration.</li> <li>You are a continual learner, love new ideas and have a natural <br/>  curiosity to keep improving.</li> <li>You understand the value of timely releases to market, and know <br/>  when not to budge on software quality.</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong>  <ul>   <li>A degree or diploma in Engineering, Computer Science or a related <br/>  field.</li> <li>At least 3 years of experience in web application development, <br/>  ideally in Angular.</li> </ul> <strong>Bonus points if you <br/> have experience with:</strong>  <ul>   <li>High data security/privacy environments</li> <li>Spring / Spring Boot</li> <li>OAuth flows</li> <li>CA API Gateway, OrionHealth Rhapsody</li> <li>SQL Server or other database systems</li> <li>RabbitMQ or other messaging systems</li> <li>Board/Card games</li> <li>Foosball</li> </ul>
Title: Software Developer - Portal

Job_Description: Open Systems International, Inc. (OSI) www.osii.com is a fast-paced, growing, high technology company, headquartered in Medina, Minnesota. As a world leader in the Operations Technology (OT) field, OSI develops and supplies state-of-the-art energy management, optimization and control software solutions to energy utility companies worldwide. <br/><br/> In this position, you will create compelling applications that enable our customers to view, control and analyze their electrical infrastructure. All of this is done using the latest technologies in a fast-paced, collaborative environment at our forward-looking company. Specific, on-the-job training will be provided. In this position, you will have the following responsibilities: <ul>  <li>Develop the applications that collect data from millions of sensors, integrating protocol data, qualities, and timestamps into OSI's SCADA product infrastructure.</li>  <li>Design APIs, interfaces and process interaction data flows to optimize performance, ensure no data loss and maximize throughput.</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements</strong> <ul>  <li>Bachelors or Masters degree from an accredited institution in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or related technical field.</li> <li>5+ years of experience in protocol development.</li> <li>C development skills plus experience in one or more of the following: C#, C++, Java, Python, etc.</li> <li>Networking knowledge and protocols (TCP/IP, UDP, DNS, XMPP, HTTP, MSRP, XCAP, SOAP, REST, DNP, etc.).</li> <li>Familiar with platform independent tools and libraries.</li> <li>Strong attention to detail with background in practical understanding of industry-standard protocols and devices.</li> </ul> <strong>Benefits</strong> <br/><br/> OSI offers a comprehensive benefit package including bonuses, profit sharing and a generous amount of paid time off and paid holidays. Additional perks include casual dress code, flexible work hours, free beverages, employee events, onsite fitness center, exciting travel opportunities, employee referral bonus programs, and monthly birthday and anniversary celebrations. Check out our <strong>Life at OSI</strong> Facebook page to see more. <br/><br/> As an employee of OSI you will have access to cutting edge technologies in a fun, professional, positive and dynamic work environment. We have excellent opportunities for growth and development.
Title: Communications Protocol Developer

Job_Description: <div><div> <strong>EVA Developer</strong><br/><br/>We can transform banking, reimagine it, make banking work for people. We’re on a journey to make meaningful impacts on an industry that has the power to transform a person’s life. When we talk about transformation at ATB Financial, we’re not just talking about pie in the sky ideas, we’re listening and collaborating to bring those ideas to life. To put it simply, we’re on a mission to reinvent how banking can support people's lives. We’re going to provide meaningful solutions to problems, deepen our connection with customers and while we’re at it, transform ourselves from the inside out.  <br/><br/> We need collaborative visionaries and executors who are eager to listen to our customers in order to do things other banks wouldn’t do. We’re building a team of relentless, passionate and inquisitive ATB transformers to build our bench strength in disrupting ourselves before we get disrupted.  <br/><br/> Want to be a part of our story? If you’re looking for an organization where you can use your talents to do remarkable things, you may be the alpha to our beta and we encourage you to read on. <br/><br/> <strong>TEAM TRANSFORMATION:</strong> <br/><br/> To learn more about us and what each of our areas focus on, including who our fearless leaders are, connect with us at https://atbalphabeta.com/ or here. <br/><br/> <strong>THE OPPORTUNITY:</strong> <br/><br/> ATB is growing our capabilities in natural language understanding, blockchain and machine learning. This role is at the heart of a growing team passionate about elevating ATB’s customer experience through these capabilities. We are seamlessly weaving these technologies into an offering that empowers our team members and customers to rethink how they manage data and workflow. The outcome is a brilliantly simple concept that elevates and engages our customers.  <br/><br/> Working on a sprint-based delivery team, with an agile mentality, this role is responsible for designing the future of interactions and easy-to-maintain automation according to team standards.  <br/><br/> Our best and brightest members bring a balance of technical know-how and an ability to understand connections in the world. You’ll be challenged to set your own goals and priorities and manage your pace of delivery while contributing to the overall success of the team.  <br/><br/> You will love this role if you’re someone who needs to understand abstract ideas and emerging technologies. You ask great questions, think deeply and critically to analyze issues, document your findings and monitor your own progress. You collaborate with others, but are comfortable challenging the status-quo. You are a risk taker who believes you define what is possible and deserve to shape the future. You’re looking for a role you can grow with, one that lets you work hard, play hard, and allows you to write the story of how ATB is making banking work for people. <br/>  </div>  </div><br/>   <div> <div> Job Requirements</div><br/>  <div><strong>KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES:</strong>  <ul> <li>University degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Math or related disciplines, or an acceptable combination of education, experience and training</li> <li>Experience in javascript, node.js (2 years) and google cloud (1 year)</li> <li>Experience using tensorflow, ibm watson & ML in AWS (1 year) are considered an asset</li> <li>Experience in rxjs, pub/sub, angular & ionic (1 year) are considered an asset</li> <li>Previous experience in the financial services industry is considered an asset</li> <li>Previous experience with agile delivery methodologies and/or continuous improvement methodologies is considered an asset</li> </ul> <strong>ATTRIBUTES FOR SUCCESS:</strong> <ul> <li><strong>You focus on impact over hard work:</strong> what isn't of a concern is the hours you work, but your results and impact on team members and customers</li> <li><strong>You thrive on learning new things:</strong> expect a steep learning curve, and get ready to always be elevating your game</li> <li><strong>You like to solve difficult problems, together:</strong> no one said transforming banking was going to be easy, but we’re collectively reimagining it and there are no solo heroes welcome</li> <li><strong>You operate with a mentality of Build-Measure-Learn:</strong> our agile mindset is not just for our technical teams, it's a mindset that every one of us is asked to operate from. We move fast, we make mistakes but we measure the impact, learn, grow and change as a result </li> <li><strong>You communicate in ways that makes complex information brilliantly simple:</strong> written or verbal, you’re happy to help others understand technology and how it can change their work</li> <li><strong>You focus on ex and leave the incremental thinking at home:</strong> if something doesn't have significant impact, you are the person to challenge whether or not it's worth doing</li> <li><strong>You do it with passion or not at all:</strong> you’re inspired by our purpose and you see the link between yourself and the work you are doing to transform banking </li> </ul> As a team member with the Transformation team at ATB, you can expect:  <ul> <li>No day will ever be the same - we’re learning, iterating and making big steps towards our vision of transforming an entire industry, everyday</li> <li>The ability to grow a career within an inspiring, impact focused culture where you are surrounded by changemakers and leaders that empower you to use your voice to make banking work for people</li> <li>To be a part of the energy of an organization that is unlike any other, where you may pinch yourself on the daily and wonder how you got so lucky</li> <li>Bragging rights! You get to call yourself a Transformer and an ATBer and know you play a direct role in helping us become a cutting edge financial institution (it’s going to feel more like a technology company, but either way it’s hella cool.) </li> </ul>   <br/> And being part of ATB Financial you get: <ul> <li>An excellent benefits and pension package, opportunities for career advancement, and a financial institution that’s leading the way in change – now you’re talking about a career with a company that allows you to grow. </li> <li>Amazing benefits for your everyday banking, mortgages, loans and investments needs.</li> <li>Be a part of an award-winning employer-of-choice – we have the best of the best working for Albertans.</li> </ul> If you want to know more, read our employer reviews visit our Glassdoor page. <br/><br/> Online applications are preferred. ATB Financial is an equal opportunity employer. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, due to the high number of resumes we receive, only short-listed candidates will be contacted. <br/><br/> If your application is shortlisted, we might ask you to participate in a digital interview. <br/><br/> Please click the following link for information on communities where ATB thrives. <br/><br/> #LI-POST</div>  </div>  <br/>Apply
Title: EVA Developer

Job_Description: Nureva is looking for an experienced <strong>Software Test Developer</strong> to join our team whichdesign and builds our Product Development test automation processes. You are well-versed with the process of ensuring products will be brought to market with quality. Reporting to the Manager, Test Implementation, you will work with development, DevOps and existing QA staff to enhance automation in the current QA process. This ongoing effort will increase repeatability and reliability in test execution and increase our test coverage. <br/><br/> You are diligent, proactive and have a reputation as an excellent problem solver. You enjoy collaborating with small teams and have the resourcefulness and initiative to ask the right questions to develop thorough test coverage. You take ownership of your deliverables and take pride in the knowledge that your efforts will have an impact on end-users. You will work with a diverse team of developers and designers who are passionate about technology, user experience and market success. <br/><br/> <strong>What you will do</strong>  <ul> <li>Work closely with the development teams to understand the product architecture, function, intended user experience, and performance expectations.</li> <li>Develop documentation for test plans, results and reports.</li> <li>Design and develop software automated test frameworks and test suites within an Agile development team.</li> <li>Maintain a comprehensive awareness of the technology landscape and identify opportunities for future test suite enhancements</li> <li>Design, develop, validate, maintain a QA automation framework and architecture</li> <li>Automate test cases that are part of a continuous delivery workflow, while minimizing the need for manual test repetition</li> <li>Guide other QA Analysts and development team to write effective automated tests that are reliable, repeatable and visible</li> <li>Assist in UI experience testing as required</li> <li>Ensure accurate test reports for internal and external audiences as required</li> <li>Assist in mentoring and training of new staff as required.</li> </ul> <strong>What you bring:</strong>  <ul> <li>A degree in computer science, software engineering or equivalent experience</li> <li>Ability to write both manual and automated tested cases</li> <li>Experience in software development with strong knowledge of C#, .NET, and JavaScript. Familiarity with PowerShell is an asset</li> <li>Experience with RESTful Web APIs</li> <li>Experience in test automation within Microsoft Visual Studio, Team Services, WPF applications and JS/HTML browser-based applications. Familiarity with Selenium, ROBOT or other modern automation tools is also an asset</li> <li>Familiarity of Agile software development methods</li> <li>Familiarity with local and cloud virtualization methods</li> <li>Excellent written and verbal English communication skills</li> </ul> We offer a competitive total compensation package, an open and collaborative office in downtown Calgary, and a great team environment. <br/><br/> Apply by close of business <strong>June 15th, 2018</strong>. Please outline how you will make a difference on our team. We will spend time to ensure that you understand the role and our company to ensure that we are a good fit for you.
Title: Software Test Developer

Job_Description: Company Description<div>As the world's leading international pure-play geophysical company, we offer unique seismic solutions that help the oil and gas industry meet energy demands responsibly. <br/><br/> To build on the success of our business we are continuing to strengthen, mobilize, and energize our most important asset: <strong>our people.</strong> <br/><br/> We actively encourage technical excellence, problem-solving, innovation and teamwork.</div>Job Description<div>The Software Development Intern will work with the Project Development Manager (PDM) to define requirements in sufficient detail for successful development of assigned software features. The Software Developer will also design, develop and implement high quality software that fulfills the defined requirements, and assist the Quality Assurance team with testing tools.</div>Qualifications<div><strong>Job Responsibilities:</strong> <ul> <li>Setup of a fully automated software testing framework.</li><li>Maintain the current software version.</li><li>Deliver software design and code on schedule.</li><li>Report progress on a frequent basis to the project manager.</li><li>Maintain code with the approved source control system and update the source control problem tracking system.</li><li>Stay up to date with the latest technologies.</li> </ul> <strong>Job Requirements:</strong> <ul> <li>Must be enrolled in an accredited North American university with a focus on geophysics, physics, mathematics, computer science, engineering or related science degrees. Enrollment in advanced degrees is desirable.</li><li>Past experience on software development projects beyond school work is preferred.</li><li>Good written and verbal communication skills - essential for interacting with users and colleagues.</li><li>Must be able to clearly present design ideas and programming results to colleagues.</li><li>The ability to function in a team environment or an individual setting</li><li>Analytical and creative problem solving skills. Strong ability to recognize errors, troubleshoot and identify solutions independently.</li><li>Good practical knowledge of the programming languages and software development tools necessary for creating the target software applications.</li><li>Fluent in C++ is a must. Experience in automated software testing is preferred.</li> </ul> <strong>Other Requirements:</strong> <ul> <li>Excellent work ethic and positive attitude; demonstrated to be dependable and trustworthy, and practices personal and professional integrity at all times.</li><li>Enthusiastic approach to personal and professional development and life-long learning.</li><li>Position will be for a defined period of time from May until August.</li></ul></div> <br/> Additional Information<div><strong>Why choose CGG?</strong> <br/><br/> Joining a company with a culture of learning and a world-class structured career development pathway, our graduates can develop their technical, commercial and personal skills for the future via a suite of internal courses led by our own CGG University. <br/><br/> We encourage you to take ownership of your development by identifying opportunities to further progress your own skills and experience. <br/><br/> CGG focuses on the strengths and talents of our people and develop learning opportunities that encourage development at every step of your career.</div>
Title: Software Development Intern

Job_Description: At General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada, Canada’s premiere defence company, innovation happens on a daily basis. We develop and deliver highly-complex leading edge technology, products and systems that make important contributions to our customer’s success in land, airborne, maritime and public safety applications. The challenges and opportunities are endless.The results – incredible. <br/><br/> Our employees are exceptional. We are proud to employ more than 1,100 talented individuals across Canada. Working in a collaborative environment, our employees are encouraged daily to contribute their technical knowledge and expertise. Our employees are passionate, dedicated, and conscientious about the work they do which results in our ability to deliver the highest value, customized solutions in order to meet the most demanding requirements. <br/><br/> General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada currently has exciting new Junior Software Developer opportunities with our Calgary team. As part of our team, you will play a key role in delivering a world class secure next generation communications system for the Ministry of Defense in the United Kingdom. General Dynamics Canada is working in partnership with General Dynamics Mission Systems - United Kingdom to design, develop, and deliver an exceptional Command, Control, Communications, Computing and Intelligence (C4I) system based on open architecture and industry standard principles. <br/><br/> Our Calgary team is developing a key software product as part of this offering that provides the operating system and middleware to enable tactical voice and data communications, sensor and device integration, and common application services. Software will be developed for Windows 10 laptops and for General Dynamics developed hardware products running embedded Linux. The project includes all phases including system design, software and hardware design, system integration, and system validation. The project will be a multi-site development with activities spanning several product development groups in Calgary and across the General Dynamics Mission Systems International business area. <br/><br/> The software product team will consist of several software development teams, each focusing on a specific set of software components and services in the areas of communication, device integration, and common services for multiple third-party software applications. Software development teams will follow the Scrum framework for software development. As a member of a Scrum team, the successful candidates will design, implement, and test software features for the product. <br/><br/> Typical Duties: <ul> <li>Participate in Scrum events, including Sprint Planning, Daily Scrum, Sprint Review, and Sprint Retrospective</li><li>Continually refine Sprint backlog into smaller tasks</li><li>Work cooperatively with the development team to take on new tasks</li><li>Perform detailed design, implementation, and unit testing activities in order to complete Sprint tasks</li><li>Ensure completed tasks meet the Definition of Done and the Acceptance Criteria</li><li>Share knowledge and skills with other development team members</li><li>Participate in the refinement of the product backlog</li> </ul> Required Skills & Experience: <ul> <li>Experience with C++ or other higher level programming languages</li><li>Experience with developing software in a Linux operating system (kernel 3.X)</li><li>Experience with developing software in a Windows operating system (Windows 7, 8, 10)</li><li>Experience with UML and modelling techniques</li><li>Experience with unit testing and test driven development</li><li>Disciplined approach to software engineering with knowledge of agile development methods</li><li>Strong attention to detail</li><li>Strong communication skills, both written and verbal</li><li>Strong problem solving and analysis skills</li> </ul> Skills & Experience – Nice to Have: <ul> <li>Experience with Service-oriented architecture including Web Services, WebSockets, and RESTful APIs</li><li>Experience with cross-platform development</li><li>Experience with pub/sub and request/response messaging patterns</li><li>Experience with XML</li><li>Experience with network device management technologies such as vision, prescriptions, Registered Retirement Savings Plan (RRSP) with generous company match, long and short term disability and life insurances, etc.,
Title: Software Developer/Engineer

Job_Description: Here’s what you need to know about our <strong>Product</strong> team: The BlueCat Product team prides ourselves on our diversity and innovation at our core. Delivery of a quality and cutting edge product is our priority. Most importantly, we always have fun while doing it. We run an Agile shop across all three of our products and rely on product demos and daily standups to keep each other in the loop on all of the amazing things that are happening at BlueCat while keeping each other transparent and challenged. <br/><br/> BlueCat is looking for a Director, Software Development to work in our Toronto Head Quarters. <br/><br/> The Director role will be responsible for multiple agile teams that are building massively scalable SaaS products in the networking and network security space. You’ll be directly responsible for managers and team leads who will benefit from your experience with AWS based SaaS application development. We have a large and growing group of talented engineers leveraging AWS, Docker and microservices architectures. You’ll work closely with a variety of dynamic teams, including Product Management, Architecture, Operations and Customer Care, understanding what it takes lead great teams that build great software. You are expected to guide, mentor and get the best out of everyone while having fun. <br/><br/> The most important aspect of this team is that we’re never satisfied with status quo. We continually learn, adapt and extend. BlueCat is an agile shop, so we expect you to Get Sh!t Done by experimenting, failing, learning and most importantly, pushing forward. <br/><br/> BlueCat is a highly collaborative place to work. We prefer walking up to someone’s desk over sending an email. We support, thank and congratulate each other. <br/><br/> <strong>This job might be for you if you:</strong> <ul> <li>Have spent the last decade successfully building, deploying and managing massively large scale distributed internet systems and products</li><li>Have spent the past 5 years managing multiple agile teams</li><li>Have actually used AWS as part of a solution in production and are cozy with continuous delivery and continuous deployment topics</li><li>Are extremely comfortable when navigating the world of open source tools and frameworks</li><li>Are comfortable communicating with people at all levels, both written and verbal</li> </ul> <strong>You’re practically a shoe in if you:</strong> <ul> <li>Are motivated by helping your teams grow as much as by working on cool technology</li><li>Have experimented with data analytics and machine learning</li> </ul> <strong>BlueCat’s core values are:</strong> <ul> <li>Curiosity - We care and inquire about the challenges and needs of our customers.</li><li>Clarity - We keep communication crisp, clear, and responsive.</li><li>Collaboration - We win with each other, never alone.</li><li>Transparency - We ensure all relevant information is available – no questions are off limits.</li><li>Ownership - We are responsible and accountable for getting things done.</li> </ul> <strong>What you’ll get from us:</strong> <br/><br/> Fast growth for BlueCat means fast growth for you! With the world’s biggest and hottest logos as our clients, we are a well-established business that still operates with the fun culture of a start-up. We get to work hard and still have all the fun without all of the risk! Experienced leaders make sure we keep going to the moon and beyond. <br/><br/> While we’re growing together, we’ll have your back with solid compensation/bonuses, education budgets, record breaking sales quarters, and a company culture that values curiosity, clarity, collaboration, transparency and ownership. <br/><br/> If you’re as excited about the future of our company as we are, we would love to hear from you! <br/><br/> Accommodations will be provided throughout the recruitment, hiring and employment process in accordance with the AODA and the Ontario Human Rights Code.
Title: Director, Software Engineering

Job_Description: Nureva is looking for an experienced <strong>Software Test Developer</strong> to join our team whichdesign and builds our Product Development test automation processes. You are well-versed with the process of ensuring products will be brought to market with quality. Reporting to the Manager, Test Implementation, you will work with development, DevOps and existing QA staff to enhance automation in the current QA process. This ongoing effort will increase repeatability and reliability in test execution and increase our test coverage. <br/><br/> You are diligent, proactive and have a reputation as an excellent problem solver. You enjoy collaborating with small teams and have the resourcefulness and initiative to ask the right questions to develop thorough test coverage. You take ownership of your deliverables and take pride in the knowledge that your efforts will have an impact on end-users. You will work with a diverse team of developers and designers who are passionate about technology, user experience and market success. <br/><br/> <strong>What you will do</strong>  <ul> <li>Work closely with the development teams to understand the product architecture, function, intended user experience, and performance expectations.</li> <li>Develop documentation for test plans, results and reports.</li> <li>Design and develop software automated test frameworks and test suites within an Agile development team.</li> <li>Maintain a comprehensive awareness of the technology landscape and identify opportunities for future test suite enhancements</li> <li>Design, develop, validate, maintain a QA automation framework and architecture</li> <li>Automate test cases that are part of a continuous delivery workflow, while minimizing the need for manual test repetition</li> <li>Guide other QA Analysts and development team to write effective automated tests that are reliable, repeatable and visible</li> <li>Assist in UI experience testing as required</li> <li>Ensure accurate test reports for internal and external audiences as required</li> <li>Assist in mentoring and training of new staff as required.</li> </ul> <strong>What you bring:</strong>  <ul> <li>A degree in computer science, software engineering or equivalent experience</li> <li>Ability to write both manual and automated tested cases</li> <li>Experience in software development with strong knowledge of C#, .NET, and JavaScript. Familiarity with PowerShell is an asset</li> <li>Experience with RESTful Web APIs</li> <li>Experience in test automation within Microsoft Visual Studio, Team Services, WPF applications and JS/HTML browser-based applications. Familiarity with Selenium, ROBOT or other modern automation tools is also an asset</li> <li>Familiarity of Agile software development methods</li> <li>Familiarity with local and cloud virtualization methods</li> <li>Excellent written and verbal English communication skills</li> </ul> We offer a competitive total compensation package, an open and collaborative office in downtown Calgary, and a great team environment. <br/><br/> Apply by close of business <strong>June 15th, 2018</strong>. Please outline how you will make a difference on our team. We will spend time to ensure that you understand the role and our company to ensure that we are a good fit for you.
Title: Software Test Developer

Job_Description: Imagine yourself as part <br/> of one of the most dynamic companies in the healthcare technology industry <br/> today! QHR Technologies is a division of Shoppers Drug Mart, a Loblaw Company. <br/> QHR is leading the way in Canadian healthcare technology, by providing solutions <br/> to assist healthcare professionals enrich their practices and improve the <br/> quality of care delivered to all Canadians across the country. We are looking <br/> for talented, inspired, and motivated people to join our incredible team and <br/> experience a workplace culture that stands above the rest! Competitive salaries <br/> and generous perks are just a few of the reasons that QHR has been voted one of <br/> BC's Top Employers and Canada’s Top Small & Medium Employers for 2017. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Summary:</strong> <br/><br/> We deliver a <br/> comprehensive suite of technologies to enable secure medical record management <br/> and office automation for clinical environments. Our Electronic <br/> Medical Record (EMR) software Accuro®EMR has the largest adoption in Canada and <br/> serves thousands of practitioners and millions of patients. Our patient platform Medeo leverages that market <br/> penetration and connects patients to their healthcare providers.  <br/> As we continue to expand our integrations into patient and pharmacy workflows, <br/> we are looking for strong Angular or full-stack developers to be part of our <br/> team and to help shape our next generation of products and services. <br/><br/> <strong>About You:</strong>  <ul>   <li>You are enthusiastic about making a significant difference in the <br/>  lives of your customers through your work.</li> <li>You are passionate about software development and take security <br/>  seriously.</li> <li>You love building beautiful applications that are easy to <br/>  understand and use.</li> <li>You care deeply about your code and couldn’t imagine writing <br/>  software without TDD and Continuous Integration.</li> <li>You are a continual learner, love new ideas and have a natural <br/>  curiosity to keep improving.</li> <li>You understand the value of timely releases to market, and know <br/>  when not to budge on software quality.</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong>  <ul>   <li>A degree or diploma in Engineering, Computer Science or a related <br/>  field.</li> <li>At least 3 years of experience in web application development, <br/>  ideally in Angular.</li> </ul> <strong>Bonus points if you <br/> have experience with:</strong>  <ul>   <li>High data security/privacy environments</li> <li>Spring / Spring Boot</li> <li>OAuth flows</li> <li>CA API Gateway, OrionHealth Rhapsody</li> <li>SQL Server or other database systems</li> <li>RabbitMQ or other messaging systems</li> <li>Board/Card games</li> <li>Foosball</li> </ul>

Job_Description: The Role<br/><br/>The Pason Power team focuses on the monitoring and intelligent control of distributed energy storage systems. There will be a number of potential applications ranging from installation of energy storage with solar/PV systems to utility companies looking to build a responsive and adaptable electrical grid. You will have the opportunity to combine your experience with Pason’s in data acquisition and embedded control systems combined with cutting edge Internet of Things (IoT) and cloud technologies to provide a best in class solution.<br/><br/>Essential Duties and Responsibilities   <ul> <li>Work as a part of an agile scrum team, contributing to the development of the Pason Power product line</li> <li>Contribute to the development of Pason Power web applications and monitoring & control systems</li> <li>Work alongside data science engineers to improve and optimize control system algorithms</li> <li>Maintain and extend reliable communications with external hardware devices using protocols such as Modbus, CANbus, ZigBee, etc.</li> <li>Further the integration with cloud services and IoT transport mechanisms</li> <li>Write unit and integration tests</li> <li>Troubleshoot and provide timely solutions for production issues</li> <li>Understand and contribute to the development of system architecture</li> <li>Participate in Code Reviews</li> <li>Participate in team technical discussions, challenge ideas and present solutions and approaches to be considered by the team</li> <li>Participate and contribute in weekly Agile meetings, discuss and present work accomplished and provide constructive feedback to help improve the team</li> <li>Contribute to our evolving development environment through research, experiment with new technologies and attend conferences or courses. Educate your peers on what you have learned.</li> <li>Travel to our Houston office 1-2 weeks per year to spend time working in person with the technical team there</li> </ul>  Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities   <ul> <li>Expertise in any of the following programming languages: Python, JavaScript, Java, C/C++ or C#</li> <li>Experience with the React.js framework</li> <li>Familiarity with code versioning tools such as Git</li> <li>Proficiency in Linux</li> <li>Experience working with hardware / IoT device control systems</li> <li>Experience with Test Driven Development / Behavioral Driven Development</li> <li>Experience providing leadership in technical teams</li> <li>Experience working with protocols such as Modbus, CANbus, ZigBee etc.</li> <li>Familiar with RESTful APIs</li> <li>Familiar with container technologies (Docker)</li> <li>Familiar with messaging protocols such as MQTT or AMQP</li> <li>Build automation / continuous integration / continuous delivery experience</li> <li>NoSQL database experience (MongoDB, DynamoDB, InfluxDB, etc.)</li> <li>Working in cloud environments (AWS, Google Cloud, Azure, etc.)</li> <li>A knack for benchmarking and optimization</li> <li>Agile/Scrum experience</li> <li>Experience in integration and unit testing</li> <li>Ability to work in a team or as an individual.</li> </ul>
Title: Intermediate Software Developer (Pason Power)

Job_Description: <div><strong>Position Overview</strong></div><br/>  <div> <div>Site Reliability Developers/Engineers (SREs) are responsible for creating and improving the tools and processes that power the building, validation, deployment, and monitoring of Replicon's globally distributed multi-tenant SaaS systems. SREs are spreading and evangelizing the DevOps culture throughout Replicon.</div><br/>  <div>Working at Replicon is an opportunity to take on the unique challenges of a successful, large scale SaaS business application that existed before "web applications" as we know them today even existed. We have unusual challenges in such as extreme data consistency & reliability (nobody puts up with being paid incorrectly), large scale, complex legacy systems, enterprise-scale customizability, all combined with a friendly non-technical user experience. It's a "never-stop-learning" environment, where you'll be working with a strong technical team.</div>  <br/><strong><div>Responsibilities include:</div>  <br/></strong>   <ul>  	<li>Remove impediments in the technical development processes to support high-frequency, low lead-time software deployments</li> <li>Isolate risk of deployment or software failures to minimize scope and impact of production incidents</li> <li>Collaborate effectively with multiple product teams with unique internal processes and technologies</li> <li>Identifies where development and operational practices are outside industry norms; doesn't accept "we've always done it this way", works to do it better</li> <li>Effectively implements automation to augment or replace manual processes; prefers adopting rather than building software where appropriate</li> <li>Participates in the on-call rotation to efficiently triage critical production incidents, reduce incident severity, and document incident in detail for product team follow-up</li> </ul>  <strong><div>Qualifications:</div>  <br/></strong>   <ul>  	<li>Deep understanding of web technologies (HTTP, DNS, TLS/SSL, web services, load balancing)</li> <li>Experience with AWS (have used S3, EC2, RDS); would accept experience with Azure and/or Google Cloud</li> <li>Experience with automation tools (eg. Docker, Terraform, Jenkins, CodePipeline)</li> <li>Familiar with agile processes/scrum and TDD</li> <li>Built or have supported CI and CD processes</li> <li>Experience with post mortems/failure analysis - identifying the root cause & contributing factors of incidents</li> <li>Experience with a SaaS, globally-distributed multi-tenant system would be a preference</li> <li>Experience with a micro-services architecture, or the transition towards one</li> </ul>  </div> <br/>
Title: Site Reliability Software Developer

Job_Description: Building our People and our Products is what Inspires Us. <br/><br/> Job Posting for: Embedded Software Developer <br/><br/> Reports to: Engineering Manager, Firmware <br/><br/> Location:Calgary <br/><br/> Employment Type: Permanent, Full-time <br/><br/> <strong>About the Company</strong> <br/><br/> INOVA aspires to be THE land seismic technology company by developing reliable seismic instruments that enable geophysical service providers to efficiently design and execute complex seismic acquisition programs on behalf of our energy and production customers around the world. <br/><br/> We are a global organization with technical professionals who focus on innovation in land seismic product development to ensure our products remain on the cutting-edge of innovation, guided by the practical reality of what contractors require to reliably execute complex seismic programs in the most difficult operating environments. In addition, we manufacture these innovative seismic instruments with a strong commitment to quality and safety. Our global sales and service teams market our innovative products and concentrate on providing Best in Class customer satisfaction. <br/><br/> <strong>Purpose of the Job:</strong> <br/><br/> The Embedded Software Developer will be a key member of the firmware team. This employee will deliver and support a package of high quality, feature rich firmware for INOVAs land seismic data acquisition systems for oil and gas exploration. <br/><br/> Duties and job requirements include, but are not limited to: <br/><br/> Responsible for the design and development of embedded software in a Microsoft Windows environment as part of a team of embedded software and hardware developers <br/> Perform the testing and integration of firmware and software with other components of the system <br/> Responsible for submitting software to a version control system using bug tracking software <br/> Work in accordance with all legislation and company policy requirements pertaining to employee safety, health and wellness <br/><br/> <strong>Education and Work Experience:</strong> <br/><br/> 2- 5 years experience in developing software for embedded real-time multithreaded applications <br/> Bachelors Degree in Engineering, Mathematics or Physics <br/><br/> <strong>Specific Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:</strong> <br/><br/> Previous experience with multiprocessor and FPGA based designs <br/> Familiarity with embedded RTOSs such as VxWorks, eCos, FreeRTOS <br/> Strong C/C++ programming and debugging skills <br/> Experience with Eclipse development environment and GNU toolchain <br/> Excellent analytic, problem solving, and troubleshooting skills <br/> Preferred skills: Device drivers for control of hardware circuits and interfaces including Flash, EEPROM, SPI, I2C, USB, RS-232, and 1-wire; ARM, MSP430, and Nios processors <br/> Working knowledge of digital oscilloscopes, analyzers, and JTAG debuggers <br/><br/> We sincerely thank you for your interest in this position, however, we will only contact applicants selected for an interview.
Title: Embedded Software Developer

Or if willing to refer someone who is qualified, Systematix will offer a referral fee for successful placements.</div> <div><strong>ABOUT S</strong><strong>YSTEMATIX</strong><strong>:</strong></div><div>Systematix is one of Canada’s largest privately owned National Consulting and Resourcing firms. Job_Description: Showpass is a ticketing and event management software company. We empower venue and event organizers to create a rich, connected experience for their customers through next-generation technology. We combine cutting-edge software and hardware for seamless on- and offline sales, while delivering event management tools on the same integrated platform. <br/><br/> <em><strong>But what makes us different?</strong></em> <br/><br/> Showpass offers a unique platform for collaboration between the key groups that power events. From venues, to organizers, to street teams, to event attendees, we are focused on bringing people together through the magic of live events. We also happen to be powered by a very talented team fostering innovation, creativity and disruption. These pillars support the Showpass culture which is built on a love for events, and all things food. Thats what makes us the fastest growing Canadian ticketing company. <br/><br/> <strong>THE ROLE:</strong> Senior Software Engineer (full-time permanent role) <br/><br/> <strong>THE PERKS:</strong> <ul> <li>A unique and fun place to work flexible hours and vacation policy, in-house chef, fully stocked snack and fresh pressed juice bar, gym membership, dog-friendly office and parking</li><li>Competitive compensation and benefits package</li>  </ul> <strong>THE RESPONSIBILITIES:</strong> <ul> <li>Facilitate best practices for quality assurance such as code reviews and technical recommendations</li><li>Work with developers and designers to design new features and optimize the stability and scalability of our servers</li><li>Stay up to date and knowledgeable on the latest programming tools and practices</li><li>Write effective tests to find bugs quickly, and teach other developers to do the same</li><li>Participate in routine standups, code reviews and testing parties</li> </ul> <strong>THE QUALIFICATIONS:</strong> <ul> <li>Minimum 3 years work experience in Python/Django or similar</li><li>Post secondary education in engineering or computer science would be an asset</li><li>Natural ability to find and exploit weaknesses in a system</li><li>Relentless pursuit of perfection in code and design</li><li>Highly skilled with latest DevOps tools and practices including: Docker, Kubernetes, Google Cloud Platform, AWS</li><li>Experience with AngularJS or similar frontend frameworks (Backbone, React, Polymer)</li><li>Experience with testing tools such as CircleCI, mocha, unittest</li><li>Strong knowledge of database concepts</li><li>Must work great in a team and also as an individual contributor</li><li>Analytical thinker with the ability to problem solve in a fast-paced work environment</li><li>Must have the hustle and drive to take initiative and make things happen!</li> </ul> <strong>NOTE: We will only contact qualified candidates of interest</strong>

Job_Description: The Role <br/>  <br/> We are seeking someone who is passionate about cloud-based technologies and improving how software is developed and deployed. You will be responsible for improving the software development and deployment of Pason’s DataHub web application through the adoption of AWS services and technologies such as containers. <br/> You will also develop and enable blue-green software deployments, adopt new AWS features, and automate the provisioning and orchestration of AWS resources. We are looking for candidate who is excited about learning new technologies and enabling infrastructure as code. <br/>  <br/> Essential Duties and Responsibilities   <ul> <li>Develop infrastructure as code frameworks to manage Pason’s AWS infrastructure deployments.</li> <li>Develop and design a system to support rolling deployments, system auto-scaling and automation of monitoring in AWS.</li> <li>Work with the AWS migration team to improve the integration of Pason’s DataHub application with AWS technologies.</li> <li>Develop and improve Pason’s automated software deployment system to decrease deployment time</li> </ul>  Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities   <ul> <li>Proficient experience working with Python or Java</li> <li>Experience working with configuration management technologies such as Puppet and Ansible are preferred</li> <li>Experience working with Amazon Web Services including: EC2, ELB, S3, RDS is preferred</li> <li>Strong cloud development and automation skills</li> <li>Experience with the following tools: GIT (or equivalent), Jenkins, Artifactory</li> <li>Experience working in an agile development environment (Scrum or Kanban)</li> <li>Familiar with Development Operations principles</li> <li>Organizational skills with the ability to work on multiple tasks and projects</li> <li>Self-awareness, with a desire for constant self-improvement</li> <li>Strong advocate for quality on the team and motivated to deliver top quality results</li> <li>Ability to work in a fast-paced environment</li></ul>
