Job_Description: <div> <div> <div> <div>SigFig is tearing down the barriers to investing. We've raised $60 million to support our growth as the #1 Online Investment Advisor for large Financial Institutions. To meet the rapidly growing demand and interest in our investment solution, we have recently set-up a development center in Calgary. Come join a fast growing San Francisco based-company and help build SigFig Calgarys team. Help us define the next generation of investing!</div> <br/> <div>As a Software Engineer at SigFig, you will work with a team of brilliant developers to build solutions that analyze billions in investor assets, running complex algorithms and recommendations software to help people make better investment decisions. Youll help us Platformize (yes thats a word) our code, build high-impact features, and make it more easily configurable and customizable for a diverse set of needs. Its not easy, but its an incredible opportunity for people who like technical, people and business challenges.</div></div> </div><br/>  <div> <div><strong>WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING:</strong></div><div>   <ul> <li>Design, develop, test, deploy and maintain services around SigFigs Wealth Management Platform.</li> <li>Integrate SigFigs Wealth Management systems into a diverse set of third-party enterprise systems.</li> <li>Interact with engineering members across the organization to ensure consistency in engineering practices and foster active exchange of ideas. We have development centers in San Francisco, Tucson, Singapore and India and the ability to work with distributed teams is a key skill.</li> <li>Perform peer code reviews. Review performance, security and flexibility of the code.</li> <li>Participating in SigFigs agile ceremonies (e.g. daily standup, release and sprint planning, demos, scrum of scrums).</li> </ul> <strong>WE'RE LOOKING FOR SOMEONE WITH:</strong>  <ul> <li>You possess a BTech/BE in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related technical field or equivalent practical experience. Strong Computer Science fundamentals - you understand data structures, algorithms and software design practices.</li> <li>Good experience with JVM languages (Scala, Java) and relational databases (ability to design, query, transform and optimize).</li> <li>Great Communication Skills You have excellent communication skills and are able to clearly articulate your thoughts during verbal and written communications. The work we do here is very collaborative (and globally distributed), so team players and an experience with fast moving projects is a big plus as well.</li> <li>Self starters with the interest and ability to learn other coding languages as needed.</li> <li>Knowledge of modern web technologies including Javascript, AngularJS is a plus.</li> <li>Familiarity working with SSO solutions (SAML, OAuth, OpenID), CRM vendors, email systems, e-signature providers, or financial data (FIX, OFX), web infrastructure (firewalls, VPNs, proxies) and hosting is a plus.</li> <li>Domain Experience is a plus You understand the financial services domain and have executed projects involving implementation and integration of software solutions with other systems in financial institutions. You understand the need for strong security, audits and performance criteria that are associated with the banking and financial services industry.</li> <li>Passion for finance and investing is a plus.</li> </ul>  </div> </div><br/>  <div> <div><strong>ABOUT SIGFIG</strong></div> <br/> <div>SigFig is dedicated to making high-quality investment advice more accessible and affordable to investors of all wealth levels. Using a combination of design, data science, and technology, SigFig helps empower investors with the information and guidance they need to achieve their personal financial goals. Through partnerships with some of the worlds largest and most innovative financial institutions, SigFig seeks to help investors and advisors better manage their investments. Its enterprise technology accelerates time to market for its partners, while doing so in a secure, scalable, and compliant way. Its product, design, and growth labs fuel innovation, accelerate adoption, and create delight for clients.</div> <br/> <div>Founded in 2007, SigFig is backed by leading financial institutions including Eaton Vance, Comerica Bank, New York Life, Santander InnoVentures, and UBS, as well as top-tier venture capital firms, including Bain Capital Ventures, DCM Ventures, Nyca Partners, and Union Square Ventures. The company is headquartered in San Francisco, California. Learn more at www.sigfig.com.</div></div> </div> <br/>
Title: Backend Software Engineer

Job_Description: <div><b>Business Development/Client Sales Executive REF#00483X</b></div><div><b>Calgary, Alberta</b></div><div><br></div><div>Schneider Electric™ creates connected technologies that reshape industries, transform cities and enrich lives. Our 160,000 employees thrive in more than 100 countries. From the simplest of switches to complex operational systems, our technology, software and services improve the way our customers manage and automate their operations. Help us deliver solutions that ensure Life Is On everywhere, for everyone and at every moment: https://youtu.be/NlLJMv1Y7Hk.</div> <div> </div> <div><b>Great people make Schneider Electric a great company.</b></div> <div> </div> <div><b>Schneider Electric Process Automation (PA) brings together the best-known brands in industrial automation (Foxboro DCS, Triconex SIS, and Modicon PLC</b><b>’s</b><b>) to deliver integrated solutions that automate and optimize plant operations. We are part of Schneider-Electric, a $35 billion & 160,000 employee global group headquartered in France. Schneider-Electric is a major global supplier of systems, software, instruments, and solutions for electrical distribution, process automation and asset performance management. Primary customer industries include Refining and Petrochemicals, Upstream Oil and Gas, Metals and Mining, Pulp & Paper, and Power and Utilities.</b></div> <div> </div><div> <div>We are presently looking for a Client Sales Executive (CSE) to strengthen our team in the West.</div> <div>Ideally, the candidate should be based in Calgary, Alberta. </div><u><div><u><br></u></div>Responsibilities</u><br><br>The Client Sales Executive is responsible for the establishment and maintenance of the sales relationship with each client/prospect in their portfolio at every level from the executive suite (CxO) to departmental line managers. The CSE drives new business through the identification, development, negotiation, and closure of new automation projects and services agreements with prospects and clients, and participates in the subsequent maintenance of the client relationship. They target potential leads, qualify them, and lead the pursuit team in crafting and positioning the offer and pursuit. To this end, they leverage their industry and financial business knowledge to create demand and persuade through the development and presentation of compelling purchasing rationales and offers. Product, Services and Solution agreements will encompass all PA offerings and range in scale from short-term consulting engagements to complex, multi-year, multi-service, and global projects and partnerships. Specific new sales/revenue and profit margin targets are established annually by management for each CSE.<br><br>Additional CSE responsibilities include the smooth transition of new business from sales to delivery, coaching and mentoring account delivery leaders on client relationship management issues, providing feedback on customer needs to the S-E strategic portfolio manager, ensuring compliance with the sales processes and approval requirements, coordinating the relationship between key client personnel and management, and leading or coordinating global relationship management initiatives with other geographic units focused on the same client.<br><br>The CSE also shares industry, deal, and sales best-practice knowledge with the S-E sales community and may mentor and coach other Client Sales Executives, as required.<br><u><br></u></div><div><u>Job Essential Functions</u></div> <div><br>PA Client Sales Executives are responsible for managing the entire sales process from identifying prospects to negotiating contracts.<br><br>Other job essential functions include, but are not limited to, the following:<br>• Identify prospects and create entry strategies for each<br>• Create and manage demand and qualify opportunities </div> <div>• Utilize business and financial knowledge to create value propositions<br>• Execute competitive sales tactics to win business<br>• Coordinate the pursuit as well as the deal crafting and positioning<br>• Lead or participate in contract negotiations </div> <div>• Create and maintain territory sales plan and Account plans</div> <div>• Report client activities in bFO/ SalesForce CRM</div> <div>• Maintain all opportunities current and accurate in bFO/ SalesForce<br><br>This position will :</div> <div>- Have a strong Business Development component for large projects in the East.</div> <div>- Will have minimum travel requirement of 50&</div> <div><u>Education: </u></div> <div><br>Undergraduate degree, preferably in Business, Engineering, or Computer Science, or College degree with strong pertinent experience. An MBA, or graduate degree in Business, Engineering, Computer Science, or professional qualifications in Law or Finance are considered a major plus.<br><br><u>Experience:</u> </div> <div><br>• 10 years of complex, solution selling sales experience to industrial clients, ideally to the refining, oil and gas, Metals & Mining industries.<br>• Strong technical knowledge of DCS, Safety Systems, PLC controls, Instruments, and Advanced Applications for process optimization, management or control.<br>• Past experience in closing deals of $2-3 Million in contract value<br>• Knowledgeable of Business Solutions and Manufacturing Applications<br>• Ability to establish CXO level relationships<br>• Track record of meeting/exceeding yearly quota<br>• Experience in business transformation solutions<br>• Capability to understand S-E offerings and articulate those offerings to the industry and prospects</div> <div>As part of our team, you'll build a strong career with a collaborative, knowledgeable team of people. We'll challenge you to think differently to achieve your goals. You'll have easy access to senior management, leading thinkers, and colleagues around the world.</div> <div><br>In addition to competitive salaries and inclusive benefits, we offer global career opportunities and travel to new places to inspire fresh, new thinking. We believe in rewarding and recognizing risk-taking and creativity. We also promote a healthy work-life balance as essential for your personal growth.</div> <div> </div> <div> <div>Visit…. Web site</div> <div> </div> <div>We seek out and reward people for being straightforward, open, passionate, effective and challenging the status quo. We want our employees to reflect the diversity of the communities in which we operate. We welcome people as they are, creating an inclusive culture where all forms of diversity are seen as a real value for the company. We’re looking for people with a passion for success — on the job and beyond. See what our people have to say about working for Schneider Electric: https://youtu.be/6D2Av1uUrzY. </div> <div> </div> <div><b>Let us learn about you! Apply today.</b></div> <div><b> </b></div> <div>You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled. </div> <div> </div> <div>It is the policy of Schneider Electric to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities in the areas of recruiting, hiring, training, transferring, and promoting all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, color, gender, disability, national origin, ancestry, age, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristic or conduct.</div> <div> </div> <div>Concerning agencies: Schneider Electric does not accept unsolicited resumes and will not be responsible for fees related to such.</div><br><br><br></div>

maintaining unit tests.</li> <li>Experience with developing software using Agile software development.</li> <li>Building and deploying applications to Google AppEngine or Amazon Web Services.</li> Job_Description: At General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada, Canada’s premiere defence company, innovation happens on a daily basis. We develop and deliver highly-complex leading edge technology, products and systems that make important contributions to our customer’s success in land, airborne, maritime and public safety applications. The challenges and opportunities are endless.The results – incredible. <br/><br/> Our employees are exceptional. We are proud to employ more than 1,100 talented individuals across Canada. Working in a collaborative environment, our employees are encouraged daily to contribute their technical knowledge and expertise. Our employees are passionate, dedicated, and conscientious about the work they do which results in our ability to deliver the highest value, customized solutions in order to meet the most demanding requirements. <br/><br/> An excellent opportunity for a junior Software Developer in Calgary to join a team of engineers working on a Military Communications System. The purpose of this position is to work with the development team to develop capabilities in the areas of networking, system management, radio voice and data services, or test automation. <br/><br/> Typical Duties: <br/><br/> The responsibilities and range of activities will vary, but in general include: <ul> <li>Design, code, test, integrate and document software/firmware solutions.</li> <li>Apply principles and techniques of computer science, engineering, and mathematical analysis for the development of complex systems and architectures.</li> <li>Analyze code to determine behavior of legacy systems.</li> <li>Implement new functionality in deployed systems.</li><li>Participate in technical reviews as a reviewer or author.</li><li>Work with hardware, firmware, system and test engineers to identify defects, resolve issues, and perform verification activities.</li><li>Work with system engineers to determine behavior and plan for new functionality in the deployed system.</li> <li>Maintain the code base for a legacy deployed system.</li> </ul> Required Skills & Experience <ul> <li>Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.</li> <li>Strong problem solving and analysis skills.</li><li>Strong knowledge of development using C++.</li> <li>Ability to work effectively both independently and in a team environment, with minimum supervision.</li>  </ul> Education <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Engineering, or applicable scientific discipline is required.</li><li>Candidates with diplomas will be considered with adequate additional experience.</li> </ul> Assets <ul> <li>Experience working in both Linux and Windows development environments.</li> <li>Experience in scripting languages such as Python.</li>  </ul> Other <br/><br/> <strong>Minimum 10 year consecutive residence in Canada – for Canadian Secret Security Clearance</strong> <br/> Applicants will be required to obtain/hold a valid and current Canadian security clearance to gain access to the classified spaces, information and equipment in order to perform the work associated with this position. <br/><br/> General Dynamics Mission Systems – Canada is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace. Workplace accommodations are available.
Title: Software/Firmware Developer , Junior

Job_Description: <P></P> <P><BR></P> <P>Schneider Electric™ creates connected technologies that reshape industries, transform cities and enrich lives. Our 160,000 employees thrive in more than 100 countries. From the simplest of switches to complex operational systems, our technology, software and services improve the way our customers manage and automate their operations. Help us deliver solutions that ensure Life Is On everywhere, for everyone and at every moment: https://youtu.be/NlLJMv1Y7Hk. </P> <P> </P> <P><B>Great people make Schneider Electric a great company.</B></P> <P><B><BR></B></P> <P><B>Software Product QA Manager</B></P> <P><B><BR></B></P> <P><B>What do you get to do in this position?</B><B></B></P> <P><BR></P> <P>As a Software Product QA Manager reporting to the Senior QA Manager for Enterprise Pipeline Management Software, first and foremost you are grounded in being a great software quality engineer with a strong history in highly complex, distributed computing, enterprise scale products. This isn’t just your history, you are passionate about delivering high-quality products and strive to continuously improve the practices followed by the team that surrounds you. Your foundation of software quality engineer gives you the ability to understand the needs of the various teams you are involved with, and enable them to grow in their careers while actively working on exciting software.</P> <P><BR></P> <P>The OASyS platform, and the industry applications built on it, deliver live real time control systems that operate 24x7 with 99.999> of availability. In other words, large scale software that has no more than 5 minutes of downtime per year, running for decades without intervention. It gets data from a field device into the user’s hands within a second. And it enables the user issue a control to large scale industrial devices in the field within a second.</P> <P><BR></P> <P>You are able to apply Lean Thinking to everything you do, and have had enough experience to proactively help your team to progress through the challenges they are facing through thoughtful, yet rigorous leadership. This is how you work day in day out. You have activated and realized your ideas to make your team and the product they work on better. You’ve seen where your ideas have succeeded and where they have failed. You can speak to these successes and failures, and enjoy the wisdom that comes from both. You have excellent communication skills (both verbal and in writing) to help champion your ideas. Others describe you as being confident, capable of listening and learning with a sense of humility, and then adapting appropriately. </P> <P><BR></P> <P>Ideally you also have grounding in the computing science underpinnings of real time software quality assurance. You understand and are focused in understanding deeply how the software you work on is used by its users. You translate this knowledge in thoughtful test plans working with your teams and practice active listening techniques to ensure you are in tune with your customers.</P> <P><BR></P> <P>You will be actively participating in helping to define the product software architecture for the future of both OASyS and the Enterprise Pipeline Applications. You will You will be part of a leadership team, exchanging ideas and challenging both yourself and the other leaders to learn work on growing an exciting R&D department towards the delivery of High Quality Software. Yet, this role is also a hands on job, as this is the primary way to help your team continuously improve and to get the best out of them. In this regard, continuous improvement is in your DNA, and you are always asking how you can iterate and improve on your current ideas, and your skills.</P> <P><BR></P> <P><B>Specific Responsibilities: </B></P> <P><B><BR></B></P> <P>· Manages the product QA teams.</P> <P>· Provides guidance, leadership, and training to all QA members integrated into the Agile SCRUM development teams and ensure consistency of our built-in quality efforts across all SCRUM teams.</P> <P>· Responsible for assigning resources against competing projects and negotiating timelines with PMs and Development Managers.</P> <P>· Responsible for the quality of the products being released.</P> <P>· Defines test plans.</P> <P>· Defines the test automation strategy.</P> <P>· Recommends and implements test tools.</P> <P>· Ensures test results are recorded, available, and reports test status to business stakeholders.</P> <P>· Tracks and reports on key Quality and Defect Metrics.</P> <P>· Uses Continuous Improvement initiatives to improve product quality.</P> <P>· Guides the entire department towards a culture of built-in quality and continuous improvement using LEAN principals.</P> <P>· Work with the development teams to ensure that User Stories are testable.</P> <P>· Performs internal audits periodically to ensure that the department is adhering to processes.</P> <P></P> <P>· Manages hiring, retention, and performance management for the QA team.</P> This job might be for you if: <P>· 5 years related QA Manager Experience.</P> <P>· Subject matter expert on quality best practices.</P> <P>· Experience managing a quality assurance software product organization.</P> <P>· Experience managing remote employees and/or offices.</P> <P>· Experience managing offshore teams.</P> <P>· Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, with an ability to work with diverse groups.</P> <P>· Strong organization skills.</P> <P>· Able to observe bottlenecks in process and then develop processes and procedures to overcome them.</P> <P>· Independent decision maker – develop ideas and proposals to suggest changes and make decisions.</P> <P>· Strong initiative – proactively make use of resources to offer solutions or resolve problems.</P> <P>· Collaboration and negotiation with internal and external groups.</P> <P>· Team building and motivational skills.</P> <P>· Proven capability to delegate work across a large team or multiple teams.</P> <P>· Understands software development lifecycle in a product development environment.</P> <P>· Proactive problem solver.</P> <P><B><BR></B></P> <P><B>Preferred Technical Skills</B>:</P> <P>· Experience in industrial connectivity standards and networking protocols such as ModBus, DNP3, OPC UA, OPC, IEC-104 and other relevant Telemetry centric protocols.</P> <P>· Experience with QA Test Automation.</P> <P>· Experience with defect management tools.</P> <P>· Experience with source control management systems.</P> <P>· Cloud Technology knowledge.</P> <P>· Deep understanding of Windows environment, Active Directory Security and highly distributed systems.</P> <P>· Experience in testing user and system authentication, encryption, cryptography and other cyber-security standards and measures.</P> <P>· Experience with OASyS products and other industrial automation products is highly preferred.</P> <P>· Prior experience in the Oil and Gas Pipeline Industry is a big plus.</P> <P> </P> <P>We seek out and reward people for being straightforward, open, passionate, effective and challenging the status quo. We want our employees to reflect the diversity of the communities in which we operate. We welcome people as they are, creating an inclusive culture where all forms of diversity are seen as a real value for the company. We’re looking for people with a passion for success — on the job and beyond. See what our people have to say about working for Schneider Electric: https://youtu.be/6D2Av1uUrzY. </P> <P> </P> <P><B>Let us learn about you! Apply today.</B></P> <P><B> </B></P> <P>You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled. </P> <P> </P> <P>It is the policy of Schneider Electric to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities in the areas of recruiting, hiring, training, transferring, and promoting all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, color, gender, disability, national origin, ancestry, age, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristic or conduct.</P> <P> </P> <P>Concerning agencies: Schneider Electric does not accept unsolicited resumes and will not be responsible for fees related to such.</P> <P> </P> <P><B>Schneider Electric is an Equal Opportunity Employer.</B></P> <P><B>Minorities/Women/Vets/Disabled</B></P>
Title: Software Product QA Manager OASyS Platform

Job_Description: <strong>Regional Sales Representative/software</strong> <br/><br/> Our client has an opening for a regional sales representative working out of a remote, home based office office. <br/> This is an exciting opportunity for the right individual to work with a talented team of specialists taking care of an existing territory and solid customer base. <br/> You primary focus will be sales to both new and existing clients with a marketing component as well as customer retention. <br/> If you are familiar with the term "saas" and have experience working with small businesses up to enterprise opportunities, you should seriously consider this opportunity because there's nothing here but potential. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong>   <ul> <li>Work with existing client base by establishing relationships with key contacts and suggesting ancillary products and services to compliment their current programs.</li>  <li>Demonstrate products to new and existing clients, high lighting the advantages of the software packages.</li>  <li>Regular warm and cold calls to new prospects as well as timely response to inbound calls.</li>  <li>Maintain a CRM database with accurate, up to date information.</li>  <li>Maintain a robust pipeline and regularly communicate forecasts and sales progress with Sales Manager.</li>  <li>Implement regional marketing plans and campaigns showcasing the companies software programs, driving growth and creating awareness (top of mind).</li>  <li>Position yourself as the main point of contact for your clients.</li>  <li>Stay on top of industry and market trends and develop plans to leverage the companies position.</li>  <li>Develop and implement an effective business plan annually for the assigned territory.</li>  </ul>  <strong>Requirements</strong> <br/><br/> There will be some associated travel in the Eastern US and Canada as required. There is also a requirement to attend industry relevant trade shows and conferences. The hours are flexible and the territory is in an Eastern time zone so adjusting to the difference at the start of the day will be a consideration. <br/><br/> <strong>Skill set</strong>   <ul> <li>Clear and effective communication skills.</li>  <li>Minimum three years sales experience in a technical setting (soft ware sales preferred)</li>  <li>Customer centric.</li>  <li>Willingness to work with and respect others.</li>  <li>Effective at sourcing and developing leads.</li>  <li>Driven by successes.</li>  <li>Solid and demonstrable sales skills.</li>  <li>Comfortable presenting to all levels.</li>  <li>At ease on the telephone.</li>  <li>Polished writing skills (e-mail communication).</li>  <li>Solid business sense. Good business versus bad.</li>  <li>Social media savvy.</li>  </ul>  <strong>Education etc.</strong>   <ul> <li>Post secondary (technical diploma or degree)</li>  <li>Experience in surveying is a benefit.</li>  <li>Engineering discipline.</li>  <li>Sales experience as noted.</li> </ul>  <strong>Remuneration</strong>   <ul> <li>The job comes with a <strong>generous base salary plus uncapped commissions</strong>.</li>  <li>On target sales will exceed <strong>85K</strong> plus in first year. You can basically make as much money as you want, it's up to you.</li>  <li>RRSP matching.</li>  <li>Three weeks vacation.</li>  <li>Medical, dental, life insurance etc.</li> </ul>

Job_Description: The software products group at Nureva is constantly growing, and we are currently looking for a highly motivated full-stack <strong><em>Senior</em></strong> <strong><em>Software Developer</em> </strong>to join our team. If you are passionate about developing across all layers of innovative cloud-based solutions, including rich interactive web applications, cloud services, and supporting API’s, come work with us! <br/><br/> At Nureva you will be involved in the development of concepts, innovative design, and delivery of solutions right through to completion. You will work with a diverse team of developers, designers, and product managers who are passionate about technology, user experience and market success. <br/><br/> We strive to create experiences with a human-centered approach to design. Our multidisciplinary professionals work collaboratively to push the boundaries of what is technically possible and develop applications for the global markets. The entrepreneurial environment at Nureva appeals to self-driven, flexible team players who are creative, learn quickly and aren’t afraid to tackle hard problems. <br/><br/> <strong>Opportunity to</strong>  <ul> <li>Design and develop new features across all application layers in the product</li> <li>Research new technologies and bring forward new ideas to support the business</li> <li>Perform full life cycle feature development</li> <li>Deliver products from requirements through design, implementation, and release using a continuous delivery approach based on automated, repeatable and reliable releases</li> <li>Work closely with other talented developers, UX, and QA in a collaborative Scrum team</li>  </ul> <strong>Preferred Skills and Knowledge</strong>  <ul> <li>Programming in two or more of C#, WPF or .NET, JavaScript, HTML5, Angular, MS SQL</li> <li>Skilled at developing responsive user interfaces</li> <li>Experience developing real-time and/or RESTful API services</li> <li>Experience with developing enterprise-level features including Single Sign On is an asset</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications and Experience</strong>  <ul> <li>Minimum Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent</li> <li>7+ years of relevant work experience including server-side and web development</li> <li>Thrive on the unknown and always interested in your next challenge</li> <li>Excited about learning and proactive about picking up new technologies</li> <li>Creative and a natural ability to solve problems</li> <li>Solid understanding of programming fundamentals</li> <li>Experience with all parts of the development life cycle</li> <li>Ability to work within an agile process and a rapidly changing environment</li> <li>Passion for championing best practices and ensuring high-quality code by providing technical leadership and mentorship to other developers</li> <li>Excellent communication and collaboration skills</li>  </ul> We offer a competitive total compensation package, an open and collaborative office in downtown Calgary and a great team environment. <br/><br/> Apply online. Please outline how you will make a difference being part of our team. If we select you for an interview, we will spend time helping you understand the role and our company to ensure that we are a good fit for you.
Title: Senior Software Developer

Job_Description: Interested in being a part of a team that is leading the digital evolution of retail in Canada? <br/><br/> Embracing and driving change is critical to our success. The complexity and rate at which the retail industry is transforming has increased exponentially in recent years and we are committed to being a leader in the industry. <br/><br/> As such we are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join the Canadian Tire Family of Companies as a Senior Software Developer at Canada’s premier sporting goods retailer, FGL. FGL owns the most recognizable sporting goods brands in the country including Sport Chek, Sports Experts, National Sports, Pro Hockey Life and Atmosphere. <br/><br/> <strong>What you’ll do</strong> <br/><br/> In this role, you will be expected to: <br/><br/> Collaborate actively with the business analyst (BA) in the design of: <ul> <li>Fully integrated systems, which may include applications, databases, and related systems</li><li>Alternative solutions to existing applications</li><li>Effective and efficient interfaces to systems, applications, and databases</li><li>Conduct feasibility studies, proof-of-concept prototypes</li><li>Provide high-level development during the initial stages of a project</li><li>Provide & meet estimated time of accomplishment for assigned tasks</li><li>Evaluate and enhance the efficiency of existing programs, anticipating future user needs</li><li>Ensure system integrity, efficiency, and security</li><li>Provide and supervise unit, integrated, and volume testing</li><li>Maintain and support assigned systems to ensure minimal downtime and loss of productivity, service</li><li>Maintain and support associated databases, models, and technical documentation</li><li>Lead a small team of developers to achieve the above goals</li> </ul> <strong>Who you are</strong> <br/><br/> We are looking for a high performing individual who: <ul> <li>Possesses an entrepreneurial spirit, a bias for action, and a desire to work with key stakeholders to drive innovation in the retail environment and in-store e-commerce;</li><li>Is direct and truthful, and builds trust and credibility with co-workers, vendors, and customers by consistently adhering to the organization’s business principles and values</li><li>Demonstrates a desire to help and is proactive, responsive, and focused on discovering, anticipating, and exceeding the customer’s needs</li><li>Is committed to results by taking personal responsibility for achieving mutually agreed upon individual/team objectives, and working collaboratively and cooperatively with others to achieve shared goals and objective</li><li>Considers the wider team, function, banner or the organization and takes action or makes decisions which support the success of those groups</li><li>Recovers quickly after change, disruptions, or mistakes and can remain productive and focused</li><li>Is adaptable and can apply lessons learned in one situation to another situation</li><li>If you’re curious, ready to take on new challenges and open to doing things differently to help us evolve rapidly, then FGL Sports is definitely the place to be</li> </ul> <strong>What you’ve done</strong> <ul> <li>Minimum 10 years of experience as a developer</li><li>5 years working experience designing and building applications using Java</li><li>Fundamental understanding of Java design concepts and design patterns</li><li>Strong understanding of the J2EE ecosystem including proven experience with Application Servers (Apache Tomcat) and standard Java technologies such as JNDI, JMS, JMX, and the Spring Framework</li><li>Experience with the MEAN stack (MongoDB/MariaDB, Express, Angular, Node.js)</li><li>Experience building and debugging client/server Internet systems and architecture</li><li>Strong understanding of Git</li>  <ul> <li>Solid knowledge of at least one SQL programming environment</li><li>SQL Server 2005-2012</li><li>Oracle 9i-12c</li><li>MariaDB or MySQL 10</li> </ul>  <li>Experience in native Android application development</li>  <ul> <li>Android Studio, Gradle, Maven</li><li>User Interfaces Layouts</li><li>SQLite</li> </ul>  <li>Local Services, External Services, Content Providers, Account Manager Integration Spring Mobile, Corodva (nice to have)</li><li>Proficient understanding of Linux operating systems (RHEL 6.x, 7.x) and development environments</li><li>Understanding of security, encryption, and compression best practice</li><li>Experience developing and deploying to at least one cloud platform</li>  <ul> <li>AWS</li><li>Azure</li><li>Google Cloud</li><li>Kubernetes/Docker</li> </ul>  <li>Experience with DevOps environments</li><li>Bamboo, Jenkins, Ansible</li>  </ul> <strong>Why us</strong> <br/><br/> Canadian Tire is one of Canada’s most iconic and diversified companies. Our culture and values uphold our pledge to sustainable practices, and the commitment to our local communities through Jumpstart cannot be beat. <br/><br/> To learn more about this team and the Canadian Tire Family of Companies follow us on LinkedIn. <br/><br/> FGL Sports is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees - their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.
Title: Senior Software Developer - FGL Sports - Calgary, AB

Job_Description: Cognera is looking for a self-starting individual who enjoys a fast-paced environment. When people think about Cognera, they think teamwork, client focus and fun. As a web developer, you will be responsible for designing, coding and modifying web applications, from layout to function and according to a client's specifications. You will be working in a full-stack JavaScript development web environment with some legacy support for older web applications. You should be keen on striving to create visually appealing apps that feature user-friendly design and clear navigation.  <ul> <li>Work on an agile team developing and supporting web applications.</li><li>Responsible for feature additions, debugging, deployment, customer support, and design.</li><li>Code reading and code writing as required.</li><li>Ability to problem-solve and troubleshoot customer issues.</li><li>Skilled in all areas of communication, verbal and written.</li><li>Prepare and maintain well-organized documentation.</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Experience in application development using modern JavaScript libraries</li><li>Oracle JET, node.js, jQuery, Knockout, Require.js are just some examples of the technology you will be using</li><li>Working knowledge of relational databases and experience with Oracle is desirable</li><li>A driven self-starter able to work in a team or individually</li><li>Strong verbal and written communication skills</li><li>Strong understanding of security principles and their implementation</li><li>Understanding of Object-Oriented Design principles</li><li>Understanding of Web Services (REST/SOAP)</li><li>Ability to create clear and concise API designs</li><li>Understand Agile development methodologies</li><li>Understand foundations of good UI/UX design</li> </ul>  Cognera (www.cognera.com), a division of Harris Computer Systems, provides next generation billing solutions and online services to help our clients improve their customer relationships. Our deep-rooted experience in the energy and utilities industries, in both regulated and deregulated environments, makes us a natural choice when upgrading systems to meet evolving business, regulatory and technology requirements. <br/>  <br/> Harris Computer Systems has been providing complete Customer Information System (CIS) and Financial Management solutions exclusively to public and municipal utilities for over 30 years. Our track record speaks for itself. We are an experienced, solid company with proven solutions that are presently in use by over 6000 customers across North America. We are the number one provider of powerful Financial and CIS solutions because of our specialized understanding of the electric, water and gas utility industry and our commitment to customer relationships. <br/>  <br/> Harris Computer Systems is a member of the Constellation Software Inc. group of companies. <br/>  <br/> Harris is an EEO/AA/Disability/ Veteran employer.
Title: Web Developer

Job_Description: <strong>Regional Sales Representative/software</strong> <br/><br/> Our client has an opening for a regional sales representative working out of a remote, home based office office. <br/> This is an exciting opportunity for the right individual to work with a talented team of specialists taking care of an existing territory and solid customer base. <br/> You primary focus will be sales to both new and existing clients with a marketing component as well as customer retention. <br/> If you are familiar with the term "saas" and have experience working with small businesses up to enterprise opportunities, you should seriously consider this opportunity because there's nothing here but potential. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong>   <ul> <li>Work with existing client base by establishing relationships with key contacts and suggesting ancillary products and services to compliment their current programs.</li>  <li>Demonstrate products to new and existing clients, high lighting the advantages of the software packages.</li>  <li>Regular warm and cold calls to new prospects as well as timely response to inbound calls.</li>  <li>Maintain a CRM database with accurate, up to date information.</li>  <li>Maintain a robust pipeline and regularly communicate forecasts and sales progress with Sales Manager.</li>  <li>Implement regional marketing plans and campaigns showcasing the companies software programs, driving growth and creating awareness (top of mind).</li>  <li>Position yourself as the main point of contact for your clients.</li>  <li>Stay on top of industry and market trends and develop plans to leverage the companies position.</li>  <li>Develop and implement an effective business plan annually for the assigned territory.</li>  </ul>  <strong>Requirements</strong> <br/><br/> There will be some associated travel in the Eastern US and Canada as required. There is also a requirement to attend industry relevant trade shows and conferences. The hours are flexible and the territory is in an Eastern time zone so adjusting to the difference at the start of the day will be a consideration. <br/><br/> <strong>Skill set</strong>   <ul> <li>Clear and effective communication skills.</li>  <li>Minimum three years sales experience in a technical setting (soft ware sales preferred)</li>  <li>Customer centric.</li>  <li>Willingness to work with and respect others.</li>  <li>Effective at sourcing and developing leads.</li>  <li>Driven by successes.</li>  <li>Solid and demonstrable sales skills.</li>  <li>Comfortable presenting to all levels.</li>  <li>At ease on the telephone.</li>  <li>Polished writing skills (e-mail communication).</li>  <li>Solid business sense. Good business versus bad.</li>  <li>Social media savvy.</li>  </ul>  <strong>Education etc.</strong>   <ul> <li>Post secondary (technical diploma or degree)</li>  <li>Experience in surveying is a benefit.</li>  <li>Engineering discipline.</li>  <li>Sales experience as noted.</li> </ul>  <strong>Remuneration</strong>   <ul> <li>The job comes with a <strong>generous base salary plus uncapped commissions</strong>.</li>  <li>On target sales will exceed <strong>85K</strong> plus in first year. You can basically make as much money as you want, it's up to you.</li>  <li>RRSP matching.</li>  <li>Three weeks vacation.</li>  <li>Medical, dental, life insurance etc.</li> </ul>
Title: Regional Sales Representative/Software solutions

A KPMG professional should have all the following characteristics:  <ul> <li>Strong work ethic</li> <li>Thrive on challenges</li> <li>Dedicated to providing outstanding client service.</li>  </ul>  <strong>Position Summary</strong> <br/>  <br/> KPMG's Management Consulting group is experiencing exceptional growth, especially within IT Advisory. The rapidly expanding IT Advisory team is seeking a Senior Consultant for its Technology Enablement practice in Montreal. leads and use identified business requirements to design successive integrations of Workday with external HR vendors and software applications during testing and production periods. <br/><br/> order to deliver high-quality services and products</li><li>Manage client expectations on a daily basis, and work to resolve issues</li> </ul>  <strong>Financial</strong>  <ul> <li>Increase efficiency within client teams by identifying ways to improve processes</li> </ul>  <strong>Skills & Qualifications</strong>  <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics or any other major with significant quantitative/technical course work</li><li>Prior class or work experience that demonstrates analytical capabilities in programming languages such as Java, XML/XSLT or SQL</li><li>Fundamental knowledge of HR systems, such as PeopleSoft, SAP, Oracle, Workday as well as other leading best-of-breed systems</li><li>Propensity to quickly comprehend new and emerging technologies and understand business and testing scenarios</li><li>Self-starter; interest in continually challenging oneself and willingness to step outside of one’s comfort zone</li><li>Well organized and detail oriented</li><li>Ability to work both independently and on client teams and enjoy a fast-paced environment</li> </ul>  </div>   <br/><strong>Why Choose KPMG will consult with all applicants with disabilities who request accommodation during the recruitment process to ensure that the accommodation provided takes into account the applicant’s individual accessibility needs. <br/><br/> <strong>Category</strong> Consulting <br/>  <br/> <strong>Job Function</strong> Advisory <br/>  <br/> <strong>Service Line</strong> IT Advisory (Management Consulting) <br/>  <br/> <strong>Industry</strong> Not Applicable

Job_Description: <strong>Position summary:</strong> <br/><br/> Develop enterprise-class HTML5 application code using Angular for the UI and a combination of C++ and SQL stored procedures for application logic and persistence. Expand the capabilities of Hitachi ID Systems products by adding and supporting features for managing identities, credentials, security entitlements and privileged access to a range of on-premises and SaaS applications. Work alongside a team of talented developers, testers and solution architects. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong> <br/><br/> Work with team-members to develop, re-factor, enhance, and maintain product subsystems that span screens, unattended services, batch jobs, data loaders, workflow processes and analytics. Write application logic in C++ with SQL stored procedures for all data interaction and Angular for user interfaces. <br/><br/> <strong>Qualifications:</strong> <ul> <li>Strong C++ developer (related languages, such as C or Java would be an asset).</li><li>Familiar with SQL databases (writing SQL code) and AJAX UIs (preferably with a framework such as Angular).</li><li>Some familiarity with scripting languages such as Python, Perl or PowerShell.</li><li>Experience designing and debugging complex systems.</li><li>Familiarity with revision control systems (git, svn, etc.) and build automation (Make, Jam, Jenkins, etc.).</li><li>Ability to collaborate in a team, verbally and in writing, in English.</li><li>A B.Sc. or M.Sc. is required, preferably in software engineering, computer science or a related discipline.</li><li>Additional skills that would be useful include:  <ul> <li>Worked on large scale development projects with tight deadlines.</li><li>Developed nontrivial systems as a member of a team.</li><li>Familiarity with test automation and regression testing.</li><li>Platform knowledge: Unix/Linux, Windows, IIS, Apache, MSSQL and mobile platforms (Android, iOS).</li></ul></li> </ul> <strong>Compensation/ <br/>  benefits:</strong> <ul> <li>Competitive salary.</li><li>Extensive health benefits paid by the employer.</li><li>RRSP and bonus plans.</li><li>Paid vacation.</li><li>Flexible work hours.</li><li>Informal and rewarding work environment staffed with IT experts.</li><li>Be part of a growing, stable company with a great reputation.</li> </ul> Hitachi ID is an equal opportunity employer. Together we succeed. <br/><br/> <strong>Location:</strong> <br/><br/> Calgary, Alberta
Title: Software Developer: C++/SQL/Angular

Job_Description: About Vista<br/><br/>Recognized as one of Canadas top employers and Best Managed Companies, Vista Projects is a full service engineering, procurement and project management company serving Western Canadas oil sands and conventional oil and gas producers for over 30 years. Our continued growth comes from an experienced team of professionals who have an absolute commitment to providing our clients with exceptional service. We specialize in facility engineering design for thermal heavy oil (SAGD, CSS), enhanced oil recovery, and sustaining capital projects. Over the years, we have earned our reputation as a trusted leader in thermal energy projects, working on some of the most successful in-situ heavy oil projects in the oil sands.<br/><br/>Main Duties and Competencies<br/><br/>The Business Intelligence Analyst is responsible for the development and maintenance of the company business intelligence portal, and related business applications. This is a fantastic opportunity for either a tech savvy business graduate, or a business savvy developer to elevate their career. <br/><br/> This role combines business analysis, front-end and back-end development to deliver a challenging and engaging position where the successful candidate will be able to see their contributions come to life within a fast-paced and dynamic workplace. <br/><br/> If a role where you are empowered and supported to move from opportunity identification, through conceptualization, development and testing in weeks and not years sounds up your alley read on. <br/><br/> Duties will include:  <ul> <li>Creative problem solving</li> <li>Design and develop business intelligence reporting tools, visualizations and applications across all parts of Vistas business</li> <li>Maintain and work within Vistas data warehouse. Participate in the design, development and analysis of the data warehouse</li> <li>Assist in the selection, deployment and maintenance of third party business applications</li> <li>Maintain and develop new and legacy code for proprietary business applications</li> <li>Complete ad-hoc BI reporting for a variety of stakeholders</li> <li>Document business processes, relationships and software</li> <li>Design, code and test SQL queries to provide information to internal teams</li> <li>Identify process improvement opportunities within the organization</li> <li>Complete data integrity audits</li> <li>Complete security audits</li> <li>Other duties as required.</li> </ul>  <strong>Requirements:</strong>   <ul> <li>Undergraduate degree in one of: Business, Commerce, Accounting, Management Information Systems or Engineering OR post-secondary diploma in Software Development, Web Development</li> <li>Strong understanding of best-in-class business processes (HR, Accounting, Finance etc)</li> <li>Advanced knowledge of relational databases (RDB) and SQL (one of tSQL, MySQL, Postres etc)</li> <li>Must be trustworthy, discreet, detail focused and action orientated.</li> <li>Must be comfortable working autonomously, as well as in a team-development environment. Must be comfortable working with a remote team</li> </ul>  <strong>Preferred:</strong>   <ul> <li>Demonstrated experience in programming in either PHP or Python</li> <li>Previous development experience in either Logi Analytics, Tableau, SiSense</li> <li>Three plus years of post-graduate professional work experience</li> </ul>  What We Offer<br/><br/>An opportunity with Vista is not just a job; it is a chance to work with colleagues who are among the most recognized and accomplished in the industry.<br/><br/>Vista offers all employees   <ul> <li>A stimulating, fast-paced and challenging work environment where you will contribute to the most successful oil and gas projects in Western Canada;</li> <li>An opportunity to be a part of an entrepreneurial, technically skilled team which has established leadership in innovative engineering;</li> <li>A strong value-based philosophy that provides an informal, close-knit team environment, where you and your family feel like a part of our organization, and not just an employee number;</li> <li>Competitive compensation and benefits, including a performance-linked variable pay program;</li> <li>Company-sponsored social events and team sports;</li> <li>Flexible work schedules, half-day Fridays and free parking (excludes downtown office);</li> <li>An organization that values and encourages diversity;</li> <li>Shareholder opportunities are a long-term potential for exceptional employees.</li> </ul>  How To Apply<br/><br/>Please submit a cover letter concisely demonstrating how your skills and experience align with our job posting. <br/><br/> <strong>Note:</strong> <em>As part of the interview process there will be a technical testing component which will take up to two hours and can be completed at home on your own timelines. Candidates may be required to complete a security clearance procedure prior to offer.</em>
Title: Business Intelligence Analyst / Developer

Job_Description: Who we are <br/><br/> We have built Curve Dental into an industry-leading provider of beautiful cloud software for the dental industry. With development operations based in Calgary for over 12 years, we recently received private equity investment (Battery Ventures) so that we can accelerate our growth and further dominate the dental software industry. <br/><br/> Who we are looking for <br/><br/> Developers at all levels - whether you're junior, intermediate or senior. We hire developers who are passionate about software development and technically excellent. Our developers work across the full stack of an application and understand that a project is not done until it has been deployed to production for our users. We want developers who can contribute positively to our culture and teach us things we didn't know before. Those same developers are always hungry to learn and improve in any way they can. <br/><br/> On top of that, our senior developers take a leadership role in stewarding the code to ever higher standards, mentoring other developers on the team and driving forward the technical direction of both Curve and its products. <br/><br/> Does this sound like a description of you? Read on, my friend... <br/><br/> Things were looking for in terms of more specific skill-sets and experience: <br/><br/> BS, MS, or Ph.D. in Computer Science or related technical discipline (or equivalent). <br/> Extensive programming experience in a language that demands strong OO skills (C# / Java / C++ / etc.). Note that we don't use all these technologies; these are examples of the types of skills we look for. <br/> Experience working with javascript frameworks in a complex web application <br/> Experience working with other scripting languages like PHP, Ruby, Python or Perl in a web application. <br/> Coding skills in Javascript / AJAX, database design and SQL. <br/> Several years of software design and development experience, with knowledge of Unix / Linux. Ideally, youve been coding since you were old enough to read. <br/> A solid foundation in computer science, with strong competencies in data structures, algorithms, and software design. <br/> Previous experience with agile development methodologies and unit testing. <br/> An interest in working with industry-leading technologies such as Ansible, Angular, AWS, BI. <br/> (Senior developers) Experience leading a team of developers while still spending a large chunk of your time on development projects. <br/><br/> How to Apply <br/><br/> Send your resume to devjobs@curvedental.com with the subject line YOUR NAME: Junior/Intermediate/Senior Full Stack Software Developer! Remember to make the name substitution, select the level of experience you have and include the exclamation mark :-) <br/><br/> Don't just send us your standard cover letter; simply answer the following 3 questions: <br/><br/> What do you know about our business and industry? <br/> Why is what we do important to our clients? <br/> What is your favourite aspect of our business, and why? <br/><br/> This particular role is at Curve Dental's office in Calgary, Alberta, Canada. To find out more about Curve Dental and what it's like to work with us go to www.curvedental.com/jobs.
Title: Full Stack Software Developer (all levels of experience)!

Job_Description: BBG Management Corporation has an opportunity for a Microsoft Dynamics NAV Software Developer in Calgary, AB. <br/><br/> The ideal candidate will work for a company that delivers a specialized product for one of the world’s largest technology corporations. This firm provides solutions for business professionals in many different industries, helping them to make the most of their technology products. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong>   <ul> <li>Working with implementation team to create and fulfill customer requirements</li> <li>Overseeing the delivery of services</li> <li>Offering troubleshooting support for customers</li> </ul>  <strong>Requirements:</strong>   <ul> <li>Experience developing Enterprise Resource Planning software</li> <li>Experience with MS Dynamics NAV (3+ years) and Visual Studio (1+ year)</li> <li>NAV Solution developer certification</li> <li>Knowledge of .NET, SQL, and various development/testing methods</li> <li>Solid analysis and PM skills, including ability to budget, plan, and oversee various projects</li> <li>Familiarity with Windows, DBs, and various networks</li> <li>Good communication skills</li> <li>Spanish is an asset</li> <li>CS degree is preferred (or comparable experience)</li> </ul>  If you feel that you would be a good fit for this position, please contact Kate Macdonald at kate.macdonald@bbgmanagement.com. <br/><br/> <em>BBG Management welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations for disabilities in relation to the job selection process are available upon request.</em> <br/><br/>
Title: Microsoft Dynamics NAV Software Developer

Job_Description: <div> <div>SigFig is tearing down the barriers to investing. We've raised $60 million to support our growth as the #1 Online Investment Advisor for large Financial Institutions. Help us define the next generation of investing! <br/><br/> As a Software Engineer at SigFig, you will work with a team of brilliant developers to build solutions that analyze billions in investor assets, running complex algorithms and recommendations software to help people make better investment decisions. Youll help us Platformize (yes thats a word) our code, build high-impact features, and make it more easily configurable and customizable for a diverse set of needs.. Its not easy, but its an incredible opportunity for people who like technical, people and business challenges.<br/><br/><strong>WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING:</strong>   <ul> <li>Design, develop, test, deploy and maintain highly performant web applications on our stack (AngularJS, Typescript, Sass, Bootstrap).</li> <li>Work with our amazing product design team to develop and iterate on user interfaces that bring simplicity to complicated financial data.</li> <li>Interact with engineering members across the organization to ensure consistency in engineering practices and foster active exchange of ideas. We have development centers in San Francisco, Tucson, Singapore and India and the ability to work with distributed teams is a key skill.</li> <li>Perform peer code reviews. Review performance, security and flexibility of the code.</li> <li>Participating in SigFigs agile ceremonies (e.g. daily standup, release and sprint planning, demos, scrum of scrums).</li> </ul>  <strong>WE'RE LOOKING FOR SOMEBODY WITH:</strong>   <ul> <li>Degree or diploma from an accredited college or university, or equivalent work experience. Strong Computer Science fundamentals - you understand data structures, algorithms and software design practices.</li> <li>Good expertise with front end technologies (Javascript, AngularJS, Typescript, Sass, Bootstrap) and experience building large scale responsive web applications.</li> <li>Great Communication Skills You have excellent communication skills and are able to clearly articulate your thoughts during verbal and written communications. The work we do here is very collaborative (and globally distributed), so team players and an experience with fast moving projects is a big plus as well.</li> <li>Self starters with the interest and ability to learn other coding languages as needed.</li> <li>Knowledge of server side technologies like Scala, Java, PHP is a plus.</li> <li>Domain Experience is a plus You understand the financial services domain and have executed projects involving implementation and integration of software solutions with other systems in financial institutions. You understand the need for strong security, audits and performance criteria that are associated with the banking and financial services industry.</li> <li>Passion for finance and investing is a plus.</li> </ul> <strong>ABOUT SIGFIG</strong> <br/><br/> SigFig is dedicated to making high-quality investment advice more accessible and affordable to investors of all wealth levels. Using a combination of design, data science, and technology, SigFig helps empower investors with the information and guidance they need to achieve their personal financial goals. Through partnerships with some of the worlds largest and most innovative financial institutions, SigFig seeks to help investors and advisors better manage their investments. Its enterprise technology accelerates time to market for its partners, while doing so in a secure, scalable, and compliant way. Its product, design, and growth labs fuel innovation, accelerate adoption, and create delight for clients. <br/><br/> Founded in 2007, SigFig is backed by leading financial institutions including Eaton Vance, Comerica Bank, New York Life, Santander InnoVentures, and UBS, as well as top-tier venture capital firms, including Bain Capital Ventures, DCM Ventures, Nyca Partners, and Union Square Ventures. The company is headquartered in San Francisco, California. Learn more at www.sigfig.com.</div> </div> <br/>
Title: Front End Software Engineer

Job_Description: We are building a world-class development team passionate about implementing and deploying the ABB Ability platform for onshore Oil and Gas. Are you passionate about building complex, highly scalable cloud solutions to present data form IoT devices? <br/><br/> We are using leading edge technology such as Azure Cloud, real-time databases, Progressive Web Apps, Cosmos DB, Azure Functions and IoT hubs to help Oil and Gas production company’s take advantage of the cloud. We are looking for developers who share our passion for exceptional coding and well versed in software development principles with solid understanding of Azure back-end services, security and performance. Utilizing your Azure skills you will get the opportunity to help build and maintain a SaaS solution that is scalable, maintainable and secure <br/><br/> <strong>Specific Responsibilities:</strong>   <ul> <li>Develop understanding of ABB’s Oil and Gas SCADA solutions</li> <li>Work with senior developers and architect on complex back-end services</li> <li>Understand or willing to learn Azure analytics and machine learning services</li> <li>Able to develop, test, deliver, document and support new features using .NET Core</li> <li>Develop, debug and deploy Azure Functions for new application logic</li> <li>Able to develop and maintain existing REST APIs and Swagger documentation</li> <li>Use VSTS to update build deployments</li> <li>Demonstrate ability to successfully work in a small, innovative and creative team</li> <li>Demonstrate understanding of user experience development</li> <li>Computer Science, Mathematics or equivalent degree and relevant experience</li> <li>5+ years professional software development</li> <li>Visual Studio and .NET core development</li> <li>Experience developing using Azure services including Cosmos DB, Azure storage and Azure Functions</li> <li>Experience deploying and updating SaaS systems</li> <li>Strong written and verbal communication skills in English</li> <li>Willingness to learn new skills</li> <li>Enjoys working with others in a small team</li> <li>Positive attitude</li> <li>Self-motivated</li> <li>Enjoys solving problems</li> <li>Attention to detail, but willing to ask when stuckABB is an Employment Equity Employer and values a diverse workforce. ABB will provide reasonable accommodation to applicants with disabilities. In support of our Employment Equity Program, women, aboriginal people, members of visible minorities, and/or persons with disabilities are encouraged to apply and self-identify in the application process. We also offer a stimulating work environment, competitive salaries and a complete benefits package. ABB is prepared to act on requests for disability accommodations that might be required to allow any disabled person to access our facility. Please advise us if any attending person requires/requests some specific form of disability accommodation. The masculine form is used as neutral gender and includes men and women.</li> </ul>
Title: Azure Back-End Software Developer

Job_Description: GIS Web and Desktop Developer <br/><br/> Manpower is currently hiring a GIS Web and Desktop Developer to fill a long-term contract for our client in Calgary. <br/><br/> Summary of Key Responsibilities include (job functions include but are not limited to): <br/><br/> Collaborate with project team to convert existing Building Central web application based on Silverlight to new web application using ESRIs JavaScript API and Web App Builder, Dojo, Backbone, JavaScript, JQuery <br/> Investigation and publication of the 3D building wireframe extractions to internal city business groups aligned to the 3D Corporate strategy. <br/> Improve integration with other internal source systems <br/> GIS development assignments on other project(s) under the same portfolio (IT-CS-Project Centre Corp. Services) <br/> Code development, and all phases of testing (unit, system, integration, and performance / load). <br/> Documentation and training on the modified process for business and technical stakeholders. <br/> Updated technical and process documentation as required. <br/> Collaborate on work planning following city methodology. <br/> Resolution of bugs during testing. <br/> Report progress to the IT Lead and IT Analyst assigned to the project. <br/><br/> <strong>Qualifications and Requirements:</strong> <br/><br/> Minimum of 5 years of relevant work experience mentioned below <br/> Technical Requirements: ESRIs JavaScript API technology, includes build test, and deploy a web application using ArcGIS API for JavaScript, ArcGIS Server platform to incorporate ready-to-use content and online services that allow end users to visualize, query, and analyze data ESRIs Web App Builder technology, SQL and Oracle, ArcMap, ArcCatalog, ArcObjects, ArcSDE Geodatabase , HTML5 and ArcObjects, Visual Studio 2017, Dojo, Backbone, JavaScript, JQuery. <br/> Proficiency with C#.Net <br/> Proficiency in ArcGIS desktop extensions development <br/> Strong written and verbal communication skills. <br/> Proven experience with Responsive GIS Web UI Design. <br/> Excellent understanding of SDLC (Software Development Life Cycle). <br/> Telerik Kendo UI for JQuery. <br/> Implementing 3D data in web GIS environment <br/> Experience with ArcGIS enterprise geodatabase environment. <br/> Experience with development tools and technologies like Blacksmith, Web Trend, Style Library. <br/><br/> Please apply online and/or create and manage your profile at www.manpowerab.ca. Alternatively, you can email us directly at Divya.singh@manpower.com or contact us at 403-269-6936 & ask for our Professional team. <br/><br/> You can also follow us on Facebook (@manpower.alberta), Instagram (Manpower.AB), twitter (@ManpowerAB) & LinkedIn (Manpower Alberta) for more information on our current Companies and Job postings.
Title: GIS Web and Desktop Developer

Job_Description: <div><strong>What You'll Do</strong> <br/><br/> This is an opportunity to work within a group of exceptional software engineers on one of the fastest growing products. <br/><br/> The AMP (Advanced Malware Protection) team has shipped endpoint software for a number of platforms including Windows, Mac, Linux, and Android. The endpoint clients communicate with a Linux backend running Mongo, ElasticSearch, MySQL, Hive, RabbitMQ, Ruby, and custom C code, all managed by Chef. We're deployed across a cloud infrastructure including Amazon's EC2 and our own hardware running Joyent's SDC, and have condensed these services down into a single instance deployable on VMWare. <br/><br/> We know how to ship software, and shipping software feels good. <br/><br/> <strong> Who You'll Work With</strong> <br/><br/> We have a dynamic environment that inspires employees to create, honing their talents and skills every day. Employees are self-motivated, results driven and engaged. We recognize and reward quality results and commitment to our company's purposes and principles. <br/><br/> We are looking for an experienced windows software developer to join us. We are willing to train those excited to learn. <br/><br/> <strong>Who You Are</strong> <br/><br/> Required Skills: <ul> <li>6-10 years of relevant professional experience</li><li>Strong debugging skills</li><li>3 + years of C/C++ development under Windows</li><li>Experience with writing test tools/frameworks</li><li>Strong understanding of secure computing practices</li> </ul> Nice to have: <ul> <li>Kernel driver/embedded development experience</li><li>Security experience</li>  </ul> <strong>Why Cisco</strong> <br/><br/> We connect everything: people, processes, data, and things. We innovate everywhere, taking bold risks to shape the technologies that give us smart cities, connected cars, and handheld hospitals. And we do it in style with unique personalities who aren't afraid to change the way the world works, lives, plays and learns. <br/><br/> We are thought leaders, tech geeks, pop culture aficionados, and we even have a few purple haired rock stars. We celebrate the creativity and diversity that fuels our innovation. We are dreamers and we are doers. <br/><br/> We Are Cisco.</div>
Title: Software Engineer, Windows

Job_Description: <p> <strong>ITN International</strong> has an opening for a self-motivated and ambitious .NET Web Applications Developer to join their Events Solutions team. ITN Technologies is a unique global events company that provides technology applications for Fortune 100 companies and major association events. We’re an international events technology company.</p> <p>Responsibilities: </p> <p>· Develop engaging event application websites for clients and shows all over the world. </p> <p>· Work closely with project managers and an experienced team of developers to deliver other technology solutions in response to customer needs. </p> <p>· Be knowledgeable in creating public-facing sites from inception to completion: managing the design, development, testing and implementation. </p> <p>· Work well under pressure and react to quick turnaround times when called upon to generate ad hoc reports, create and submit scripts for any data changes. </p> <p>· Maintain legacy applications while new solutions are developed. </p> <p><br></p> <p>Technical Requirements: </p> <p>· NET 4.0/4.5+, C#, ASP.NET Web Forms/MVC, T-SQL, JavaScript, Web Services (SOAP and REST), Entity Framework 6 </p> <p>· Preferred Skills: </p> <p>· Front-end: Advanced JavaScript, Angular, Bootstrap</p> <p> · Services: WCF, WebApi, Azure API Apps, </p> <p>· Experience with Microsoft Azure products and services. </p> <p>· Experience with VSTS, TFS, Git and Continuous integration </p> <p>· Strong with design patterns and general software architecture. </p> <p>· General love of development and can quickly adopt new technologies. </p> <p>· Excellent troubleshooting and debugging skills. </p> <p>· Excellent oral and written communication skills. </p> <p>· Attention to detail and thoroughness a must. </p> <p>· Ability to travel both domestic and internationally a plus. </p> <p>Preferred candidates should have a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a closely related field and five years of progressively responsible work experience related to Internet application development. Additional experience or certifications may be substituted for education on a case by case basis. Any Microsoft certifications a plus. All applicants must have a minimum of 3 years of experience in developing applications. <strong>All applicants must live in the Calgary, Alberta area. Only apply if you live in the Calgary, Alberta area.</strong> This position will require the applicant to spend some time weekly in the office located in the Calgary downtown beltline and some international travel to the events we service. By becoming an ITN team member you will be joining a diverse group of international professionals all focused on delivering best-of-class solutions to clients around the world. </p>
Title: .NET Web Developer

Job_Description: The Role<br/><br/>The Pason Power team focuses on the monitoring and intelligent control of distributed energy storage systems. There will be a number of potential applications ranging from installation of energy storage with solar/PV systems to utility companies looking to build a responsive and adaptable electrical grid. You will have the opportunity to combine your experience with Pason’s in data acquisition and embedded control systems combined with cutting edge Internet of Things (IoT) and cloud technologies to provide a best in class solution.<br/><br/>Essential Duties and Responsibilities   <ul> <li>Work as a part of an agile scrum team, contributing to the development of the Pason Power product line</li> <li>Provide mentorship and guidance to other software developers</li> <li>Develop Pason Power web applications</li> <li>Participate in Code Reviews</li> <li>Integrate web applications with backend services, including AWS hosted web-services, Lambdas, databases (relational and NoSQL), as well as IoT transport mechanisms</li> <li>Interface with the UX team to deliver visually appealing and easily approachable web applications</li> <li>Troubleshoot and provide timely solutions to production issues</li> <li>Participate in team technical discussions, challenge ideas and present solutions and approaches to be considered by the team</li> <li>Participate and contribute in weekly Agile meetings, discuss and present work accomplished and provide constructive feedback to help improve the team</li> <li>Contribute to our evolving development environment through research, experiment with new technologies and attend conferences or courses. Educate your peers on what you have learned.</li> <li>Maintain and expand our suite of automated tests</li> <li>Implement security best practices and protections in our web applications and with our customer data</li> <li>Understand and contribute to the development of system architecture</li> <li>Travel to Houston 1-2 weeks per year to work in person with our technical team there</li> </ul>  Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities   <ul> <li>Proficient with JavaScript</li> <li>Proficient in Python, Java, C/C++/C#, or other back-end languages</li> <li>Understanding of React.js or similar web frameworks</li> <li>Experience with databases (relational and NoSQL)</li> <li>Experience with RESTful APIs</li> <li>Familiarity with code versioning tools such as Git</li> <li>Proficient in Linux</li> <li>Experience in integration and unit testing</li> <li>Ability to work in a team or as an individual</li> <li>Experience with common front-end development tools such as Babel, Webpack, NPM, etc.</li> <li>Experience working with hardware / Internet of Things (IoT) device control systems</li> <li>Familiar with container technologies (Docker)</li> <li>Familiar with messaging protocols such as MQTT or AMQP</li> <li>Build automation / continuous integration / continuous delivery experience</li> <li>Experience Working in cloud environments (AWS, Google Cloud, Azure, etc)</li> </ul>
Title: Senior Software Developer (Full Stack Developer)
