Title: Senior Web Developer

Job_Description: <div>Cisco people are not happy merely moving the security innovation needle a few millimeters – we want to blow it off the dial. Every day we look for new ways to merge innovative security technology with Cisco’s 25+ years of networking expertise to redefine network security. We need like-minded colleagues who dream big about transforming security and networks, and who expect to reap the rewards for their high-visibility creations. <br/><br/> <strong> Who You’ll Work With</strong> <br/><br/> This is an opportunity to work within the Cisco AMP team on our AMP Private Cloud product. The Cisco AMP team has a dynamic work environment that inspires employees to create opportunities by daily honing their talents and skills. Employees are self-motivated, results driven and engaged. We recognize and reward quality results and commitment to our company’s purposes and principles. You will be working within a team of exceptional software engineers, who are always ready to share their knowledge and skills. <br/><br/> <strong>What You’ll Do</strong> <br/><br/> The Cisco AMP team is responsible for shipping client software for all flavours of Windows, Mac, Linux, and Android, supported by a Linux backend containing MongoDB, Cassandra, ElasticSearch, MySQL, Hadoop, Hive, RabbitMQ, Ruby, and custom C code, all Chef managed <ul> <li>We deploy across a cloud infrastructure including Amazon’s EC2 and our own hardware running Joyent’s SDC, and have condensed these services down into a single instance with our Private Cloud</li><li>Active participation in design and code reviews</li><li>Implementing product features and fixing existing bugs logged in the bug database</li><li>Developing and maintaining internal tools for automated functional, integration and performance testing</li><li>Supporting Tier 3 Technical support by debugging and bug fixing production issues</li><li>We know how to ship software and shipping software feels good</li><li>We are looking for a software engineer to join us, focusing on our Private Cloud appliance</li> </ul> <strong>Who You Are</strong> <ul> <li>Have high personal integrity and ethical standards</li><li>Strong team oriented</li> <li>Passionate about designing and building high-quality software</li><li>Excellent communication skills</li><li>An unquenchable desire to learn</li><li>2+ years of experience in software development</li><li>Experience with Unix shell scripting: sh and Bash</li><li>Experience with any of the following scripting programming languages: Ruby, Python, Perl</li><li>Experience with source control management systems: i.e., git, subversion, CVS</li><li>Practical experience with SQL</li><li>Good understanding of administrating Linux systems</li><li>Experience with system and application debugging and performance optimization</li><li>Good understanding of computer networking protocols</li> </ul>  <div><strong>Desired Skills:</strong></div><ul><li>Experience with compiled languages such as: C, C++, Go, Rust</li><li>Understanding of secure coding practices</li><li>Contributions to open source projects</li><li>Experience with system configuration management systems: Chef, CFengine, Puppet, Ansible, SaltStack</li><li>Working knowledge with common compile, build, and packaging tools, i.e., gcc, make, rpmbuild</li><li>Working knowledge of some of the following technologies: memcache, NGINX HAproxy, MongoDB, Cassandra, RabbitMQ, MySQL, ElasticSearch</li><li>Understanding of modern PC hardware</li> </ul> About Cisco <br/><br/> The Internet of Everything is a phenomenon driving new opportunities for Cisco and it's transforming our customers' businesses worldwide. We are pioneers and have been since the early days of connectivity. Today, we are building teams that are expanding our technology solutions in the mobile, cloud, security, IT, and big data spaces, including software and consulting services. As Cisco delivers the network that powers the Internet, we are connecting the unconnected. Imagine creating unprecedented disruption. Your revolutionary ideas will impact everything from retail, healthcare, and entertainment, to public and private sectors, and far beyond. Collaborate with like-minded innovators in a fun and flexible culture that has earned Cisco global recognition as a Great Place To Work. With roughly 10 billion connected things in the world now and over 50 billion estimated in the future, your career has exponential possibilities at Cisco.</div>
Title: Software Engineer

Job_Description: <strong>Position Overview</strong> <br/><br/> The <strong>School of Public Policy</strong> in conjunction with <strong>Development & Alumni Engagement</strong> is currently seeking a Full-time Regular <strong>Associate Director of Development</strong>. <br/><br/> This position reports to the Director of Development at the School of Public Policy and works closely with The School of Public Policy, Executive office, the University’s Central Development Office, University Relations, Financial Services, senior faculty leadership, and other relevant areas of the university. The Associate Director of Development is involved in strategic planning and implementation for the School’s Fund Development program, and has access to highly sensitive and confidential information. <br/><br/> This position is responsible for planning and implementing donor relationship programs for the School, including direct interaction with donors, sponsors and volunteers to secure high-level donations. In collaboration with the Director, the incumbent is responsible for the short and long term planning, development and implementation of a proactive development program. <br/><br/> The position demands a high volume of work with early morning, evening and weekend hours often required. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Description</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Summary of Key Responsibilities</strong> (job functions include but are not limited to): <ul> 	<li>In collaboration with the Director, is responsible for the development and implementation of a proactive development program, as well as short and long term planning</li> 	<li>Actively develop relationships with assigned major gift prospects and donors with a focus on face to face interactions</li>	<li>Ensure that stakeholders are appropriately involved and consulted in establishing annual fundraising targets, developing and implementing plans and advancing donor prospects</li>	<li>Develops build and maintain key relationships with the Faculty, staff and various University departments</li>	<li>Write for development including: presentations, solicitation and acknowledgement letters, proposals and stewardship reports</li>	<li>Oversee the SPP student awards program, liaise with the Student Awards and the Central Development Office to ensure proper establishment of student awards by SPP team, and liaise with donors to fund awards</li>	<li>Oversee the sponsorship strategy and execution of the strategy for events hosted by The School, working closely with the communications and outreach teams</li>	<li>Exercise considerable independent managerial discretion in the development of business and engaging sponsors into a donor program; this individual has independent discretion and operates across all aspects of typical managerial decisions</li>	<li>Maintain professional relationships with donors and stewards to ensure success in this role and the success of the School</li>	<li>Ensure confidentiality related to the donations and development programs which is critical to the ongoing success for this position</li>	<li>Secure major donations in support of institutional strategic initiatives</li>	<li>Provide expert listening and negotiation skills as well as sound judgment and decision making capabilities</li>	<li>Work effectively in a large, complex, dynamic and sophisticated organization</li>	<li>Respect for confidentiality and strong sense of professional ethics</li>	<li>Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work both independently and as part of a team</li>	<li>Build and maintain effective relationships with volunteers in the community, and with Faculty/University staff and administrators to ensure appropriate involvement and consultation in securing gifts</li>	<li>Responsible for managing special gifts, including class gifts and student awards</li>	<li>Regular meetings and updates to the Directors and staff to ensure the fund development team can achieve success</li>	<li>Knowledge and ability to use the Raiser's Edge fundraising software</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications / Requirements:</strong> <ul> 	<li>University degree, and minimum of 3 to 5 years of directly related fundraising experience, preferably in a post-secondary educational setting, or equivalent combination of experience and education</li>	<li>Demonstrated experience in annual and major gift solicitations required</li>	<li>Ability to combine people and resources in a manner that will achieve objectives within established limits</li>	<li>Management of a prospect pipeline working with donors in identification, cultivation, solicitation and stewardship phases</li>	<li>Excellent verbal and written communication abilities</li>	<li>Sound judgment and decision-making capabilities and the ability to work independently and as part of a team</li>	<li>Excellent organization skills</li>	<li>Ability to secure major donations</li>	<li>Ability to work effectively in a large, complex, dynamic and sophisticated organization</li>	<li>Respect for confidentiality and strong sense of professional ethics</li>	<li>Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work both independently and as part of a team</li>	<li>Knowledge of Raiser's Edge fundraising software an asset</li> </ul> <strong>Application Deadline:</strong> June 1, 2018 <br/><br/> <em>We would like to thank all applicants in advance for submitting their resumes. Please note, only those candidates chosen to continue on through the selection process will be contacted.</em> <br/><br/> <strong>Additional Information</strong> <br/><br/> This position is classified in the<strong> Professional Career Band, Level P3</strong> of the Management and Professional Staff Career Framework. <br/><br/> To find out more about management and staff opportunities at the University of Calgary and all we have to offer, view our <strong>Management and Staff Careers website</strong>. For more information about Development & Alumni Engagement visit<strong>http://development.careers.ucalgary.ca/</strong>. <br/><br/> <strong>About the University of Calgary</strong> <br/><br/> The University of Calgary is Canada’s leading next-generation university – a living, growing and youthful institution that embraces change and opportunity with a can-do attitude. Located in the nation’s most enterprising city, the university is making tremendous progress on its Eyes High journey to be recognized as one of Canada’s top five research universities, grounded in innovative learning and teaching and fully integrated with the community it both serves and leads. The University of Calgary inspires and supports discovery, creativity and innovation across all disciplines. For more information, visit <strong>ucalgary.ca</strong>. <br/><br/> <em>The University of Calgary recognizes that a diverse staff/faculty benefits and enriches the work, learning and research experiences of the entire campus and greater community. We are committed to removing barriers that have been historically encountered by some people in our society. We strive to recruit individuals who will further enhance our diversity and will support their professional success while they are here. We encourage all qualified applicants to apply, however preference will be given to Canadian citizens and permanent residents of Canada.</em>
Title: Associate Director of Development, School of Public Policy, Development & Alumni Engagement

Job_Description: Showpass is a ticketing and event management software company. We empower venue and event organizers to create a rich, connected experience for their customers through next-generation technology. We combine cutting-edge software and hardware for seamless on- and offline sales, while delivering event management tools on the same integrated platform. <br/><br/> <strong><em>But what makes us different?</em></strong> <br/><br/> Showpass offers a unique platform for collaboration between the key groups that power events. From venues, to organizers, to street teams, to event attendees, we are focused on bringing people together through the magic of live events. We also happen to be powered by a very talented team fostering innovation, creativity and disruption. These pillars support the Showpass culture which is built on a love for events, and all things food. That’s what makes us the fastest growing Canadian ticketing company. <br/><br/> <strong>THE ROLE:</strong> Mobile Application Developer (full-time permanent role) <br/><br/> <strong>THE LOCATION:</strong> Calgary, Alberta <br/><br/> <strong>THE PERKS:</strong>   <ul>   <li>A unique and fun place to work – flexible hours and vacation policy, in-house chef, fully stocked snack and fresh pressed juice bar, gym membership, dog-friendly office and parking</li> <li>Competitive compensation and benefits package</li>  </ul>  <strong>THE RESPONSIBILITIES:</strong>   <ul>   <li>Build new apps using Swift and Kotlin with AR features</li> <li>Deliver the best user experience to meet the needs of current users and gain new users</li> <li>Integrate peripheral hardwares to mobile application</li> <li>Work closely with backend developers and UX designers to effectively build app features</li> <li>Manage app releases on App Store and Google Play</li> <li>Troubleshoot and debug apps</li> <li>Participate in routine standups, code reviews and testing parties</li> <li>Write clean code in a testable, reliable and sustainable way</li> </ul>  <strong>THE QUALIFICATIONS:</strong>   <ul>   <li>Post secondary education in engineering or computer science would be an asset</li>   <li>Experience with published apps is required</li> <li>Experience with the following technologies is required: Objective C or Java, Javascript, HTML and CSS, REST API, Git and Github, Unit testing</li> <li>Experience with the following technologies would be an asset: Swift, Kotlin, continuous integration, ARKit/ARCore</li> <li>Experience working in a technology or software company would be an asset</li> <li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills</li> <li>Strong testing and debugging skills</li> <li>Must work great in a team and also as an individual contributor</li> <li>Ability to champion new ideas and develop creative approaches</li> <li>Analytical thinker with the ability to problem solve in a fast-paced work environment</li> <li>Must have the hustle and drive to take initiative and make things happen!</li> </ul>  <strong>NOTE: We will only contact qualified candidates of interest.</strong>
Title: Mobile Application Developer

Job_Description: <div> <div><strong>Position Overview</strong></div><br/>  <div>Replicon's Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) team has a focus on automating the smooth operation of Replicon's Cloud Platform. We strive to accomplish projects such as fully automating a continuous delivery process, building highly resilient infrastructure components, and introducing & practicing Chaos Engineering.</div><br/>  <div>Junior SRE team members are software developers who love automating work, rather than doing tedious work themselves. They're deeply interested in the infrastructure upon which a complex system runs, rather than just building software features. They are expected to learn quickly, bring new ideas and concepts into the team, and always look for a solution rather than focusing on a problem. They are heavily supported by our amazing senior team members.</div><br/>  <div><strong>What responsibilities does the SRE team have?</strong></div>   <ul>  	<li>Implement new infrastructure systems to provide new operational and business capabilities supporting our platform and product</li> <li>Remove impediments in the engineering processes to support high frequency, low risk software deployments</li> <li>Promotes an environment of continuous improvement throughout the engineering organization</li> <li>Ensures that production and pre-production systems are strongly secured</li> <li>Optimizes the costs of running our cloud platform on AWS</li> <li>Participates in the on-call rotation to triage critical production incidents, reduce incident severity, and document incident in detail for product team follow-up</li> </ul>  <div><strong>What does your day-to-day work in this role look like?</strong></div><br/>  <div><strong>Work in a small scrum team of about six colleagues to:</strong></div> <ul>  	<li>Understand high-level requirements for new systems and capabilities</li> <li>Break down work into manageable tasks, using a combination of technical design documentation and Jira for task tracking</li> <li>Implement new systems, which is primarily a mix of node.js coding, Terraform infrastructure-as-code, bash or PowerShell scripting, and occasionally some C#</li> <li>Give and receive code reviews, working with colleagues to ensure the highest quality work is accomplished</li> </ul>  <div><strong>In addition to this routine work, you'll often have to:</strong></div> <ul>  	<li>Participate in retrospectives and post-incident reviews to figure out how the team, department, and organization can improve</li> <li>Provide support, incident resolution, and code reviews for other teams</li> <li>Perform on-call drills and training exercises to sharpen skills in incident management and resolution</li> </ul>  <div><strong>What qualifications should you have?</strong></div>   <ul>  	<li>You are eager to learn new technologies and systems, and can grasp new concepts very quickly</li> <li>You are able to mentally leap between different technology platforms and environments smoothly</li> <li>You have worked hands-on performing software development on a web application; preference to experience with node.js or C# platforms</li> <li>You are familiar with systems design and architecture in a large-scale web application (multi-tier, microservices, load balancing)</li> <li>You have knowledge or experience working with cloud platforms (preference: AWS)</li> <li>You're always uncomfortable when working in a project without a version control system in-place (preference: git)</li> <li>You've worked with database systems (preference: PostgreSQL)</li> </ul>  </div> <br/>
Title: Site Reliability Engineering - Junior

Job_Description: Interested in being a part of a team that is leading the digital evolution of retail in Canada? <br/><br/> Embracing and driving change is critical to our success. The complexity and rate at which the retail industry is transforming has increased exponentially in recent years and we are committed to being a leader in the industry. <br/><br/> As such we are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join the Canadian Tire Family of Companies as a Senior Software Developer at Canada’s premier sporting goods retailer, FGL. FGL owns the most recognizable sporting goods brands in the country including Sport Chek, Sports Experts, National Sports, Pro Hockey Life and Atmosphere. <br/><br/> <strong>What you’ll do</strong> <br/><br/> In this role, you will be expected to: <br/><br/> Collaborate actively with the business analyst (BA) in the design of: <ul> <li>Fully integrated systems, which may include applications, databases, and related systems</li><li>Alternative solutions to existing applications</li><li>Effective and efficient interfaces to systems, applications, and databases</li><li>Conduct feasibility studies, proof-of-concept prototypes</li><li>Provide high-level development during the initial stages of a project</li><li>Provide & meet estimated time of accomplishment for assigned tasks</li><li>Evaluate and enhance the efficiency of existing programs, anticipating future user needs</li><li>Ensure system integrity, efficiency, and security</li><li>Provide and supervise unit, integrated, and volume testing</li><li>Maintain and support assigned systems to ensure minimal downtime and loss of productivity, service</li><li>Maintain and support associated databases, models, and technical documentation</li><li>Lead a small team of developers to achieve the above goals</li> </ul> <strong>Who you are</strong> <br/><br/> We are looking for a high performing individual who: <ul> <li>Possesses an entrepreneurial spirit, a bias for action, and a desire to work with key stakeholders to drive innovation in the retail environment and in-store e-commerce;</li><li>Is direct and truthful, and builds trust and credibility with co-workers, vendors, and customers by consistently adhering to the organization’s business principles and values</li><li>Demonstrates a desire to help and is proactive, responsive, and focused on discovering, anticipating, and exceeding the customer’s needs</li><li>Is committed to results by taking personal responsibility for achieving mutually agreed upon individual/team objectives, and working collaboratively and cooperatively with others to achieve shared goals and objective</li><li>Considers the wider team, function, banner or the organization and takes action or makes decisions which support the success of those groups</li><li>Recovers quickly after change, disruptions, or mistakes and can remain productive and focused</li><li>Is adaptable and can apply lessons learned in one situation to another situation</li><li>If you’re curious, ready to take on new challenges and open to doing things differently to help us evolve rapidly, then FGL Sports is definitely the place to be</li> </ul> <strong>What you’ve done</strong> <ul> <li>Minimum 10 years of experience as a developer</li><li>5 years working experience designing and building applications using Java</li><li>Fundamental understanding of Java design concepts and design patterns</li><li>Strong understanding of the J2EE ecosystem including proven experience with Application Servers (Apache Tomcat) and standard Java technologies such as JNDI, JMS, JMX, and the Spring Framework</li><li>Experience with the MEAN stack (MongoDB/MariaDB, Express, Angular, Node.js)</li><li>Experience building and debugging client/server Internet systems and architecture</li><li>Strong understanding of Git</li>  <ul> <li>Solid knowledge of at least one SQL programming environment</li><li>SQL Server 2005-2012</li><li>Oracle 9i-12c</li><li>MariaDB or MySQL 10</li> </ul>  <li>Experience in native Android application development</li>  <ul> <li>Android Studio, Gradle, Maven</li><li>User Interfaces Layouts</li><li>SQLite</li> </ul>  <li>Local Services, External Services, Content Providers, Account Manager Integration Spring Mobile, Corodva (nice to have)</li><li>Proficient understanding of Linux operating systems (RHEL 6.x, 7.x) and development environments</li><li>Understanding of security, encryption, and compression best practice</li><li>Experience developing and deploying to at least one cloud platform</li>  <ul> <li>AWS</li><li>Azure</li><li>Google Cloud</li><li>Kubernetes/Docker</li> </ul>  <li>Experience with DevOps environments</li><li>Bamboo, Jenkins, Ansible</li>  </ul> <strong>Why us</strong> <br/><br/> Canadian Tire is one of Canada’s most iconic and diversified companies. Our culture and values uphold our pledge to sustainable practices, and the commitment to our local communities through Jumpstart cannot be beat. <br/><br/> To learn more about this team and the Canadian Tire Family of Companies follow us on LinkedIn. <br/><br/> FGL Sports is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees - their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.
Title: Senior Software Developer - FGL Sports - Calgary, AB

Job_Description: The Role<br/><br/>The Pason Power team focuses on the monitoring and intelligent control of distributed energy storage systems. There will be a number of potential applications ranging from installation of energy storage with solar/PV systems to utility companies looking to build a responsive and adaptable electrical grid. You will have the opportunity to combine your experience with Pason’s in data acquisition and embedded control systems combined with cutting edge Internet of Things (IoT) and cloud technologies to provide a best in class solution.<br/><br/>Essential Duties and Responsibilities   <ul> <li>Work as a part of a scrum team, contributing to the development of the Pason Power product line</li> <li>Provide mentorship and guidance to other software developers</li> <li>Enhance and extend our IoT software platform at the edge which monitors and controls power electronics hardware and stationary battery systems</li> <li>Work alongside data science engineers to improve and optimize control system algorithms</li> <li>Maintain and extend reliable communications with external hardware devices using protocols such as Modbus, CANbus, Zigbee, etc</li> <li>Further the integration with cloud services and IoT transport mechanisms</li> <li>Write unit and integration tests</li> <li>Implement security best practices and protection regarding edge device and cloud communications</li> <li>Troubleshoot and provide timely solutions for production issues</li> <li>Understand and contribute to the development of system architecture</li> <li>Participate in Code Reviews</li> <li>Participate in team technical discussions, challenge ideas and present solutions and approaches to be considered by the team</li> <li>Participate and contribute in weekly Agile meetings, discuss and present work accomplished and provide constructive feedback to help improve the team</li> <li>Contribute to our evolving development environment through research, experiment with new technologies and attend conferences or courses. Educate your peers on what you have learned.</li> <li>Travel to our Houston office 1-2 weeks per year to spend time working in person with the technical team there</li> </ul>  Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities<ul> <li>Expertise in any of the of the following programming languages: Python, JavaScript, Java, C/C++ or C#</li> <li>Experience working with hardware / IoT device control systems</li> <li>Experience with Test Driven Development / Behavioral Driven Development</li> <li>Experience providing leadership in technical teams</li> <li>Familiarity with code versioning tools such as Git</li> <li>Proficiency in Linux</li> <li>Experience in integration and unit testing</li> <li>Ability to work in a team or as an individual.</li> <li>Experience doing code review Familiar with RESTful APIs</li> <li>Familiar with container technologies (Docker)</li> <li>Familiar with messaging protocols such as MQTT or AMQP</li> <li>Build automation / continuous integration / continuous delivery experience</li> <li>NoSQL database experience (MongoDB, DynamoDB, InfluxDB, etc)</li> <li>Working in cloud environments (AWS, Google Cloud, Azure, etc)</li> <li>A knack for benchmarking and optimization</li> <li>Agile/Scrum experience</li> </ul>
Title: Senior Software Developer (Monitoring & Control Systems)

Job_Description: <div><strong>Position Overview</strong></div><br/>  <div>Replicon is looking for an experienced web applications software engineer who is passionate about coding and technology to work on our Time Intelligence platform. We are building workforce management solutions for global enterprise customers and growing rapidly. The entire multi-tenant SaaS solution is built using modern AWS cloud tech stack utilizing open source technologies.</div>   <br/><strong><div>About you:</div>  <br/></strong> <br/> <div>You are passionate about technology and coding best practices. Self initiating, takes pride in ownership, naturally collaborative personality, shares knowledge, likes to learn new technologies, keeps up with technology trends and has worked on recent projects utilizing a modern tech stack. This is a crucial senior team member role that requires full ownership of taking solutions from requirements analysis to production deployment. <br/><br/> <strong>What else you need to bring:</div>  <br/></strong>   <ul>  	<li>Expertise in full stack web applications development</li>   <li>Expert coding skills across the entire stack UI, Services and Data</li> <li>Recent experience of working with cloud providers (AWS, Azure or Google)</li> <li>Expertise in JavaScript, Node.js and your favorite modern UI development framework (we use React)</li> <li>Highly skilled in developing beautiful looking, rich interactive web user interfaces (modern CSS skills)</li> <li>Quick learner - we understand you will not know everything but should have demonstrated competency to learn and grow</li> </ul>  <strong><div>Extra credit:</div>  <br/></strong>   <ul>  	<li>A portfolio of your accomplishments outside of work (Git repo, open source contributions, technical blog, presentations, etc.)</li> <li>Experience with Mobile Apps, UI development</li> </ul>  <strong><div>How we work:</div>  <br/></strong>   <ul>  	<li>An agile development environment delivering functionality to production every week</li> <li>Collaborative team involving development, test automation and DevOps</li> <li>Continuous learning culture with Lunch & Learns and peer collaboration/mentoring</li> </ul>
Title: Senior Software Engineer - Nodejs, React, AWS Position

Job_Description: This position is the second level in the Software Development Career Path. The primary responsibility of this position is to design, develop and deliver GIS (Geographic Information System) software solutions for IHS Markit use. Solutions will include support and growth of common mapping components, incorporation of third party GIS technology (e.g. ESRI, FME), GIS data and services. Incumbent has in-depth knowledge across a broad spectrum of programming languages in GIS automation and data processing techniques and applies both existing and new technologies in developing solutions. <br/><br/> General Job Duties <br/> Participate in the design, planning and development of solutions based on industry requirements. <br/> Participate as part of a project team to design, code, test and implement moderately complex programs to support the portfolio management process. <br/> Manage small to mid-level sized programs or portions of a program. <br/> Establishes testing procedures to ensure application is thoroughly tested throughout development and before release. <br/> Monitor and report to management on project status, identify issues that may impede attainment of goals, recommend and implement corrective measures. <br/> Provide technical direction and training to more junior Software Development personnel. <br/> Perform other duties as required. <br/><br/> Specific Job Duties <br/> Duties will include but may not be limited to: <br/><br/> Requirements analysis, design and implementation of the geoprocessing software. This design, development and implementation work may include software development, process development, data layer development or other development to support GIS viewing platforms. <br/> Development of GIS automation scripts using FME or Arcpy. <br/> Automated testing scripts <br/> Creation of devops monitoring functionality <br/> Management and maintenance of processes and environments running the processes (ie. FME Server, Desktops, etc). <br/> User support and assistance with on demand processing of created scripts, software, or processes. <br/><br/> Education/Experience Requirements <br/> Bachelors in Computer Science, Geography, GIS or related field or equivalent experience. <br/> 8+ years of experience in GIS software development, geoprocessing services, cartography principles, topplogy and database design <br/> Thorough knowledge of one or more technologies (e.g., FME, Python and ArcObjects). <br/> Knowledgeable in one or more technologies, ESRI spatial technologies (ArcGIS Desktop, ArcGISServer), FME Desktop and/or Server, and GIS Databases (FileGeodatabase, Shapefiles, Oracle, SQL Server and PostgreSQL SDE database technologies). <br/> Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. <br/> Strong interpersonal skills – must be able to work effectively as part of a project/program team and foster team cooperation. <br/> Previous experience designing and developing GIS automation scripts is required. <br/> Previous experience with creating, loading and editing GIS data. <br/> Stays current with rapidly changing technology and applies it to business needs. <br/> Must be able to effectively communicate technical information to both technical and non-technical personnel. <br/><br/> Organizational Relationships <br/> Reports directly to Senior Manager, Product Development <br/> Acts in a lead capacity on small to mid-sized programs, but has no direct supervisory responsibility. <br/> Interacts with other colleagues at all levels in the conduct of day-to-day activities. <br/><br/> External Relationships <br/> Participates in meetings with customers to assess business needs. <br/> Actively participates in industry forums and user groups.
Title: Principal / Associate Director Software Developer

Job_Description: Who we are looking for <br/><br/> We have built Curve Dental into an industry-leading provider of beautiful cloud software for the dental industry. With development operations based in Calgary for over 12 years, we recently received private equity investment (Battery Ventures) so that we can accelerate our growth and further dominate the dental software industry. <br/><br/> In this position you will lead a team of QA analysts that test every release of our SaaS product, Curve Hero. Your team will be responsible for manual and automated testing, including building new automation and analyzing the results. You will work with teams across the company to coordinate and schedule testing resources, and raise issues to senior management when necessary. Though not heavily involved in the day to day testing you may need to occasionally roll up your sleeves and get your hands dirty by reviewing test plans, test cases and test results and sometimes even testing things yourself. <br/><br/> This position is also responsible for overseeing the companys ISO certification process and quality management system. In this role you will coordinate all necessary activities and resources to ensure that the company successfully maintains its ISO 9001:2015 and ISO 13485:2016 certification. You will also work with senior management to help ensure that medical device licensing is maintained for our product. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Responsibilities:</strong> <br/><br/> Management <br/><br/> Manage a QA team made up of QA Analysts, Software Developers in Test who are focused on manual and automated testing (as well as regulatory personnel as the team grows) <br/> Lead resource management across projects, recruiting, mentorship, and performance management for the QA team <br/> Work with senior management to track and manage budgetary and resourcing needs for the QA team <br/> Report on overall team and departmental performance to senior management <br/><br/> Process <br/><br/> Responsible for the overall QA process for manual and automated testing <br/> Responsible for driving quality across all disciplines, providing guidance, feedback, and suggestions to improve quality practices across the company <br/> Establish, build and grow an automated testing discipline within the company <br/> Define and evolve ongoing QA process improvements including management of QA outputs, work processes, adoption and implementation of best practices and tools, etc <br/> Establish methods for monitoring and reporting on overall product quality and test coverage with a view to improving both <br/><br/> Product <br/><br/> Work with project leads to plan, estimate and coordinate QA resources, activities and dependencies in order to meet project needs and deliverables <br/> Work with project leads to define and monitor quality objects and report on overall product quality with a view to meeting and exceeding those objectives <br/> Review QA outputs including test plans, test cases, and results for quality, consistency and appropriateness <br/> Ensure QA resources are delivering on project needs <br/><br/> Regulatory <br/><br/> Oversee the ISO 9001:2015 and ISO 13485:2016 Quality Management System <br/> Plan and coordinate activities required to maintain ISO certification (under MDSAP) including audits <br/> Coordinate regulatory (Health Canada and FDA) filings as needed to maintain medical device licensing, working with senior management <br/> Coordinate cross functional stakeholders and contributors in the process of maintaining and improving the Quality management System <br/> Ensure that company stakeholders are following defined standard operating procedures <br/> Periodically review changes to FDA and Health Canada Medical Device Regulations and manage impacts to the quality management system <br/> Periodically conduct internal audits on the quality management system processes <br/><br/> <strong>Key Job Requirements:</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Must Haves:</strong> <br/> 5 years of experience in hands-on testing and 3 years of experience as a manager <br/> Hands on experience in both manual and automation testing <br/> Strong technical background with experience in web technologies <br/> Strong familiarity with the tools that agile development and QA teams use for managing their work <br/> Ability to plan, estimate and coordinate tasks and resources is a must. Some experience with project management is a bonus. <br/> Strong verbal and written communications skills <br/> Ability to work closely with cross functional teams at all levels of the organization <br/> Post-secondary education in engineering, computer science, information systems, or other related field <br/><br/> <strong>Nice to haves, but not mandatory:</strong> <br/> Familiarity with ISO 9001 and 13485 quality standards and quality management systems <br/> Familiarity with FDA and Health Canada Medical Device Regulations <br/><br/> How to Apply <br/><br/> Send your resume to qajobs@curvedental.com with the subject line YOUR NAME: QA (Software) and Regulatory Manager! Remember to make the name substitution, and to include the exclamation mark :-) <br/><br/> Don't just send us your standard cover letter; simply answer the following 3 questions: <br/><br/> What do you know about our business and industry? <br/> Why is what we do important to our clients? <br/> What is your favourite aspect of our business, and why? <br/><br/> This particular role is at Curve Dental's office in Calgary, Alberta, Canada. To find out more about Curve Dental and what it's like to work with us go to www.curvedental.com/jobs
Title: QA (Software) and Regulatory Manager

Job_Description: DevFacto is looking for a SharePoint Developer to join our team! <br/><br/> At DevFacto, we build a diverse array of SharePoint solutions for our clients. The ideal candidate for this role does not fit generic classifications you are multi-faceted and you can adapt to the different needs of different projects and learn new technologies quickly. <br/><br/> <strong>If youre looking to:</strong>  <ul> <li>Design, develop and deliver key components of SharePoint solutions and web-based applications</li> <li>Implement SharePoint-based workflows</li> <li>Gather effective business requirements including workshop facilitation</li> <li>Actively participate in product design reviews by providing creative and practical ideas and solutions in a teamwork environment</li> <li>Participate in the testing process through test reviews and analysis, test witnessing and certification of software</li> </ul> <strong>And you have:</strong>  <ul> <li>Strong understanding of SharePoint 2007, 2010, 2013, 2016, and complementing technologies</li> <li>A strong programming background and knowledge of web programming languages and frameworks including C#, ASP.NET, HTML, JavaScript, AJAX, and third party controls</li> <li>Experience with SharePoint Designer, InfoPath, Web Parts, Search Functions and workflow creation</li> <li>Extensive knowledge of MS Visual Studio, SharePoint Designer, and MS SQL Server</li> <li>Experience integrating SharePoint with other enterprise systems</li> <li>Strong understanding of programming methodologies and best practices</li> <li>Experience with the Nintex and Gimmal suite of products</li> <li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems; or related discipline</li> </ul> <strong>DevFacto can offer you:</strong>  <ul> <li>Competitive salaries, group benefits, profit sharing</li> <li>Challenging projects and leading-edge technologies</li> <li>Extensive training</li> <li>Flexible hours, creative workspaces with games and a fully stocked kitchen</li> <li>Regular team social events including Friday happy-hours and monthly team outings</li> <li>Award-Winning Culture</li> </ul> If this sounds like a match made in heaven, we want to hear from you!
Title: SharePoint Developer

Job_Description: <strong>About You:</strong> <ul> <li><strong>You’re highly collaborative</strong> - you have an affinity for finding solutions through discussions with team members</li><li><strong>You’re a problem solver</strong> – you enjoy solving complex problems, and are comfortable exploring them even if the problem and solution are not yet well-defined</li><li><strong>You’re always improving something</strong> – whether it’s learning a new programming language, or finding better ways to do things in your team or organizationally, continuous improvement is important to you</li><li><strong>You’re practical</strong> – you assess the circumstances and make the best decision based on the facts</li> </ul> <strong>Some of the things you’d be doing as a developer on our team:</strong> <ul> <li>Be an active and collaborative team member as part of an agile development team of 4-5 people</li><li>Design, code and test enhancements for a Web application written in .NET Core</li><li>Deploy solutions onto Elastic Beanstalk on AWS</li><li>Work closely with customer stakeholders to ensure we’re adding value for our users</li><li>Work closely with other developers, for example by pair programming and participating in code reviews</li><li>Troubleshoot and fix bugs</li><li>Contribute to testing of user stories, features and releases</li><li>Assist our customer facing support team in solving client issues, when necessary</li><li>Contribute insights and suggestions as part of our continuous improvement</li><li>Generally pitch in wherever needed to help get a high quality release out on time</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications that would make you a good fit for this role:</strong> <ul> <li>Minimum B.Sc. in software engineering, computer engineering, computer science, or equivalent experience</li><li>3+ years work experience</li><li>Experience writing code in a web environment using .NET Core and Javascript</li><li>Familiarity with object oriented software design</li><li>Experience with automated testing processes</li><li>Experience with deploying applications on the cloud</li><li>Familiarity with, or interest in, agile principles, values and practices</li> </ul> It is the policy of IHS Markit to provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, IHS Markit will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. We maintain a drug-free workplace. For candidates in the US, we are a participant in E-Verify (see link below). <br/><br/> EEO is the Law <br/> EEO is the Law Supplement <br/> Right to Work <br/> Pay Transparency Policy <br/> E-Verify<br/><br/>Current ColleaguesIf you are currently a colleague with IHS Markit please apply internally via Workday.

Job_Description: <div><strong>Intermediate – Senior GIS Developer, Calgary</strong> <br/><br/> Our client requires an Intermediate / Senior GIS Developer for creating GIS web based applications including web application design, development, testing and implementation of projects. <br/><br/> The resource will be required to assist in completing the assigned development tasks, testing and documentation. This is a contract from June 2018 until May 2019. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong>  <ul>   <li>Providing system analysis</li> <li>Developing UI design</li> <li>Implementing software coding</li> <li>Unit testing</li> <li>Fixing defects</li> <li>Releasing software</li> <li>Documentation as required by the Project Team</li> <li>Supporting Production issues and required fixes</li> </ul>   </div> <br/><strong>Qualifications – the following experience is mandatory</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Experience with ESRI GIS technology (ArcGIS Desktop, Server, SDE Geodatabase, ArcGIS Online) (>5yrs)</li> <li>Experience with GIS web application development (HTML5, JavaScript, ESRI JavaScript API, Web AppBuilder) (>5yrs)</li> <li>Experience with GIS batch job development (.net, C#, Python) (>5yrs)</li> <li>Proven experience with ESRI Geoprocessing service development (Python) (>5yrs)</li> <li>Proven experience with ESRI Geodatabase Design (Oracle, SQL Server) (>5yrs)</li> <li>Documentation and communication skills</li> </ul> <strong>How to Apply:</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Online:</strong> Apply online now at www.Brainhunter.com <br/><br/> <strong>Company Overview:</strong> <br/><br/> BRAINHUNTER provides staffing and recruitment for full time, part time, contract and consulting services. BRAINHUNTER also provides payroll management services and a comprehensive suite of HRIS IT, ATS, and CRM software. BRAINHUNTER is a Microsoft Certified Partner, HP Alliance One Partner, Telus Business Solutions Partner, Oracle Partner, and ranked among the top Global Recruitment Industry providers. Job_Description: <strong>Department overview:</strong> <br/><br/> Financial Risk Analytics is part of the IHS Markit group and provides industry leading risk analytics solutions to sell side institutions within the financial markets. Risk management and risk regulation is continuously driving demand for more accurate calculations and risk system vendors are continuously striving for improvements in performance and scalability. The product has been designed, built and continuously improved over a ten year period. It is carefully architected to scale from running on a single laptop for demonstration purposes right through to running on 1,000+ core distributed grids. <br/><br/> Financial Risk Analytics provides solutions for Credit Risk PFE, Market Risk VaR and sensitivities, Credit Value Adjustment (CVA), Initial Margin (IM) and regulatory calculations such as EC, RC, IRC and CRM, <br/><br/> <strong>Position summary</strong> <br/><br/> Markit is currently investing in their technology platform to develop a number of new revenue-generating products, leveraging open source projects and big data technologies. These include new visualisation, risk aggregation and smart data initiatives that address new data, risk, and regulatory requirements and are highly visible and strategic within the organisation. <br/><br/> These initiatives are using best-of-breed technologies, such as Hadoop, Spark, HDFS, and HBase along with in-house-developed technologies. The successful candidate will be working in a fast-paced, dynamic team environment, building commercial products which are at the heart of the business. <br/><br/> Markit is looking for a highly-skilled Big Data developer proficient in the JVM ecosystem, with strong analysis and troubleshooting skills; Scala is the language of choice. The candidate needs to be able to design, develop, profile and debug a highly-available, distributed system. <br/><br/> Markit follows agile software development processes with the emphasis on delivering high-quality, tested and demo-able code at the end of each sprint. <br/><br/> <strong>Duties & accountabilities</strong> <br/><br/> Design and implement Big Data platforms for batch and real-time analytics. <br/><br/> Interpret and analyse business use-cases and feature requests into technical designs and development tasks. <br/><br/> Take ownership of development tasks; participate in regular backlog grooming, sprint planning, design and code review meetings. <br/><br/> Be an active contributor in system architecture and design discussions, with a focus on system performance. <br/><br/> Produce high-quality work, always following quality standards such as unit testing, integration tests and documented code. <br/><br/> Be delivery-focused, have a passion for technology, and enjoy offering new ideas and approaches. <br/><br/> Work with distributed teams in multiple locations worldwide. <br/><br/> <strong>Business competencies</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Education and experience</strong> <br/><br/> Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Engineering, or a related discipline, or equivalent experience. <br/><br/> Strong software development experience in Scala and Java <br/><br/> Be able to demonstrate experience with a key role in Big Data projects. <br/><br/> Good knowledge of Apache Spark. <br/><br/> Experienced in the Hadoop ecosystem (HDFS, Hive, HBase). <br/><br/> Hadoop optimisation, including storage file formats, data transmission techniques and partitioning. <br/><br/> Linux and scripting <br/><br/> Experience with Docker, Kubernetes, Business Intelligence (BI) tools and SQL is an advantage. <br/><br/> <strong>Commercial awareness</strong> <br/><br/> Knowledge of credit risk and market risk management workflows is useful but not required. <br/><br/> Management requirements <br/><br/> You can effectively provide technical direction and estimates to fulfil requirements. <br/><br/> You can coordinate teams across time zones to effectively manage deliveries. <br/><br/> You follow relevant technology trends and actively evaluate new technologies to improve the product. <br/><br/> You get a lot of satisfaction from on-time delivery. <br/><br/> Happy clients are really important to you. <br/><br/> <strong>Personal competencies</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Personal impact</strong> <br/><br/> You love to solve complex problems, whether that's making the user experience as responsive as possible or understanding complex client requirements. <br/><br/> <strong>Communication</strong> <br/><br/> You can confidently present your own ideas and solutions, as well as guide technical discussions. <br/><br/> You can effectively communicate with external clients <br/><br/> <strong>Teamwork</strong> <br/><br/> Your welcoming attitude encourages people to approach you when they have a problem you can help them solve. <br/><br/> We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer M/F/Disability/Veterans. Please refer to the <strong>EEO is the Law Poster & Supplement, Right to Work and Pay Transparency Policy. IHS Markit is a participant in E-Verify (see links below)</strong>. Job_Description: <div><div><strong>Title: Intermediate Software QA Analyst</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Location: Calgary, AB</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Trimble Oil & Gas Services:</strong> <br/><br/> Trimble Oil and Gas Services offers comprehensive telematics and transportation operations solutions to oil and gas companies, and service providers in the U.S. and Canada. From tracking, analytics, and paperless invoicing, to in-cab navigation and personal safety systems, Trimble solutions give managers and operators the tools they need to be more productive, competitive, safe and compliant. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Overview:</strong> <br/><br/> We are looking for a very positive and collaborative team player to join our Calgary Technology team. As an intermediate QA Analyst, you will work within the QA Team and in conjunction with the Software Development team to validate requirements, and verify software and system functionality. You will identify and document defects within system integration, help resolve critical issues in the software, and challenge specifications of features, especially if the issue may be a problem in the field. This role requires a solid understanding and utilization of all QA best practices to make our QA department succeed. <br/><br/> <strong>Requirements:</strong>  <ul> <li>5+ years of experience in Manual Software QA & Testing, mobile and web-based systems, communication and networking protocols.</li>   <li>5+ years of experience designing and executing various types of testing methodologies, such as Smoke, System, Functional, Integration, Acceptance and Regression.</li>   <li>Automation experience plus Performance, Scalability, Load and Usability testing experience would be an asset.</li>  <li>Positive team player who prides themselves on delivering high quality work</li>  <li>Self-starter with a “can-do” attitude, who is willing to take the initiative in finding answers in a timely manner, sometimes with little direction</li>  <li>Experience with SCRUM methodology and QA Process best practices</li>  <li>Experience testing multiple integrated products within an Agile project environment</li>  <li>Ability to estimate issues and track time allocated to tasks when required</li>  <li>Ability to handle multiple tasks well simultaneously</li>  <li>Creativity with testing, and thinking outside normal test case parameters</li>  <li>Any other duties as requested by Supervisors and Managers.</li>  <li> * Experience with JIRA, qTest, Sauce Labs, Jenkins, and Selenium tools would be an asset, as would field & integration testing of hardware and web/mobile-based applications.</li> </ul> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul> <li>Ensuring all items assigned are tested and ready for production (accountability)</li>  <li>Clearly communicating the status of tasks as required at regular stand-up meetings, both within your team and to your direct report</li>  <li>Create and maintain test plans and test cases based on feature requirements</li>  <li>Ability to execute and maintain test cases prepared by yourself or others</li>  <li>Comfortable showcasing new functionality to stakeholders in the form of a demo (public presentation)</li>  <li>Provide detailed feedback to developers on issues, and identifying discrepancies between requirements and actual results from testing</li>  <li>Coordinate efforts with other QA team members to ensure adequate testing coverage has been accomplished</li>  <li>Provide estimates on time required to plan, create and run test cases</li>  <li>Troubleshoot failures in order to demonstrate repeatability, in an effort to improve test coverage</li>  <li>Testing on multiple platforms to ensure compatibility</li>   <li>Develop boundary, negative and edge case test scenarios as part of the coverage test suite</li>  <li>Provide visibility into the progress of testing within each iteration, including defect maintenance</li>   <li>Proper versioning and tracking of QA documents for audit purposes where necessary</li>   <li>Perform other operational duties as required</li> </ul> Trimble Inc. is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, gender, age, color, religion, national origin, marital status, disability, sexual orientation, status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws, or any other protected factor. EOE/M/F/V/D</div> </div><div></div>
Title: Intermediate Software QA Analyst

Job_Description: At General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada, Canada’s premiere defence company, innovation happens on a daily basis. We develop and deliver highly-complex leading edge technology, products and systems that make important contributions to our customer’s success in land, airborne, maritime and public safety applications. The challenges and opportunities are endless.The results – incredible. <br/><br/> Our employees are exceptional. We are proud to employ more than 1,100 talented individuals across Canada. Working in a collaborative environment, our employees are encouraged daily to contribute their technical knowledge and expertise. Our employees are passionate, dedicated, and conscientious about the work they do which results in our ability to deliver the highest value, customized solutions in order to meet the most demanding requirements. <br/><br/> General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada is looking for a computer engineering, software engineering, or computer scientist for an eight month work term to help deliver a world class Tactical Communication and Information System (TacCIS) to a new customer. Our Canadian teams will design, integrate, manufacture, verify, deliver, install and support the TacCIS System. Following the Engineering Phase, the project will lead into production and through life support services. The Project will be a multi-site development in Ottawa and Calgary with activities spanning several product development groups across the Land and Joint Solutions business area. <br/><br/> The TacCIS Software Team will work collaboratively with the System Engineering team on evaluating, selecting, modifying, and integrating existing software solutions into the system architecture, as well as designing, implementing, and testing new solutions for components, services, and GUIs that do not exist. The following are some of the Computer Software Configuration Items (CSCIs) in the system that the software team will provide or integrate with; Smart Display Operating System, Drivers and Software, Tactical Integration Framework, Time Services and Network Services. <ul> <li>Participate in sprint planning, retrospectives, daily scrums and backlog refinement as part of an Agile development team</li><li>Software development for a web-based application</li><li>User interface and embedded software development for a Linux device</li><li>Develop web-based applications</li><li>Develop solutions to integrate software components</li><li>Develop user interface and embedded software</li><li>Develop and execute test scripts</li><li>Integrate computer data terminals and networking hardware</li><li>Create and update technical documentation</li><li>Ensure completed tasks meet the acceptance criteria and the definition of done</li><li>Participate in system demonstrations</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Experience developing applications for an embedded system</li><li>Experience with computer programming in C, C++ and Python</li><li>User interface development in JavaScript</li><li>Hands-on experience installing and configuring Linux based operating systems</li><li>Familiarity and understanding of network and Linux security</li><li>Experience configuring an IPv4 network</li><li>Work effectively in a team environment</li><li>Strong problem solving and analysis skills</li><li>Strong communication skills, both written and verbal</li><li>Adaptable to a fast paced learning environment</li> </ul> <strong>Assets</strong> <ul> <li>Experience with networking technologies such as VLANs, routing protocols (OSPFv2 or RIPv2), or IPv6</li><li>Experience with network device management technologies such as SNMP and NETCONF</li><li>Experience with cybersecurity techniques and public key encryption (IPSEC)</li><li>Experience with audio and multimedia processing</li><li>Understanding of Object Oriented Programming principals</li><li>Embedded software development on a Raspberry Pi</li><li>Qt User Interface development</li><li>Knowledge using Git for Job_Description: NovAtel is a leader in high precision OEM positioning technology. Our GNSS products and services are used in more than 60 countries around the globe to deliver precise positioning solutions in precision agriculture, defense, mapping, autonomous vehicles, survey and many other industries. <br/><br/> As NovAtel's Software Process Analyst you will provide end to end stewardship of our processes for Software/Firmware development and Verification & Validation. In addition to your deep understanding of best in class software development practices, you will leverage your excellent leadership and facilitation skills to refine existing processes and introduce new ones that help our development teams be maximally effective. This is a newly created role with high visibility within the Engineering team, exposure to senior level management and an opportunity to make a real impact. <ul> <li>Process creation, documentation, implementation and maintenance</li><li>Process compliance reporting, including conducting internal audits</li><li>Identifying and leading Continuous Improvement efforts to address deficiencies and improve efficiency</li><li>Process change management and training</li><li>Developing and refining metrics for tracking development and test compliance, quality, progress and productivity</li><li>Gap analysis with respect to established Quality Management Systems and development capability frameworks</li><li>Process tailoring as appropriate on a project by project basis</li> </ul> <strong>Must-Have:</strong> <ul> <li>B.Sc. in Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent</li><li>5+ years’ experience in a software development and test environment</li><li>Practical experience in process development and deployment</li><li>Well versed in Continuous Improvement methodologies, tools, and techniques</li><li>Familiarity with a variety of Software development models and quality frameworks (eg. SPICE, CMMI)</li><li>Experience with systematic approaches for identifying and assessing metrics and KPIs</li><li>Experience with issue tracking and collaboration tools</li><li>Must be able to achieve Controlled Goods and Reliability level security status</li> </ul> <strong>Key Success Factors:</strong> <ul> <li>Passionate about good process</li><li>Organized and detail oriented</li><li>Excellent facilitation and influencing skills</li><li>Confident, no ego, driven by integrity</li><li>Self-motivated, comfortable working autonomously and in a team environment</li><li>Excellent written and verbal English language communication skills</li> </ul> <strong>Nice-to-Have:</strong> <ul> <li>Experience with Jira, Confluence, Collaborator, Polarion RMT, Smartsheet</li><li>Embedded FW development experience</li><li>Knowledge of IATF 16949, ISO 26262</li><li>BA certification</li> </ul>

Job_Description: At General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada, Canada’s premiere defence company, innovation happens on a daily basis. We develop and deliver highly-complex leading edge technology, products and systems that make important contributions to our customer’s success in land, airborne, maritime and public safety applications. The challenges and opportunities are endless.The results – incredible. <br/><br/> Our employees are exceptional. We are proud to employ more than 1,100 talented individuals across Canada. Working in a collaborative environment, our employees are encouraged daily to contribute their technical knowledge and expertise. Our employees are passionate, dedicated, and conscientious about the work they do which results in our ability to deliver the highest value, customized solutions in order to meet the most demanding requirements. <br/><br/> General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada is staffing for an exciting opportunity to deliver a world class secure next-generation communications system for the Ministry of Defence (MoD) in the United Kingdom. GDMS-C is working in partnership with General Dynamics Mission Systems - United Kingdom to design, develop, and deliver an exceptional Command, Control, Communications, Computing and Intelligence (C4I) system based on open architecture and industry standard principles. <br/><br/> Calgary is developing a key software product as part of this offering that provides the operating system and middleware to enable tactical voice and data communications, sensor and device integration, and common application services. Software will be developed for Windows 10 laptops and for General Dynamics developed hardware products running embedded Linux. <br/><br/> The project includes all phases including System Design, Software and Hardware Design, System Integration, and System Validation. The project will be a multi-site development with activities spanning several product development groups in Calgary and across the General Dynamics Mission Systems International business area. <br/><br/> The software product team consists of several software development teams, each focusing on a specific set of software components and services in the areas of communication, device integration, and common services for multiple third-party software applications. Software development teams follow the Scrum framework for software development. As a member of a Scrum team, the successful candidates will design, implement, and test software features for the product. <ul> <li>Participate in Scrum events, including Sprint Planning, Daily Scrum, Sprint Review, and Sprint Retrospective.</li><li>Continually refine Sprint backlog into smaller task</li><li>Work cooperatively with the development team to take on new tasks</li><li>Perform detailed design, implementation, and unit testing activities in order to complete Sprint tasks</li><li>Ensure completed tasks meet the Definition of Done and the Acceptance Criteria</li><li>Share knowledge and skills with other development team members</li><li>Participate in the refinement of the Product Backlog</li></ul>  <ul> <li>Experience with C++ or other higher level programming languages</li><li>Experience with developing software in a Linux operating system (kernel 3.X)</li><li>Experience with developing software in a Windows operating system (Windows 7, 8, 10)</li><li>Experience with UML and modelling techniques</li><li>Experience with unit testing and test driven development</li><li>Disciplined approach to software engineering with knowledge of agile development methods</li><li>Strong attention to detail</li><li>Strong communication skills, both written and verbal</li><li>Strong problem solving and analysis skills</li> </ul> <strong>SKILLS & EXPERIENCE - NICE TO HAVE</strong> <ul> <li>Experience with Service-oriented architecture including Web Services, WebSockets, and RESTful APIs</li><li>Experience with cross-platform development</li><li>Experience with pub/sub and request/response messaging patterns</li><li>Experience with XML</li><li>Experience with network device management technologies such as SNMP and NETCONF</li><li>Experience with multimedia technologies such as SIP, RTP, and RTCP</li><li>Experience with 3GPP IMS standard</li><li>Experience with transport layer technologies such as TCP/IP and UDP</li><li>Experience with networking technologies such as IPv4, IPv6, VLANs, 802.3, Routing Protocols (OSPF, IS-IS, BGP4), 802.1x, DSCP, and DHCP</li><li>Experience with directory services technologies (e.g., LDAP, X.500)</li> </ul> <strong>Education</strong> <br/><br/> Bachelor’s degree in Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or equivalent discipline is required. <br/><br/> <strong>Minimum 10 year consecutive residence in Canada – for Canadian Secret Security Clearance</strong> <br/><br/> Applicants will be required to obtain/hold a valid and current Canadian security clearance to gain access to the classified spaces, information and equipment in order to perform the work associated with this position. <br/><br/> General Dynamics Mission Systems – Canada is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace. Workplace accommodations are available.

Job_Description: <div>At Paysafe, we are building the future in payments – an ever-evolving platform that meets the needs and expectations of tomorrow's businesses and consumers. <br/><br/> We’re a global provider of online and mobile payment processing services to thousands of companies and millions of consumers. From cash to digital currency; from all-in-one processing to multi-currency consumer wallets and remittance; from order-ahead mobile apps to consumer credit solutions, our unique portfolio for merchants, partners, developers and consumers comprises industry-leading capabilities in payment processing, digital wallets and online cash solutions. But we’re much more than that. We offer people confidence and convenience when they buy and pay online. And we help companies win and keep more customers by improving the services they provide. <br/><br/> Having been at the centre of innovation in payments since 1996, we understand how to stay ahead of the curve. How to anticipate new customer needs. How to react to changes in regulation. How to leverage new technologies. How to adapt and be agile. This is what defines us. That’s why at Paysafe, you will see a portfolio and set of capabilities that is always growing. Never standing still, never complacent. <br/><br/> Our staff of over 2000 includes more than 40 nationalities, based at our offices throughout Europe and North America. We are all working towards the Paysafe vision of becoming the world’s favourite payments provider. <br/><br/> <strong>The Candidate:</strong> <br/><br/> We’re seeking an intermediate to senior range developer to join our team. <br/><br/> Your responsibilities include:  <ul>  	<li>Creating a beautiful front-end experience.</li> <li>Provide expertise with HTML 5, (S)CSS, JavaScript, Angular, RxJS, as well as other client-side technologies.</li> <li>Writing maintainable, tested, and well documented client-side code that adhere to best practices.</li> <li>Translate visual and written designs into efficient reusable Angular components.</li> <li>Liaise with UX Team, Development, Test Analysts, Product Management, and Project Management.</li> <li>Ability to quickly ramp up on and apply new technologies and processes.</li> <li>Advocating delivery and maintenance in terms of technical feasibility, value, and complexity.</li> </ul> Do you have?  <ul>  	<li>Strong knowledge of HTML 5, (S)CSS and JavaScript.</li> <li>Experience with modern SPA frameworks such as Angular, React, VueJs, Ember, etc.</li> <li>Minimum of 3 years’ experience focusing on front-end development and implementation.</li> <li>Experience with front-end build tools, such as NPM, Yarn, Gulp, etc.</li> <li>Experience with responsive design/development.</li> <li>Working with code repositories such as GIT or SVN.</li> <li>Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities.</li> <li>Great attention to detail.</li> <li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills.</li> <li>(Bonus) Experience in Java Development</li> <li>(Bonus) Experience in SQL</li> </ul> <strong>Technologies we use:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Angular 2+</li> <li>Typescript/Javascript</li> <li>CSS/SCSS</li> <li>RxJS</li> <li>Protractor/Karma/Jasmine</li> <li>Webpack/SystemJS</li> <li>npm/gulp</li> </ul> <strong>What’s in it for you?</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Enjoy working in a highly collaborative environment</li> <li>Competitive salary and bonus package</li> <li>Full benefits (health, dental and vision)</li> <li>RRSP matching and share purchase program</li> <li>Lively, open workspace</li> <li>Casual dress code</li> </ul>  </div> <br/>

Job_Description: Seequent is a world leader in the development of data visualization software. Our solutions (including Leapfrog and Blockbuster) enable people to create rich stories and uncover valuable insights from geological data, and ultimately make better decisions about their earth, environment and energy challenges. <br/><br/> Our primary development centres are in New Zealand (head office), Canada and South Africa. We also have offices in Australia, Chile, Brazil, Peru, Russia and the UK. The development team in Calgary is seeking a Front-End Developer to support our web-based communication and visualization product, View. <br/><br/> As an experienced Front-End Developer, you see the web as a powerful communication and visualization tool. You have developed in the web space but are looking to really hone your craft and work in web applications that leverage 2D, 3D and 4D visualization. You are well versed in current web technologies and have a good appreciation for design and aesthetics. You want to learn by doing and you live for steep learning curves. <br/><br/> In this role, you will bring and maintain a significant knowledge, competence and capability in front-end web development and you work efficiently with designers and product owners. <br/><br/> You build general, tested code, and refactor as you go. You can plan quickly and test quickly - you know the plan will change.<br/><br/>You will own the forward-facing component of a web application. You will help organize/execute the release of this application and ensure that features are continually tested. You identify and communicate risks and opportunities to business.<br/><br/><strong>Requirements</strong> <ul>  <li>Minimum 3 years demonstrated development experience with hand-coding HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript</li> <li>University degree in computer science and/or compelling and extensive experience in real-world applications</li> <li>Confident oral and written communication skills in English</li> <li>Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to develop and build sustainable working relationships</li> <li>Team-oriented attitude and good conflict management skills</li> <li>Ability to manage your own workload effectively and to work efficiently alongside team members</li> <li>Balanced and informed approach to problem solving</li> <li>Tenacity, persistence and focus with the ability to prioritize between multiple tasks</li> <li>Ability to work in a quickly growing, fast paced and constantly changing environment</li> </ul> <strong>Benefits</strong> <br/><br/> Our 3D modelling products and collaborative technology are used for projects such as road and rail tunnel construction, groundwater detection and management, geothermal exploration, resource evaluation and estimation, and subterranean storage of spent nuclear fuel. <br/><br/> Seequent's global team is diverse – we’re geologists, software engineers, sales people and communication specialists. We’re technical experts who are driven by the challenges our customers face. We leverage the experience of our people to solve the highly complex problems of today, and work toward the bigger solutions of tomorrow. <br/><br/> We offer market competitive salaries and support continuing growth and education. <br/><br/> If what we do is something that would get you out of bed in the morning, we would love to hear from you.
Title: Front End Developer - International Software Company

Visual Studio and/or PHP is a definite asset</li><li>Strong creative problem-solving ability</li><li>Ability to contribute to cross functional team discussions</li><li>BSc. in Computer Science or equivalent education/experience</li><li>Excellent communication, organizational, and interpersonal skills</li> </ul> <strong>Who We Are:</strong> <br/><br/> Getty Images is the most trusted and
