Getty Images works with over 200,000 contributors and hundreds of image partners to provide comprehensive coverage of more than 130,000 news, sport and entertainment events, impactful creative imagery to communicate any commercial concept and the world's deepest digital archive of historic photography. <br/><br/> Visit Getty Images at www.gettyimages.com to learn more about how the company is advancing the unique role of still and moving imagery in communication and business, and enabling creative ideas to come to life. For company news and announcements, visit our Press Room, and for the stories and inspiration behind our content, visit Stories & Trends. Find Getty Images on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, LinkedIn, Pinterest and Tumblr, or download the Getty Images app where you can explore, save and share the world's best imagery. <br/><br/> Getty Images is an equal opportunity employer and strongly supports diversity in the workplace.</div>
Title: Senior Software Engineer

Job_Description: Due to continued growth, iSolutions Consulting is looking for a Intermediate to Senior .Net Software Developer with experience in the Upstream Oil & Gas and / or Power Industries to join our team. The ideal candidate for this role has multiple years of industry experience in increasingly challenging roles, takes pride in the quality of implemented solutions and understands how business needs drive the technology. <br/><br/> <strong>Technology Skills</strong> <ul> <li>ASP.Net 2.0+</li><li>ADO.Net</li><li>SQL Server 2005+ Queries & Stored Procedures</li><li>Oracle, PL/SQL</li><li>SSRS / Crystal Reports and / or Jasper Reporting</li><li>SSIS / ETL Tools</li><li>MS MVC</li><li>MS AJAX</li><li>JQuery</li><li>Browser DOM Model</li><li>Multi-threaded programming concepts</li> </ul> <strong>Additional Skills</strong> <ul> <li>Experience with OSISoft PI, Honeywell PHD or Aspentech IP.21 historians</li><li>OPC Interfaces</li><li>Field Device Protocols (Modbus / DNP3)</li><li>Business Intelligence toolsets</li><li>Formal quality assurance training</li> </ul> <strong>Intangibles</strong> <ul> <li>Team Player</li><li>Diligent, able to document work processes & procedures</li><li>Able to work independently</li><li>Strong troubleshooting skills</li> </ul> iSolutions services a large number of name-brand clients in the oil & gas and power domains. We offer our consultants access to interesting and challenging work assignments, performance based compensation & fast-tracked career progression for those with the drive to succeed. <br/><br/> iSolutions Inc. is a Data Management consulting company that specializes in designing, implementing and supporting real-time, historian based, reporting and integration solutions for Oil/Gas and Power Generation/Transmission companies. Our implementations allow clients to make educated, site specific production and operational decisions based on the analysis of real time data from integrated field and plant systems.
Title: Intermediate / Senior .Net Developer

Job_Description: At Robots and Pencils, were expanding and looking for a Senior Android Developer to join our talented and world class robot team. <br/><br/> <strong>Who you are:</strong> <br/><br/> You are someone who prefers to communicate through code. You love to create and have a strong desire to learn. You have strong opinions but that are weakly held; you are humble yet confident. In fact, youre the first to pass along the latest headache busting library from Square to your colleagues just minutes after sending a link to a mind clarifying blog post from Romain Guy. <br/><br/> You can speak to language best practices and are not afraid of anonymous inner-classes. You never overlook the saved instance state and have contemplated the tradeoffs between activities, fragments, and views. You have knowledge of how a RESTful web service works, what makes it RESTful, and how it can be accessed from Android. You are also diligent about meeting allocated budgets and can work within time constraints, but you will never sacrifice quality. <br/><br/> <strong>What youll do:</strong> <ul> <li>Design, program and test software.</li><li>Author and maintain relevant documentation for developers, Clients and users.</li><li>Develop and refine prototypes to confirm requirements.</li><li>Program according to project plans (versions, sprints).</li><li>Test according to pre-determined test plans.</li><li>Support release and post-release activities, such as support, versioning and maintenance.</li><li>Collaborate with our pencils (designers) to create interfaces that conform to the Google design guidelines.</li><li>Peer review other team members code, and learn and adapt from peer review of your own code.</li><li>Support sales and project managers with technical insights, leading to the creation of budgets and schedules for projects.</li> </ul> <br/><br/> <strong>About Robots and Pencils:</strong> <br/><br/> Robots and Pencils is a digital innovation agency companies engage to create what's next. Trusted by some of the world's best brands, we help our Clients use mobile, web, and frontier technologies to transform their businesses. <br/><br/> In 2009, we created Robots and Pencils with the then-contrarian view that mobile would be more transformative than the internet. Today, our thinking is rooted in the belief that, in the age of unprecedented technology acceleration, maintaining a competitive advantage requires new strategies and a focus on innovation. <br/><br/> Our approach has been to create a company designed to follow the talent, allowing us to amass an unfair share of hyper-skilled people who call Robots and Pencils home. A team of people who not only develop innovative solutions to transform businesses, but also create products that have been previously inconceivable. <br/><br/> At R&P, we believe that our products and workplace are better with a diverse team makeup. Our Talent offers a variety of backgrounds, skillsets, and expertise from across the globe. Thank you Recruiters, but were not looking for help with this.<br/><br/>Requirements:  <ul> <li>10+ years of delivering software with preference given to those who have a degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent</li><li>Solid understanding and practical knowledge of the full mobile development and application life cycle</li><li>Solid understanding of Android UX/UI guidelines and best practices</li><li>Experience with Android using Android Studio and JAVA</li><li>Experience with a distributed Version Control System</li><li>Experience with mobile development issues related to performance optimization, caching and security</li><li>Familiar with Architecture patterns (MVP/ MVVM etc.)</li> <li>Excellent communications skills with the ability to share insights and expectations with Clients, stakeholders and colleagues, both locally and remotely</li> </ul>
Title: Senior Android Developer

Job_Description: <strong>Intermediate IT Programmer Analyst</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Location: Calgary, AB</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Scope and Overview</strong> <br/><br/> As an Intermediate IT Programmer Analyst, you will support and make enhancements to an existing web-based system and be responsible for evolving its technologies and projects, building value-added new features. This is an ideal opportunity to gain exposure to the vast technologies required for a leading transportation provider in Southern Alberta. The Intermediate IT Programmer Analyst is required to respond to users during regular office hours with the exception of off-hour emergency situations. This position reports directly to the IT Team Lead. <br/><br/> <strong>Knowledge & Skills Required</strong> <ul> <li>Education with a recognized IT institution, ideally in Computer Science</li><li>Three to five years of application development experience with C#/VB and ASP.Net technologies</li><li>Experience in database design and data analysis with Microsoft SQL Server 2005/2008/2012. Good aptitude in writing queries and preparing analytical reports. Comfortable with database administration, monitoring/tuning database performance and establishing/interpreting database performance metrics</li><li>Good understanding of transportation business and technologies applied in the domain is preferred; experience with GPS system development is an asset</li><li>Former experience of phone app development is a plus</li><li>Experience assisting and supporting users</li><li>Education and/or experience with Networks/Internet</li><li>Some experience in large networks is an asset</li> </ul> <strong>Principal Duties and Responsibilities</strong> <ul> <li>Primarily maintain/support the company business systems, ASP.Net websites and apps in service for business users or customers</li><li>Follow the development standards and conventions with regards to all aspects of the application including documentation, coding, etc.</li><li>Delivering assigned tasks on time and on budget with expected quality based on established priorities</li><li>Design and collaborate with onsite management and IT based business requirements</li><li>Adhere to IT policies, backup policies, internet policies and remote-home access policies</li> </ul>
Title: Intermediate IT Programmer Analyst

Job_Description: Robert Half Technology is currently seeking a Full Stack Developer for our Calgary Client. <br/> If you have the qualifications we are looking for, please submit your resume online to <br/> stephanie.sherlock@rht.com <br/><br/> <strong>RESPONSIBILITIES</strong> <br/> ×	Full stack development using various frameworks <br/> ×	Design code for testability using experienced working knowledge of best practices, patterns and principles of software development <br/> ×	Apply knowledge of modern techniques and concepts to design and develop a variety of applications <br/> ×	Practice critical thinking to help ensure cost effective solutions within Agile projects <br/> ×	Liaise with team members on projects, progress, issues, and risk <br/> ×	Other duties as assigned
Title: Full Stack Developer

Job_Description: <div><div> <p><strong>YOUR OPPORTUNITY:</strong><br> The Information Systems (IS) Developer Analyst is responsible for the analysis, design and building of systems through the development of application logic, user interfaces, data interfaces, data conversion scripts and reports. An IS Developer Analyst works under the guidance and direction of IS Business Systems Analyst to support the portfolio of applications for IS</p>  <p><strong>COMPETITIVE SALARY - STOCK OPTIONS - STOCK SAVINGS PLAN - ANNUAL BONUSES – BENEFITS!</strong></p>  <p><strong>HOW WILL YOU MAKE YOUR MARK?</strong><br> • Participate in supporting and enhancing the portfolio of applications for Oil Sands<br> • Analyzing, designing and developing applications<br> • Developing and maintaining functional/technical specifications and documentation<br> • Troubleshooting problems that occur in the everyday use of applications<br> • Fixing program bugs and/or data errors identified during troubleshooting<br> • Manage multiple tasks at the same time with high levels of effectiveness<br> • Demonstrate the ability to handle complex work</p>  <p><strong>QUALIFICATIONS:</strong><br> • Highly developed analytical skills<br> • Excellent interpersonal, team and communication skills<br> • Strong multi-tasking and prioritizing abilities<br> • A post-secondary degree in Computer Science or a related field of study<br> • Demonstrated proficiency in N-tier application analysis, design and development using Microsoft VB.NET/ASP.Net, Web Services/APIs<br> • Experience with Oracle SQL and Oracle PL/SQL, MSRS, MS Orchestrator<br> • Familiarity with product licensing and compliance<br> • Between 5 – 10 years of experience as a Programmer Analyst</p>  <p>To see related Information Technology roles at CNRL, visit: www.cnrl-careers.com/jobs/Information-Technology</p>  <p><strong>About Canadian Natural</strong><br> At Canadian Natural, we strive to live through our mission statement: "To develop people to work together to create value for the Company's shareholders by doing it right with fun and integrity." As a leading oil and gas producer, our diverse combination of assets include light oil, heavy oil, in situ oil sands production, oil sands mining and upgrading facilities, and natural gas. At Canadian Natural, safety is a core value. We conduct all of our operations in a way that identifies, minimizes and mitigates harm to the health and safety of employees, contractors, the public and the environment.</p>  <p>Canadian Natural Resources Limited - CNRL - is a publicly traded company on the TSX and NYSE as CNQ.</p> </div></div><div><div> <br></div></div>
Title: Developer

Job_Description: <strong>Parkland is unique.</strong> We fuel communities by safely delivering high-quality petroleum products to motorists, businesses, consumers and wholesale customers across North America. Through unrivaled dependability and service, we connect communities to the products they need to heat their homes, fuel their industries and drive their economies. <br/><br/> <strong>Parkland is strong.</strong> We are one of North America’s fastest growing and largest independent distributors and marketers of fuels and lubricants. Our family includes Bluewave Energy, Columbia Fuels, Elbow River Marketing, Island Petroleum, Fas Gas Plus, Farstad Oil, Les Pétroles Parkland, Pioneer Energy, Sparlings, Superpumper Inc., Ultramar, and most recently Parkland Refining (B.C.) Ltd. <br/><br/> <strong>Parkland is growing.</strong> Our organization is powered by effective leadership, progressive strategies and industry-leading best practices— but more importantly, it is driven by talented, customer-focused people who value integrity, innovation and quality. We are looking for good-natured, hard-working candidates who want to build a rewarding career in a dynamic and collaborative work environment. We are a family and our family continues to grow. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Summary:</strong> <br/><br/> The Jr. ETL Developer will be actively involved in data modeling for BI, reviewing existing data architecture and making improvements as directed, support Sr, ETL team members with data integrity validation for BI, review underlying framework for data presentations and make improvements as directed, and to ensure compliance in data architecture and ETL governance and policies. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Responsibilities:</strong> <br/><br/> • Support the work of all ETL Development Projects   <ul> <li>Production support of existing applications which involve at times working late nights and/or over the weekend for providing bug fixes or other support activities as required by the team.</li> <li>Create SQL stored procedures, functions, etc for the purpose of enhancing or fixing existing ETL architecture.</li> <li>Utilize experience with Version Control tools to maintain repository of files.</li> <li>Support all ETL activities in the BI area</li> <li>Work with Sr. ETL Developer in supporting multiple projects <br/><br/> <strong>Qualifications and Skills:</strong> <br/><br/> • Post-secondary education in Computer Science or Information Systems, relevant experience will also be considered</li> <li>1 to 3 years of ETL experience (Preferably Talend ETL Else Informatica)</li> <li>Knowledge of Talend Data Integration tool or Informatica (must be willing to learn& work on Talend if no prior experience exists)</li> <li>2 or more years of SQL experience (Preferably MSSQL, Oracle, MySQL).</li> <li>Knowledge or experience working on ETL Development Projects</li> <li>Basic understanding of Java</li> <li>Knowledge of Client-Server and Web-based applications</li> <li>Experience working with Version Control tools</li> <li>Knowledge of data modeling for Business Intelligence platforms</li> <li>Skill in promptly detecting, analyzing and resolving computer software issues</li> <li>Must demonstrate active listening and strong facilitation and conflict resolution skills</li> <li>Must possess strong organizational and analytical skills <br/><br/> Candidates must be legally able to work in Canada at this time. Parkland regrets that it is unable to sponsor employment Visas or consider individuals on time-limited Visa status for this position. <br/><br/> Our main priority at Parkland is our people. As an employee, you can expect a fair workplace, a professional work environment, competitive compensation, outstanding benefits, and a share in our success through the Employee Share Purchase Plan and our Annual Incentive Plan. <br/><br/> <strong>Our preferred method of application is online at www.parkland.ca</strong> <br/><br/> We thank all candidates in advance for their interest, however only those being considered will be contacted. <br/><br/> Parkland Fuel Corporation is committed to the principles of Employment Equity. <br/><br/> We strive to provide accessibility in employment to ensure equal access to employment opportunities for candidates, including persons with disabilities. Parkland Fuel Corporation will endeavour to provide accommodation to persons with disabilities in the recruitment process upon request. If you are selected for an interview and you require accommodation due to a disability, please notify us upon scheduling your interview.</li>  </ul>
Title: Jr ETL Developer

Job_Description: At Robots and Pencils, were expanding and looking for an iOS Developer to join our talented and world class robot team. What do we mean by world class? Youll get to work with one of the developers who built udacity, and with former lead engineers from major tech companies like Yahoo, Apple, and Google. <br/><br/> <strong>Who you are:</strong> <br/><br/> You are someone who prefers to communicate through code. You love to create and have a strong desire to learn. In fact, youre the first to rattle off which WWDC video would help your coworker. <br/><br/> You can speak to language best practices, understand when its reasonable to swizzle methods, have a strong understanding of generics and protocol oriented programming, and know the advantages and tradeoffs between closure/blocks and delegates. Youre also diligent about meeting allocated budgets and can work within time constraints, but you will never sacrifice quality. <br/><br/> On top of this, you are comfortable working in cross-functional teams and can share insights and expectations with stakeholders, Clients, team members, and various levels of management. <br/><br/> <strong>What youll do:</strong> <br/><br/> <ul> <li>Design, program and test software.</li><li>Author and maintain relevant documentation for developers, Clients, and users.</li><li>Develop and refine prototypes to confirm requirements.</li><li>Program according to project plans (versions, sprints).</li><li>Lead release and post-release activities, such as support, versioning, and maintenance.</li><li>Collaborate with our pencils (designers) to create interfaces that conform to Apples Human Interface Guidelines.</li><li>Peer review other team members code, and learn and adapt from peer review of your own code.</li><li>Support sales and project managers with technical insights, leading to the creation of budgets and schedules for projects.</li> </ul> <br/><br/> <strong>About Robots and Pencils:</strong> <br/><br/> Robots and Pencils is a digital innovation agency companies engage to create what's next. Trusted by some of the world's best brands, we help our Clients use mobile, web, and frontier technologies to transform their businesses. <br/><br/> In 2009, we created Robots and Pencils with the then-contrarian view that mobile would be more transformative than the internet. Today, our thinking is rooted in the belief that, in the age of unprecedented technology acceleration, maintaining a competitive advantage requires new strategies and a focus on innovation. <br/><br/> Our approach has been to create a company designed to follow the talent, allowing us to amass an unfair share of hyper-skilled people who call Robots and Pencils home. A team of people who not only develop innovative solutions to transform businesses, but also create products that have been previously inconceivable. <br/><br/> At R&P, we believe that our products and workplace are better with a diverse team makeup. Our Talent offers a variety of backgrounds, skillsets, and expertise from across the globe. Thank you Recruiters, but were not looking for help with this.<br/><br/>Requirements:  <ul> <li>8+ years of delivering software with preference given to those who have a degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent</li><li>High level of working knowledge with native iOS and/or Mac development using Xcode, Swift, and Objective C</li><li>High level of working knowledge with a distributed Version Control System</li><li>Experience with testing and behavior driven development</li> </ul>
Title: Senior iOS Developer

This role will allow you to develop your business knowledge of the oil and gas industry, experience working in a global IT organization and communication skills through extensive collaboration within Imperial Oil and ExxonMobil teams across Canada and around the world. <br/><br/> As a member of the UIT team, you will:  <ul>  	<li>Help promote IT capabilities by understanding Upstream business needs and consult on technology or work with other IT teams to develop effective IT solutions (e.g. process improvements through use of IT technology)</li> <li>Interface with other IT teams locally Engineering, Computer Science or Information Systems students interested in a career in information technology.</li> <li>To be considered for employment, your most recent unofficial transcript(s) must be submitted with your application</li> </ul> <strong>Other:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Strong interpersonal, listening, verbal and written communication skills</li> <li>Ability to work effectively in a team environment to accomplish organizational goals</li> <li>Highly motivated individual able to work with minimal supervision and build network of contacts</li> <li>Continuous improvement mindset with ability to identify problems and drive resolution</li> <li>Flexibility in dealing with changing priorities and short deadlines</li> <li>Rapidly learn and apply new IT technologies, along with the ability to teach/train others</li> <li>Travel to sites may be required</li> </ul> <strong>Start date:</strong>September 2018 (start date negotiable) <br/><br/> <strong>Work term:</strong> 8 months preferred, 12 months considered <br/><br/> <strong>Location:</strong> Calgary, Alberta <br/><br/> <strong>Your benefits</strong> <br/><br/> This position will provide you with an opportunity to leverage your skills in support of a large integrated oil company. You will be provided an opportunity to:  <ul>  	<li>Work in a high caliber, collaborative learning environment</li> <li>Receive on-the-job experience, coaching and training</li> <li>Gain technical and business background in the operations of the oil & gas resource industry through participation in various networking programs</li> <li>Work with a geographically distributed team across Canada</li> <li>Learn about various technologies and how to use them to enhance productivity</li> <li>Work directly with business units to deliver IT solutions to meet their needs</li> </ul> <strong>Who we are</strong> <br/><br/> At ExxonMobil Business Support Centre Canada ULC (EMBSCC) we are an integral part of a worldwide network of business support centres that provide financial, technical, information service, transactional, and customer service support for ExxonMobil’s global operations. <br/><br/> <strong>Other considerations</strong>  <ul>  	<li>For applicants selected to be interviewed, pre-employment background screening will be required.</li> <li>We thank all those who apply; however, only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.</li> </ul> <strong>Eligibility to work in Canada</strong> <br/><br/> Applicants must be eligible to work in Canada. Proof of eligibility must be in the form of a Canadian birth certificate, Canadian passport, Canadian citizenship certificate, Canadian certificate of permanent residence or work permit. Document must be current and valid (not expired, cancelled or voided). Work permit must be valid for the duration of the term. Proof of eligibility is required if an offer is made. Failure to provide the appropriate documentation within a reasonable timeframe (generally 6 weeks prior to your start date) may result in the offer being rescinded or a delay in your start date. <br/><br/> <strong>Application deadline:</strong> May 13, 2018</div> <br/>The ExxonMobil Business Support Centre Canada is committed to providing equitable treatment and equal opportunity to all individuals. <br/><br/> In certain situations, ExxonMobil may use your application to consider your suitability for other positions within the Company and may also provide the information to its affiliates, including Imperial Oil and affiliates of Exxon Mobil Corporation, in connection with possible opportunities at those affiliates.</div>  </div>  </div>  </div> <br/><strong>Job Segment:</strong>  <br/>  Gas, Gas Technician, Information Technology, Developer, Engineer, Energy, Technology, Engineering</div>  <br/>Apply now »<br/>   <div> Apply now    <ul>    <li> <br/> <br/>  Start apply with LinkedIn</li> <br/><br/> <li> <br/> <br/>  Start apply with Facebook</li> <br/><br/> <li> <br/> <br/>  Start apply with Xing</li> <br/><br/> <li> <br/> <br/>  Start apply with Seek</li> <br/><br/> <li> <br/>  Apply Now</li><br/>  <div> <div> <div> Start</div>  </div>  </div>  <br/><li>  <div> <strong>Please wait...</strong></div> </li>  </ul>   </div> </div>  <br/>

Job_Description: At General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada, Canada’s premiere defence company, innovation happens on a daily basis. We develop and deliver highly-complex leading edge technology, products and systems that make important contributions to our customer’s success in land, airborne, maritime and public safety applications. The challenges and opportunities are endless.The results – incredible. <br/><br/> Our employees are exceptional. We are proud to employ more than 1,100 talented individuals across Canada. Working in a collaborative environment, our employees are encouraged daily to contribute their technical knowledge and expertise. Our employees are passionate, dedicated, and conscientious about the work they do which results in our ability to deliver the highest value, customized solutions in order to meet the most demanding requirements. <br/><br/> Typical Duties: <br/><br/> The responsibilities and range of activities will vary, but in general will include: <ul> <li>Participate in an interdisciplinary integrated project team environment under the supervision of more senior engineers and leads.</li><li>Perform system requirements analysis</li><li>Perform system design and/or analysis functions based on requirements</li><li>Define SAFe Capabilities and Features</li><li>Prepare and review system specifications, system design documents, and interface design documents</li><li>Provide design information to hardware and software engineers implementing the system</li><li>Prepare and review test plans, procedures and results</li><li>Identifying defects, resolving issues and verification</li><li>Support the change management process as the system design evolves</li><li>Documenting the analysis, design and test in accordance with development standards</li><li>Planning of activities/tasks for each design iteration</li><li>Reporting progress against plans</li> </ul> Required Experience: <br/><br/> Experience is required in a number of the following areas: <ul> <li>Disciplined approach to system engineering with knowledge of the full system life cycle.</li><li>Experience with model based design tools (PTC Integrity Modeler in particular) and SysML.</li><li>DOORS Requirements Management</li><li>Rational Team Concert</li><li>Tactical Communications and Networking Systems</li><li>Information Management Systems</li><li>Voice and Multimedia</li><li>Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.</li><li>Strong problem solving and analysis skills.</li><li>Enthusiastic contributor, willing to learn new skills and takes on ownership of work.</li><li>Ability to work effectively both independently and in a team environment, with minimum supervision.</li><li>Experience with Agile product development methods</li> </ul> Education <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Engineering, or applicable scientific discipline is required</li> </ul> <strong>Minimum 10 year consecutive residence in Canada – for Canadian Secret Security Clearance</strong> <br/> Applicants will be required to obtain/hold a valid and current Canadian security clearance to gain access to the classified spaces, information and equipment in order to perform the work associated with this position. <br/><br/> General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace. Workplace accommodations are available.
Title: System Engineer (Contract)

Job_Description: The Calgary Development Center is a partnership between Robots and Pencils and a large US Hospital Network. <br/><br/> You will be joining the Robots and Pencils team as a full-time employee working directly with the client in managing and shaping the future of this partnership. <br/><br/> <strong>Who you are:</strong> <br/><br/> You want to help us transform healthcare through technology that is smart, sophisticated, user-centric and measurable. You are someone who prefers to communicate through code. You love to create and have a strong desire to learn. You have strong opinions but that are weakly held; you are humble yet confident. You want your work to change healthcare as we know it. <br/><br/> You love frontier technologies. Youre not bound to any one framework; you code in different languages and know the advantages and tradeoffs between threaded parallelization and single threaded event loops. Youre also diligent about meeting allocated budgets and can work within time constraints, but you will never sacrifice quality. <br/><br/> On top of this, you are independent, but youre also comfortable working in cross-functional teams. You have excellent communications skills and can share insights and expectations with stakeholders, clients, team members and various levels of management. <br/><br/> <strong>What youll do:</strong> <br/><br/> <ul> <li>Implement rich interactive WebRTC applications with modern Javascript frameworks, such as React, to improve the healthcare experience for both patients and providers.</li> <li>Work with customers, designers, and UX experts to design and develop solutions to challenging problems.</li> <li>Build out mobile APIs and web applications for mobile and browser clients</li><li>Peer review other team members code, and learn and adapt from peer review of your own code.</li><li>Support sales and project managers with technical insights, leading to the creation of budgets and schedules for projects.</li><li>Provide thought leadership through investigating new technologies and how they can be applied.</li> <li>Share knowledge and insights with team members through lunch n learn programs or mentorship</li> </ul> <br/><br/> <strong>About Robots and Pencils:</strong> <br/><br/> Robots and Pencils is a digital innovation agency companies engage to create what's next. Trusted by some of the world's best brands, we help our Clients use mobile, web, and frontier technologies to transform their businesses. <br/><br/> In 2009, we created Robots and Pencils with the then-contrarian view that mobile would be more transformative than the internet. Today, our thinking is rooted in the belief that, in the age of unprecedented technology acceleration, maintaining a competitive advantage requires new strategies and a focus on innovation. <br/><br/> Our approach has been to create a company designed to follow the talent, allowing us to amass an unfair share of hyper-skilled people who call Robots and Pencils home. A team of people who not only develop innovative solutions to transform businesses, but also create products that have been previously inconceivable. <br/><br/> At R&P, we believe that our products and workplace are better with a diverse team makeup. Our Talent offers a variety of backgrounds, skillsets, and expertise from across the globe. Thank you Recruiters, but were not looking for help with this.<br/><br/>Requirements:  <ul> <li>5+ years of delivering software with preference given to those who have a degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent.</li><li>Ability to lead a team, mentor, and develop other technologists.</li> <li>Proficient in software development design patterns and methodologies.</li><li>Proficient in at least one language or platform.</li><li>Familiar with some or all of the following: Rails, Go, JavaScript, Node.js, AWS, Elasticsearch, PostgreSQL, Redis, Docker, Cassandra, Git, client-side JavaScript, and mobile first HTML and CSS frameworks and tooling.</li><li>Proven experience building microservices at scale with NOSQL database technologies.</li> <li>Experience with testing and behavior driven development.</li><li>Excellent communications skills with the ability to share insights and expectations with clients, stakeholders and colleagues, both locally and remotely</li> </ul>
Title: Full Stack Developer - Calgary Development Center

Job_Description: At General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada, Canada’s premiere defence company, innovation happens on a daily basis. We develop and deliver highly-complex leading edge technology, products and systems that make important contributions to our customer’s success in land, airborne, maritime and public safety applications. The challenges and opportunities are endless.The results – incredible. <br/><br/> Our employees are exceptional. We are proud to employ more than 1,100 talented individuals across Canada. Working in a collaborative environment, our employees are encouraged daily to contribute their technical knowledge and expertise. Our employees are passionate, dedicated, and conscientious about the work they do which results in our ability to deliver the highest value, customized solutions in order to meet the most demanding requirements. <br/><br/> General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada currently has an exciting opportunity for a Product Owner in Calgary. As part of our team, you will play a key role in delivering a world class secure next generation communications system for the Ministry of Defense in the United Kingdom. General Dynamics Canada is working in partnership with General Dynamics Mission Systems - United Kingdom to design, develop, and deliver an exceptional Command, Control, Communications, Computing and Intelligence (C4I) system based on open architecture and industry standard principles. <br/><br/> Our Calgary team is developing a key software product as part of this offering that provides the operating system and middleware to enable tactical voice and data communications, sensor and device integration, and common application services. Software will be developed for Windows 10 laptops and for General Dynamics developed hardware products running embedded Linux. The project includes all phases including system design, software and hardware design, system integration, and system validation. The project will be a multi-site development with activities spanning several product development groups in Calgary and across the General Dynamics Mission Systems International business area. <br/><br/> The software product team will consist of several software development teams, each focusing on a specific set of software components and services in the areas of communication, device integration, and common services for multiple third-party software applications. Software development teams will follow the Scrum framework for software development. The Scrum teams operate within a larger Scaled Agile Framework organization. The successful candidate will be a Product Owner for one of the Scrum teams. <br/><br/> Typical Duties: <br/><br/> The Product Owner is a content management leader who prioritizes and grooms the Product Backlog and ensures that the team understands what they are working on. The Product Owner’s responsibilities include: <ul> <li>Working with the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) Product Manager and other stakeholders to understand their needs</li><li>Having a vision and roadmap for what the Product Owner wishes to be built</li><li>Clearly expressing this vision in understandable Product Backlog items</li><li>Ordering and prioritizing the items in the Product Backlog to best achieve goals and missions</li><li>Optimizing the value of the work the Development Team performs</li><li>Ensuring that the Product Backlog is visible, transparent, and clear to all, and shows what the Scrum team will work on next</li><li>Ensuring the Development Team understands items in the Product Backlog to the level needed</li><li>The Product Owner is the sole person responsible for managing the Product Backlog</li> </ul> Required Skills & Experience: <ul> <li>Minimum of four years experience in software engineering</li><li>Disciplined approach to software engineering with knowledge of agile development methods</li><li>Strong attention to detail</li><li>Strong communication skills, both written and verbal</li><li>Strong problem solving and analysis skills</li> </ul> Skills & Experience – Nice to Have: <ul> <li>Previous experience as a Product Owner or Scrum Master on an Agile team</li><li>Professional Scrum Product Owner (PSPO) or Professional Scrum Master (PSM) certification</li><li>Previous experience leading teams in an agile environment</li><li>Previous experience, certification, or knowledge of the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe 4.0)</li> </ul> Education: <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree in Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, System Engineering or equivalent discipline is required.</li> </ul> <strong>Minimum 10 year consecutive residence in Canada – for Canadian Secret Security Clearance</strong> <br/><br/> Applicants will be required to obtain/hold a valid and current Canadian security clearance to gain access to the classified spaces, information and equipment in order to perform the work associated with this position. <br/><br/> General Dynamics Mission Systems – Canada is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace. Workplace accommodations are available.
Title: Software Engineer (Product Owner), Senior - EvO (P4)

Job_Description: Autodata Solutions is looking for a <strong>Senior Front-End Web Developer</strong> in our Calgary, AB office! <br/><br/> We are looking for a Front-End Web Developer who is motivated to combine the art of design with the art of programming. This is an opportunity for a Senior Leader manage both sides and define not only how the application looks, but how it works. You will translate the UI/UX design wireframes to actual code that will produce visual elements of the application while integrating SEO principals into your design. Through collaboration with our backend developers, you will integrate REST service endpoints to the UI through AJAX calls and design the expected output from the services. MUST have solid previous experience with ReactJS to join this project. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul> <li>Develop new user-facing features while buiding reusable code and libraries for future use</li> <li>Ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs</li> <li>Optimize application for maximum speed and scalability</li> <li>Integrate user interfaces with backend REST services</li> <li>Execute effectively in a high-volume, fast-changing work environment while managing multiple time-critical issues</li> <li>Act as technical advisor to business owners, project management, UX Designers</li> <li>Troubleshoot issues with code, integrations, and other related website properties</li>  </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong>  <ul> <li>2+ years of hands-on experience designing and building React.js applications</li> <li>5+ years professional experience with web markup, including HTML5, CSS3, and Javascript up to and including ECMAScript 6</li> <li>Demonstrable experience implementing SEO principles and ensuring that the application will adhere to them</li> <li>Good understanding of build tools, including Gulp, Bower, Webpack, and Yeoman</li> <li>Proficient understanding of client-side scripting and JavaScript frameworks, including jQuery</li> <li>Good understanding of other advanced JavaScript libraries and frameworks, such as AngularJS (vs 1 and 2), KnockoutJS, BackboneJS, Meteor, DurandalJS etc.</li> <li>Good understanding of asynchronous request handling, partial page updates, and AJAX</li> <li>Basic knowledge of image authoring tools, to be able to crop, resize, or perform small adjustments on an image. Familiarity with tools such as Gimp or Photoshop is a plus</li> <li>Working knowledge of NodeJS, including Express, Meteor, and other modules</li> <li>Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git / Mercurial / SVN</li> </ul> For more information about Autodata, please visit our company website: www.autodata.net. <br/><br/> We thank all applicants for their interest however only those selected for an interview will be notified. Autodata Solutions is an equal opportunity employer. We are compliant with AODA legislation; if you require work related accommodations, please specify.
Title: Front-End Web Developer

Job_Description: Are you excited by the challenge of protecting people against advanced computer security threats? Do you have the programming skills and experience to improve the advanced detection capabilities of our cloud security platform? <br/><br/> <strong>Who You’ll Work With</strong> <br/><br/> Billions of times a day, computers around the world communicate with the Cisco Advanced Malware Protection Cloud and rely on the AMP product to protect them against advanced forms of malware. Some malware is straightforward to identify, but antivirus has done that forever. Our customers need protection against malware that’s tricky to identify: <ul>  <li>Viruses that generate different binaries on every machine they infect</li> <li>Things that seem benign until you start looking closely at their behaviour</li> <li>Malicious programs that have invented new ways of hiding themselves</li> </ul> To make the problem even more interesting: it may only become clear after a few days that a program or behavior was malicious. Does that sound fun to you? <br/><br/> The AMP Data Team is responsible for running advanced malware identification algorithms on incoming event data streams and storing and indexing that data. We index that data both for future detailed investigations of malware incidents, and to retrospectively detect previously unidentified malware in stored data. We strive for sub-second processing latencies in our streaming platforms and databases as they handle data volumes of >100TB/month and growing. <br/><br/> Do you love learning and working with technologies like the following? <ul>  <li>Kafka</li> <li>Cassandra</li> <li>Flink</li> <li>Storm</li> <li>Linux</li> <li>JRuby</li> </ul> If using those to help improve computer security sounds exciting, this is the place for you. <br/><br/> <strong>What You’ll do</strong> <br/><br/> Our team is looking for a Software Developer who will help scale our infrastructure as the business grows, make server-side code changes for new features, develop and maintain research tools, and take proof-of-concept detections from our researchers and apply their power to protect our customers. <br/><br/> <strong>Who You Are</strong> <br/><br/> You are self-motivated, results driven and engaged. You’re passionate about back-end development and enjoy collaborating in a team based environment. You have fun learning new technologies. You want to get to the bottom of things, understand what’s going on, and make a difference. You are someone who doesn’t give up when faced with complex problems. <br/><br/> <strong>Must-haves</strong> <ul>  <li>Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Math, or Physics</li> <li>Enjoy writing server-side code and unit tests</li> <li>Knowledge of algorithmic complexity</li> <li>Able to debug, diagnose, and resolve occasional production problems</li> <li>Have 2–8 years experience writing object-oriented code and are ok working in Ruby, Java, JRuby, and Scala</li> <li>Experience with Linux command-line and system administration basics: ssh, permissions, packages, log files, &c.</li> </ul> <strong>Nice to have</strong> <ul>  <li>Master’s degree or PhD</li> <li>Experience detecting malware in event streams</li> <li>Experience with cloud systems architecture</li> <li>Able to smash the stack, use heap sprays, &c., to control EIP</li> <li>Real-world experience with streaming platforms like Storm, Flink, and Kafka Streams</li> <li>Production experience with distributed databases like Mongo and Cassandra</li> <li>Open-source contributions</li> <li>Peer-reviewed publications</li> </ul> <strong>Why Cisco</strong> <br/><br/> The Internet of Everything is a phenomenon driving new opportunities for Cisco and it is transforming our customers' businesses worldwide. We are pioneers and have been since the early days of connectivity. Today, we are building teams that are expanding our technology solutions in the mobile, cloud, security, IT, and big data spaces, including software and consulting services. As Cisco delivers the network that powers the Internet, we are connecting the unconnected. Imagine creating unprecedented disruption. Your revolutionary ideas will influence everything from retail, healthcare, and entertainment, to public and private sectors, and far beyond. Collaborate with like-minded innovators in a fun and flexible culture that has earned Cisco global recognition as a Great Place To Work. With roughly 10 billion connected things in the world now and over 50 billion estimated in the future, your career has exponential possibilities at Cisco. <br/><br/> We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status <br/><br/> <strong>@CiscoCareers #CalgaryJobs #CiscoJobs</strong>

Job_Description: Senior Agile Developer<br/><br/><strong>Start Date:</strong> Immediately <br/> <strong>Terms:</strong> Permanent FT <br/><br/> <strong>Salary:</strong> DOE <br/><br/> <strong>Deadline:</strong> June 1, 2018<br/><br/>About Symend<br/><br/>Our team is passionate about changing the lives of people experiencing financial hardship. Most importantly, we’re determined to bring hope and dignity to those on the other end of the collections conversation. <br/><br/> At Symend we pride ourselves on being different – it’s our entrepreneurial drive that sets us apart. It’s the same drive that’s helped us become one of Canada’s fastest growing FinTech’s. Our Team leads with passion and honesty and thinks creatively. Our people are the source of our success and we value collaboration, try to always understand our customers’ business, and strive for the highest standards of excellence.<br/><br/>The Role: Are you up for the challenge?<br/><br/>At Symend, we’re expanding and looking for a Senior Agile Developer to join our talented and results oriented team. What do we mean by results oriented? You'll work closely with clients to understand not only what they want but what they need and help them solve some big and interesting problems.<br/><br/>Who you are<br/><br/>You are someone who likes solving interesting problems with a team. You love to get at the root of a problem and work with others to create great outcomes and have a strong desire to learn. In fact, you’re the first to rattle off which Rails video or Blog would help your coworkers. <br/><br/> You can speak to language best practices, understand that starting is as important as finishing, know the difference between simple and easy, have a strong understanding of classes and mix-ins, and know the advantages and trade-offs between closure/blocks and delegates. You’re also diligent about meeting allocated budgets and can work within time constraints, but you will never sacrifice quality. <br/><br/> On top of this, you are comfortable working in cross-functional teams and can share insights and expectations with stakeholders, clients, team members and various levels of management.<br/><br/>Key Responsibilities   <ul> <li>Design, program and test software</li>  <li>Author and maintain relevant documentation for developers, clients and users</li>  <li>Develop and refine prototypes to confirm requirements</li>  <li>Program according to project plans (versions, sprints)</li>  <li>Lead release and post-release activities, such as support, versioning and maintenance</li>  <li>Collaborate with our designers to create interfaces</li>  <li>Peer review other team members’ code, and learn and adapt from peer review of your own code</li>  <li>Support sales and project managers with technical insights, leading to the creation of budgets and schedules for projects</li> </ul>  Basic Qualifications   <ul> <li>7+ of delivering software with preference given to those who have a degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent</li>  <li>High level of working knowledge with C#, .NET, Azure, SQLServer</li>  <li>High level of working knowledge with NoSQL and serverless architectures a plus</li>  <li>Experience with DevOps</li>  <li>Experience breaking down user problems into stories and solutioning</li>  <li>Experience working on iterative projects with continuous delivery pipelines</li>  <li>Experience with test driven development</li>  <li>Preferred Qualifications</li>  <li>Ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical audiences</li>   <li>Exceptional interpersonal and relationship management skills</li>  <li>Demonstrated effectiveness working across multiple business units to achieve results</li>  <li>Hands on development experience or full understanding of mobile and service development pipeline and process</li>  <li>Track record for being detail-oriented with a demonstrated ability to self-motivate and follow-through on projects</li>  <li>Strong problem-solving skills; the ability to analyze problems and develop actionable and appropriate tactical plans quickly</li>  <li>Ability to succeed in a fast-paced, innovative, and rapidly evolving industry and business organization</li> </ul> To apply for this position, please e-mail your resume and cover letter with the Subject Line: “Senior Agile Developer”. Apply early as position may be filled prior to deadline. <br/><br/> No phone calls please, only those candidates selected to move forward will be contacted.

Job_Description: <div><div><div><div><div>If you are committed to public service, enjoy collaborating with others, share our values and have a desire to learn and grow, join The City of Calgary. City employees deliver the services, run the programs and operate the facilities which make a difference in our community. We support work-life balance and offer competitive wages, pensions, and benefits. Together we make Calgary a great place to make a living, a great place to make a life.</div></div> </div> </div></div><div><div><div><div> <div><strong>As the Senior Systems Engineer, you will report to the Rail Systems Coordinator who has the overall responsibility for engineering, operation and maintenance of the electrical aspect of the Rail Systems, including traction power, signals & communications, and control systems. As a Department ID (DeptID) Owner, you will also be responsible and accountable for the operating budget for all maintenance service contracts (approximate annual contract values are over $5 million). Major duties include:</strong></div><ul>	<li>	<div>Prepare and control engineering safety standards, specifications, design guidelines, procedures and practices to be used in the construction and maintenance of traction power systems for the Light Rail Transit (LRT) system. The process involves liaising with regulatory agencies, contractors, industrial associations and City business units.</div></li>		<li>	<div>Build and lead a team of technical professionals to deliver traction power design, maintenance, and construction engineering support for transit projects.</div></li>		<li>	<div>Provide technical support and advice to project engineers in Transit Capital Construction, Rail Systems and Engineering Support groups. Present Transit’s interests and concerns on maintenance and operational issues.</div></li>		<li>	<div>Assist in the selection process of consultants and contractors carrying out traction power design and construction.</div></li>	</ul></div> </div> </div></div><div><div><div><div><div><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong>Qualifications</strong></strong></strong></strong></strong></strong></div>  <ul> 	<li>	<div>An Electrical Engineering degree, and current licensure as Professional Engineer with the Association of Professional Engineers and Geoscientists of Alberta (APEGA), or licensure by the first day of work.</div></li>		<li>	<div>A minimum of 8 years of directly related experience, including working knowledge in traction power systems design standards, is required.</div></li>		<li>	<div>You demonstrate sound knowledge of the principles, theories, concepts and practices of system engineering. This must include the application of principles related to conceptual design, requirements definition, design, testing, and project management.</div> </li>		 <li> <div><strong>Success in this role requires:</strong></div><ul> <li> <div>Expert analytical thinking and problem-solving skills to breakdown complex system problems and develop recommendations.</div></li>  <li> <div>Solid interpersonal and communication skills to build trust by consulting and liaising with others.</div></li>  <li> <div>The ability to apply a team approach as needed to achieve solutions on moderately complex technical issues.</div></li> </ul>	</li> </ul>  <div><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong>Pre-employment Requirements</strong> </strong></strong></strong></strong></strong></strong></div><div>  <ul> 	<li>	<div>Successful applicants must provide proof of qualifications.</div></li>	</ul></div> </div> </div> </div></div><div><div><div><div><div> <div> <div>Union: Exempt</div>  <div>Business Unit: Calgary Transit</div> </div> <div> <div>Position Type: Permanent</div> <div>Location: 1417C 33 Street S.W.</div></div> <div> <div>Compensation: Engineer Level F $88,307 - 148,777 per annum</div> <div>Days of Work: This position typically works a 5 day</div> <div>work week, earning 1 day off in each 3 week cycle.</div></div> <div> <div>Hours of work: Standard 35 hour work week</div></div> <div> <div>Audience: Internal/External</div> <div>Apply By: May 24, 2018</div></div> <div> <div>Amendment: Closing Date</div>  <div>Job ID #: 300727</div></div> </div> <div>About our organization</div> </div> </div> </div></div>

We work closely with our clients to understand their business and create things that really matter to them. As a result, we build a lot of really cool stuff that actually gets used and helps people. Theres a really exciting trend in the industry right now where were seeing Enterprise Mobility play a larger and larger role in the solutions we build with our clients. <br/><br/> In order to meet this need, were looking for people with a broad range of skills. general application of physical security technology</li>  <li>An understanding of and experience with fundamental concepts pertaining to IP networks, low voltage electronics, power, and communications</li>  <li>A strong command of the English language supported by excellent written and verbal communication skills</li>  <li>The ability to simultaneously handle multiple tasks and projects and be responsive to changing priorities in a fast-paced environment</li>  <li>Post-secondary education from an accredited college, university, or technical institution in Business, Construction Management, Electronics, Engineering, Information Technology, or a related field</li>  <li>P.Eng, EIT, CET, or equivalent professional technical designation is preferred</li>  <li>Highly developed analytical and problem solving skills</li>  <li>Motivated self-starter with ambition to independently research new technologies as well as engineering and business Job_Description: <P><B>Summary:</B></P> <DIV><STRONG></STRONG> </DIV> <DIV>Reporting to the Manager of IT, within Information Technology, the Systems Developer (located in Calgary, Alberta) will be responsible for the outstanding coding of the AX2012 Global HR module and associated integrations at Ensign. This position requires a creative person who is an exciting team player, with a strong technical background, and excellent verbal and written communications skills. Candidates must be able to analyze system design, address quality assurance, question issues, and work through problems on a day to day basis.</DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV><B>Position Responsibilities:</B></DIV> <UL> <LI> <DIV>Designing, building, testing and maintaining the various applications, and customizations in the Dynamics AX2012 modules, as well as the integration between the various applications and Dynamics AX2012;</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Building the Benefits module in AX2012; the benefits integration from AX2012 to Avanti (Canadian payroll system); the integration from AX2012 to Meridian (Australia payroll system); and any other development requirements for the Global HRMS AX2012;</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Working closely with IT Business Analysts and the HRIS and Compensation Analyst to determine if business and functional requirements are met;</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Working with project managers to determine schedules and estimates;</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Preparing technical documentation;</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Providing technical support and problem resolution expertise.</DIV></LI></UL> <P> <DIV><B>Note: </B></DIV> <DIV><STRONG></STRONG> </DIV> <DIV>Some travel may be required.</DIV> <DIV>This is a 12 month temporary contract.</DIV> <P></P> <UL> <LI> <DIV>Post-secondary education in Computer Science, Mathematics or Engineering discipline or equivalent experience;</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>5 – 7 years development experience in the object oriented language of C#, with a focus on integration;</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Expertise in Microsoft Dynamics AX2012;</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Understanding of ERP systems and the ability to learn quickly;</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Experience with Microsoft integration and reporting technologies SSIS, SSRS, OBI and/or Business objects, SQL and OLAP; </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Experience with unit testing frameworks such as NUnit would be an asset;</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Proven technical ability supported by strong analytical and problem solving skills;</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Ability to work effectively as part of a team as well as independently in a self-directed mode;</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Strong interpersonal and communication skills;</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>The ability to work well in a fast paced environment through exceptional time management skills and the ability to multi-task and prioritize duties;</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Oilfield experience, specifically in the Energy Services sector, would be an asset.</DIV></LI></UL>
Title: Systems Developer

Job_Description: <strong>Job Description</strong> <br/> IBM Global Business Service: Join a leader. Consult with us!I <br/><br/> BM Global Business Services helps top-tier clients solve their most complex business and technical issues. <br/><br/> Our Canadian Cognitive and Advanced Analytics team is a global leader in providing clients with innovative solutions based on cutting-edge technology. We design and develop industry solutions across domains from Finance and Healthcare to Natural Resources and Mining. <br/><br/> We are helping our client build the next generation of cognitive solutions that are cloud enabled and powered by the IBM Bluemix Cloud Platform and IBM Watson Solutions and APIs. <br/><br/> This position is for the IBM Advanced Analytics team based in Downtown Toronto. <br/><br/> Our team is looking for enthusiastic and driven Application Developers with full stack application development skills. <br/><br/> Do you live and breathe code? Are you that person who sees opportunity everywhere for digital technology to improve experiences? Can you collaborate and push the envelope to design, develop and implement leading applications for our clients? We want your skills and experience. Bring us your work portfolio and lets talk! <br/><br/> Required Technical and Professional Expertise <br/><br/> 3 or more years experience in responsive web technologies (HTML5, JavaScript, CSS3) 2 or more years of experience with full stack JavaScript development tools - specifically AngularJS (v1 or later), ReactJS and NodeJS/Express 2 or more years of experience working in a true Agile & Scrum environment Understanding of current Digital technologies such as RESTful and Streaming APIs, RDBMS and NoSQL databases, DevOps, Cognitive / Watson, and Big Data analytics <br/><br/> Preferred Tech and Prof Experience <br/><br/> 3 or more years experience in responsive web technologies (HTML5, JavaScript, CSS3) 2 plus years of experience with full stack JavaScript development tools e.g. AngularJS, NodeJS, Express JS, Grunt Bower, Gulp, backbone, jquery, etc 2 plus years of experience working in a true Agile & Scrum environment; exposure to Confluence and JIRA or similar tools. 1 year experience in developing complex rich mobile/web user interfaces, component, and widgets 2 plus years of experience with middleware and server development in a standard language and framework such as Java Spring or NodeJS 1 year in unit testing using frameworks such as Karma, Mocha.js, Jasmine and/or Selenium 1 year experience with cloud development platforms such as IBM Bluemix, AWS, or Azure 2 plus years of experience with at least one relational and one NoSQL database technology such as DB2/Oracle/dashDB/Postgres/mySQL/etc. and Cloudant/Cassandra/Mongo/etc. <br/><br/> EO Statement <br/> IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status. <br/><br/>

Job_Description: <div> <div><strong>Position Overview</strong></div><br/>  <div>Replicon's Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) team has a focus on automating the smooth operation of Replicon's Cloud Platform. We strive to accomplish projects such as fully automating a continuous delivery process, building highly resilient infrastructure components, and introducing & practicing Chaos Engineering.</div><br/>  <div>Junior SRE team members are software developers who love automating work, rather than doing tedious work themselves. They're deeply interested in the infrastructure upon which a complex system runs, rather than just building software features. They are expected to learn quickly, bring new ideas and concepts into the team, and always look for a solution rather than focusing on a problem. They are heavily supported by our amazing senior team members.</div><br/>  <div><strong>What responsibilities does the SRE team have?</strong></div>   <ul>  	<li>Implement new infrastructure systems to provide new operational and business capabilities supporting our platform and product</li> <li>Remove impediments in the engineering processes to support high frequency, low risk software deployments</li> <li>Promotes an environment of continuous improvement throughout the engineering organization</li> <li>Ensures that production and pre-production systems are strongly secured</li> <li>Optimizes the costs of running our cloud platform on AWS</li> <li>Participates in the on-call rotation to triage critical production incidents, reduce incident severity, and document incident in detail for product team follow-up</li> </ul>  <div><strong>What does your day-to-day work in this role look like?</strong></div><br/>  <div><strong>Work in a small scrum team of about six colleagues to:</strong></div> <ul>  	<li>Understand high-level requirements for new systems and capabilities</li> <li>Break down work into manageable tasks, using a combination of technical design documentation and Jira for task tracking</li> <li>Implement new systems, which is primarily a mix of node.js coding, Terraform infrastructure-as-code, bash or PowerShell scripting, and occasionally some C#</li> <li>Give and receive code reviews, working with colleagues to ensure the highest quality work is accomplished</li> </ul>  <div><strong>In addition to this routine work, you'll often have to:</strong></div> <ul>  	<li>Participate in retrospectives and post-incident reviews to figure out how the team, department, and organization can improve</li> <li>Provide support, incident resolution, and code reviews for other teams</li> <li>Perform on-call drills and training exercises to sharpen skills in incident management and resolution</li> </ul>  <div><strong>What qualifications should you have?</strong></div>   <ul>  	<li>You are eager to learn new technologies and systems, and can grasp new concepts very quickly</li> <li>You are able to mentally leap between different technology platforms and environments smoothly</li> <li>You have worked hands-on performing software development on a web application; preference to experience with node.js or C# platforms</li> <li>You are familiar with systems design and architecture in a large-scale web application (multi-tier, microservices, load balancing)</li> <li>You have knowledge or experience working with cloud platforms (preference: AWS)</li> <li>You're always uncomfortable when working in a project without a version control system in-place (preference: git)</li> <li>You've worked with database systems (preference: PostgreSQL)</li> </ul>  </div> <br/>
Title: Site Reliability Engineering - Junior

Job_Description: <div> <div> <div>Java Programmer - Canada</div><div>Summary</div><div>Title: Java Programmer - Canada</div> <div>ID: 2018C020</div> <div>Job Department: Technical</div> <div>Job Location: Calgary, Edmonton</div> <div>Description</div><div><div>Emerald Associates is a Canadian Oracle Platinum Partner - Cloud Standard. Headquartered in Calgary, Alberta, we have specialized in Oracle Engineering and Construction (formerly Primavera) suite for over 23 years. We take a best-of-breed, highly integrated and automated approach to drive project management excellence with our clients that includes many Emerald proprietary solutions. <br/><br/> We are actively looking for Full Cycle Java Developers in a full-time capacity to join our team in all of our locations including Canada, USA, Brazil, Philippines, Belarus. Qualified candidates with success working remotely will be considered, regardless of geographical proximity.<br/><br/>The Role - Integration Specialist <br/> As part of our programming and technology delivery team you will work with functional and technical project management leaders to deliver where your unique contributions make a difference to our corporate and client success.<br/>  <div> <div>You will work on a diverse portfolio of products and bespoke software in the project management space, including standalone Emerald products, add-ons to the Oracle Engineering and Construction suite of products, and system integrations and visualizations for clients. You will proactively be contributing to the full software development life cycle involving application analysis/design, coding, testing, documentation, deployment, and post-production verification and support; seeing your work product through to completion. <br/><br/> The ideal candidate is a highly collaborative, proactive self-starter with experience delivering in fast-paced customer driven project environments. <br/><br/> <strong>Who you are:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>You are highly organized and take charge of deliverables</li> <li>You see potential issues before they arise</li> <li>You remove obstacles and roadblocks to deliver on-time</li> <li>You thrive on solving problems</li> <li>You design with innovation in mind</li> <li>You love learning and thrive on collaboration</li> <li>You pick up new concepts easily</li> <li>You write clean, re-usable code</li> <li>You communicate with ease - both written and verbal</li> <li>You know that team success is the only success; mentoring, self-critiquing, collaborating and leading are your passion</li> </ul>  <strong>What you'll do:</strong>   <ul>  	<li>Work on new and existing software. Proprietary, third party and client specific</li> <li>Develop new code as well as maintain, update and upgrade existing software including:   <ul>   <li>Libraries and APIs</li> <li>Web applications</li> <li>Web services</li> <li>Enterprise integrations</li> <li>Plugins and add-ons to existing tools</li> </ul>  	</li> <li>Reporting and graphical visualization</li> <li>Design and collaborate with team member to deliver quality solutions</li> <li>Contribute new ideas to drive continuous improvement</li> </ul>  </div> </div><br/>  <div> <div><strong>Some of our tools:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Java 8</li> <li>IntelliJ IDEA Ultimate</li> <li>Redmine</li> <li>Git, GitLab</li> <li>Nexus, Maven</li> <li>Java Libraries: Google Guava, Apache Commons, FreeMarker, Apache Wicket, Spring IoC</li> <li>Excelsior JET</li> <li>Oracle, SQL Server</li> <li>SQL Developer</li> <li>jQuery</li> <li>Oracle Primavera P6-EPPM, Oracle Unifier, Oracle OPPM, OBIEE, Oracle Data Visualization</li> <li>Quip, HipChat, ZOHO</li> </ul>  </div> </div>  <br/>The Skills & Requirements<br/>  <div><strong>Mandatory Qualifications</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Fluency in the English language, both written and spoken</li> <li>Degree or diploma in computer science or a related discipline</li> <li>3-5+ years of Java development experience</li> <li>Working knowledge of SQL</li> <li>Experience designing, programming and delivering applications</li> </ul> <strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Experience developing rich web applications</li> <li>Experience developing cloud applications</li> <li>Experience with Spring and Wicket</li> <li>Working knowledge of PL/SQL / T-SQL</li> <li>Experience with the Linux shell</li> <li>Experience working remotely</li> </ul>  </div> <br/>If you are driven, collaborative, innovative, and love working with a great team to deliver on new challenges - <strong>Apply today!</strong></div> </div> </div></div>
Title: Java Programmer

Job_Description: <div><div><div><div><div>If you are committed to public service, enjoy collaborating with others, share our values and have a desire to learn and grow, join The City of Calgary. City employees deliver the services, run the programs and operate the facilities which make a difference in our community. We support work-life balance and offer competitive wages, pensions, and benefits. Together we make Calgary a great place to make a living, a great place to make a life.</div></div> </div> </div></div><div><div><div><div><div>  <div><strong>Reporting to the Systems Support Manager, and as a member of the Management Team, the Communications Systems Engineer provides leadership and functional guidance for technical support staff. This position is responsible for technical specification, maintenance and upgrading of systems including telephones, portable and mobile radios, radio consoles, voice recording systems, computer hardware and software, and networks. The Communications Systems Engineer will play a key role in developing Next Generation (NG9-1-1) technologies. Primary duties include:</strong></div><ul> <li> Manage or provide technical oversight to technology projects in accordance with corporate project management framework.</li>  <li> Create technological strategies, solutions and capacity for industry initiatives.</li>  <li> Liaise with and provide business oversight for Information Technology (IT) managed projects and applications.</li>  <li> Work with public safety partners (e.g. Police, Fire, EMS, Bylaw) on supporting systems and integrations.</li>  <li> Develop and maintain technical system documentation, diagrams and approve as an engineering authority.</li>  <li> Provide guidance and or leadership in developing NG9-1-1 capable systems including Internet Protocol (IP) telephony, advanced analytics and use of cognitive systems.</li> </ul> </div> </div> </div> </div></div><div><div><div><div><div><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong>Qualifications</strong></strong> </strong> </strong> </strong> </strong> </div>  <ul> 	<li>Typically possess a degree in a related field in Engineering, must be registered as a Professional Engineer in Canada, and will be required to obtain registration with The Association of Professional Engineers and Geoscientists of Alberta (APEGA) by the first day of work.</li> 	<li>Minimum of five years of post Professional Engineer experience is required.</li> 	<li>Strong knowledge of telephony, networks and trunked radio systems.</li> 	<li>Specific knowledge of IP telephony, Project 25 (P25) radio systems, network security and computer-aided dispatch is considered an asset.</li> 	<li>Knowledge of Public Safety Answer Point (PSAP) Operations and experience in emergency operations or a call centre environment are also considered assets.</li> 	<li>Strong project management skills as well as experience with technical writing and business development are essential.</li> 	<li>Success in this position requires superior technical aptitude, excellent problem solving, supervision and change management skills.</li> 	<li>Strong communication skills, be able to work under pressure and to maintain confidentiality in a secure environment</li> 	<li>	<div>Equivalent combinations of experience and education may be considered.</div> </li>	 </ul>  <div><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong>Pre-employment Requirements</strong> </strong> </strong> </strong> </strong> </strong> </strong> </div> <div>  <ul> 	<li>	<div>An enhanced security clearance and a pre-employment polygraph examination will be conducted.</div> </li>		<li>	<div>Successful applicants must provide proof of qualifications.</div> </li>	</ul></div> </div> </div> </div></div><div><div><div><div>	<div> <div> <div>Union: Exempt</div>  <div>Business annum</div> <div>Days of Work: This position works a 5 daywork week with one day off in a 3 week cycle.</div></div> <div> <div>Hours of work: Standard 35 hour work week and provides after hours into cogent and secure software designs.</li> </ul>  <strong>Candidate shall be chosen based upon the required skills below:</strong> </div><div>  <ul> <li>2+years of experience working with Windows kernel mode drivers</li> <li>4+years of experience working with Linux kernel mode modules</li> <li>Expertise in design and development of algorithms</li> <li>Expertise in advanced data structure concepts like linked lists, trees.</li> <li>Expertise in Optimization techniques</li> <li>Experience working in Performance evaluation and enhancement</li> <li>1 + year of experience with writing user mode application</li><li>2+ years of experience in writing unit and sanity test cases in C or C++.</li> <li>5+ years of experience in crash dump analysis and working with debugging tools like Windbg.</li> <li>Experience resolving critical customer issues.</li> <li>Experience with SDLC (Design, Development, Testing, Debugging and Bug fixing).</li> <li>Strong debugging skill as well as experience working on an Enterprise product line following security based coding practices is a must</li><li>Excellent communications skills are require</li> </ul>  <br/> <div><div>Educational Job_Description: <div><strong>Position Overview</strong></div><br/>  <div> <div>DevOps Engineers are responsible for creating and improving the tools and processes that power the building, validation, deployment, and monitoring of Replicon's globally distributed multi-tenant SaaS systems. DevOps are spreading and evangelizing the DevOps culture throughout Replicon.</div><br/>  <div>Working at Replicon is an opportunity to take on the unique challenges of a successful, large scale SaaS business application that existed before "web applications" as we know them today even existed. We have unusual challenges in such as extreme data consistency & reliability (nobody puts up with being paid incorrectly), large scale, complex legacy systems, enterprise-scale customizability, all combined with a friendly non-technical user experience. It's a "never-stop-learning" environment, where you'll be working with a strong technical team.</div>  <br/><strong><div>Responsibilities include:</div>  <br/></strong>   <ul>  	<li>Remove impediments in the technical development processes to support high-frequency, low lead-time software deployments</li> <li>Isolate risk of deployment or software failures to minimize scope and impact of production incidents</li> <li>Collaborate effectively with multiple product teams with unique internal processes and technologies</li> <li>Identifies where development and operational practices are outside industry norms; doesn't accept "we've always done it this way", works to do it better</li> <li>Effectively implements automation to augment or replace manual processes; prefers adopting rather than building software where appropriate</li> <li>Participates in the on-call rotation to efficiently triage critical production incidents, reduce incident severity, and document incident in detail for product team follow-up</li> </ul>  <strong><div>Qualifications:</div>  <br/></strong>   <ul>  	<li>Deep understanding of web technologies (HTTP, DNS, TLS/SSL, web services, load balancing)</li> <li>Experience with AWS (have used S3, EC2, RDS); would accept experience with Azure and/or Google Cloud</li> <li>Experience with automation tools (eg. Docker, Terraform, Jenkins, CodePipeline)</li> <li>Familiar with agile processes/scrum and TDD</li> <li>Built or have supported CI and CD processes</li> <li>Experience with post mortems/failure analysis - identifying the root cause & contributing factors of incidents</li> <li>Experience with a SaaS, globally-distributed multi-tenant system would be a preference</li> <li>Experience with a micro-services architecture, or the transition towards one</li> </ul>  </div> <br/>
Title: Senior Software Engineer DevOps
