Job_Description: <div><strong>Who You’ll Work With</strong> <br/><br/> The Cisco AMP engineering team is composed of highly skilled individuals who are comfortable working in a fast paced and technically challenging environment. The AMP team is a highly performant group that are involved with all stages of the product development process from solving complex engineering problems to working directly with customers. <br/><br/> Cisco enjoys a unique position and is leveraging an unprecedented capability to secure the network through intelligence derived from data collected on a global scale. Engineers on the ThreatGRID and Cisco Advanced Malware Protection (AMP) teams are leading the way in their capacity to invent, prove-out, and enable new technologies in big data analytics and threat intelligence. <br/><br/> <strong>What You'll Do</strong> <br/><br/> This is an exciting opportunity to work with the Cisco AMP engineering group based in Calgary to maintain, grow and scale the AMP infrastructure. The successful candidate will play a key role in supporting our AWS footprint through SaltStack. In addition, the selected applicant will be responsible for monitoring our production environment and resolving issues through established playbooks. <br/><br/> <strong>Who You Are</strong> <br/><br/> <em>Minimum Qualifications</em> <ul> <li>4+ years experience in the administration of enterprise-grade AWS infrastructures</li><li>Familiarity with software orchestration: SaltStack</li><li>Very strong Debian Linux system administration skills</li><li>Experience in Elasticsearch, Logstash and Kibana</li><li>Proficiency in infrastructure, service and application monitoring tools</li><li>Ability to be on-call 24x7</li> </ul> <em>Desired Skills</em> <ul> <li>Familiarity with JVM performance monitoring using JMX</li><li>Familiarity with Kafka and Zookeeper</li><li>Python background</li><li>Experience with Datadog</li> </ul> <strong>Why Cisco</strong> <br/><br/> We connect everything: people, processes, data, and things. We innovate everywhere, taking bold risks to shape the technologies that give us smart cities, connected cars, and handheld hospitals. And we do it in style with unique personalities who aren't afraid to change the way the world works, lives, plays and learns. <br/><br/> We are thought leaders, tech geeks, pop culture aficionados, and we even have a few purple haired rock stars. We celebrate the creativity and diversity that fuels our innovation. We are dreamers and we are doers.</div>

Job_Description: <strong>Position Overview</strong> <br/><br/> The <strong> Marketing team</strong> within <strong> University Relations</strong> is currently seeking a Full-time Limited Term <strong> Front-end Developer (Web)</strong> ,for approximately 1 year. <br/><br/> This position reports to the Associate Director, Digital Experience. <br/><br/> Working with, and guided by, the Senior Experience Designer, this role collaborates on UX concepts or visual designs and turns them into operational and interactive digital elements which work across multiple platforms while following the experience standards. The work includes responsibility for shared, global and custom user experience elements and their technical implementation regardless of backend technology (eg, global CSS, Javascript). The role requires the management of competing interests and deadlines, and the ability to manage multiple projects with shifting priorities within a SCRUM based development environment. The ideal candidate for this position will have a combination of creativity and technical expertise. <br/><br/> <strong>Position Description</strong> <br/><br/> <strong>Summary of Key Responsibilities</strong> (job functions include but are not limited to): <ul> 	<li>Understand and apply effective use of digital design and display technologies for digital applications and/or websites while adhering to university brand standards</li> 	<li>Determine technical solutions for experience challenges including the coding of the appropriate solution in a way it can be reusable by others on campus across multiple technologies and/or devices</li> 	<li>Strive to attain industry standards in digital usability</li> 	<li>Provide input into the front-end prototype</li> 	<li>Find development solutions for approved prototypes</li> 	<li>Work with the senior experience designer and back-end developers to build processes and procedures that ensure a robust and well-tested build</li> 	<li>Work with development teams in a SCRUM, Agile or Waterfall environment</li> 	<li>Provide input on project scope and timelines</li> 	<li>Deliver against the timelines and scope of the project</li>  </ul> <strong>Qualifications / Requirements:</strong> <ul> 	<li>Minimum of 4 years' experience as a front-end web developer and designer in the digital space with a particular focus on organizations with both central and distributed authoring models</li> 	<li>Undergraduate degree or diploma in a related field of study such as visual communications, web or digital design, graphic design, or a related field</li> 	<li>Intermediate technical and digital production experience in all of the following areas with a bias towards front-end development: HTML5, CSS3, SASS, JavaScript, jQuery / jQuery Mobile and Adobe Creative Suite</li> 	<li>Intermediate technical expertise and experience in mobile-first frameworks with a primary focus on Bootstrap 3 as well as experience with Drupal 8 and Twig templating, ReactJS and CSS Grid, PHP</li> 	<li>Strong knowledge of best practices for digital design and an understanding of the principles of responsive and accessible design</li> 	<li>Experience working from design flats and rapid prototyping tools such as Axure, as well as agile collaboration systems such as Jira within SCRUM, Agile and waterfall development teams</li> 	<li>Experience with code storage, versioning and promotion using Git</li> 	<li>Familiarity with both Mac and PC platforms as well as mobile operating systems such as iOS and Android for platform-testing purposes</li> 	<li>Ability to effectively manage multiple projects/tasks of varying complexities; ability to work autonomously and under pressure, as required</li> 	<li>Demonstrated interest in remaining at the forefront of trends and technologies; willingness to experiment with new ideas and tools</li> 	<li>Strong communications and interpersonal skills are required to work with area team members and to sustain strong relationships with internal clients and external vendors</li>  </ul> <strong>Application Deadline:</strong>  May 21, 2018 <br/><br/> <em>We would like to thank all applicants in advance for submitting their resumes. Please note, only those candidates chosen to continue on through the selection process will be contacted.</em> <br/><br/> <strong>Additional Information</strong> <br/><br/> This position is part of the AUPE bargaining unit, and falls under the <em><strong>Technical Job Family, Phase I</strong></em>. <br/><br/> To find out more about management and staff opportunities at the University of Calgary and all we have to offer, view our <strong>Management and Staff Careers website</strong>. <br/><br/> <strong>About the University of Calgary</strong> <br/><br/> The University of Calgary is Canada’s leading next-generation university – a living, growing and youthful institution that embraces change and opportunity with a can-do attitude. Located in the nation’s most enterprising city, the university is making tremendous progress on its Eyes High journey to be recognized as one of Canada’s top five research universities, grounded in innovative learning and teaching and fully integrated with the community it both serves and leads. The University of Calgary inspires and supports discovery, creativity and innovation across all disciplines. For more information, visit <strong>ucalgary.ca</strong>. <br/><br/> <em>The University of Calgary recognizes that a diverse staff/faculty benefits and enriches the work, learning and research experiences of the entire campus and greater community. We are committed to removing barriers that have been historically encountered by some people in our society. We strive to recruit individuals who will further enhance our diversity and will support their professional success while they are here. We encourage all qualified applicants to apply, however preference will be given to Canadian citizens and permanent residents of Canada.</em>

Job_Description: At General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada, Canada’s premiere defence company, innovation happens on a daily basis. We develop and deliver highly-complex leading edge technology, products and systems that make important contributions to our customer’s success in land, airborne, maritime and public safety applications. The challenges and opportunities are endless.The results – incredible. <br/><br/> Our employees are exceptional. We are proud to employ more than 1,100 talented individuals across Canada. Working in a collaborative environment, our employees are encouraged daily to contribute their technical knowledge and expertise. Our employees are passionate, dedicated, and conscientious about the work they do which results in our ability to deliver the highest value, customized solutions in order to meet the most demanding requirements. <br/><br/> General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada is growing their Calgary team and currently have new opportunities for System Engineers, P3 for our EvO program. We are staffing for an existing program to deliver a world class next-generation secure communications system for the Ministry of Defence (MoD) in the United Kingdom. General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada is working in partnership with General Dynamics Mission Systems - United Kingdom to design, develop, and deliver an exceptional Command, Control, Communications, Computing and Intelligence (C4I) system based on open architecture and industry standard principles. Our Calgary team is developing key software and hardware products as part of this offering to enable tactical voice and data communications, sensor and device integration, and common application services. <br/><br/> The program includes system design, software and hardware design, system integration, and system validation. The project will be a multi-site development with activities spanning several product development groups in Calgary and across the General Dynamics Mission Systems International business area. The system engineering team consists of several design teams, each focusing on a specific set of software or hardware components and services. This program is being delivered using a Scaled Agile Framework organization. The successful candidate will be system engineer within an Agile Release Train that has been established to define and develop the system solution. <br/><br/> Typical Duties: <br/><br/> The responsibilities and range of activities will vary, but in general will include: <ul> <li>Participate in an interdisciplinary integrated project team environment under the supervision of more senior engineers and leads</li><li>Perform system requirements analysis</li><li>Perform system design and/or analysis functions based on requirements</li><li>Define SAFe Features that describe the work to be executed.</li><li>Prepare and review system specifications, system design documents, and interface design documents</li><li>Provide design information to hardware and software engineers implementing the system</li><li>Prepare and review test plans, procedures and results</li><li>Investigate defects and propose solutions</li><li>Support the change management process as the system design evolves</li><li>Document the analysis, design and test in accordance with development standards</li><li>Plan activities/tasks for each design iteration</li><li>Report progress against plans</li> </ul> Required Skills & Experience: <ul> <li>Experience is required in a number of the following areas:</li><li>4+ years of experience in systems engineering or similar discipline</li> <li>Disciplined approach to system engineering with knowledge of the full system life cycle</li><li>Experience with model based design tools (PTC Integrity Modeler in particular) and SysML</li><li>DOORS Requirements Management</li><li>Rational Team Concert</li><li>Tactical Communications and Networking Systems</li><li>Information Management Systems</li><li>Voice and Multimedia</li><li>Strong communication skills, both written and verbal</li><li>Strong problem solving and analysis skills</li><li>Enthusiastic contributor, willing to learn new skills and take on ownership of work</li><li>Ability to work effectively both independently and in a team environment, with minimum supervision</li><li>Experience with Agile product development methods</li> </ul> Education: <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Engineering, or applicable scientific discipline is required</li> </ul> <strong>Minimum 10 year consecutive residence in Canada – for Canadian Secret Security Clearance</strong> <br/> Applicants will be required to obtain/hold a valid and current Canadian security clearance to gain access to the classified spaces, information and equipment in order to perform the work associated with this position. <br/><br/> General Dynamics Mission Systems – Canada is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace. Workplace accommodations are available.
Title: Systems Engineer - EvO (P3)

Job_Description: Category : Engineering <br/> Location/City : AB - Edmonton <br/>  <br/> Athenian Group is a full-service placement agency providing Professional Technical Recruitment, Staffing and Payroll services to Canadaâ?'s top Consulting, Engineering, Manufacturing and Construction companies.Our focus is on providing businesses with the highest quality of worker for both contract and permanent staff positions.Our client, is a leading Engineering, Procurement, Construction Company with expertise in oil sands, refining, petrochemicals and pipeline segments and covers both operational and engineering aspectsCurrently we are recruiting for;INSTRUMENTATION & CONTROL SYSTEMS ENGINEERYou are a motivated self-starter and team contributor with eight plus (8+) yearsâ progressive Instrumentation & Controls Engineering experience, within an EPC and/or industrial plant environment (Petrochemical focus).KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES & EXPERIENCE	Identify / prepare key deliverables (P&IDs, CWPs, MRs, Control Narratives, Shut-down Keys, etc.) conforming to internal and external requirements throughout various project stages (scoping studies, detailed design, etc.).	Develop Instrumentation & Controls engineering specific project requirements through the preparation of design basis documents (design criteria) and identifying / confirming standards and specifications to be used.	Must be willing and able to travel to client facilities as required to scope jobs, attend project meetings and execute deliverables.	Demonstrated ability to interface between the engineering disciplines, project engineer, project manager and the client to ensure timely delivery and accuracy of information.	Work with discipline engineers and designers to ensure technical integrity and designs per Company and client standards / specifications.	Embrace and support a coaching / learning environment with a focus on knowledge transfer and increasing technical competencies of the department.	Attend process hazard analysis and SIL/LOPA meetings and provide recommendations on selected processes and control system implementation per project / client specifications.	Ensure recommendations are in accordance with industrial regulations	Prepare Man-Hour Estimates and Define project deliverables.	Ability to efficiently contribute to the development of all project deliverables.	Plan / Monitor / Review: project scope, schedule, costs, and quality of completed work (e.g. key drawings, design concepts, calculations, etc.).	Program and maintain existing process control systems, specifically Experion PKS, Honeywell TPS/TDC 3000, Emerson DeltaV, Allen Bradley PLC, Triconex SIS, Moore Quadlog SIS/BMS etc...	Ensure the timely resolution of technical issues, technical requests for information and the support for process control and application related problems	Provide Commissioning & Start Up (C&SU) support to sustaining projects	Apply continuous improvement techniques to optimize control systems reliability and performance	Develop, manage and sustain control system performance related to Key Performance Indicators (KPI's)EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:	Degree in a related engineering discipline such as Electrical, Computer, Computer Process Control or Instrumentation is required	8+ years related experience	Previous EPC experience required	Previous Oil Sands Extraction, Oil refinery / Upgrading experience required	Alberta P.Eng. or P.L.(Eng.) status is mandatory	Working knowledge (hands-on programming and configuration) of Honeywell DCS platforms	Working knowledge (hands-on programming and configuration) of Triconex PLC platform	Motivated, self-starter with ability to work under minimal supervision	Hands on experience of Basic Process Control System (BPCS), PLC and Safety Systems - hardware and software configuration	Experience with Honeywell Experion PKS/ TPS/TDC3000 System, Emerson DeltaV System, Triconex SIS, Moore Quadlog SIS GE Mark V/VI and Allen Bradley PLCs is an asset	Experience in installing, troubleshooting and maintaining communications between various control systems using industrial communication protocols like Object linking and embedding process control (OPC) and Modbus is an asset	Experience in maintenance/construction and commissioning/operations support would be an assetIf you or someone you know is interested in this position, please contact;Jason Wahljason@atheniangroup.caEdmonton â 780-499-5959Calgary â 403-969-9962North America â 877-596-5522

Job_Description: <strong>We are an experience design agency with a relentless focus on the customer.</strong> <br/><br/> The way a customer experiences a brand has a profound impact on perception, purchase behavior and loyalty. Thats why our work begins and ends with our clients customers. We listen to them. Validate with them. We even include them in our design process. By creating customer experiences that are simple, valuable, entertaining, and convenient, we deliver measurable results for some of the worlds most admired brands. <br/><br/> <strong>Today were 950 people in 11 offices on 4 continents.</strong> <br/><br/> We love diverse points of view, open minds, and people who are passionate, driven, and real. And we love all things digital, too. <br/><br/> <strong>Senior Developer</strong> <br/><br/> The Critical Mass tech team is looking for an inspired & motivated Senior Front-End Developer to join our team. There is also an opportunity for a contract extension pending client needs. <br/><br/> Primary responsibilities will be to use HTML5, CSS3 and some JS to develop new features for our clients responsive websites. In all cases were taking advantage of everything HTML5 & CSS3 have to offer, as well as the latest in responsive grid frameworks, templating engines and various JavaScript patterns for reusability and performance. Ideal candidates must have extensive experience in responsive HTML and CSS development, dont necessarily need to be an expert in JavaScript, but some experience and a deep passion to improve your craft is a must. The role will be mentored by a Tech Lead. Candidates will be working hand in hand with Creative and UX to fulfill client requests. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul> <li>Rapid prototyping with code, using modern front-end frameworks and a digital pattern library</li> <li>Deliver solutions balancing technical and business requirements. Experience has taught you what works. Your long history in the game helps you choose the best mix of proven and cutting-edge technology.</li> <li>Interacting with project teams to understand business and user requirements</li> <li>Maintaining high coding standards and practices and exercise quality control on all aspects of web development</li> <li>Problem-solving in all areas of web development</li> </ul> <strong>Requirements:</strong>  <ul> <li>6+ years demonstrated development experience with hand-coding advanced HTML, CSS, HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript</li> <li>Experience developing with modern front-end tools and frameworks such, e.g. AngularJS,</li> <li>Backbone.js, SASS/LESS, Node.js</li> <li>Package manager and automation tool experience (npm, gulp, grunt)</li> <li>Demonstrated understanding of Responsive Web Design principles</li> <li>Proficiency with Semantic HTML Markup</li> <li>Accessibility knowledge (WCAG 2.0 Level AA) preferred</li> <li>Experience diagnosing and solving cross-browser/cross-platform issues</li> <li>Experience working with cross-functional and cross-office teams</li>  </ul>

Job_Description: The Role<br/><br/>Pason is seeking a Site Reliability Engineer to join the team in improving the reliability of Pason’s DataHub infrastructure. This role requires a combination of Linux system administration, configuration management (Ansible and Puppet) as well as scripting and automation skills to support Pason’s goals of improved uptime and disaster recovery timeframes. In addition, a solid understanding of Dev/Ops and Agile principles including Continuous Integration and Test-Driven Development in a cloud-based environment are highly valued.<br/><br/>Essential Duties and Responsibilities   <ul> <li>Ensure our cloud infrastructure is running without interruption and with proper monitoring and visibility</li> <li>Collaborate with developers to design fault-tolerant, load balanced services that can be deployed automatically to various cloud providers</li> <li>Identify and remove all manual deployment steps from existing services by moving all configuration to version control and configuration management systems</li> <li>Manage and evolve our OpenStack private cloud platform</li> <li>Improving disaster recovery timeframes and capabilities by migrating services to Ubuntu, Puppet and Amazon Web Services</li> <li>Improve system health and recovery times by improving monitoring and system visibility for all systems</li> <li>Participate in an 24/7 on-call rotation</li> </ul>  Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities   <ul> <li>Experience with the following technologies: Python, Bash, OpenStack, AWS, MySQL, Linux (Ubuntu), VMWare, InfluxDB</li> <li>Experience with configuration management and version control (Puppet, SVN, Git) is highly valued</li> <li>Experience with Amazon EC2 and S3</li> <li>Experience working with load balancers</li> <li>Experience working with or on software development teams</li> <li>Organizational skills and the ability to work on multiple tasks & projects and adapt to frequent change</li> <li>Ability to work as a member of a team and independently with limited direct supervision in a self-motivated and self-directed manner</li> <li>Self-awareness, with a desire for constant self-improvement</li> <li>Strong advocate for quality on the team and motivated to deliver top quality results</li> <li>Strong problem-solving skills</li> <li>Ability to work in a fast-paced environment</li> </ul>
Title: Site Reliability Engineer

Job_Description: Company Description<div><p>ShoreWise Consulting is a world class IT solution provider offering technology solutions and managed services in verticals such as Customer Contact, Healthcare and Finance (banking & trading).</p></div>Job Description<div><p>Programmer / Developer<br></p><p><b><u>Essential Demonstrate experience in resume in the following areas</u></b></p><ul><li>Strong design portfolio of work that demonstrates expertise across digital, interface and graphic design, responsive web design, typography, navigation and iconography.</li><li>Superior knowledge working with the latest versions of Mac OS, Photoshop and Illustrator</li><li>Ability to implement designs using HTML, CSS and Javascript</li><li>Understanding of user-centered design best practices</li><li>Ability to visualize and verbalize your ideas to teams and clients</li><li>Have an understanding of technologies and how they can help and hinder your design solutions</li><li>Facilitation skills when working with cross functional teams</li></ul><p><b><u>Desired</u></b></p><ul><li>Passionate about all aspects of interactive design and a keen eye for details</li><li>Understanding of current Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.0</li><li>Experience designing for enterprise or social products</li><li>Strong knowledge of web standards, and cross-browser development</li><li>Webtrends and Google Analytics</li><li>Mobile Design & Development</li><li>Experience with APIs</li><li>Experience using ReactJS, Angular JS and SASS/LESS</li></ul><p><b><u>Skill Required:</u></b></p><ul><li>Latest versions of Mac OS, Photoshop and Illustrator </li><li>HTML/CSS/JAVASCRIPT</li></ul></div>Additional Information<div><p>Minimum 6 Months contract with possibility of extension</p></div>I'm interested

Job_Description: Robert Half Technology is currently seeking a Senior Business Intelligence Developer for our Calgary Client. <br/> If you have the qualifications we are looking for, please submit your resume online to stephanie.sherlock@rht.com <br/><br/> <strong>RESPONSIBILITIES</strong> <br/> ×	Accountable for the design, development and support of databases, data marts and reporting solutions. The position will be influential in architecting the BI solutions based on business needs. <br/> ×	Lead BI and Data Management practice for the business. <br/> ×	Design and develop data models and ETL processes for downstream reporting and analysis, including the creation and maintenance of fact and dimension tables within a data warehouse and the development of validation tools and processes. <br/> ×	Document data flow and design <br/> ×	Establishing and maintaining BI best practices and standards <br/> ×	Share technical expertise with the team and provide recommendations for best practices. <br/> ×	Establish data governance and data management principles to improve data quality <br/> ×	Collaborate with team members to develop quality databases and data marts for business use <br/> ×	Review, evaluate, develop and maintain business intelligence systems including: dimension and fact tables, validation tools and processes, user monitoring and security <br/> ×	Other duties as assigned

Job_Description: Autodata Solutions is looking for a <strong>Database Developer</strong> to join their growing Calgary team! <br/><br/> <strong>Position Overview:</strong> <br/><br/> As a Database Developer, you will work within our New Product department to create database driven applications that are high performing, scalable and efficient. You will define standards and models for our database architecture. In collaboration with other teams, you will strategically design and implement databases across a portfolio of technology products. <br/><br/> <strong>Key Responsibilities:</strong>  <ul> <li>Analyze, design and develop MS SQL/MySQL code (tables, indexes, constraints, queries, stored procedures, functions, views, triggers, etc) as part of product development</li> <li>Utilize in-depth SQL Development skills to develop complex SQL calls and tune existing calls</li> <li>Configure, optimize and support MS SQL & MySQL and/or other relational databases</li> <li>Be the database subject matter expect for the Development teams and work with them to ensure the databases are always performing at the best levels possible</li> <li>Identify and develop system requirements considering desired results, hardware limitations and operating requirements</li> <li>Design and implement monitoring and reporting for high usage, impacting queries and error messages throughout all servers</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong>  <ul> <li>3+ years previous experience in database design for high volume transactional enterprise systems</li> <li>5+ years experience in developing enterprise SQL code</li> <li>Expertise with database design tools (such as Toad Data Modeler)</li> <li>Strong experience with cloud hosting providers (ex. Azure)</li> <li>Past experience with NoSQL databases like Cassandra are considered an asset</li> <li>Adaptable, flexible, hands-on creative problem solver</li> <li>Good knowledge of release management and configuration management practices</li> </ul> Autodata Solutions is a consulting, technology services and business process outsource company dedicated to the automotive industry. Founded in 1990, it is our mission to provide solutions that increase the effectiveness of the automotive sales chain and help put vehicles in consumers' driveways. Clients benefit from the expertise we have gained from our singular focus on the automotive sector as well as 27 years of successful client engagements. <br/><br/> For more information about Autodata, please visit our company website at www.autodata.net. <br/><br/> We thank all applicants for their interest however only those selected for an interview will be notified. Autodata Solutions is an equal opportunity employer. We are compliant with AODA legislation; if you require work related accommodations, please specify.
Title: Database Developer

Job_Description: Who You'll Work With <br/> The Advanced Threat Security Team in Cisco's Security Business Group is building a global scale, multi product security platform with an emphasis on Threat Intelligence and Incident Response support. <br/> Our system runs as a distributed cluster in the cloud and shrunk down to a single on-premises appliance. This keeps us focused on simple solutions, clear abstractions between services, composition of services, functional data processing, and minimal state. <br/> Our team is distributed across the U.S. and works from home with occasional office visits and travel -- this requires excellent written communications, self-confidence, trust in your co-workers, and assuming ownership of the problems you encounter. <br/>  <br/> What You'll Do <br/> This is an exciting opportunity to work with the Cisco AMP engineering group based in Calgary to assure quality for the Advanced Malware Protection platform. The hired employee will be responsible for testing on Windows, Linux, and Mac platforms as well as operating within a cloud architecture in both a manual and automated fashion. Furthermore, that person will be required to read technical documents, create test cases/test plans, contribute to overall design, and perform other tasks to improve software quality. <br/><br/> Who You Are   <ul> <li>Ability to work independently when writing test cases, test plans, and other supporting documentation</li> <li>Prior experience in collaborating with both technical engineers and non-technical customers</li> <li>Experience testing in mixed OS environments including Windows, Mac, and Linux</li> <li>Development or automated testing experience in either Ruby or Python</li> <li>Testing and/or configuration of security products</li> </ul>  Why Cisco <br/> We connect everything: people, processes, data, and things. We innovate everywhere, taking bold risks to shape the technologies that give us smart cities, connected cars, and handheld hospitals. And we do it in style with unique personalities who aren't afraid to change the way the world works, lives, plays and learns. <br/>  <br/> We are thought leaders, tech geeks, pop culture aficionados, and we even have a few purple haired rock stars. We celebrate the creativity and diversity that fuels our innovation. We are dreamers and we are doers. <br/>  <br/> We Are Cisco.<br/>  <div>dicedev #GD2015</div>
Title: Software Engineer in Test II

Job_Description: <strong>Job Description</strong><br/><br/>SNC-Lavalin provides cutting-edge engineering, procurement, construction and financing solutions to projects in more than 100 countries around the world. From the Canadian Arctic to the Southern African region and Australasia, our multicultural workforce is driven by a fierce pride in their work and a pioneering vision. <br/><br/> SNC-Lavalin is truly a global leader in its field, and has been chosen to design and build some of the most prestigious projects in the world. Within Canada, our Rail & Transit team has been selected to design and deliver most of the recent greenfield and brownfield LRT, ALRT and Light Metro jobs awarded in the last 10 years including the Canada Line, Calgary West LRT, Edmonton North LRT, Evergreen Line, Confederation Line, Eglinton-Crosstown, and the Réseau Express Métropolitain. <br/><br/> Our Rail Control Systems team, under the broader Rail & Transit Engineering division, deliver solutions which include rail signalling, train control, and communications systems. The Rail Control Systems team is expanding their capabilities into the Class 1 railway domain and is looking for a Senior Signalling Systems Engineer, reporting to the Manager, Signalling & Train Control Systems to join our growing team. This position can be based in Vancouver or Calgary. To perform this role successfully, the individual will be responsible for but not limited to the following: <ul> <li>Lead a group of technical specialists in the design of conventional railway signalling systems</li><li>Lead the review of client specifications and requirements</li><li>Lead the generation of technical specifications</li><li>Lead the production of signal designs including wiring plans, application software, and test plans</li><li>Interaction with clients, senior management and technical leads</li><li>Interaction with construction management and delivery leads</li><li>Support of construction and installation activities in the field</li><li>Support for Test & Commissioning and setting to work of Class 1 railway signalling systems</li><li>Support for System Assurance / Verification & Validation teams in the delivery of Class 1 railway signalling systems</li> </ul> <strong><strong>Skills and Experiences</strong></strong> <ul> <li>10+ years proven track record and experience in the design and development of Class 1 railway systems, with specific conventional signalling systems design experience and expertise in this domain.</li><li>Experience in design of interlockings and crossings in Canada and the US with working knowledge of relay and microprocessor based interlocking control systems.</li> <li>Ability to read, understand, and modify signal plans for traditional relay based signalling systems as well as application software for microprocessor based signalling systems.</li><li>Experience in the Testing & Commissioning of conventional signalling systems.</li><li>Knowledge of sub-system level technologies and wayside components of signalling systems, including: power switch machines, track circuits, and signals.</li><li>Knowledge of AREMA, CROR, Transport Canada, and FRA regulations/standards.</li><li>Able to lead, mentor and coach a team of signalling systems designers/engineers.</li><li>Able to lead discussions with the partners, clients and suppliers and to interact with senior discipline staff as overall delivery lead.</li><li>Excellent MS Office skills, especially Excel and Word.</li><li>Experience of multi-disciplinary technical environments, people management and financial management.</li><li>Excellent written, presentation and communication/briefing skills; able to present to large audiences of industry experts.</li><li>Excellent networking and client relationship management skills; able to influence and manage key stakeholders and build trust and advocacy with clients.</li><li>Excellent people management and interpersonal skills; able to engage staff and address difficult issue effectively and fairly.</li><li>Experience in the design of Positive Train Control (PTC) systems is considered an asset.</li><li>Experience in the design of Cab Signalling based systems is considered an asset.</li> </ul> <strong><strong> Travel:</strong></strong> <ul>  <li>Approximately 25% travel within Canada</li>  </ul> <strong> Qualifications:</strong> <ul>  <li>P.Eng designation with EGBC or APEGA is required, Electrical or Mechanical degree</li> <li>SNC-Lavalin is one of the world's largest engineering and construction companies. Our Rail & Transit Engineering Unit is responsible for the development and execution of large transportation infrastructure projects valued at several billion. <br/><br/> We offer an opportunity to work on some of the largest projects in North America. You will work in an environment that will give you an opportunity to excel and advance in your career.</li>  </ul>  <strong>Worker Type</strong>Employee<strong>Job Type</strong>Regular<br/><br/>At SNC-Lavalin, we seek to hire individuals with diverse characteristics, backgrounds and perspectives. We strongly believe that world-class talent makes no distinctions based on gender, ethnic or national origin, sexual identity and orientation, age, religion or disability, but enriches itself through these differences.
Title: Senior Signalling Systems Engineer - Vancouver or Calgary based

Job_Description: The CBDM works collaboratively with the Commercial Account Manager (CAM) and District Commercial Banking Team to seamlessly transfer new customer relationships, with the supporting Customer Action Plan, to the CAM for future revenue generation, in accordance with bank standards and policies and will support retention efforts for this set of customers where warranted. The CBDM will address the customer’s business needs with an emphasis on providing holistic banking solutions across their Operational Business Management Cycle using the RM “The BMO Way” process (The Complete Conversation). This entails identifying and selling appropriate solutions across: Financing, Deposit, Cash Management (Payment and Collections) solutions as well as the referral of complex sales of financing, cash management and Personal/PCG product needs to the appropriate partner (e.g. CFD). In addition, the CBDM will partner with the Cash Management Specialist (CMS) to develop non-standard pricing /negotiated customer proposals that meet profitability standards and ensure that customer loyalty objectives are achieved through the delivery of exceptional service. <br/><br/> The CBDM will ensure credit decisions and recommendations are in accordance with sound credit-granting principles as described in the Commercial Lending Process and in compliance with Bank Policies & Procedures, and ensure compliance with internal and external requirements and regulations. The CBDM plays a strong role as a knowledgeable and experienced professional in the success of the District and is responsible for enhancing BMO’s presence within the community. <br/><br/> <strong>Risk Management</strong>  <ul> <li>Protect the Bank’s assets and maintain quality of the Banks lending portfolio by adhering to Commercial lending processes, policies & procedures, legal and ethical requirements and regulations, audit requirements, and established risk guidelines. Ensure all Commercial Banking Business is in conformity with Bank Policies and other guidelines</li>   <li>Accountable for risk management and minimizing losses through monitoring and control reports, (managing quality of information, analysis, profitability and credit recommendations, ensuring all legal, regulatory, ethical and compliance requirements, audits, and verifications are completed in accordance with Bank Policies & Procedures (i.e. hand off deal with no trailing deficiencies)) in executing sales of credit/non-credit products and services to Commercial customers and prospects</li>   <li>Document and follow-up on any discrepancies to procedures, with significant operational risk and escalate, as required</li>   <li>Respond to questions and/or resolve issues raised through audits and quality checks, to ensure lending decisions are adequately documented, clearly communicated and followed</li>   <li>Exercise individually held Commercial Recommendation Discretionary Limits (i.e.: overdrafts, credit applications), ensuring credit decisions and recommendations are in accordance with sound credit-granting principles and in compliance with the Bank’s policies and related procedures (i.e.: Lending Directives, Commercial Lending Policy, etc.); completing analysis; confirming security valuations; completing and approving credit applications for authorizations under Commercial Lending Policy</li>   <li>Adhere to Know Your Customer Rules and Bank Policies & Procedures for the prevention of loss due to fraud, counterfeiting, money laundering, or defalcation; identify and report suspicious and other reportable transactions or patterns of activity that are suspected to be related to money laundering</li>   <li>Maintain up-to-date knowledge and understanding of Commercial products, processes, and relevant legal, regulatory and technology requirements, including BASEL II risk rating requirements.</li>  </ul> <strong>Planning</strong>  <ul> <li>Develop, implement, review and revise short (3 – 12 months) and long term (1 – 2 year) rolling sales strategies and tactical plans, focusing on identifying profitable business prospects and creating a network of referral sources for the assigned territory that will result in meeting or exceeding sales, service, revenue, share of wallet and loyalty targets.</li>   <li>Apply territory management, relationship selling and relationship expansion strategy and performance to potential Commercial Banking customers ensuring comprehensive, holistic financial solutions</li>   <li>Review and monitor sales, revenue and share of wallet performance against plan, identify gaps, develop appropriate action plans (as appropriate) and share best practices.</li>   <li>Contribute to District Business Plan (as appropriate), regarding new business opportunities, increased profitability and new customer business growth potential, based on knowledge of local marketplace.</li>   <li>Review sales and service plans on an ongoing basis to reflect opportunities and changes in the competitive local market environment; develop an action plan, and update CBAM on any changes that may impact the Area/District Business Plan</li>   <li>Plan, implement and maintain an effective business development and community involvement strategy to protect and expand profitable Commercial businesses, utilizing an extensive network of referral resources</li>   <li>Develop and co-ordinate individual relationship planning, implementation and review activities with key BMO Partner Groups (Corporate Finance, PCG, Transactional Credit, Personal Banking) identifying opportunities to ensure customer’s needs and expectations are profitably met and/or exceeded. Outline to the CAM and CBAM in the Relationship hand off , any significant risk or untoward factors that could impair the ongoing success of the customer from information garnered in relationship and business generation activities.</li>  </ul> <strong>Business Development, Sales and Service</strong>  <ul> <li>Obtain and utilize market/industry/customer knowledge to proactively maximize sales, customer share of wallet increase cash management penetration, revenue per customer and customer loyalty for all new customers</li>   <li>Complete proactive, focused, profitable sales of commercial solutions based on referrals/prospects, and knowledge of the assigned territory to improve share of wallet and market share</li>   <li>Concurrently support commercial market share expansion, customer experience and share of wallet objectives to achieve revenue growth, share of wallet, acquisition, cash management sales, and customer loyalty objectives leveraging the RM The BMO Way process and The Complete Conversation</li>   <li>Be highly visible in the marketplace to proactively, and with a long-term focus, develop an internal and external network of referral sources that effectively generates prospects for new business to maintain a consistent pipeline of prospective customers for future execution. This will include Corporate Finance Account Managers, financial investors, financial professionals & consultants.</li>   <li>Provide prospective commercial customers holistic banking solutions to meet their banking needs across the customers’ entire Operational Business Management Cycle: Make Payments, Collect Funds, Manage Deposits and Financing</li>   <li>Establish linkages with PCG Partners, Headquarters and “Industry Specialty” Groups, to leverage sales and referral opportunities, improve share of wallet, and to maximize customer experience and profitability to the bank</li>   <li>Contribute to the Bank’s business objectives and increasing share of wallet through direct market intervention by way of sales calls (individually and jointly with DVP, Commercial Account Managers, CMS), establishing a personal referral network and other business development activities.</li>   <li>Accountable for proactive, focused sales of Commercial solutions and services, based on referrals/prospects, knowledge of local market,</li>   <li>Develop an understanding of cross channel sales referral processes, local market, and existing business relationships to maximize balance acquisition, share of wallet, revenue, and to acquire new Commercial customers</li>   <li>Establish and enhance the Bank’s profile by participating in meaningful and focused business and community activities and seeking out and creating opportunities to generate new Commercial business</li>   <li>Apply resourceful business development and relationship management sales and service principles, practices and techniques, to support the achievement of target level sales of Commercial lending ,deposit products and services, including complex cash management solutions</li>   <li>Champion a sales environment that achieves consistent, superior customer service and good working relationships with Commercial Account Manager, Customer Service Officers (CSO’s), , Cash Management Specialist (CMS), Personal Banking and PCG Banking partners</li>   <li>Leverage technology, applications and tools to identify and refer profitable sales opportunities and to ensure optimal effectiveness, efficiency, and delivery of Commercial products and services</li>   <li>Accompany and support the District Vice-President and Commercial Account Manager with customer interactions, and relationship building</li>   <li>Develop and co-ordinate individual relationship planning, implementation and review activities with key BMO Partner Groups (Corporate Finance, PCG, Personal Banking) identifying opportunities to ensure customer’s needs and expectations are profitably met and/or exceeded. Outline to the CAM and CBAM in the Relationship hand off , any significant risk or untoward factors that could impair the ongoing success of the customer from information garnered in relationship and business generation activities.</li>   <li>Effectively transition the relationship management of all new customers to the appropriate CAM at the appropriate time and in accordance with bank standards.</li>   <li>Provide timely and effective problem resolution, escalating customer issues as necessary as per the established Problem Resolution Process</li>   <li>Respond to questions and/or issues raised relative to customers that have been handed off to the Commercial Account Manager ensuring a high level of customer satisfaction.</li>  </ul> <strong>Role Requirements:</strong>  <ul> <li>Commercial Credit Qualification with Limits</li>   <li>L1- Working/L2 In-Depth understanding of Commercial Products, Commercial Lending Process, Commercial Lending Directives, enterprise credit risk policies and standards and all supporting processes and technology</li>   <li>L2 -Designated Real Estate Account manager (DREAM) designation is required for this role with the DREAM designation level aligned to the portfolio customers being managed (ie. Portfolio requirement to manage customers with construction risk vs. no construction risk).</li>  </ul> <strong>Preferred:</strong> Credit adjudication experience. Good understanding of capital structuring to support the identification of referral <br/><br/> We’re here to help <br/><br/> At BMO we have a shared purpose; we put the customer at the centre of everything we do – helping people is in our DNA. For 200 years we have thought about the future—the future of our customers, our communities and our people. We help our customers and our communities by working together, innovating and pushing boundaries to bring them our very best every day. Together we’re changing the way people think about a bank. <br/><br/> As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset. <br/><br/> To find out more visit us at https://bmocareers.com. <br/><br/> BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.
Title: Commercial Business Development Manager

Job_Description: <DIV>Join our growing team and help make us the Bank of Business in Canada</DIV> <br/> <DIV>We’re on a journey to become the ‘bank of choice’ for the franchising sector. We’re looking for enthusiastic people with the business development, sales and analytical skills to provide industry-leading financial solutions that continue to differentiate BMO in this growing and diverse sector.</DIV>  <br/> <DIV>BMO’s financing programs meet the unique needs of franchise networks from start-up to multi-unit consolidations. We’re building our reputation in the franchising sector, and opportunities to provide banking and financing solutions are available. Our holistic approach to the franchising sector is complemented by our partnership with BMO Business Banking, BMO Retail Banking, BMO Private Banking and BMO Capital Markets.</DIV>  <br/> <DIV>BMO expansion includes introducing Business Development Directors as franchising sector market leaders into six regions nationally with high concentrations of franchise networks.</DIV>  <br/> <DIV>What is the opportunity?</DIV> <br/> <DIV>Reporting directly to the Head, Franchise Sector, the Business Development Director is accountable for the implementation of the franchising sector strategy to optimize the client experience and loyalty, drive sales results and maximize sustainable profitability in alignment with BMO’s risk appetite.</DIV>  <br/> <DIV>What will you do?</DIV> <br/> <DIV>The Business Development Director acts as the industry segment leader for their designated geographic region. They will represent BMO in external communications including promotional opportunities including industry conferences and symposia, on professional committees and in community activities, all to network for profitable client relationships.</DIV>  <br/><strong><DIV>The Business Development Director will:</DIV> <br/> </strong>  <li>Generate new and profitable business in the franchise industry segment;</li> <li>Define the desired client experience within their region;</li> <li>Maintain an active outreach with key clients and prospects, and to work collaboratively with the district business banking team to identify prospective clients, drive growth and aid in retention efforts of the franchise portfolio;</li> <li>Leverage partnerships with internal BMO parties such as retail and private bankers to deliver a holistic offering and enhanced client experience;</li> <li>Provide leadership on all matters related to financing solutions for the franchise sector for the region’s business bank and all banking partners;</li> <li>Develop and manage relationships with key influencers and partners in the franchise ecosystem for the region, which includes regional and national sponsorships.</li> What you bring to the table: <br/><br/> • Demonstrated history of business development and sales. <br/><br/> • Experience and demonstrated strong knowledge of the franchise industry. <br/><br/> • Inclusive of a minimum of 3 years’ relationship management experience providing business banking solutions to franchise networks. <br/><br/> • Established presence in the franchise ecosystem. <br/><br/> • Comfortable when interacting with business leaders, up to the C-suite level. <br/><br/> • Exceptional communication skills, both oral and written. <br/><br/> • Strong negotiation skills. <br/><br/> • Strong due diligence skills, including loan structure terms & conditions. <br/><br/> We’re here to help <br/><br/> At BMO we have a shared purpose; we put the customer at the centre of everything we do – helping people is in our DNA. For 200 years we have thought about the future—the future of our customers, our communities and our people. We help our customers and our communities by working together, innovating and pushing boundaries to bring them our very best every day. Together we’re changing the way people think about a bank. <br/><br/> As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset. <br/><br/> To find out more visit us at https://bmocareers.com. <br/><br/> BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.
Title: Business Development Director – Franchising
