Job_Description: <div> <div> Program Manager - Standards Development, Petroleum & Natural Gas <br/> 	<div> <div>To display this page you need a browser with JavaScript support.<br/> <div> <div> Job ID: <br/>  J0418-1125</div><br/>  <div> Job Title:  <br/>  Program Manager - Standards Development, Petroleum & Natural Gas</div><br/>  <div> Job Type: <br/>  Permanent Full Time</div><br/>  <div> Number Of Positions: <br/>  1</div><br/>  <div> <div> Job Summary:<br/><br/>CSA Group has an opportunity for a Program Manager, Standards in the Petroleum & Natural Gas sector. This role is responsible for providing strategic and execution leadership in the development of standards-based solutions for the Oil and Gas program; addressing the needs of industry, government and the public, primarily through the management of a team of Project Managers. <br/><br/> A leader, motivator, and builder, you thrive on developing and executing plans and strategies for expanding CSA’s presence in safety standards. An outstanding relationship builder, you have a track record of developing and maintaining strategic relationships with senior leaders within industry, government and academia. <br/><br/> Facilitative and customer-driven, you have a knack for developing the solutions that pragmatically address CSA clients’ needs. You also understand the importance of effective people and process management, utilizing CSA’s recently introduced metrics to augment your team’s decision-making. <br/><br/> You have proven, well-developed decision-making and communication skills, along with exceptional organizational and people development abilities. You show initiative, ensuring that all financial targets are met (revenue, cost and margin), as well as being someone who is motivated, resilient and flexible. Detail and process orientation is important, as is the ability to work well with people at all levels and with divergent interests.</div><br/>  <div> Responsibility:<br/><br/>• Hires, continually assesses, trains and develops Project Managers, to ensure program objectives are achieved.   <ul> <li>Meets regularly with staff to ensure standards projects are achieving their objectives (e.g. timelines), within prescribed budgets, planning and executing corrective actions as required.</li> <li>Develops annual business plan for the program, including the execution plan and budget.</li> <li>Works with the Director, Manager-Standards and Product Manager, to drive business development opportunities within the scope of the program, including advisory services, to ensure continual growth of the full portfolio of products and services, interfacing with other groups as required (e.g. Learning Services, Sales & Marketing, CSA International).</li> <li>Interfaces with external parties to advance the work of the program, facilitates knowledge transfer, and manages program specific stakeholder issues. This includes working with organizations such as ISO, NGOs, industry associations, strategic partners, government agencies, etc.</li> <li>Committee management, as applicable (e.g., Strategic Steering Committees), including establishing the scope of work to be completed, preparation of meeting agendas/minutes/documents, managing required resources, maintaining current and balanced membership, and providing ongoing project management and strategic leadership in conjunction with the Chair and Vice-Chair.</li> <li>Manages key program funding contracts, as applicable, and relationships with key funders and related stakeholders.</li> <li>Provides support to Standards Manager in development and sustaining of Communities of Interest (COI) for their program area; including developing social media strategy, membership models, participation, funding, and communication with members.</li> <li>Responsible to continuously improve Customer Loyalty and employee engagement in the program area.</li>  <strong><li>Decisions making:</li>  </strong>  <li>Overall project plans submitted by Project Managers, including timelines and budgets.</li> <li>Assignment of responsibility for new projects and product initiatives.</li> <li>Portfolio mix (e.g. standards areas to be withdrawn, new subject areas to be added).</li> <li>Personnel training and development plans.</li> <li>Performance assessment and development planning for personnel.</li> <li>All business travel requests, including attendance of staff at conferences.</li>  <strong><li>Recommendations:</li>  </strong>  <li>Annual strategic and business plans, including budgets, operational execution plans, headcount, etc.</li> <li>Contracting of outside parties (e.g. training organizations, business partners).</li> <li>Disciplinary actions contemplated dealing with committee members, Chairs or Vice-Chairs.</li> <li>Disciplinary actions contemplated dealing with staff.</li>  <strong><li>Additional comments:</li>  </strong>  <li>The role will require a sound understanding of the various processes and procedures of the company, many of which are mandated under the accreditation of CSA Standards by the Standards Council of Canada, which in turn reports to Industry Canada. A key element of the position is to ensure that these processes and procedures are adhered to, and that the timelines of projects are achieved within defined budgets.</li> <li>This requires supporting the activities of Project Managers, and the many members of standards development committees, as well as their Chairs and Vice-Chairs, which can be very demanding, as these people are all volunteers, with no formal reporting relationship to the company. This volunteer membership includes industry executives, academia, and senior government officials. The role requires a capacity to engage and manage a diverse stakeholder community, and an ability to manage conflict. It is the ultimate form of working with, and getting things done through others.</li> <li>The role emphasizes management, leadership and soft skills over technical know-how, and requires the ability to speak on a range of complex subjects as a credible professional, both to internal and external audiences.</div></li>  <br/> <br/> </ul>  <div> Education:<br/><br/>• An undergraduate degree in Engineering, Science or Applied Science.   <ul> <li>A post graduate degree in Management is a definite asset.</div></li>  <br/> <br/> </ul>  <div> Experience:<br/><br/>• Minimum of 5 years’ experience in strategic planning, operational management, and Program or Project management in the Oil & Gas sector, coupled with a solid knowledge of related sector issues and trends.   <ul> <li>Experience with managing people, knowledge of standards development processes and, dealing with teams of high profile experts would also be definite assets.</div></li>  <br/> <br/> </ul>  <div> Skills:<br/><br/>• Knowledge of national and international standards industry.   <ul> <li>Knowledge of the standards industry, government policy, industry landscape, and funding programs/models.</li> <li>Research and analytical skills.</li> <li>High degree of self-motivation.</li> <li>Strong leadership skills.</li> <li>Strong organizational and planning skills.</li> <li>Strong oral and written communication, facilitation and interpersonal skills.</li> <li>Ability to work within a politically sensitive environment.</li> <li>Competency with major Microsoft and Project Management software.</li> <li>Bilingualism would be a definite asset.</div></li>  <br/> <br/> </ul>  <div> Travel:<br/><br/>25% domestic travel is required.</div><br/>  <div><strong>BUILDING A WORLD CLASS TEAM STARTS WITH YOU</strong> <br/><br/> At the heart of CSA Group is a vision: making the world a better, safer, more sustainable place. It’s been part of our mission for nearly one hundred years: from the first engineering standard for railway bridges developed in 1919, to more than 3,500 standards, codes & related products today. <br/><br/> Headquartered in Canada, with a global footprint of more than 30 labs and offices across Europe, Asia and North America, CSA Group tests, inspects and certifies a wide range of products—from every day household items to leading edge technology-to meet exacting requirements for safety, performance and environmental impact. <br/><br/> Our employees take pride in making a difference in people’s lives through the work that we do. We’re looking for people like you to help make it happen.</div>  </div>  </div><br/>  <div> </div></div></div></div></div>
Title: Program Manager - Standards Development, Petroleum & Natural Gas

Job_Description: To Submit Resume Quote - 17-83EW<br/><br/>CTP Distributors, along with its parent company Action Car and Truck Accessories, is Canada’s only national automotive accessory retailer and distributor. We have 36 locations across the country and are growing every year….with us, you will find not a job, but a career. We are currently seeking a Business Development Manager for British Columbia. <br/><br/> Based in the Surrey area - the Business Development Manager is responsible for creating and managing customer accounts with fleet customers in the assigned business region. The Business Development Manager maintains strong customer relationships by problem solving, providing knowledge and assistance, and making regular visits to the customer location. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities</strong>   <ul> <li>Visit new and existing fleet customers at their place of business</li> <li>Provide quotes and other information to new and existing customers</li> <li>Meet monthly, quarterly and annual sales budgets for the assigned territory</li> <li>Ensure consistent, ongoing communication with the stores within your region</li> <li>Complete and submit weekly sales activity reports</li> <li>Attend and participate in trade shows</li> <li>Travel as required regularly within British Columbia as well as other areas of the country on occasion <br/><br/> <strong>Qualifications</strong></li> <li>Community College Diploma, preferably in sales or automotive</li> <li>Minimum of 5 years of sales experience along with extensive knowledge of and a passion for the automotive industry</li> <li>Excellent teamwork and communication skills (both written and verbal)</li> <li>Self-motivated, able to work independently and as part of a team</li> <li>Highly organized</li> <li>Strong attention to detail</li> <li>Strong computer skills <br/><br/> To apply for this position, please contact Kristen Chamberlaine via email: careers@actiontrucks.com or fax (506) 857-8366. <br/><br/> <strong>Please quote 17-83EW in the subject line.</strong> <br/><br/> For more information, visit our website at www.getyourcareerinaction.ca</li>  </ul>
Title: Business Development Manager

Job_Description: We’re on a journey to become the ‘bank of choice’ for the franchising sector. We’re looking for enthusiastic people with the business development, sales and analytical skills to provide industry-leading financial solutions that continue to differentiate BMO in this growing and diverse sector. <br/><br/> BMO’s financing programs meet the unique needs of franchise networks from start-up to multi-unit consolidations. We’re building our reputation in the franchising sector, and opportunities to provide banking and financing solutions are available. Our holistic approach to the franchising sector is complemented by our partnership with BMO Business Banking, BMO Retail Banking, BMO Private Banking and BMO Capital Markets. <br/><br/> BMO expansion includes introducing Business Development Directors as franchising sector market leaders into six regions nationally with high concentrations of franchise networks. <br/><br/> What is the opportunity? <br/><br/> Reporting directly to the Head, Franchise Sector, the Business Development Director is accountable for the implementation of the franchising sector strategy to optimize the client experience and loyalty, drive sales results and maximize sustainable profitability in alignment with BMO’s risk appetite. <br/><br/> What will you do? <br/><br/> The Business Development Director acts as the industry segment leader for their designated geographic region. They will represent BMO in external communications including promotional opportunities including industry conferences and symposia, on professional committees and in community activities, all to network for profitable client relationships. <br/><br/> The Business Development Director will: <br/><br/> • Generate new and profitable business in the franchise industry segment; <br/><br/> • Define the desired client experience within their region; <br/><br/> • Maintain an active outreach with key clients and prospects, and to work collaboratively with the district business banking team to identify prospective clients, drive growth and aid in retention efforts of the franchise portfolio; <br/><br/> • Leverage partnerships with internal BMO parties such as retail and private bankers to deliver a holistic offering and enhanced client experience; <br/><br/> • Provide leadership on all matters related to financing solutions for the franchise sector for the region’s business bank and all banking partners; <br/><br/> • Develop and manage relationships with key influencers and partners in the franchise ecosystem for the region, which includes regional and national sponsorships. <br/><br/> Qualifications <br/><br/> What you bring to the table: <br/><br/> • Demonstrated history of business development and sales. <br/><br/> • Experience and demonstrated strong knowledge of the franchise industry. <br/><br/> • Inclusive of a minimum of 3 years’ relationship management experience providing business banking solutions to franchise networks. <br/><br/> • Established presence in the franchise ecosystem. <br/><br/> • Comfortable when interacting with business leaders, up to the C-suite level. <br/><br/> • Exceptional communication skills, both oral and written. <br/><br/> • Strong negotiation skills. <br/><br/> • Strong due diligence skills, including loan structure terms & conditions.
Title: Business Development Director Franchising

Job_Description: The CBDM works collaboratively with the Commercial Account Manager (CAM) and District Commercial Banking Team to seamlessly transfer new customer relationships, with the supporting Customer Action Plan, to the CAM for future revenue generation, in accordance with bank standards and policies and will support retention efforts for this set of customers where warranted. The CBDM will address the customer’s business needs with an emphasis on providing holistic banking solutions across their Operational Business Management Cycle using the RM “The BMO Way” process (The Complete Conversation). This entails identifying and selling appropriate solutions across: Financing, Deposit, Cash Management (Payment and Collections) solutions as well as the referral of complex sales of financing, cash management and Personal/PCG product needs to the appropriate partner (e.g. CFD). In addition, the CBDM will partner with the Cash Management Specialist (CMS) to develop non-standard pricing /negotiated customer proposals that meet profitability standards and ensure that customer loyalty objectives are achieved through the delivery of exceptional service. <br/><br/> The CBDM will ensure credit decisions and recommendations are in accordance with sound credit-granting principles as described in the Commercial Lending Process and in compliance with Bank Policies & Procedures, and ensure compliance with internal and external requirements and regulations. The CBDM plays a strong role as a knowledgeable and experienced professional in the success of the District and is responsible for enhancing BMO’s presence within the community. <br/><br/> <strong>Risk Management</strong>  <ul> <li>Protect the Bank’s assets and maintain quality of the Banks lending portfolio by adhering to Commercial lending processes, policies & procedures, legal and ethical requirements and regulations, audit requirements, and established risk guidelines. Ensure all Commercial Banking Business is in conformity with Bank Policies and other guidelines</li>   <li>Accountable for risk management and minimizing losses through monitoring and control reports, (managing quality of information, analysis, profitability and credit recommendations, ensuring all legal, regulatory, ethical and compliance requirements, audits, and verifications are completed in accordance with Bank Policies & Procedures (i.e. hand off deal with no trailing deficiencies)) in executing sales of credit/non-credit products and services to Commercial customers and prospects</li>   <li>Document and follow-up on any discrepancies to procedures, with significant operational risk and escalate, as required</li>   <li>Respond to questions and/or resolve issues raised through audits and quality checks, to ensure lending decisions are adequately documented, clearly communicated and followed</li>   <li>Exercise individually held Commercial Recommendation Discretionary Limits (i.e.: overdrafts, credit applications), ensuring credit decisions and recommendations are in accordance with sound credit-granting principles and in compliance with the Bank’s policies and related procedures (i.e.: Lending Directives, Commercial Lending Policy, etc.); completing analysis; confirming security valuations; completing and approving credit applications for authorizations under Commercial Lending Policy</li>   <li>Adhere to Know Your Customer Rules and Bank Policies & Procedures for the prevention of loss due to fraud, counterfeiting, money laundering, or defalcation; identify and report suspicious and other reportable transactions or patterns of activity that are suspected to be related to money laundering</li>   <li>Maintain up-to-date knowledge and understanding of Commercial products, processes, and relevant legal, regulatory and technology requirements, including BASEL II risk rating requirements.</li>  </ul> <strong>Planning</strong>  <ul> <li>Develop, implement, review and revise short (3 – 12 months) and long term (1 – 2 year) rolling sales strategies and tactical plans, focusing on identifying profitable business prospects and creating a network of referral sources for the assigned territory that will result in meeting or exceeding sales, service, revenue, share of wallet and loyalty targets.</li>   <li>Apply territory management, relationship selling and relationship expansion strategy and performance to potential Commercial Banking customers ensuring comprehensive, holistic financial solutions</li>   <li>Review and monitor sales, revenue and share of wallet performance against plan, identify gaps, develop appropriate action plans (as appropriate) and share best practices.</li>   <li>Contribute to District Business Plan (as appropriate), regarding new business opportunities, increased profitability and new customer business growth potential, based on knowledge of local marketplace.</li>   <li>Review sales and service plans on an ongoing basis to reflect opportunities and changes in the competitive local market environment; develop an action plan, and update CBAM on any changes that may impact the Area/District Business Plan</li>   <li>Plan, implement and maintain an effective business development and community involvement strategy to protect and expand profitable Commercial businesses, utilizing an extensive network of referral resources</li>   <li>Develop and co-ordinate individual relationship planning, implementation and review activities with key BMO Partner Groups (Corporate Finance, PCG, Transactional Credit, Personal Banking) identifying opportunities to ensure customer’s needs and expectations are profitably met and/or exceeded. Outline to the CAM and CBAM in the Relationship hand off , any significant risk or untoward factors that could impair the ongoing success of the customer from information garnered in relationship and business generation activities.</li>  </ul> <strong>Business Development, Sales and Service</strong>  <ul> <li>Obtain and utilize market/industry/customer knowledge to proactively maximize sales, customer share of wallet increase cash management penetration, revenue per customer and customer loyalty for all new customers</li>   <li>Complete proactive, focused, profitable sales of commercial solutions based on referrals/prospects, and knowledge of the assigned territory to improve share of wallet and market share</li>   <li>Concurrently support commercial market share expansion, customer experience and share of wallet objectives to achieve revenue growth, share of wallet, acquisition, cash management sales, and customer loyalty objectives leveraging the RM The BMO Way process and The Complete Conversation</li>   <li>Be highly visible in the marketplace to proactively, and with a long-term focus, develop an internal and external network of referral sources that effectively generates prospects for new business to maintain a consistent pipeline of prospective customers for future execution. This will include Corporate Finance Account Managers, financial investors, financial professionals & consultants.</li>   <li>Provide prospective commercial customers holistic banking solutions to meet their banking needs across the customers’ entire Operational Business Management Cycle: Make Payments, Collect Funds, Manage Deposits and Financing</li>   <li>Establish linkages with PCG Partners, Headquarters and “Industry Specialty” Groups, to leverage sales and referral opportunities, improve share of wallet, and to maximize customer experience and profitability to the bank</li>   <li>Contribute to the Bank’s business objectives and increasing share of wallet through direct market intervention by way of sales calls (individually and jointly with DVP, Commercial Account Managers, CMS), establishing a personal referral network and other business development activities.</li>   <li>Accountable for proactive, focused sales of Commercial solutions and services, based on referrals/prospects, knowledge of local market,</li>   <li>Develop an understanding of cross channel sales referral processes, local market, and existing business relationships to maximize balance acquisition, share of wallet, revenue, and to acquire new Commercial customers</li>   <li>Establish and enhance the Bank’s profile by participating in meaningful and focused business and community activities and seeking out and creating opportunities to generate new Commercial business</li>   <li>Apply resourceful business development and relationship management sales and service principles, practices and techniques, to support the achievement of target level sales of Commercial lending ,deposit products and services, including complex cash management solutions</li>   <li>Champion a sales environment that achieves consistent, superior customer service and good working relationships with Commercial Account Manager, Customer Service Officers (CSO’s), , Cash Management Specialist (CMS), Personal Banking and PCG Banking partners</li>   <li>Leverage technology, applications and tools to identify and refer profitable sales opportunities and to ensure optimal effectiveness, efficiency, and delivery of Commercial products and services</li>   <li>Accompany and support the District Vice-President and Commercial Account Manager with customer interactions, and relationship building</li>   <li>Develop and co-ordinate individual relationship planning, implementation and review activities with key BMO Partner Groups (Corporate Finance, PCG, Personal Banking) identifying opportunities to ensure customer’s needs and expectations are profitably met and/or exceeded. Outline to the CAM and CBAM in the Relationship hand off , any significant risk or untoward factors that could impair the ongoing success of the customer from information garnered in relationship and business generation activities.</li>   <li>Effectively transition the relationship management of all new customers to the appropriate CAM at the appropriate time and in accordance with bank standards.</li>   <li>Provide timely and effective problem resolution, escalating customer issues as necessary as per the established Problem Resolution Process</li>   <li>Respond to questions and/or issues raised relative to customers that have been handed off to the Commercial Account Manager ensuring a high level of customer satisfaction.</li>  </ul> <strong>Role Requirements:</strong>  <ul> <li>Commercial Credit Qualification with Limits</li>   <li>L1- Working/L2 In-Depth understanding of Commercial Products, Commercial Lending Process, Commercial Lending Directives, enterprise credit risk policies and standards and all supporting processes and technology</li>   <li>L2 -Designated Real Estate Account manager (DREAM) designation is required for this role with the DREAM designation level aligned to the portfolio customers being managed (ie. Portfolio requirement to manage customers with construction risk vs. no construction risk).</li>  </ul> <strong>Preferred:</strong> Credit adjudication experience. Good understanding of capital structuring to support the identification of referral <br/><br/> We’re here to help <br/><br/> At BMO we have a shared purpose; we put the customer at the centre of everything we do – helping people is in our DNA. For 200 years we have thought about the future—the future of our customers, our communities and our people. We help our customers and our communities by working together, innovating and pushing boundaries to bring them our very best every day. Together we’re changing the way people think about a bank. <br/><br/> As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset. <br/><br/> To find out more visit us at https://bmocareers.com. <br/><br/> BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.
Title: Commercial Business Development Manager

Job_Description: DevFacto is eagerly seeking a Mobile Developer to join our team in Calgary. <br/><br/> Were a consulting company, which is great because we get to work with so many different industries and technologies. We work closely with our clients to understand their business and create things that really matter to them. As a result, we build a lot of really cool stuff that actually gets used and helps people. Theres a really exciting trend in the industry right now where were seeing Enterprise Mobility play a larger and larger role in the solutions we build with our clients. <br/><br/> In order to meet this need, were looking for people with a broad range of skills. Bringing a clients vision to life means youll wear a lot of hats. This often means being able to dig into the details of their business, bring new ideas to the table, and be able to design then build solutions that blow their socks off. <br/><br/> Development-related skills:  <ul> <li>Computer science fundamentals including algorithms, design patterns, and data structures</li> <li>Familiarity with mobile design principles</li> <li>Familiarity with responsive web design</li> <li>iOS, Android, or WPF/WinRT development experience</li> <li>C#, ASP.NET (Web API, MVC) experience or similar</li> </ul> It's even better if you have experience with business analysis, solution architecture design, and technical writing and documentation. The one thing you must have is the ability to empathize with others --- we're in the "problem elimination" business after all which involves understanding how humans think, relating to them, and then, if it's the right thing to do, writing code to solve the problem. <br/><br/> Why join our team?  <ul> <li>Competitive salaries, group benefits, profit sharing</li> <li>Challenging projects and leading-edge technologies</li> <li>Extensive training</li> <li>Flexible hours, creative workspaces with games and a fully stocked kitchen</li> <li>Regular team social events including Friday happy-hours and monthly team outings</li> <li>A really cool award-winning culture</li> </ul> If this sounds like a match made in heaven, we want to hear from you!
Title: Mobile Developer

Job_Description: <P><B>Summary:</B></P> <DIV><STRONG></STRONG> </DIV> <DIV>Reporting to the Manager of IT, within Information Technology, the Systems Developer (located in Calgary, Alberta) will be responsible for the outstanding coding of the AX2012 Global HR module and associated integrations at Ensign. This position requires a creative person who is an exciting team player, with a strong technical background, and excellent verbal and written communications skills. Candidates must be able to analyze system design, address quality assurance, question issues, and work through problems on a day to day basis.</DIV> <DIV> </DIV> <DIV><B>Position Responsibilities:</B></DIV> <UL> <LI> <DIV>Designing, building, testing and maintaining the various applications, and customizations in the Dynamics AX2012 modules, as well as the integration between the various applications and Dynamics AX2012;</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Building the Benefits module in AX2012; the benefits integration from AX2012 to Avanti (Canadian payroll system); the integration from AX2012 to Meridian (Australia payroll system); and any other development requirements for the Global HRMS AX2012;</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Working closely with IT Business Analysts and the HRIS and Compensation Analyst to determine if business and functional requirements are met;</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Working with project managers to determine schedules and estimates;</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Preparing technical documentation;</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Providing technical support and problem resolution expertise.</DIV></LI></UL> <P> <DIV><B>Note: </B></DIV> <DIV><STRONG></STRONG> </DIV> <DIV>Some travel may be required.</DIV> <DIV>This is a 12 month temporary contract.</DIV> <P></P> <UL> <LI> <DIV>Post-secondary education in Computer Science, Mathematics or Engineering discipline or equivalent experience;</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>5 – 7 years development experience in the object oriented language of C#, with a focus on integration;</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Expertise in Microsoft Dynamics AX2012;</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Understanding of ERP systems and the ability to learn quickly;</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Experience with Microsoft integration and reporting technologies SSIS, SSRS, OBI and/or Business objects, SQL and OLAP; </DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Experience with unit testing frameworks such as NUnit would be an asset;</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Proven technical ability supported by strong analytical and problem solving skills;</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Ability to work effectively as part of a team as well as independently in a self-directed mode;</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Strong interpersonal and communication skills;</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>The ability to work well in a fast paced environment through exceptional time management skills and the ability to multi-task and prioritize duties;</DIV></LI> <LI> <DIV>Oilfield experience, specifically in the Energy Services sector, would be an asset.</DIV></LI></UL>
Title: Systems Developer

Job_Description: DIRECTOR, BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT <br/><br/> Term: Permanent <br/> Main Location: Candidate ideally willing to relocate to Montreal or Toronto <br/> Starting Date: As soon as possible <br/><br/> Effigis, a leader in the Canadian geospatial industry, employs more than 170 people. Effigis multidisciplinary personnel are primarily made up of GIS specialists, IT specialists, professional land surveyors, engineers, geographers, cartographers, managers and geologists. <br/> For more than 20 years, our team has been involved in supporting Ontario and Quebec organizations with their asset management through geospatial technology. We specialize in large infrastructure inventories, geospatial databases, and aerial and underground network inspection. We are now looking to accelerate our growth in the rest of Canada. <br/> Reporting to the Vice-President, the incumbent will be mainly responsible for identifying and developing business opportunities and implementing strategies in line with the vision of the executive management to achieve the sales growth objectives of the company. The incumbent must be a born hunter with strong prospecting skills and interest in acquiring new clients. <br/> Main Duties    <ul> <li>Identify potential clients with large infrastructure inventories, geospatial databases, and aerial and underground networks in Canadian markets outside of Quebec</li>  <li>Develop new clients who are in line with the corporate sales and growth objectives</li>  <li>Navigate large complex organizations in order to solicit potential clients to generate client meetings aimed at understanding their needs and expectations</li>  <li>Play a leading role with technical team to discover opportunities, then prepare and present clients with added-value business solutions</li>  <li>Oversee the process of developing service proposals with clients, along with the in-house sales team</li>  <li>Present proposals to clients, and participate in negotiating contracts</li>   <li>Exceed sales objectives, calls and monthly appointments</li>  <li>Build and maintain strong client relationships and serve clients at all times in a way to meet their needs and ensure their satisfaction</li>  <li>Produce sales reports based on the companys needs</li>  <li>Regularly update client data in the CRM</li>  <li>Contribute to the development of sales projections</li>  <li>Participate in the development of new services or improve current services, which will help increase corporate sales.</li> </ul>  Job Requirements   <ul> <li>Ten years experience in the industry with a proven experience in business development, sales of services and solutions in the field of telecommunications or public services</li>  <li>Experience in engineering, infrastructure network deployment and asset management, an asset</li>  <li>Able to thoroughly understand the needs of clients and present business solutions to decision makers and business groups</li>  <li>Strong personality, leadership, go-getter mentality, and autonomous.</li>  <li>In-depth MS Office skills</li>  <li>Knowledge of SAP (CRM) is an asset</li>  <li>Bilingualism English and French, spoken and written is important</li>  <li>Ability to travel across the country.</li> </ul>  If you are dynamic and passionate, have a proven track record of success, and want to be part of a growing team, we would like to talk to you! <br/> For more information about Effigis, please visit http://www.effigis.com/en/ <br/> We would like to thank all our candidates for their interest in this job. However, only those selected will be contacted. We are an equal opportunity employer. <br/><br/>
Title: Director, Business Development

Job_Description: <div><div><div><div><div>Ernst & Young's multidisciplinary tax team, specializing <br/> in scientific research and experimental development (SR&ED) tax credits and <br/> other incentives, is currently seeking a candidate to deliver first-rate <br/> advisory services to our clients in Alberta. We offer an excellent opportunity <br/> for talented people to play a key role in Ernst & Young's rapidly growing <br/> and dynamic R&D incentives practice. Either individually or as part of a <br/> team, you will be interacting regularly with clients at the forefront of <br/> technology. <br/><br/> <strong>Position description:</strong> <br/><br/> As a Technical Specialist, you will be working with new and <br/> existing clients to evaluate and prepare their R&D incentive claims. This <br/> involves assessing the client's eligibility to receive funding, establishing <br/> how much they can claim, and writing technical project descriptions that detail <br/> the innovation, development methodologies, and activities that were involved <br/> for each project. An interest in science and technology is a must. If you want <br/> to be at the forefront of exciting R&D initiatives taking place in a wide <br/> variety of industries, such as oil & gas, manufacturing, chemical, mining <br/> and forestry, this role is for you. <br/><br/> We are looking for a recent graduate with outstanding verbal <br/> and written communication skills to join our team as a Technical Specialist. If <br/> you are inquisitive and expressive, you will find this position both <br/> stimulating and rewarding.<br/> <div><strong>As a Technical Specialist, you will:</strong> <br/><br/> <ul> <li>Meet with technical and financial professionals across client organizations in various fields</li><li>Understand technical concepts, gain insight into R&D processes through detailed review of client documentation</li><li>Conduct scoping sessions to determine if there are eligible projects or expenditures</li><li>Prepare detailed technical reports on client R&D activities</li><li>Support reviews with the Canada Revenue Agency or other agencies</li><li>Network in industrial communities on behalf of EY</li> </ul> <strong>Qualifications:</strong> <br/><br/> <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree in Engineering or Science related fields, excluding computer engineering and computing sciences</li><li>High level of proficiency gathering detailed client feedback and requirements</li><li>Creative thinker - ability to innovate solutions to client problems on the spot</li><li>Excellent skills in negotiation and team building</li><li> Ability to quickly absorb and understand numerous technical concepts</li><li>General understanding of financial principles relating to job costing strategies, strong social and communication skills (interpersonal, written, verbal, and listening)</li><li>Ability to work under pressure and meet strict deadlines</li><li>Ability to work in a team environment as well as independently</li><li>Entrepreneurial drive</li> <li>Prior SR&ED experience is an asset, but not required</li> </ul> <strong>Ernst & Young is committed to diversity and equity.</strong><br/> <div></div></div>  </div> </div>  </div>  </div> </div> <br/>
Title: Technical Specialist, R&D Incentives (Scientific Research & Experimental Development)

Job_Description: Co-op Student, Oil Sands Project Development - 15580 Description Job Title: Co-op Student, Oil Sands ProjectDevelopment Location: Calgary, AB Start Date: September 4, 2018 Length of Term: 8, 12 or 16 months Business Unit: Oil Sands ApplicationDeadline: May 20, 2018 or once the position has been filled OpportunityDetails: The OilSands Projects team has a Co-op opportunity to support various projects in theOil Sands Business Unit. Oil Sands Projects offers a dynamic opportunityto experience the full lifecycle of a project from design concept toconstruction and the critical measure of performance acceptance. Job_Description: Paladin Technologies has emerged as the largest complex systems integrator in Canada. As a leader in the design, deployment, optimization, management, and maintenance of communication and digital networks, Paladin can meet the needs of clients on a national scale, while providing local support. <br/><br/> We are 100% Canadian-owned, and operate nationally. The experts that make up Paladin's teams stay at the forefront of the changing technology landscape through continued training, complex client projects, and company support. As Paladin continues to grow, we continue to provide our employees with exciting challenges and a rewarding career. <br/><br/> The Systems Engineer/Designer performs discovery and analysis of business needs to define client requirements. This position works in conjunction with Account Executives and the Project Management team to determine technical requirements for project work and to ensure fit and suitability of our product offering within the client environment. <br/><br/> RESPONSIBILITIES:  <ul>  	<li>Prepare high level system designs in a thorough and professional manner during the pre-sales cycle. Design work may include conducting site surveys and device mark-ups, network architecture design, server loading, writing technical narratives and proposals, and preparing bills of materials</li>  <li>Produce detailed post-sale design documents that will guide the technical installation and configuration of systems</li>  <li>Develop financial and logistics estimates, both independently and in collaboration with Paladin Technologies sales, marketing, and project management professionals</li>  <li>Multi-task and manage time effectively to prioritize projects, tasks, and meetings as necessary</li>  <li>Identify, establish, and document processes to support design efficiency and scalability</li>  <li>Develop productive relationships with clients and key stakeholders which will build respect and confidence in the organization's capabilities.</li>  <li>Understand and maintain an awareness of the productivity and profitability of work carried out by the organization</li> </ul> QUALIFICATIONS:  <ul>  	<li>A minimum of three years of design experience in the information technology, instrumentation and controls, and/or security industries</li>  <li>Field experience in a construction environment is an asset</li>  <li>A strong understanding of the physical security and/or IT industries, including an awareness of complimentary products, technologies, trends, and the general application of physical security technology</li>  <li>An understanding of and experience with fundamental concepts pertaining to IP networks, low voltage electronics, power, and communications</li>  <li>A strong command of the English language supported by excellent written and verbal communication skills</li>  <li>The ability to simultaneously handle multiple tasks and projects and be responsive to changing priorities in a fast-paced environment</li>  <li>Post-secondary education from an accredited college, university, or technical institution in Business, Construction Management, Electronics, Engineering, Information Technology, or a related field</li>  <li>P.Eng, EIT, CET, or equivalent professional technical designation is preferred</li>  <li>Highly developed analytical and problem solving skills</li>  <li>Motivated self-starter with ambition to independently research new technologies as well as engineering and business methodologies/concepts</li> </ul>

Job_Description: <div>Reporting to the Director of Regional Innovation, the Technology Development Advisor (TDA) is responsible for engaging and advising Small and Medium size Enterprises (SMEs) in business, product development and commercialization activities in their region. <br/><br/> This position is based in Calgary and requires someone with a network of local connections and knowledge about the city of Calgary and surrounding areas. TDA’s are connectors in the Innovation Ecosystem. This includes connecting SMEs to business support services, professionals and programs from the Provincial and Federal Government, Colleges, Universities, non-profits and industry contacts. <br/><br/> The incumbent will: foster existing relationships and spend time cultivating new ones while proactively connecting the dots; act as a coach, and navigator for SMEs to access Alberta’s Innovation System programs and support services; and seek out innovative SMEs to address Alberta’s Innovation targets. <br/><br/> <strong>Responsibilities include, but not limited to:</strong> <br/> 	Lending expertise in guiding client through the business, product development, to commercialization opportunities <br/> 	Evaluating business plans and market assessments <br/> 	Coaching the client through their business and technology readiness journey <br/> 	Liaising with internal and external clients to recommend funding opportunities aligned with Alberta Innovates mandate and outcomes <br/> 	Connecting client to service provider organization and assist with project development <br/> 	Developing and maintaining networks outside of Alberta Innovates, and with other SME funding and support conduits and professional service providers to ensure strong due diligence <br/> 	Summarizing client due diligence for internal programs <br/> 	Fulfilling internal reporting requirements <br/> 	Maintaining confidentiality of client information</div> <br/> <strong><div> Requirements Education and Experience:</strong> <br/> 	A bachelor’s degree, preferably in commerce, economics, engineering, or equivalent <br/> 	10+ years in business, manufacturing or production setting, management consulting or leading a technology based SME <br/> 	5 + years in key or senior management and/or business coaching experience <br/> 	Demonstrated business sense in a diversified set of industries <br/> 	Demonstrated track record of achievements and commitment to excellence <br/> 	Experience with growing and developing SMEs in the technology commercialization space <br/> 	Strong account management experience with the understanding on maintain and building strong trusted relationships <br/> Other skills and knowledge we are looking for: <br/> 	Excellent interpersonal skills, combined with an ability to work collaboratively with stakeholders, both internal and external <br/> 	Experience in communicating constructive feedback, coaching and mentoring to help clients grow and improve <br/> 	Sharp strategic mind with a creative approach to business, able to work under tight deadlines in high-stake executive environments, with a passion for accuracy and quality <br/> 	Community network to support building collaboration among local organizations <br/> 	Create synergies and links between other TDAs, regions and stakeholders in the innovation system <br/> 	Capacity to autonomously gather information, identify important and critical issues, synthesize and articulate findings and present complex issues in simple ways <br/> 	Proven project management and organizational skills <br/> 	Comfortable working with incomplete information and ability to make intelligent assumptions to produce high level estimates <br/> 	Strong skills in technology product commercialization, economic development and trade <br/> 	Willingness to challenge, question and investigate facts <br/> 	Excellent oral and written communication skills <br/> 	Some travel is required</div> <br/> <div> Compensation <DIV>Alberta Innovates offers a competitive salary and benefits package in addition to opportunities for personal and professional achievement. Final candidate will be required to undergo a security clearance. For more information on this exciting opportunity, visit Competition #AI-070 at http://www.albertainnovates.ca/careers. When applying, please submit your resume in a Microsoft Word compatible format. All interviewees must be able to meet the requirement specified in the Physical Demand Analysis. This document will be supplied during the interview process to the successful candidate(s).This competition will remain open until a successful candidate is found.</DIV> <DIV>ALBERTA INNOVATES IS COMMITTED TO THE PRINCIPLE OF EQUITY IN EMPLOYMENT AND ENCOURAGES APPLICATIONS FROM ALL QUALIFIED INDIVIDUALS. WE WISH TO THANK ALL APPLICANTS FOR THEIR INTEREST. HOWEVER, ONLY THOSE INVITED FOR AN INTERVIEW WILL BE CONTACTED.</DIV></div>

The successful candidate will leverage an innovative mindset to support clients in achieving their business objectives while also achieving company set personal monthly and annual targets. <br/><br/> <strong>As a member of our HIGH PERFORMANCE sales team you will:</strong> <ul> <li>Actively prospect and generate new advertising revenue, both in print and online</li><li>Achieve and exceed allocated sales targets</li><li>Support various Special Feature and Custom Publishing opportunities</li><li>Assist clients with building their brand and/or generating awareness about their products, events and/or services</li><li>Build and maintain strong relationships with new clients</li><li>Respond to client queries and follow-up on all client calls and emails</li><li>Develop and present persuasive presentations</li><li>Log daily sales activity into CRM</li> </ul> <strong>Why You Will Be Successful:</strong> <ul> <li>2 years of demonstrated sales success in any industry (ie. media, retail, auto, etc.)</li><li>Relevant post-secondary education would be an asset</li><li>Dedication to achieving extraordinary results Excellent oral & written presentation, communication and negotiation skills</li><li>Excellent time management skills, highly organized, detail oriented, efficient, ability to meet tight deadlines, ability to set priorities and manage daily tasks</li><li>Creative and collaborative</li><li>Proficient in Microsoft Office – Word, Excel, PowerPoint & Outlook</li><li>CRM experience is an asset</li><li>Strong sense of accountability</li><li>Must be a team player</li> </ul> <strong>Why You Will Love Working Here:</strong> <ul> <li> The opportunity to be part of a company at the cutting edge of the digital media industry; you’ll never get bored in our fast-paced, constantly evolving and challenging environment</li><li>We recognize that you have a life outside of work and we offer you real work/life balance</li><li>We’ve got your health in mind; you’ll get a comprehensive benefits package (Extended Health Care, Dental, etc.) including a minimum of 3 weeks’ vacation</li> </ul> …And let’s not forget the <strong>AWESOME PEOPLE!</strong> <br/><br/> <em>Metro English Canada is committed to providing an inclusive and barrier free recruitment process to applicants with accessibility needs in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). If you require an accommodation during this process, please inform Metro English Canada of your requirements.</em>

Job_Description: <div> <div> <div>Java Programmer - Canada</div><div>Summary</div><div>Title: Java Programmer - Canada</div> <div>ID: 2018C020</div> <div>Job Department: Technical</div> <div>Job Location: Calgary, Edmonton</div> <div>Description</div><div><div>Emerald Associates is a Canadian Oracle Platinum Partner - Cloud Standard. Headquartered in Calgary, Alberta, we have specialized in Oracle Engineering and Construction (formerly Primavera) suite for over 23 years. We take a best-of-breed, highly integrated and automated approach to drive project management excellence with our clients that includes many Emerald proprietary solutions. <br/><br/> We are actively looking for Full Cycle Java Developers in a full-time capacity to join our team in all of our locations including Canada, USA, Brazil, Philippines, Belarus. Qualified candidates with success working remotely will be considered, regardless of geographical proximity.<br/><br/>The Role - Integration Specialist <br/> As part of our programming and technology delivery team you will work with functional and technical project management leaders to deliver where your unique contributions make a difference to our corporate and client success.<br/>  <div> <div>You will work on a diverse portfolio of products and bespoke software in the project management space, including standalone Emerald products, add-ons to the Oracle Engineering and Construction suite of products, and system integrations and visualizations for clients. You will proactively be contributing to the full software development life cycle involving application analysis/design, coding, testing, documentation, deployment, and post-production verification and support; seeing your work product through to completion. <br/><br/> The ideal candidate is a highly collaborative, proactive self-starter with experience delivering in fast-paced customer driven project environments. <br/><br/> <strong>Who you are:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>You are highly organized and take charge of deliverables</li> <li>You see potential issues before they arise</li> <li>You remove obstacles and roadblocks to deliver on-time</li> <li>You thrive on solving problems</li> <li>You design with innovation in mind</li> <li>You love learning and thrive on collaboration</li> <li>You pick up new concepts easily</li> <li>You write clean, re-usable code</li> <li>You communicate with ease - both written and verbal</li> <li>You know that team success is the only success; mentoring, self-critiquing, collaborating and leading are your passion</li> </ul>  <strong>What you'll do:</strong>   <ul>  	<li>Work on new and existing software. Proprietary, third party and client specific</li> <li>Develop new code as well as maintain, update and upgrade existing software including:   <ul>   <li>Libraries and APIs</li> <li>Web applications</li> <li>Web services</li> <li>Enterprise integrations</li> <li>Plugins and add-ons to existing tools</li> </ul>  	</li> <li>Reporting and graphical visualization</li> <li>Design and collaborate with team member to deliver quality solutions</li> <li>Contribute new ideas to drive continuous improvement</li> </ul>  </div> </div><br/>  <div> <div><strong>Some of our tools:</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Java 8</li> <li>IntelliJ IDEA Ultimate</li> <li>Redmine</li> <li>Git, GitLab</li> <li>Nexus, Maven</li> <li>Java Libraries: Google Guava, Apache Commons, FreeMarker, Apache Wicket, Spring IoC</li> <li>Excelsior JET</li> <li>Oracle, SQL Server</li> <li>SQL Developer</li> <li>jQuery</li> <li>Oracle Primavera P6-EPPM, Oracle Unifier, Oracle OPPM, OBIEE, Oracle Data Visualization</li> <li>Quip, HipChat, ZOHO</li> </ul>  </div> </div>  <br/>The Skills & Requirements<br/>  <div><strong>Mandatory Qualifications</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Fluency in the English language, both written and spoken</li> <li>Degree or diploma in computer science or a related discipline</li> <li>3-5+ years of Java development experience</li> <li>Working knowledge of SQL</li> <li>Experience designing, programming and delivering applications</li> </ul> <strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong>  <ul>  	<li>Experience developing rich web applications</li> <li>Experience developing cloud applications</li> <li>Experience with Spring and Wicket</li> <li>Working knowledge of PL/SQL / T-SQL</li> <li>Experience with the Linux shell</li> <li>Experience working remotely</li> </ul>  </div> <br/>If you are driven, collaborative, innovative, and love working with a great team to deliver on new challenges - <strong>Apply today!</strong></div> </div> </div></div>
Title: Java Programmer

High tolerance for change, as our company grows and develops. Resiliency under pressure, with a flexible and reliable work style. Job_Description: Android Developer   					Posted date [Jan-05-17]  					 (ID: 89176)  				 Robots and Pencils  				               					  » See all jobs by this advertiser        | More     Back|					 								         This post has expired! It was posted more than 60 days ago.    At Robots and Pencils, we’re expanding and looking for an Android Developer to join our talented  and world class robot team.  Who you are: You are someone who prefers to communicate through code.  You love to create and have a strong desire to learn. You have strong opinions but that are weakly held; you are humble yet confident. In fact, you’re the first to pass along the latest headache busting library from Square to your colleagues just minutes after sending a link to a mind clarifying blog post from Romain Guy. You can speak to language best practices and are not afraid of anonymous inner-classes. You never overlook the saved instance state and have contemplated the tradeoffs between activities, fragments and views. You have knowledge of how a RESTful web service works, what makes it RESTful and how it can be accessed from Android. You are also diligent about meeting allocated budgets and can work within time constraints, but you will never sacrifice quality. What you’ll do:  Design, program and test software. Author and maintain relevant documentation for developers, clients and users. Develop and refine prototypes to confirm requirements. Program according to project plans (versions, sprints). Test according to pre-determined test plans. Support release and post-release activities, such as support, versioning and maintenance. Collaborate with our pencils (designers) to create interfaces that conform to the Google design guidelines. Peer review other team members’ code, and learn and adapt from peer review of your own code. Support sales and project managers with technical insights, leading to the creation of budgets and schedules for projects.  Desired skills and experience:  5+ years of delivering software with preference given to those who have a degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent Solid understanding and practical knowledge of the full mobile development and application life cycle Solid understanding of Android UX/UI guidelines and best practices Experience with Android using Android Studio and JAVA Experience with a distributed Version Control System Experience with mobile development issues related to performance optimisation, caching and security Excellent communications skills with the ability to share insights and expectations with clients, stakeholders and colleagues, both locally and remotely  Work perks  Working alongside smart, talented people who will push you and help you grow. Support for professional development and access to as many books as you can read. A great work environment and health benefits. Fun activities (like book club and board game nights), biweekly Robo Brews and team parties.  To Apply:  https://robotsandpencils.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=84 About Robots and Pencils Robots and Pencils is an app development company known for its top-ranking consumer apps, transformative enterprise apps and world-first learning platforms. Started in 2009, Robots and Pencils has more than 250 apps used by over 77 million people worldwide, and was named one of North America’s Technology Fast 500 by Deloitte in 2014. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
